Name: A O
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: A O[4] is an infamous New World pirate and captain of the A O Pirates.[2] He and his crew were subordinates to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: A O is a very tall man with a long, square shaped face, hollow eyes under prominent eyebrows, dark sideburns that go all the way down to his chin, and greenish long wavy hair. On his head, he wears a yellow and brown striped bandanna and over it is a tricorn captain's hat with what appears to be his Jolly Roger on it, a white skull wearing an animal-like hood. He also wears a dark blue, open shirt with the sleeves rolled up and a ruffled collar, and elaborate earrings made up by three little jewels each on both ears.[1]

Name: Abdullah
description: Abdullah[5] is a criminal and a former bounty hunter who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi, along with his partner Jeet.[1] He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc. After the battle with the Donquixote Pirates at Dressrosa, he joined the XXX Gym Martial Arts Alliance, which later converted to a pirate crew called the Ideo Pirates.[2][3]
appareance: Abdullah has a pointed head that is bald on the top with black hair in pigtails hanging down the sides. His high forehead has three vertical scars on it. He sports thin rectangular sunglasses and along with large purple trousers held up by brown suspenders. He also has armor over his left arm.[1]

Name: Absalom
description: Absalom of the Graveyard was the commander of the Soldier Zombies and General Zombies of Thriller Bark prior to its collapse.[4] He was one of the Mysterious Four[2] of the Thriller Bark Pirates and one of the major antagonists of the Thriller Bark Saga.
appareance: Sometime during the timeskip, he became a reporter under the alias Absa.[3] At some point, he was abducted by the Blackbeard Pirates and killed to poach his Devil Fruit powers, with his ability going to Shiryu.[8]

Name: Acilia
description: Acilia[2] is a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum who participated in a tournament for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: Acilia's concept art from the anime.

Name: Adele
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Adele[4] is a spotted knifejaw mermaid[5] and an employee at the Mermaid Café.[2]
appareance: Adele in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Aegir
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1142.
description: Aegir is a student at the Walrus School on Elbaph.[1]
appareance: Aegir is an average-sized giant child with round eyes and nose, a large forehead, and short light hair which is spiked up. He wears a light long-sleeved shirt, a dark cape, a shoulder belt, a kilt, and boots.

Name: Ageha Woman
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Ageha Woman[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Ageha Woman is a woman of average size, with long shoulder length purple hair. Due to the SMILE that she consumed, she possesses a pair set of large three butterfly wings from her upper back, antennae on her head, and a yellow scarf of some sort around her neck. Unlike other Gifters, she does not possess a pair of horns. She wears a pink flower-spotted leotard, with white gloves and red boots.[1]

Name: Aggie 68
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Aggie 68[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Aggie 68 is a large man with short hair and thick sideburns. His left arm is either covered or replaced by a three barrel gun.[1]

Name: Agotogi
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Agotogi[2] was the leader of a gang of bandits who tried to kidnap Vivi about 11 years before the princess's return to Arabasta.[1]
appareance: Agotogi is a tan-skinned man of average height who has red spiky hair, a hooked nose, a wide smile, thin eyebrows, and a pointed chin. He wears an open-up green kimono with a few purple dots on it. He wears brown pants with a yellow sash to hold it up. He also wears typical sandals. It is also notable that he was always seen smiling until he was defeated.[1]

Name: Agsilly
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Agsilly[3] is a New World pirate who allied himself with the Whitebeard Pirates.[2]
appareance: A sketch of Agsilly.

Name: Agyo
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 733.
description: Agyo[3] is a fighting lion (闘獅子, Tōjishi?) and a gladiator competing at the Corrida Colosseum for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: Agyo appears to be a white lion with whiskers, sharp teeth and a mane. He also has dark shadows around his eyes.[1]

Name: Ahho Desunen IX
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Ahho Desunen IX[2] is a noble from the Goa Kingdom and the father of Ahho Zurako.[1]
appareance: Ahho Desunen is a rotund man with blond hair and a small black mustache. His nose is slightly long and pointed, and as a noble, he wears fine, white clothes with a yellow cravat.[1]

Name: Ahho Zurako
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Ahho Zurako[2] is a noble from the Goa Kingdom and the daughter of Ahho Desunen IX.[1]
appareance: Zurako is a girl with a rather ugly face, reddish-brown hair with a yellow bow, and a light blue dress with white bows.[1]

Name: Ahiru
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 93.
description: Ahiru is the deputy commander of the East Army in the Revolutionary Army and the assistant of Belo Betty.[2]
appareance: Ahiru is a woman with pale skin, prominent lips and long hair. Her left arm is a mechanical prosthesis. She wears a blouse with an only right long sleeve, a brown glove and a red tie; in her initial appearance, she also wore a green jacket. She has a pair of goggles on her head.[1]

Name: Aisa
description: Aisa is a young Shandia girl who used to sneak onto the Upper Yard frequently to collect Vearth.[1] She is Isa's daughter. After the timeskip, she works in the Wagomuland theme park and sells Cloud Balloons.[3]
appareance: Aisa is a small Shandia girl. She wears a fur dress and cap. In the manga, her dress and cap are yellow and in the lines are white. The side cloth of her cap is also green. She has short brown hair, which Raki suggests she should grow out to become more ladylike. In the anime, her dress is brown, and her cap is yellow-white, with white cloth on the sides. In the anime she runs around in bare feet, but in the manga, wears sandals and is only barefoot while receiving a haircut from Raki. She also carries a tan satchel, with yellow buckles.[1]

Name: Akehende
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Akehende is a Marine Rear Admiral.[2][1]
appareance: Akehende as a young Marine.

Name: Akudai Kanzaburo
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Akudai Kanzaburo[2] is an arms dealer who lives in the Flower Capital of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Kanzaburo is man with curly dark brown hair, a semi-long beard and sideburns. His hair is styled in a pompadour at the front, while part of it is tied in a topknot at the back. He wears a light red kimono, dark green hakama with yellow swirling patterns, and a black and purple patterned cape.[1]

Name: Akumai
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Akumai[3] was a Billions agent who followed Mr. 2 Bon Kurei everywhere[1] before he was captured by Hina when Mr. 2 and his crew sacrificed themselves to save the Straw Hat Pirates.[4]
appareance: His hairstyle resembles the wings of the Baroque Works symbol. He wears a grey and black striped shirt and a white scarf with black spots around the neck area. He also has a sash tied around his waist like a belt. When his leader pretended to be Cobra, he was dressed like a member of the royal guard.[5] When luring Hina form the Straw Hats, he was seen dressed as Chopper.[6]

Name: Aladine
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 623.
description: Aladine[3] is a goatsbeard brotula merman. He was originally a Ryugu Kingdom soldier who was then enslaved, but then became a pirate as the doctor and later first mate of the Sun Pirates.[2][3] He is the husband of Charlotte Praline, serving as the bond between the Sun Pirates and the Charlotte Family.[3]
appareance: Aladine is a tall, muscular merman. He has slanted thin eyes, dark hair that is tied in a long ponytail falling on his back in many curves, and a full beard with a goatee in the same color. His long tail is light-brown in the upper part, but gets darker near the fins, where spots start to appear, eventually becoming a plain dark color.

Name: Albion
description: "Gashed" Albion[3] is one of the rookie pirates who joined the Fake Straw Hat Crew. He has a bounty of 92,000,000.[1]
appareance: Albion is a pale man with a large, ovular head that is wrapped in bandages, like most of his body, from his forehead to his scalp, with his face only occupying the lowest part of his head. He has a long black ponytail on the back of his head, growing out from under the bandages, and wears a captain's coat. Around his neck is what appears to be a shirt collar with two buttons that have "A" on them, along with a red and maroon striped tie around his neck. He also has a dark yellow sash around his waist.

Name: Alice
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1109.
description: Alice[4] is the current secretary of the Galley-La Company in Water 7.[3]
appareance: Alice is a 10 year-old girl with glasses and dark hair in a pigtail. For the secretary audition, she wore a dark-colored, double-breasted coat over a light-colored collared shirt, a pair of lace-trimmed socks, and bar shoes.[1] As Iceburg's secretary, she wears a pink pinstriped jacket over a red, long-sleeved, collared shirt and a short red skirt.[3]

Name: Ally
description: Ally is a little girl who was being held captive in the Biscuit Room, on Punk Hazard.[1] She was freed with the rest of the children by the Straw Hat Pirates.
appareance: Ally is larger than an average little girl due to the experiments done on her during her time in captivity. She wears a light colored sleeveless dress and has dark hair.[1] When Kin'emon gave out coats, hers was light colored with dark fur on the hood and ends of the sleeves. It also had dark buttons.[2]

Name: Alpacaman
description: Alpacaman is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates who serves as a guard in the Prisoner Mines of the Udon Region of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Alpacaman's anime concept art.

Name: Alpha
description: Alpha is a member of the CP8 branch of Cipher Pol.[1] She is the daughter of Laskey and the younger sister of CP0 agent Kalifa.[3]
appareance: Posing as a nurse, she was responsible for overseeing and secretly keeping the young Jewelry Bonney as a hostage following the brokering of a deal between Bartholomew Kuma and the World Government to create the Pacifistas in exchange for performing life-saving treatment to cure Bonney's Sapphire Scales affliction.[1]

Name: Alvida
description: "Iron Mace" Alvida[1][7] is the former captain of the Alvida Pirates, and the first enemy pirate Monkey D. Luffy encountered in his own pirate career.[1]
appareance: After her defeat by Luffy, she met and allied with Buggy to form the Buggy and Alvida Alliance, and for a time became the acting captain during Buggy's entanglements in Impel Down and the Summit War of Marineford. Since then, she has remained with the crew throughout Buggy's revolving fortunes, occupying high positions in both Buggy's Delivery[3] and the Cross Guild.[2]

Name: Amadob
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Amadob[4] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.[2]
appareance: Amadob concept art

Name: Amazon
description: Amazon[3] was the elderly gatekeeper of Skypiea and informer at the entrance to Skypiea known as Heaven's Gate. She let people in even if they could not pay her extol toll,[1] but purposely failed to tell those who did not pay about the consequences for entering the city.[5]
appareance: After the timeskip, she became the admission ticket saleswoman for Skypiea's new theme park, Wagomuland.[2]

Name: An Zengaiina
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: An Zengaiina is a prisoner on Level 2 of Impel Down.[1][2]
appareance: Zengaiina is a man with fair skin, short light brown hair, tiny black eye irises, hollow sunken black eye baggages, and a stitch patterned scar on the upper right side of his forehead. He wears the standard white prisoner outfit with black horizontal stripes, trousers, and white shoes.[1]

Name: Anba
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Anba[2] is a man living in the Wano Country[1] and a supporter of the Kouzuki Family.[2]
appareance: Anba is an man of average height with short, blue hair kept in a topknot. While at a rally supporting Kouzuki Oden's return, he wore a yukata with a floral design.[1]

Name: And
Note: His real name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Three-Headed Baskerville is the Chief Justice of Enies Lobby, in service of the World Government.[1] Ostensibly a three-headed man, "he" is actually three men—Bas, And, and Kerville—who are such close friends that they prefer acting as one body.[3][2]
appareance: The three men comprising Baskerville wear identical uniforms—blue, single-breasted coats with gold trim and brown gloves—over their abnormally-built bodies:

Name: Andre
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Andre[3] is a New World pirate captain who was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates,[4] before forming his own crew subordinate to Whitebeard. He is the twin brother of the Marine officer Candre.[5]
appareance: Andre is a large man with black curly hair and fat lips with a strong jaw and sharp teeth. He is much taller than an average human and has a big body with relatively thin legs in comparison to his arms and torso. He wears a dark purple pirate jacket that is light purple on the collar and cuffs with golden rope accessories across the jacket's buttons. He also wears a pair of white pants and long gray boots.[1]

Name: Ange
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1134.
description: Ange is a giant from Elbaph. She works as a language teacher at the Walrus School, as an assistant for Jaguar D. Saul and as a librarian of the Owl Library.[2]
appareance: Ange is a giant woman of stocky build and just slightly taller than Gerd. She sports freckles, a turned-up nose, wide chin and dark hair arranged in multiple braids.

Name: Anjo
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Anjo is a pirate admirer who witnessed Gol D. Roger's execution.[3]
appareance: Anjo is an average looking man, with slicked back green hair, and a ponytail. He has a scar on the left side of his forehead, and a jolly roger tattoo on his right arm. He also wears a black shirt,[1] which is light red in Episode of Luffy.[4]

Name: Ankoro
description: Ankoro is a gigantic anglerfish formerly under the command of captain Vander Decken IX, residing in the Underworld of the Sea, seven thousand meters underneath the ocean surface. Wadatsumi seems to regard Ankoro as a pet, as apparently Ankoro was told "not to eat ships" before.[1]
appareance: Ankoro's concept art from the anime.

Name: Antonio
Note: His name is written on his restaurant.
description: Antonio[3] is the owner of "Antonio's Graman" in Sabaody Archipelago.[1]
appareance: Antonio is a pudgy man with a small mouth, long curly mustache, and long puffy black hair. His face is rather pointed on top, but square-ish around his chin, and he also has a thick neck. He wears a light pink short-sleeved shirt under a dark green apron, which has "グラマン" (Graman) written on it.[1]

Name: Aphelandra
description: Aphelandra is a member of the tribe of Kuja living on the island of Amazon Lily.[1] During the timeskip, she became a member of the Kuja Pirates.[2]
appareance: Aphelandra is an extremely tall yet slender woman. Her facial features are childlike, with wide dark brown eyes and long orange-brown hair falling evenly past her shoulders.

Name: Aramaki
Note: His alias, Ryokugyu, was first mentioned by Donquixote Doflamingo in Chapter 713. His real name was revealed in Chapter 1053.
description: Aramaki, better known by his alias Ryokugyu, is an Admiral in the Marines. A former policeman from the Taya Kingdom,[3] he was part of the World Military Draft that filled the two Admiral vacancies (along with Fujitora), caused by Kuzan's resignation and Sakazuki's promotion.[2]
appareance: Ryokugyu was first mentioned by Donquixote Doflamingo in the Dressrosa Arc and debuted in the Levely Arc. His full appearance and real name were revealed near the end of the Wano Country Arc, in which he serves as a supporting antagonist.[6]

Name: Aremo Ganmi
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Aremo Ganmi[3] is a spectator at the Corrida Colosseum. She lives in Primula, a town in the west of Dressrosa.[3]
appareance: Ganmi in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Arlong
description: Arlong the Saw is a sawshark fish-man. He was the captain of the all fish-man crew (excluding Nami), the Arlong Pirates,[1] a former member of the Sun Pirates,[2] and the older half-brother of Madam Shyarly.[3] He is also a major inspirational figure for the New Fish-Man Pirates.
appareance: Following the death of his former captain, Fisher Tiger, Arlong was captured and sent to Impel Down, but received a pardon thanks to his comrade Jinbe becoming one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea.[8] Once freed, Arlong set his sights on conquering the East Blue, settling himself on the Conomi Islands alongside his crew and racketeering the local population. He is also the man responsible for killing Bell-mère, Nami and Nojiko's foster mother.[9] Arlong then had Nami become his subordinate, taking advantage of her cartography skills to one day conquer all of the Blue Sea.[10]

Name: Arrow
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: The Tsumegeri Guards were four men who drank the Hero Water and attempted to take down Crocodile, but failed and died from the water's side effects shortly after Crocodile refused to even fight them to give them an honorable death.[1]
appareance: The Tsumegeri Guards wore the armor similar to the regular Arabasta Royal Guards but with the addition of a turban with a duck headband and wings on each sides. They wear what appears to be war paint, with one line that goes down to the nose as their common mark.[1]

Name: Arthur
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Arthur[2] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was subordinate to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Arthur is a man with a curly brown beard that wears a light purple turban over his hair. He wears a blue vest over a brown garment that bears a kanji character (this is "長" in the manga, but appears to be "角" in his concept art.) At the bottom of his brown garment, there appear to be some sort of circular ornaments or designs. He also seems to have fairly sharp claws.[1][2]

Name: Aruyutayan V
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Aruyutayan V[2] was the king of the Lvneel Kingdom roughly 400 years ago when Mont Blanc Noland discovered Shandora.[1]
appareance: Aruyutayan was an old man with white shaggy, shoulder-length gray hair and a long gray beard. He has a large nose and thin, black eyebrows. He wears a large, golden crown that has a maroon cap and a purple band studded with turquoise. He also wears a purple shirt, a magenta cap with a fluffy white collar, and jewelry around his neck. In the anime, he wears a pink neckerchief instead.[1]

Name: Asahija
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Asahija[2] is a Marine Chief Petty Officer whose shadow was once stolen by Gecko Moria.[1]
appareance: Asahija has the normal Marine soldier appearance. He wears the standard Marine uniform along with Marine hat.[1]

Name: Asashichi
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Asashichi[2] is a resident of the Flower Capital who ran a soba shop with his wife.[1]
appareance: Asashichi is a fair-skinned man of average height and build. He has a large mouth, sharp jawline, a pink nose, and stubble on his chin. He also has pink hair tied in a topknot with long sideburns.[1]

Name: Ashura Doji
Note: He was first mentioned as "Shutenmaru" by Holed'em in Chapter 916.
description: Ashura Doji[11] was a former bandit, a samurai from Wano Country and a retainer of the Kouzuki Family, serving as one of Kouzuki Oden's Nine Red Scabbards.[12] After Oden's death, he returned to being a criminal under the name Shutenmaru,[13] assuming leadership of the Mt. Atama Thieves.[2] He initially severed his ties with the Kouzuki Family in the present but rejoined after witnessing Yasuie's death.[14]
appareance: Ashura eventually met his demise during the Raid on Onigashima, sacrificing himself to protect his fellow Scabbards from one of Kanjuro's schemes.[15]

Name: Asla
Note: It was first referenced in Chapter 1136.
description: Asla, known as the "Horse of Fortune", was the royal steed of Elbaph.[1] It passed away 63 years ago, believed to have been slain by Loki, shortly after the prince's birth.[2]
appareance: Asla was a massive horse, standing taller than Harald, a giant with ancient giant blood. Unlike normal horses, it possessed eight legs and a fiery mane, which was evenly split down its back. It also wore a horse blanket over its back, which bore the Elbaph royal symbol on its front.[1]

Name: Aswa
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Aswa[2] is Koza's mother and Toto's wife.[1]
appareance: She wears a white wrap around her head and has a light brown robe with purple spots toward the bottom. She has brown hair, and wears thick square glasses with rounded corners.[1]

Name: Atagoyama
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Atagoyama[2] is a sumo wrestler in Wano Country's Bakura Town.[1]
appareance: Atagoyama is a bulky man with light brown hair tied in a topknot. He wears a black mawashi and a white cape with blue lines.[1]

Name: Atlas
description: Atlas, also designated as Punk-05 (PUNK-05（パンク ファイブ）, Panku-Faibu?), is one of the six satellites of Dr. Vegapunk, embodying his emotions of frustrations and stress which was relieved through "violence".[1]
appareance: She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Egghead Arc.

Name: Atmos
description: "Water Buffalo" Atmos is the former 13th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.[3]
appareance: Atmos is a huge man, roughly the size of Jozu, whose choice of clothing he somehow mirrors: he is dressed in sleeveless gray and golden armor, and wears an old-fashioned Asian-themed gray helmet that has bull horns sticking out of it, that makes him resemble a water buffalo, as per his epithet. He has long, mane-like black hair, reaching down to his waist, and his beard is just as long. He has two teeth resembling those of a walrus, but square-shaped and pointing upwards. On each of his arms, he bears a purple tattooed silhouette of Whitebeard's Jolly Roger.[1]

Name: Attach
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 24.
description: Attach, commonly nicknamed Attachan (アタっちゃん, Atatchan?, VIZ: "Atacchan"), is a photojournalist employed by "Big News" Morgans for the World Economy News Paper.[4] Having previously headed the Marines' Photography Department, he supplied images of many prominent outlaws—including most of the Straw Hat Pirates—for the Marines' wanted posters,[3] but was eventually dismissed for his frequent blunders.[5]
appareance: Like Minatomo, Attach began as an SBS joke Eiichiro Oda used to "explain" a triviality—namely, how the Marines always had such high-quality illustrations of the world's most dangerous and/or unreachable criminals.[3] In time, however, he became a fully canon character, with minor but tangible impact on the story.

Name: Avalo Pizarro
Note: His name was revealed by the Marines in Chapter 576.
description: Avalo Pizarro,[6] also known as the "Corrupt King", is currently one of the Ten Titanic Captains, as the captain of the Fourth Ship.[2]
appareance: Prior to his life of crime, he was once a king of a North Blue kingdom that overthrew him for his despotic ways.[2] He was then imprisoned in Impel Down and given a life sentence in Level 6, as his crimes were so atrocious, he had to effectively be erased from history. He has since been freed by Marshall D. Teach and has become a member of his crew.[1]

Name: Ayesé Mar
Note: Joke character. They were first mentioned in SBS Volume 105.
description: Ayesé Mar is an okaki artisan from the western part of South Blue.[1]
appareance: Mar is described as a stubborn individual whose motto is "Okaki are rock'n'roll!!".[1]

Name: Azuki
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Azuki[2] is an old woman who lives in Ebisu Town.[1]
appareance: Azuki is a short elderly woman with wild white hair. She has several missing teeth and a mole above her left eyebrow. She wears a pink kimono with purple flower patterns and green patches.[1]

Name: Babanuki
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 935.
description: Babanuki is a Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates who serves as the warden of the Prisoner Mine in Udon, a region of Wano Country.[3] After the prison takeover, Babanuki was tamed by Tama.[2]
appareance: Babanuki is an extremely large and muscular tan-skinned man with long black hair and a large black beard. He possesses two sharp, fang-like teeth resembling tusks on his bottom jaw, a trait that appears to be natural, as he had them before becoming a SMILE user. Like many other SMILE users, he has two horns on the top of his head.

Name: Babe
Note: He was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 155 as his alias "Mr. 4". His real name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: "Catcher-Killing" Babe,[3] better known by his alias Mr. 4, is a former officer agent of the Baroque Works and partner of Miss Merry Christmas.[1] He is also Lassoo's owner.
appareance: He was a major antagonist during the Arabasta Arc. After the group's dissolution, he became a pizza delivery boy, stationed at the new Spiders Cafe.[2][5]

Name: Baburu
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Baburu[2] is the grandmother of the late Gaburu. She is a major supporting character in the Caribou's Kehihihihi in the New World cover story.
appareance: Baburu's appearance in the anime.

Name: Baby 5
description: Baby 5[8] is a pirate and the wife of Sai, the Happo Navy's 13th leader.[9] She is a former servant and assassin of the Donquixote Pirates,[10] serving as an officer in the Pica Army.[11] Her real name has not been revealed, as "Baby 5" is a codename given to her upon joining the Donquixote Pirates.[12]
appareance: Due to her actions, she is a minor antagonist during the Punk Hazard Arc, and a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc, before becoming an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates following her engagement with Sai in the same Arc.

Name: Bacura
Note: Her name was revealed by a Kuja in Chapter 518.
description: Bacura is a black panther owned by the Kuja Pirates under Boa Hancock.[1]
appareance: She is said to be the executioner of the Kuja tribe, and has been serving the tribe for generations.[2]

Name: Baggaley
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Baggaley[2] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: Baggaley has long black hair and a rather rectangular head. He has a tattoo covering a majority of his cheek and he wears a green hat on his head. He wears a large green cloak showing off a bit of his chest.[1]

Name: Bakezo
Note: He was named in his anime concept art.
description: Bakezo[2] is a member of the G-5 branch of the Marines.[1]
appareance: Concept art of Bakezo.

Name: Ban Dedessinée
Note: Her name was revealed in the captions of Episode 889.
description: Ban Dedessinée[3] is the Queen of the Frauce Kingdom (フラウス王国, Furausu Ōkoku?) in the East Blue and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2][3]
appareance: Dedessinée wearing her sunglasses.

Name: Banchi
description: Banchi is a giant "all-terrain" turtle used by Baroque Works—particularly Miss All-Sunday—for transportation.[2][3] He is classified as a Type A creature, "Big Friendly".[5]
appareance: Banchi in One Piece Thousand Storm.

Name: Banchina
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Banchina[3] was Usopp's mother and Yasopp's wife.[1] She died of a sickness in Syrup Village when Usopp was still young.
appareance: When she was sick, she was very pale. She had a long nose, which Usopp inherited, and black straight hair in the manga, while in the anime, her hair was dark green. She wore a pale, light green collared shirt.[1]

Name: Bankuro
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Bankuro[3] was a member of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.[1]
appareance: Bankuro's concept art

Name: Banshee
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Banshee[3] is a mermaid[4] and was the only female member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: She is a portly woman, wearing a short sleeved blouse and dark pants with light polka dots on them. She also wears dark colored heels and is seen holding a flintock. She has long, wavy light colored hair with a dark bandanna that has light colored polka dots and she wears dark lipstick.[3]

Name: Banzaburo
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 98.
description: Banzaburo[2] was a samurai of Wano Country who worked as a servant to the Kouzuki Family until their fall 20 years ago.[1]
appareance: Banzaburo's older appearance at the time of his death.

Name: Bao
description: Gyoro, Nin, and Bao were a trio of oddly shaped Soldier Zombies that were first seen reporting to Moria about the Straw Hats' arrival.[1]
appareance: They are relatively small Soldier Zombies and they are all roughly the same size as Chopper when he is when using his Brain Point. Gyoro is the zombie that looks like a one-eyed samurai with an ovular head. Nin is the pinkish-red zombie archer with a triangular head. Bao is the yellow zombie that looks like some sort of super hero with a bucket shaped head.[2]

Name: Bao Huang
description: Bao Huang is a Shinuchi in the Beasts Pirates, being part of the crew's surveillance division, the "Marys". She appears to have the duty of keeping and presenting daily schedules for the crew and their captain Kaidou.[1]
appareance: Bao Huang is a relatively short young woman with short, light blonde hair. She has two long horns at the top of her head that point upward and a large squirrel's tail protruding from her back.

Name: Barbel
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1156.
description: Barbel is a catfish fish-man and former member of the Rocks Pirates.[2]
appareance: Barbel is a notably enormous fish-man, with a face reminiscent of that of a catfish, with dark barbels, pronounced lips, a flat nose, light hair, with a fiery appearance and long sideburns. He has an overall wide build, being bigger than the largest known human, Big Mom. He dons a simple light collared shirt and a necklace of beads. Like all fish-men, his hands are webbed.

Name: Bariete
description: Bariete[4][5] is a monkey mink[1] who is a member of the Recon Squad (偵察隊, Teisatsu-tai?),[2] and the one in charge of guarding the gates of the Mokomo Dukedom.[3]
appareance: Bariete's concept art from the anime.

Name: Barrel
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: The Tsumegeri Guards were four men who drank the Hero Water and attempted to take down Crocodile, but failed and died from the water's side effects shortly after Crocodile refused to even fight them to give them an honorable death.[1]
appareance: The Tsumegeri Guards wore the armor similar to the regular Arabasta Royal Guards but with the addition of a turban with a duck headband and wings on each sides. They wear what appears to be war paint, with one line that goes down to the nose as their common mark.[1]

Name: Barry
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Barry[1][2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[2]
appareance: Barry is a slim man with long, thin limbs and a pointed nose. He has light-colored hair. He wears a light-colored, long-sleeved top that has a high collar and is looser fitting at the bottom. He also wears a light-colored hat, a necklace, striped pants, and pointed boots with a heel.[2]

Name: Bartholomew Kuma
description: Bartholomew Kuma[11] is a former Warlord of the Sea, the former king of the Sorbet Kingdom,[12] and most notably an officer, as well as founding member of the Revolutionary Army with a bounty of 296,000,000.[10] As a pirate, Kuma sailed the seas as a single-person pirate crew.[13][14] He is also the adoptive father of Jewelry Bonney,[15] daughter of his late friend and fellow revolutionary Ginny.[16] Kuma is a member of the near-extinct special race known as the Buccaneers, inherited from his late father Clapp.[17][18]
appareance: Because of the lies told to the public by the World Government, Kuma became feared as an extremely vicious pirate,[19] earning himself the title "Tyrant".[6] In exchange for curing Bonney of the deadly Sapphire Scales disease, Kuma became a special type of cyborg known as a "Pacifista", developed by the world renowned scientist Vegapunk.[20] Once Vegapunk finished his modifications on Kuma, the Warlord was converted into the first complete Pacifista cyborg, with the serial PX-0, and mentally died in the process.[2] Vegapunk also cloned Kuma as S-Bear, one of the Seraphim that were designed to replace the Warlords.[21]

Name: Bartolomeo
Note: He was first mentioned by Dagama in Chapter 704.
description: Bartolomeo the Cannibal[11] is a Super Rookie, the captain of the Barto Club[6] and the captain of the second ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[4] He joined as a gladiator to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi at the Corrida Colosseum,[12] where he met Monkey D. Luffy and pledged his loyalty towards him after winning the B Block. After a confrontation with the Red Hair Pirates his ship the Going Luffy-senpai was destroyed leaving his fate along with his crew unknown. [13]
appareance: Formerly a mob boss from the East Blue, Bartolomeo witnessed Luffy miraculously escaping the execution Buggy had prepared for him during the events of the Loguetown Arc, a scene that changed Bartolomeo's life and turned him into a major fan of the Straw Hat Pirates. He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc, the beginning of the Zou Arc, the non-canon Silver Mine Arc, the movie One Piece: Stampede and One Piece Film: Red He is also one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.

Name: Bas
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 399.
description: Three-Headed Baskerville is the Chief Justice of Enies Lobby, in service of the World Government.[1] Ostensibly a three-headed man, "he" is actually three men—Bas, And, and Kerville—who are such close friends that they prefer acting as one body.[3][2]
appareance: The three men comprising Baskerville wear identical uniforms—blue, single-breasted coats with gold trim and brown gloves—over their abnormally-built bodies:

Name: Basil Hawkins
description: Basil Hawkins[8] is an infamous pirate from North Blue known as the "Magician" and the captain of the Hawkins Pirates. He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation".[9] Hawkins attempted to create a Pirate Alliance with Eustass Kid and Scratchmen Apoo but he was betrayed by the latter who had secretly become a subordinate of the Emperor Kaidou. Defeated by Kaidou, Hawkins joined the Beasts Pirates and became one of the crew's Shinuchi.[2]
appareance: His previous known bounty amounted to 249,000,000,[1] but after the timeskip, it was raised to 320,000,000.[6]

Name: Basilisk
description: The Basilisk is the second-in-command of Impel Down's Level 2: Beast Hell, under the Sphinx. It is a snake born from a chicken as a result of a rare mutation.[1]
appareance: Basilisk's concept art from the anime.

Name: Bastille
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook. He was fully introduced in Chapter 717.
description: "Shark Cutter" Bastille is a Marine Vice Admiral who took part in the Summit War of Marineford. He later appeared in Dressrosa under the command of Admiral Fujitora.[2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Batchee
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Batchee[4] is a fly that Fullbody put in his soup to try to humiliate Sanji.[2]
appareance: Batchee is an ordinary fly belonging to the Muscidae family of flies.[4]

Name: Batman
description: Batman is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist of the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Battaman
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Battaman[4] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Battaman is a man of larger size. He wears a blue helmet on his head, with earpieces, a thin mask over his face, and the letter "B" directly over the facehole("Σ" in the anime). Like other Gifters, he has a pair of horns sticking out of it as well. He wears a blue and white Beasts Pirates outfit with shoulderpads, and an arrow pointing down.[1]

Name: Baxcon
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Baxcon[2] is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared in the Riku Royal Army Headquarters beneath the Flower Field.[1]
appareance: Baxcon is a large, muscular dwarf with lightly-tanned skin. He has a very thick, muscular neck, small eyes, small ears, and predominant cheek bones. He also has large teeth, thick lips, long, dark hair that sticks upward, bushy eyebrows, a matching bushy beard, and a dark colored tail. He wears dark-colored pants with a studded belt and a similar sash across his chest.[1]

Name: Beak Remark
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Beak Remark[2] is a fishmonger and fisherman who runs on a store on Grove 42 of Sabaody Archipelago.[1]
appareance: Remark is middle-aged man with tanned skin, thick dark eyebrows, and gray hair tied in a topknot. He has a slight stubble of a mustache and wears black sunglasses with circular lenses on his forehead. His outfit consists of a white t-shirt a red towel around his neck, blue pants with turquoise fish patterns, and brown shoes.

Name: Beegirl
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Beegirl[4] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Beegirl is a woman of average size. She has blonde hair (pink in the anime), and like other Gifters, has a pair of horns sticking out of it as well. She wears a yellow-black striped dress with the word "BEE" on the front. She has 6 arms and insect wings, likely as a result of her SMILE, and wears red gloves on each of her hands.[1]

Name: Beer VI
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 905.
description: Beer VI is the king of the Roshwan Kingdom and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2]
appareance: Beer VI is a middle-aged man with small ears, prominent cheekbones, thick lips and thick jawline. He has a thin black mustache and a goatee that end in three points.

Name: Beetleman
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Beetleman[2] is a Gifter of the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Beetleman is a tall man with blonde hair. Due to consuming a Rhinoceros Beetle SMILE, he has an extra pair of arms and rhino beetle horn protruding out of his forehead. He wears a blue cape that covers his mouth, two pairs of dark blue gloves, dark blue leather pants with a belt, and boots. As a Gifter, he also wears a pair of black horns.[3] His mouth, which he keeps hidden, is brush-like similar to a rhinoceros beetle.[2]

Name: Bekori
description: Bekori is the former king of the Sorbet Kingdom.[1]
appareance: Bekori is a rotund man with large lips and a large nose that is slightly reddened at the tip. He has light shoulder-length hair, a short dark beard, and a neat dark mustache. He wears a crown, a light cravat, and a dark royal uniform. In the manga, he was scarred by Kuma's attack while in the anime he has no facial scars.

Name: Belo Betty
description: Belo Betty is the commander of the East Army in the Revolutionary Army.[1] She succeeded the previous commander, Ginny, eight years after her death.[4]
appareance: Betty is a tall, slim woman with fair skin, short, purple hair stylized in a bob cut. Her pale green eyes are usually covered by a pair of black-framed sunglasses with red lenses and tiny white spots at the bottom. She also wears red lipstick and is usually seen smoking a cigarette.

Name: Belladonna
description: Belladonna is one of the Kuja of Amazon Lily, and the doctor of the island.[2]
appareance: Belladonna's concept art from the anime.

Name: Bellamy
description: Bellamy "the Hyena"[3][7] is a dyer and retired pirate[8] hailing from the North Blue.
appareance: Originally captain of the Bellamy Pirates,[3] he was renowned in Mock Town as the "Big-Time Rookie" until his humiliating defeat by Monkey D. Luffy.[4] Desperate to redeem himself to his idol Donquixote Doflamingo, he worked back up as a full-fledged member of the Donquixote Pirates,[2] until the crew was entirely destroyed in Dressrosa by the Straw Hat Pirates.

Name: Bellett
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Bellett[2] was the prince of an unnamed kingdom who became a pirate and was consequently imprisoned in Impel Down, and whose gender was unwillingly inverted.
appareance: Bellett was a bulky, heavyweight man with tan skin, blonde hair, and a black beard. His most distinctive feature is his large scar running from his left shoulder down to his chest. He wore green pants with a camouflage pattern (plain green in the anime).

Name: Bell-mère
Note: She was first mentioned by Nami in Chapter 50.
description: Bell-mère[6] was a former Marine and the adoptive mother of Nami and Nojiko.[1] She raised the two girls in Cocoyasi Village for approximately nine years until she was murdered by Arlong.
appareance: Bell-mère was a tall albeit slim woman with long fuchsia hair tied in a ponytail, grey eyes, and a rather unique hairstyle similar to a mohawk known as a Chelsea hawk (that Oda jokingly named "Women have guts!").[7]

Name: Benn Beckman
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 5. He was first named in the manga by Borsalino in Chapter 579.
description: Benn Beckman[6] is the first mate of the Red Hair Pirates.[2][7]
appareance: Beckman is a tall man, standing at a height of 206cm.[4] Twelve years ago, in Foosha Village, his hair was long, light brown (black in the anime) and pulled back in a ponytail.[1] In the current storyline, his hair is now gray, medium-length, and slicked-back. He also now has a large, X-shaped scar on his left temple.[8] He is never seen without his rifle nearby or a cigarette in his mouth.[1]

Name: Bent
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1147.
description: Bent is a student at the Walrus School on Elbaph.[1][2]
appareance: Bent is a young boy with short, light-colored hair in an upward spike atop an oval-shaped head with a large, round chin at its base. He wears a black fur coat over his shoulders and down his back.[1]

Name: Bentham
Note: He is formally introduced through an infobox in Chapter 154. His full name was revealed by Impel Down guard in Chapter 526.
description: Bentham of the Wild, alias Mr. 2 Bon Kurei,[7][4] is an okama and former Baroque Works officer agent.[8][3] He was a major antagonist during the Arabasta Arc, and (along with his fellow Officer Agents) one of the central characters in Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works".
appareance: While he was once an enemy of Luffy's as a member of Baroque Works,[9] the two became quick friends, leading Bon Kurei to sacrifice himself for Luffy both at Arabasta[10] and later at Impel Down[11], being one of his main allies during that Story Arc. He is currently the new queen of Newkama Land.[2]

Name: Bepo
description: Bepo[9] is a polar bear mink[4] and the navigator of the Heart Pirates.[2] He is the younger brother of the late Nox Pirate Zepo.[5]
appareance: Bepo is a polar bear mink. He wears an orange jumpsuit that bears the Heart Pirates' jolly roger. He also wears small brown boots and has sharp teeth and claws. He is as tall as a normal bear, considerably taller than common humans.[1]

Name: Bian
description: Bian is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who serves as the leader of the Pink Bee Squad[1] and a member of the Tontatta Pirates.[5]
appareance: Unlike the stocky build of most other dwarves, Bian has a slender and curvy figure. She has brown eyes, dark brown hair in a bobcut, and a black and pink striped tail.

Name: Biblo
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1135.
description: Biblo is a very old, giant owl and the chief librarian of the Owl Library, overseeing everything inside and keeping its books giant-sized.[2]
appareance: Biblo is a giant, old owl with tired eyes and glasses. Most of its plumage is dark-colored, with only its face and ears lighter and its chest made up of an alternating pattern. Biblo has prominent ear tufts which face downwards, resembling thick eyebrows.

Name: Big Pan
description: Big Pan is the largest former member of the Foxy Pirates and a combatant of the Groggy Monsters.[1] He is a wotan, being half loach fish-man and half giant.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the Long Ring Long Land Arc.

Name: Billy
Note: Mentioned only character. He was first alluded to in Chapter 96, and was named in One Piece Magazine Vol.6.
description: Billy the Orca Killer[2] is the captain of the Yes Pirates.
appareance: He had one of the fifty Skillful Grade swords, Yamaoroshi, before it was taken by Tashigi.

Name: Bimine
Note: Cover story character. He was first mentioned in Chapter 326.
description: Bimine[1] is the mayor of Pucci, "The Gourmet Town". He was first mentioned when the town of Pucci was brought up by Kalifa.[2]
appareance: Bimine in the digitally colored manga.

Name: Bingo
description: Bingo is a former priest and cooper who currently lives in Ebisu Town in Wano Country. He formerly lived in the Flower Capital before losing all his money and being exiled.[3]
appareance: Bingo is a short, elderly man with a bald head and a long, thin face. He wears a light kimono with a dark polka-dotted obi.[3]

Name: Birdy
Note: Their name was revealed in Episode 567's credits.
description: Birdy[1][4] is a Sea King.[2] It is one of the six Sea Kings that speak to Shirahoshi when she fully manifests the power of Poseidon.[5]
appareance: Birdy's full body.

Name: Bishamon
Note: His name was revealed in the credits of Episode 926.
description: Bishamon[4] is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates.[2] He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Bishonure-Onna
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Bishonure-Onna[2] is a Gifter of the Beasts Pirates who works under Black Maria.[1]
appareance: Bishonure-Onna is a tall, slim woman with short black hair. She wears kanzashi consisting of pins and a bow to adorn her hair and a yellow yukata with a blue sash.[1] Her makeup and hair are done up to resemble a geisha, and she is considered particularly beautiful among her peers. Due to consuming a Python SMILE, she secretes mucus, which covers her body.[2]

Name: Bisley
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Bisley  is a Shinuchi[3] of the Beasts Pirates and part of the Armored Division led by Sasaki.[1]
appareance: During the Raid on Onigashima, he was tamed by the power of the Kibi Kibi no Mi and joined the side of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[2]

Name: Biyo
description: Biyo (Funimation subs)
appareance: Biyo is a child who was held captive on Punk Hazard by Caesar Clown.[2] He was freed with the rest of the children by the Straw Hat Pirates.

Name: Bizarre
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Bizarre[3] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was allied with Whitebeard.
appareance: Bizarre is a massive man with a broad chest and long arms. He has long, grey hair and beard, and over his mouth he has what looks like a pair of golden metal jaws. On his head he wears a black tattered pirate hat with what looks like his Jolly Roger on it, over a purple bandanna. He sports a pair of large, square-shaped shoulder pads, and long, white gloves.[1]

Name: Bjorn
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1118.

Name: Bjorn
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1144.
description: Bjorn[2] is a student at the Walrus School on Elbaph.[1]
appareance: Bjorn is a young boy with light, straight hair with bangs that cover the left side of his face.

Name: Black Maria
Note: Her name and appearance were revealed in Chapter 978.
description: Black Maria is one of the Tobiroppo, the strongest six Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates.[5] She owns her own brothel on Onigashima near Kaidou's castle.[2]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Blackback
description: Blackback, also known by his initials BB, is a gorilla mink and a Guardian of the Whale Forest.[2]
appareance: Blackback is a large, gray-skinned[3] gorilla mink with large canine teeth, small eyes, a mustache, and a black afro. He is very thickset and wears a suit with a dark-colored cravat.[1]

Name: Blade
description: Blade is a giant from Elbaph who works as math teacher at the Walrus School.[1]
appareance: Blade is a giant with long light hair, a prominent nose, and horns indicative of ancient giant blood. He wears round glasses and has stubble of a mustache and beard. His outfit consists of a dark sleeveless shirt, a dark fur cape, a wide belt, a fur kilt, and fur-lined boots. His legs appear quite muscular.[1]

Name: Blakey
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Blakey is a longnose lancetfish fish-man[2] and a drummer in a swing jazz orchestra from Fish-Man Island.[1]
appareance: Blakey is a fish-man of light grey complexion. He has prominent lips, black hair, a reddish nose and a pink dorsal fin.

Name: Blamenco
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 58.
description: Blamenco is the former 6th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.[5]
appareance: Blamenco's concept art from the anime.

Name: Blenheim
Note: His name was revealed by pirates in Chapter 573.
description: Blenheim is the former 9th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.[5][2]
appareance: Blenheim is a huge, muscular man who is not much smaller than Whitebeard. He is large enough to carry a normal-sized human on his shoulder. He has a large mouth, small eyes, a downward pointed nose, high cheekbones, and thin, arched eyebrows. He also has dark hair pulled back in a braided ponytail, a gray beard, and chest hair. He wears a gray vest, and has purple tattoos of Whitebeard's Jolly Roger on both of his deltoids, right over two pairs of yellow armbands he wears. He has loose grayish pants tucked inside standard boots.[1]

Name: Blondie
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Blondie[3] is an infamous New World pirate who was allied with Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Blondie is a large, round man with black circles around his eyes and some stubble around his chin. He has what appears to be a small pet lion on his head, right over his pirate captain's hat (a tricorne), which has a Jolly Roger with a lion-like mane on it. He wears a standard pirate captain's coat draped over his shoulders like a cape, and striped shirt.[1]

Name: Blue Fan
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 54.
description: Blue Fan[3] is a member of the Kuja Pirates.[1]
appareance: Blue Fan's scheme from "Share the World".

Name: Blue Gilly
description: Bluegilly (WT100)[1]
appareance: Blue Gilly[7] is a martial artist from the Longleg Tribe. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[2] He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc. After the battle with the Donquixote Pirates at Dressrosa, he became part of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet[3] when he joined the XXX Gym Martial Arts Alliance, which later converted to a pirate crew called the Ideo Pirates.[4]

Name: Bluegrass
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1094.
description: Bluegrass is a Marine Vice Admiral and one of the nine that took part in the Egghead Incident.[1]
appareance: She serves as a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: Bluejam
Note: He was first mentioned by Porchemy in Chapter 583.
description: Bluejam was the captain of the Bluejam Pirates, and an infamous pirate of the East Blue. He was the main antagonist of the Post-War Arc during Luffy's flashback sequence.[1]
appareance: Bluejam was a rather tall man with short hair on the top of his head, that is fashioned in a striped manner, while the hair flowed down long and unkempt down his sides. It seemed half of his molars were missing in an alternating pattern, and he wore a traditional captain's jacket over a white shirt.[1]

Name: Blueno
Note: His name was revealed by Franky in Chapter 339.
description: Blueno is an agent of CP0.[2] Before the time skip, he was previously an agent of CP9;[10] operating undercover as the bartender of a bar in Water 7.[5]
appareance: He was one of the major antagonists during the Water 7 Arc and a minor antagonist during the Enies Lobby Arc.

Name: Blumarine
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Blumarine[4] was the shipwright[3] of the Roger Pirates[1] until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Blumarine's concept art.

Name: Boa Hancock
Note: She was first mentioned by the Risky Brothers in Chapter 489.
description: "Pirate Empress" Boa Hancock[10] is the current captain of the Kuja Pirates and was the only female Warlord of the Sea before the organization's disbandment. She is the current empress of Amazon Lily,[4] also known as the "Snake Princess". As the current empress she succeeds former empresses Tritoma, Shakuyaku, and Gloriosa. She rules over the Kuja tribe with her two younger sisters, Boa Sandersonia and Boa Marigold.[4]
appareance: Kidnapped by the World Nobles as a child along with her sisters, she was enslaved and tortured for years; during this time she was force-fed the Mero Mero no Mi, which gives her the ability to turn both living and non-living things into stone. She and her sisters escaped from Mary Geoise during a mass breakout instigated by Fisher Tiger. She was returned to her home with the help of Gloriosa, Silvers Rayleigh and Shakuyaku, where she would eventually become the island's empress, as well as one of the Seven Warlords.

Name: Boa Marigold
description: Boa Marigold[3] is the younger sister of Boa Hancock, the ruler of Amazon Lily. She is also one of the second-in commands of the Kuja Pirates and the younger sister of Boa Sandersonia. She and her sisters are referred to by the Kuja as the Gorgon Sisters.[1]
appareance: When she was 13, Marigold was quite small and slim like her older sister. Now she is a muscled, big, large woman, due to a similar training method used by sumo wrestlers to bulk themselves.[5] Her hair is arranged in a way that it looks like the patterns on a cobra's hood and to some extent, a Valkyrie's helmet.

Name: Boa Sandersonia
description: Boa Sandersonia[3] is the younger sister of Boa Hancock, the ruler of Amazon Lily. She is also one of the second-in commands of the Kuja Pirates and the older sister of Boa Marigold. She and her sisters are referred to by the Kuja as the Gorgon Sisters.[1]
appareance: Sandersonia is a large woman who resembles a snake, with a curvaceous figure and large breasts like her sisters. Her head is disproportionately large and wide to her body and her long tongue is forked, often sticking out of her mouth and has sea green eyes (amber in snake form).

Name: Bobbin
description: "Sweeper" Bobbin is a bishop-ranked combatant[3] of the Big Mom Pirates.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc.

Name: Bobby Funk
description: Bobby Funk[6] is an assassin from the Mogaro Kingdom and Kelly Funk's younger brother. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: Bobby Funk is a large, muscular man, who looms over his older brother Kelly. He has dark hair in two tails slung over his left shoulder. His long dark beard is also kept in two tails. He has a swirling lightning tattoo down his neck and right shoulder. He wears and a broad-rimmed fedora, a dred tie, and a white shirt with the sleeves rolled up.[1]

Name: Bobomba
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Bobomba[2] is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit.[1] He is the younger brother of Bomba.[2]
appareance: Bobomba, like all the other dwarves, is small and has a large fluffy tail. He has a big nose, similar in shape to his brother's, a very predominant forehead, and large cheeks. His hair is split into three segments, separated by two strips forming a V-shape. He also has a dark, thin mustache. He wears a light colored jacket with buttons on it, a dark colored scarf, and dark colored pants and shoes.[1]

Name: Bogard
Note: His name was revealed in Episode 68 credits.
description: Bogard[3] is a Marine Headquarters Marine officer and the right hand man of Vice Admiral Monkey D. Garp.[1]
appareance: Bogard is a tall man, roughly half a head higher than Monkey D. Garp who is just a bit shorter than Kuzan. He has a short hair. He wears a marine coat, which is draped over his shoulders. He wears a matching beige suit and hat, with the hat covering his eyes in a shadow.

Name: Bomba
Note: His name was revealed in Episode 622 credits.
description: Bomba[3] is a member of the Marines G-5 Branch Unit 01. He is a subordinate of Smoker and Tashigi.
appareance: Bomba is a fair-sized man with thick eyebrows, scruffy facial hair, big pink lips, a gourd-like shaped head, and black hair that sticks up. He has the words "海軍" (kaigun, meaning "Marines") tattooed on his chest.[1] While on Punk Hazard, he wore a long-sleeved shirt with the words "海軍" on it and a pair of spotted pants. While this is a blue shirt and a pair of blue spotted pants in the digitally colored manga, the anime shows him wearing a pink shirt and a pair of light-blue jeans. Additionally, he also wore a brown cloak that draped over his back while on the island.

Name: Bomba
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Bomba[4] is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom.[1] He is one of the two vice chiefs of the Tonta Corps along with Rampo, under Gancho and Leo,[4] and serves under Leo in the Tontatta Pirates.[2] He is the elder brother of Bobomba.[4]
appareance: Bomba's color scheme in the manga.

Name: Bongo
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 940.
description: Bongo is a former lumber dealer who currently lives in Ebisu Town in Wano Country.[4] He formerly lived in the Flower Capital, but was exiled after being swindled by Komurasaki.[1]
appareance: Bongo is a decrepit, thickset man with messy grey hair gathered into a topknot. He wears a white-dotted dark-purple kimono with a tattered dark-green robe over it.[1]

Name: Bonk Punch
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 101.
description: Bonk Punch[3] is one of the Senior Officers and musicians[2] of the Red Hair Pirates.[1]
appareance: Punch is a very tall, burly man with a bald head, a scar that goes down the left part of his face, neck and upper torso and dark rings around his eyes. He wears a basic shirt with a ruffled collar and rolled up sleeves, a pair of sandals and tends to have Monster perched over his shoulders.[4] He is also shown wearing a backpack during the events of the From the Decks of the World: The 500,000,000 Man Arc. In the Elbaph Arc, he wears a cape over his shoulders.

Name: Boo
description: Boo is a member of the Chinjao Family and the vice-leader of the Happo Navy.[3] He is a martial artist[4] who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1] He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc.
appareance: Boo has long orange hair, put back in two ponytails, one in the back to the right and one over the left side of his face. He has shadowy eyes, and is missing a few front teeth.

Name: Boodle
description: Boodle is the mayor of Orange Town.[4] He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Orange Town Arc.
appareance: Boodle is an elderly, bespectacled man, with curling gray hair (black in his youth) distinctly bunched atop his head and down both sides of his neck. He typically wears simple, lightweight shirts and shorts with sandals.

Name: Boogie
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Boogie[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Boogie is a man with wide shoulders and long arms in comparison to his legs. He also sports a prominent, jutting jawline, parted light hair that covers his right eye and dark lipstick. His attire consists of a leather vest adorned with small spikes over the shoulders and worn over a horizontally striped shirt.

Name: Borsalino
Note: He was first mentioned by Nico Robin in Chapter 319. His real name was revealed in Chapter 507. More commonly known by his alias Kizaru.
description: Borsalino,[8][9] more commonly known by his alias Kizaru,[1] is an Admiral in the Marines.[2] After Kuzan resigned from the Marines and Sakazuki was promoted to Fleet Admiral, Kizaru is now the only remaining Admiral from the previous trio.
appareance: He was first mentioned by Nico Robin during the Straw Hats' initial encounter with Aokiji.[2] Due of his actions and role, Kizaru is a secondary antagonist of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc and Marineford Arc, and a major antagonist of the Egghead Arc.

Name: Bourbon Jr.
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.

Name: Braham
Note: His name was revealed by Wyper in Chapter 251.
description: Braham is one of the Shandia warriors who fought to take back Upper Yard from Enel.[1]
appareance: Braham is a muscular man with the upper-half of his face always hidden by his hat. He was seen wearing this head covering even during his childhood, when hair sprouted on the back of his neck from under the hat. He wears a grass skirt, with a decorated, long light-red sash around his waist and a light-blue veil appearing from under the skirt and reaching down to his feet. However, unlike his comrades, he also sports a fur-lined, dark-green jacket, and has dark gloves on his hands.

Name: Brahm
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: The Tsumegeri Guards were four men who drank the Hero Water and attempted to take down Crocodile, but failed and died from the water's side effects shortly after Crocodile refused to even fight them to give them an honorable death.[1]
appareance: The Tsumegeri Guards wore the armor similar to the regular Arabasta Royal Guards but with the addition of a turban with a duck headband and wings on each sides. They wear what appears to be war paint, with one line that goes down to the nose as their common mark.[1]

Name: Brannew
description: Commodore Brannew[2] is a Marine officer stationed at Marine Headquarters who assigns bounties to criminals.[1] He was first introduced as a lieutenant commander during the Loguetown Arc, but was promoted to commodore during the timeskip.[2]
appareance: Brannew is a tall, tanned man with dark-green curly hair, upwards pointing sideburns, large lips, and eyes that are always obscured by a pair of sunglasses. He sports a blue and white striped shirt with an open collar, pink suit pants, and a pair of shoes. There are epaulets attached to his shirt, suggesting that this is his modified version of the Marine uniform; however, during the Summit War of Marineford, he was seen wearing a standard Marine coat with epaulets draped on his shoulders like many other officers.

Name: Brew
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Brew[2] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was subordinate to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Brew is a tall man with long flowing black hair and beard. His hair is adjusted with two arrow-like horns pointing out, and a third arrow pointing down on his forehead. His long beard is divided into five separate parts along his square jaw. He wears a light-blue bandanna, a shirt with a cloth on his collar, a pirate sash with pants, and a dark-blue pirate coat with epaulets. Overall, Brew has a bull-like appearance, matching that of his jolly roger.[1]

Name: Briscola
description: Briscola is a Shinuchi in the Beasts Pirates.[1] During the raid on Onigashima, he was tamed by the power of the Kibi Kibi no Mi and joined the side of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[3]
appareance: Briscola's concept art from the anime.

Name: Brocca
Note: Her name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Brocca[2] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was subordinate to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Brocca is an overweight woman with long flowing auburn hair and a dark brown hat with white fur lining. She wears a large circular earring on her right ear and a necklace on her neck. Furthermore, she wears a shirt that is tied into a ribbon in the front, which covers her breasts, but shows off her stomach.[1]

Name: Brogy
description: Brogy the Red Ogre is a giant from Elbaph and one of the two captains of the Giant Warrior Pirates alongside Dorry.
appareance: Once an active and infamous threat in the seas long ago, Brogy become embroiled in a personal duel over a trivial dispute with his best friend and co-captain Dorry. This duel on Little Garden lasted for a century before being interrupted by the arrival of the Straw Hat Pirates and the machinations of Baroque Works. After finally settling their duel the two giant captains returned to Elbaph and their crew, and later became involved in the Egghead Incident to rescue the Straw Hat Pirates and bring them to safety in Elbaph. During the God's Knights' invasion of Elbaph, Brogy was transformed into a demon by Imu in a bid to annex the island for the World Government.

Name: Brontosaurus
description: Brontosaurus was a dinosaur who lived on Little Garden.[1]
appareance: Brontosaurus in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Brook
appareance: "Soul King" Brook[11] is the musician of the Straw Hat Pirates, one of their two swordsmen, and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[3] He is the ninth member of the crew and the eighth to join,[17] doing so at the end of the Thriller Bark Arc.

Name: Bubblegum
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Bubblegum[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Bubblegum is a tall, lanky man who wears eyeliner, dark lipstick, with hair growing from the sides of his head in a zigzag pattern. He wears a small, spiked helmet, a long-sleeved, light-colored shirt, a chain belt and a necklace.[1]

Name: Buche
description: Buche is a member of the WCI 31, serving as the head chef of the first kitchen.[1]
appareance: Buche is a short and rotund man with short dark hair and a long handlebar mustache. His sideburns on both sides are connected by a mustache-like set of facial hair under his actual mustache. He wears a dark buttoned shirt with a sash at the top, an apron around his waist, and a large beret.[1]

Name: Buchi
description: Buchi is an officer of the Black Cat Pirates.[2] Along with his partner Sham, he is also the protector of the crew's ship, the Bezan Black, and together they are known as the Nyaban Brothers (ニャーバン・兄弟（ブラザーズ）, Nyāban Burazāzu?).[1]
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a supporting antagonist during the Syrup Village Arc.

Name: Buckingham Stussy
Note: She was first introduced as Miss Buckin. Her full name was revealed in Chapter 1072.
description: Miss Buckingham Stussy, also known by her alias Miss Buckin, is a former member of both the Rocks Pirates[2] and the illegal science institute MADS.[3] She is the self-proclaimed lover of the deceased Emperor Edward Newgate and the mother of Edward Weevil, a former Warlord of the Sea.[1]
appareance: During her time with MADS, she worked alongside other notable scientists like Dr. Vegapunk, Caesar Clown, Queen, and Vinsmoke Judge, though it has been stated that she was a freeloader who simply took and benefited from their research, hardly contributing anything of her own. Nonetheless, the group did manage to successfully produce a clone of her, Stussy, who is under the employment of Vegapunk.[2]

Name: Buffalo
Note: He was first mentioned by Donquixote Doflamingo in Chapter 682.
description: Buffalo is a combatant and an assassin of the Donquixote Pirates[1] and an officer of the Pica Army.[5] His real name is yet to be revealed, as "Buffalo" is a codename given to him upon joining the Donquixote Pirates.[6]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist during the Punk Hazard Arc, and later a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Buggy
Note: He was first mentioned by the Tightrope Walking Funan Bros in Chapter 8.
appareance: Buggy the Star Clown is the nominal president of Cross Guild, and one of the current Four Emperors dominating the New World.[6][2][15]

Name: Buhichuck
description: Buhichuck was the boss of the "Surprise Zombies" in the dining room.
appareance: Buhichuck's backside.

Name: Building Snake
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 101.
description: Building Snake[3] is one of the Senior Officers and the navigator[2] of the Red Hair Pirates.[4]
appareance: Snake is a tall and muscular man with long gray hair. He possesses two dragon tattoos: a smaller one on his right forearm and a larger one his right chest. He wears black sunglasses and a white coat.[4]

Name: Bulldog
description: Bulldog is the son of Conney and the king of the Sorbet Kingdom. He held the throne one generation before Bekori’s reign, and reclaimed his position after Bekori's successor Bartholomew Kuma became a fugitive.[1]
appareance: Bulldog's anime concept art.

Name: Bunbuku
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 93.
description: Bunbuku is a teapot owned by Tenguyama Hitetsu that was given life by "eating" the Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Tanuki.[2]
appareance: Bunbuku is a fairly big teapot adorned with dots around the middle. With its Devil Fruit transformation, it has a tanuki's head where its spout should be, a striped tail replacing the handle on the opposite side, and it is supported by tanuki legs at the bottom.[1] The sclera of its eyes are yellow in the manga,[3] but white in the anime. It is always seen stood or seated on a large, flat, fleshy sack, which does not usually appear connected to it.

Name: Bungo
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 940.
description: Bungo is an arsonist in Wano Country who currently lives in Ebisu Town.[2] He formerly lived in the Flower Capital, but was exiled after being swindled by Komurasaki.[1]
appareance: Bungo is an older-looking, decrepit man with some missing teeth. The top of his head is bald, but he has long, flowing dark hair on each side. He wears a light jacket with diamond designs over a light kimono.[1]

Name: Bunny Joe
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Bunny Joe[2] is a member of the Revolutionary Army and the leader of the group tasked with freeing the slaves on Tequila Wolf, including Nico Robin.[1]
appareance: A close-up of Bunny Joe's face.

Name: Bushon
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Bushon[1] is one of the Sea Train organizers in Water 7, along with Stevie.
appareance: Bushon is a pudgy man with a white coat and tall black hat befitting his position at Water 7. He has a black mustache and wears a white shirt with a dark tie.

Name: Busshiri
Note: His name revealed in Color Walk 4.
description: Busshiri[2] was one of the archaeologists of Ohara.[1]
appareance: Busshiri was a man with wide shoulders, tanned skin and a large chin. He had small circular eyes, along with black dreadlocks. He wore a white shirt with the word "Bomb" written on it, under a yellow jacket. In the left chest pocket of his jacket, he held a black pen, with a red and blue pen beside it.

Name: Byron
description: Byron is one of the slaves who was sold at the Human Auctioning House and was the first in the queue for sale. He is a pirate and musician.[1]
appareance: He has long blond, unkempt hair and long and big eyebrows. He has a small beard and a scar on his face which goes down from the forehead to his eye. He wears a dark coat and a red vest with a white scarf-like garment under it. He also wears an orange strip over his brown pants.

Name: Cabaji
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 15.
description: Cabaji the Acrobat[6] is the Buggy Pirates chief of staff, and a member of the Buggy and Alvida Alliance.[3] He is an acrobat swordsman. He was a member of Buggy's Delivery, and is currently a member of Cross Guild.
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered the tertiary antagonist of the Orange Town Arc, and a minor antagonist in the Loguetown Arc.

Name: Caesar Clown
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 663.
description: Caesar Clown,[6] who was referred to as "Master" by his subordinates,[1] is a scientist, the leading expert on chemical weapons of mass destruction,[6] and one of the co-founders of NEO MADS.[2]
appareance: Caesar is a former colleague of Vegapunk, having worked with him both in MADS[6][14] and later the World Government research facility on Punk Hazard,[6][7] an island that Caesar went on to devastate with a toxic gas explosion,[15] earning him a bounty of 300,000,000.[12] Years later, Caesar returned to the island in secret to continue his illegal experiments[6] until his defeat at the hands of the Straw Hat Pirates and Trafalgar Law.[16]

Name: Caimanlady
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1005.
description: Caimanlady[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates, being part of the surveillance division called the "Marys".[1][3]
appareance: Caimanlady is a young woman with long dark hair.[1] She wears a leaf-patterned kimono loosely with her shoulders exposed, and an obi around her waist. In front of her face she wears the Marys' mask with an eye symbol.[2]

Name: Camie
Note: She was formally introduced in Chapter 490.
description: Camie[3] is a kissing gourami mermaid that first appeared in Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll cover story. She first appeared in the main series after being spat out of a large sea boar that was saved by Hatchan, along with her starfish pet and master, Pappag.[5] While dreaming of becoming a designer,[6] she worked on Hatchan's Takoyaki 8 when she first met the Straw Hat Pirates. After the timeskip, she is a waitress at the Mermaid Cafe on Fish-Man Island.[7]
appareance: She is a central character during the Sabaody Archipelago Arc and also an ally of the Straw Hats in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

Name: Camel
Note: Its name was revealed in SBS Volume 70.
description: Camel is Kuzan's super penguin.[2]
appareance:
Camel is mostly dark blue with a white lining around its face. It has a white front bordered with spotted dark blue markings, a dark blue lining, then a white lining. It has a long, narrow beak that points downward at the tip. Its beak is mostly pink with a yellow rim closest to it face.
Camel is fairly large, being several times the size of its master, as Kuzan is able to lie on its head and sleep comfortably while it is swimming upright or treading water.

Name: Cancer
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Cancer is a Marine vice admiral.[4]
appareance: Cancer as a young Marine.

Name: Candre
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 70.
description: Candre is Andre's twin brother and an officer within the Marines.[5]
appareance: Candre is a tall man with a long squared face and a black afro. Like his twin brother, he also has thick lips. He wears a white shirt, a dark-color tie and jacket. Over them, he also wears a Marine high-ranking officer coat.

Name: Cands
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Cands[3] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard. He only appears in the manga.[2]
appareance: Cands is a man with an abnormally long neck, and wears a giraffe styled hood around his neck. He wears a black coat with the sleeves rolled up, and light colored pants with boots. He also has a light colored long sleeved shirt under his coat, with the sleeves rolled up above the elbows. He was seen carrying a spear, and wearing a tricorne in the manga. In his original sketch, he wore a normal cap instead of a tricorne. He strongly resembles a giraffe.[2][3]

Name: Candy
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Candy[2] is the captain of the Candy Pirates.[1]
appareance: Candy in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Capone Bege
description: Capone "Gang" Bege[10] is a mafia don-turned-pirate and the captain of the Fire Tank Pirates. He is also one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation".[11] He and his crew came from West Blue, where Bege was one of the heads of the Five Families of the West.[3] During the timeskip, he became a subordinate of Charlotte Linlin[2] and married Charlotte Chiffon. The two have a son named Capone Pez.[12] While working under the Big Mom Pirates, he held a position of a rook-ranked combatant.[13]
appareance: Due to his allegiance and actions, he is the secondary antagonist of the Zou Arc. Later, Bege formed a temporary alliance with the Straw Hat Pirates in order to kill Big Mom during the Whole Cake Island Arc.[14] After his plan failed, Bege effectively became an enemy of the Emperor and her crew.

Name: Capone Pez
description: Capone "Gang" Pez is the infant son of Capone Bege and Charlotte Chiffon, as well as the grandson of Charlotte Linlin and Pound.[1]
appareance: Pez is a small, chubby baby with long pink hair. Despite being a baby, he has 5 o'clock stubble much like his father and has a cigar-shaped pacifier in his mouth. He wears a blue onesie, with a white collar, and a black fedora hat resembling his father's.[1]

Name: Capote
description: Capote is a billfish fish-man and a former combatant of the Foxy Pirates.
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the Long Ring Long Land Arc.

Name: Caribou
Note: He was first mentioned by Demalo Black in Chapter 598.
description: "Wet-Haired Caribou"[1][7] is an infamous rookie pirate who was at the Sabaody Archipelago around the time of the Straw Hat Pirates' reunion. He has earned a bounty of 210,000,000, making him part of the new generation of rookie pirates with bounties over 100,000,000.[2] A fierce admirer of the Emperor Marshall D. Teach, Caribou dreams of becoming part of the Blackbeard Pirates.[8]
appareance: He is the big brother of "Blood Splatterer" Coribou, another infamous rookie, and the two of them are co-captains of the Caribou Pirates. Both brothers gained their reputations for killing Marines.
