As both of them have bounties over 70,000,000, they both fulfilled the requirement of the Fake Straw Hat Crew,[3] but they left upon discovering the crew's fraudulence.

Name: Carmel
Note: Her name was first mentioned by Capone Bege in Chapter 859. She was first seen via a photograph in Chapter 861.
description: Mother Carmel was a child trafficker dealing in orphans, that operated in the Underworld several decades ago, under the code name of "Mountain Witch". Running an orphanage known as the "Sheep's House", her seemingly benevolent nature caused her to be known as the "Holy Mother".[3]
appareance: In reality, she sold her orphan wards to the World Government every two years to be trained as Marines or Cipher Pol agents,[2] until she met her end 62 years ago.[7] Notably, she took care of a young Charlotte Linlin, who would later go on to become the Emperor Big Mom.[8]

Name: Carne
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 53.
description: Carne is one of the main cooks at the Baratie, currently serving as the restaurant's head charcutier.
appareance: Carne is a stocky, average-sized man with brown hair and tanned skin. Like most of the Baratie's other cooks, he wears an unremarkable chef's uniform, distinguished only by the addition of sunglasses.

Name: Carrot
description: Carrot is a rabbit mink of the Mokomo Dukedom,[7] the current ruler of the dukedom,[8][4] and a former member of the Kingsbirds[3] and Inuarashi Musketeer Squad.[2] She was trained by Pedro, whose will she carries on.
appareance: She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Whole Cake Island Saga and Wano Country Arc, where she joined the Sanji Retrieval Team to rescue Sanji on Whole Cake Island[9] and participated in the Raid on Onigashima.

Name: Catacombo
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Rear Admiral Catacombo[4] is a Marine officer who led a team to capture the Straw Hat Pirates.[1]
appareance: Non-canonically, he is the Base Commander of the GR 66 Marine Base on the Sabaody Archipelago.[2]

Name: Catarina Devon
Note: She was first mentioned by Emporio Ivankov in Chapter 538.
description: Catarina Devon,[7] known as the "Crescent Moon Hunter", was the most dangerous female pirate ever to be imprisoned in Impel Down within the Great Pirate Era. She was freed by Marshall D. Teach and recruited to the Blackbeard Pirates,[2] where she joined the Ten Titanic Captains as captain of the sixth ship.[3]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist in the Marineford Arc, a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

Name: Caucasusman
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Caucasusman[3] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates' Armored Division. During the Raid on Onigashima, he was tamed by the power of the Kibi Kibi no Mi and joined the side of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[2]
appareance: Caucasusman is a muscular man with a light brown hair. Due to consuming the Caucasus Beetle SMILE, he was an extra pair of arms, and the caucasus beetle horns protruding out of his head. He wears top hat with a skull with horns in the middle, a leather sleeveless jacket with a green collar, two pairs of light green gloves, beige pants with a belt and boots. On the back of his jacket is written 降下刺 (Kōkasasu?, meaning "descending spines", a pun on "caucasus").

Name: Cavendish
description: Cavendish of the White Horse, also known as the "Pirate Prince", is a famous Super Rookie and the captain of the Beautiful Pirates. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1] After the final battle against Donquixote Doflamingo, Cavendish decided to pledge his loyalty to Monkey D. Luffy and became the captain of the first ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[4]
appareance: He was formerly the prince of the Bourgeois Kingdom before he was exiled.[5] He also suffers from a split personality, changing into a bloodthirsty lunatic known as Hakuba when his dominant personality sleeps. While initially antagonistic, he later becomes an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc, and one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.

Name: CB Gallant
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: CB Gallant[3] was a member of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution.[1] His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Gallant's concept art.

Name: Cerberus
description: Cerberus was a wild zombie who served under Gecko Moria.[1]
appareance: Cerberus' Concept Art from the Anime.

Name: Cerberus
Note: Its name was revealed in Chapter 1138.
description: Cerberus is Figarland Shamrock's sword, which has been animated by a Mythical Zoan-type Devil Fruit, allowing it to take the form of a monstrous, three-headed dog.[2]
appareance: Untransformed, Cerberus is a saber with a long, single-edged blade, a circular knuckle-bow guard, a light-colored hilt, and a light sheath, which is usually kept hanging on Shamrock's left hip via a studded shoulder belt.[3]

Name: Cezar
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Cezar[3] is the recently-crowned king of the Ilisia Kingdom and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2]
appareance: Cezar is a man with well-defined cheekbones, large lips and a wide nose. He has long, curly brown hair. He wears a royal cape and and crown with red jewels on it.[1]

Name: Chabo
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 70.
description: Chabo is a young boy from Gosa Village.[1] He works for Nojiko on her mikan farm.[2]
appareance: He is a small boy, with brown hair, and round eyes. He wears a green beanie, and an orange jacket.

Name: Chadros Higelyges
Note: His real name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Chadros Higelyges,[6] better known as Brownbeard, is a former New World pirate. After Whitebeard's death he went off and took control of Foodvalten, one of the New World islands formerly under Whitebeard's protection.[1]
appareance: After his defeat at the hands of Basil Hawkins, he quit being a pirate and resided on Punk Hazard,[4] where he became the boss of the Centaur Patrol Unit which guarded part of the island,[3] until his "Master" Caesar Clown betrayed him.[2]

Name: Chaka
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 167.
description: Chaka the Jackal[3] is one of two head guards in the Arabasta kingdom who serves under Igaram, alongside Pell.[2] Chaka was the acting captain of the royal guard in Igaram's absence.
appareance: Chaka is a tall, imposing dark skinned man with medium length black hair and a long broad nose resembling that of a jackal.

Name: Chao
Note: His name was revealed by another dwarf in Chapter 755.
description: Chao is a dwarf from the Tontatta Kingdom who was enslaved in the SMILE Factory.[1]
appareance: Chao's color scheme in the manga.

Name: Chap
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Chap[3] is the king of the Deul Kingdom (ドイル王国, Doiru Ōkoku?) in the North Blue and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2][3]
appareance: Chap is a middle-aged man with short black hair, a short toothbrush mustache and a pointy chin sporting a goatee.

Name: Chappe
description: "Rope-Tugging" Chappe is an ex-prisoner who was a henchman for Caesar Clown. He was first seen fighting against the Marines of G-5 on Punk Hazard.[1]
appareance: Chappe's full-body.

Name: Charlos
description: Saint Charlos[4] is a World Noble, the son of Saint Rosward, and the older brother of Saint Shalria.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered one of the main antagonists of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc, and a minor antagonist during the Levely Arc.

Name: Charlotte Akimeg
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Akimeg is the 31st daughter and 71st child of the Charlotte Family[5] and the seventh of the Charlotte Decuplets to be born.[1] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2]
appareance: Akimeg is an average-sized young woman with long brown hair styled in a top knot with a pink bow on top. She wears a pink long-sleeved dress with a heart-shaped skull emblem and a yellow ribbon, white gloves, horizontally-striped pink and white leggings, and red-pink high heels.[1]

Name: Charlotte Allmeg
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Allmeg is the 32nd daughter and 72nd child of the Charlotte Family[5] and the eighth of the Charlotte Decuplets to be born.[1] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2]
appareance: Allmeg is an average-sized young woman with long brown hair styled in an afro with a pink bow on top. She wears a pink sleeveless dress with a light blue ribbon and red heart badge, white gloves, horizontally-striped pink and white leggings, and red-pink high heels.[1]

Name: Charlotte Amande
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 845.
description: "Demon Lady" Charlotte Amande is the third daughter and seventh child of the Charlotte Family, the second quadruplet sister to Mondée, Hachée, and Effilée,[6] and a snakeneck-human hybrid.[8]
appareance: She also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[3] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Nuts (ナッツ大臣, Nattsu Daijin?), governing over Nuts Island.[4]

Name: Charlotte Anana
description: Charlotte Anana is the 39th daughter of the Charlotte Family, as well as the 85th and youngest overall child, and is a member of the Big Mom Pirates.[2]
appareance: Anana is a young girl with wavy pink hair that is split on either side and large red eyes.

Name: Charlotte Angel
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Angel is the seventh daughter and 17th child of the Charlotte Family[5] and the younger triplet sister of Cracker and Custard.[4] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Angel is a thin woman with purple hair that sticks out to the right and left. She wears an open light green jacket as well as a darker green coat wrapped around her neck, and her midriff is mostly exposed, with only a short pink tube top. She wears a very short pink fur skirt and long pink boots that go up to her knees.[5]

Name: Charlotte Anglais
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 848.
description: Charlotte Anglais[4] is the 42nd son and 78th child of the Charlotte Family and a member of the Big Mom Pirates.[1][2]
appareance: Anglais's concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Basans
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Basans is the 23rd son and 39th child of the Charlotte Family and the younger twin brother of Saint-Marc.[3] He also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[4]
appareance: Basans is a very tall dark-skinned man with several antlers on his head. He wears what appears to be a puffy light blue hooded jacket with circle patterns that has a big zipper. He also wears armor on his legs.[2]

Name: Charlotte Basskarte
Note: His name was first mentioned in Chapter 898, and he was identified by the captions of Episode 839.
description: Charlotte Basskarte (WT100)[1]
appareance: Charlotte Basskarte[5] is the 13th son[5] and 22nd child of the Charlotte Family and the middle triplet brother of Nusstorte and Dosmarche.[6] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[4]

Name: Charlotte Bavarois
description: Charlotte Bavarois is the 26th son and 45th child of the Charlotte Family,[2] as well as an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3] He is the younger twin brother of Snack.[4]
appareance: Bavarois is an extremely tall man with a thick physique. He has blonde hair in strands that resemble dreadlocks, thick mustache, and a braided beard that goes to his upper chest. He wears a yellow and black horizontally-striped jumpsuit, dark shoes, and a blueish-purple cape that seems to be in tatters at the end. He also wears white bandages over his arms, dark red boxing gloves on his hands, a cap that has dark blue letters "BM" on the front, and a pair of shades made from the netting of the cap on his forehead.[2]

Name: Charlotte Brownie
description: Charlotte Brownie is the 32nd son and 58th child of the Charlotte Family[2] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3] He joined Charlotte Oven's army to intercept the Straw Hat Pirates on Cacao Island.[2]
appareance: A full-body view of Brownie.

Name: Charlotte Broyé
Note: Her name was revealed in the credits of Episode 835. Her full name was revealed in SBS Volume 90.
description: Charlotte Broyé is the ninth daughter and 20th child of the Charlotte Family[3] and the younger twin sister of Brûlée.[5] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[2] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Meringue (メレンゲ大臣, Merenge Daijin?), governing over Milenge Island.[3]
appareance: Broyé's concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Brûlée
Note: Real appearance was revealed in Chapter 832.
description: Charlotte Brûlée is the eighth daughter and 19th child of the Charlotte Family and the older twin sister of Broyé.[2][6] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: She was stationed in the Seducing Woods to ambush the Sanji Retrieval Team,[2] but after being defeated, the team used her Devil Fruit ability to enter an alternate dimension known as Mirro-World to move around Totto Land.[8] Due to her actions and role, she is a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc. She, alongside her siblings Charlotte Katakuri and Charlotte Oven, become temporary and reluctant allies of the Straw Hat Pirates during One Piece Film: Red.

Name: Charlotte Cabaletta
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 85.
description: Charlotte Cabaletta is the eighth son and the 13th child of the Charlotte Family and the fourth quintuplet brother of Opera, Counter, Cadenza, and Gala.[2] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Cabaletta concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Cadenza
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 85.
description: Charlotte Cadenza is the seventh son and the twelfth child of the Charlotte Family and the third quintuplet brother of Opera, Counter, Cabaletta, and Gala.[2] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Cadenza concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Chiboust
Note: His name was revealed in the credits of Episode 869.
description: Charlotte Chiboust[4] is the 30th son and 51st child of the Charlotte Family[3] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2] He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Mix (ミックス大臣, Mikkusu Daijin?), governing over Sanshoku Island.[3] He was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Luffy on Cacao Island.[1]
appareance: Chiboust is a tall and rotund man with comparatively short legs. He wears a blue suit over almost his entire body, leaving only his arms and face exposed. Around his head, he has cylindrical fixtures that resemble sun rays. He wears polka-dotted sashes around his shoulders and waist, and has a handle-shaped appendage on his back that resembles one for a teapot or cup.[1][5]

Name: Charlotte Chiffon
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 834.
description: Charlotte Chiffon is the 22nd daughter and the 52nd child of the Charlotte Family and Totto Land's former Minister of Puff (ふんわり大臣, Funwari Daijin?, Viz: "Minister of Fluff")[3] having governed over Funwari Island until her defection. She is Capone Bege's wife and the mother of Capone Pez, as well as a member of Bege's Fire Tank Pirates.[8]
appareance: Her father is Big Mom's 25th ex-husband, Pound,[9] and her younger twin sister is Lola. Due to her resemblance to Lola, Chiffon was abused by Big Mom in her rage for Lola abandoning an arranged marriage. This led to Chiffon cutting ties to her blood family and helping Bege in his attempt to assassinate her own mother, which caused Big Mom herself and most of Chiffon's siblings to identify her as an enemy.[5]

Name: Charlotte Cinnamon
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 892.
description: Charlotte Cinnamon is the 16th daughter and 37th child of the Charlotte Family,[5] the younger triplet sister of Smoothie and Citron,[3] and a longleg-human hybrid.[6] She also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2]
appareance: Cinnamon's full appearance.

Name: Charlotte Citron
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 892.
description: Charlotte Citron[6] is the 15th daughter and 36th child of the Charlotte Family, the middle triplet sister of Smoothie and Cinnamon,[4] and a longleg-human hybrid.[7] She also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[2] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Eggs (エッグ大臣, Eggu Daijin?), governing over Kimi Island.[3]
appareance: Citron's full appearance.

Name: Charlotte Compo
Note: His name was revealed in Episode 846. His full name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Compo[5] is the 17th son and 28th child of the Charlotte Family and the older twin brother of Laurin.[4] He also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[3] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Pie (パイ大臣, Pai Daijin?), governing over Piepie Island.[4]
appareance: Compo is a short man, and due to his clothing, his features are hidden. He wears a blue jumpsuit with his name written on it in yellow, a yellow belt, a pair of white gloves, white platform shoes, a large yellow cap, a navy ascot over his lower face, orange headphones, a dark purple cape, and sunglasses.[1]

Name: Charlotte Compote
Note: She was named in Chapter 861.
description: Charlotte Compote[6] is the eldest daughter and second child of the Charlotte Family[4] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3] She also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Fruits (フルーツ大臣, Furūtsu Daijin?), governing over Fruits Island.[2]
appareance: Compote is a very large and heavyset woman with a strong resemblance to her mother, Big Mom. She has a large nose, prominent lips, and very long and bushy teal hair. She wears a light purple frilly dress as well as a large bowl of fruit parfait on her head.[2]

Name: Charlotte Cornstarch
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Cornstarch is the 11th daughter and 27th child of the Charlotte Family and the younger triplet sister of Moscato and Mash.[5] She also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[3] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Love (愛情大臣, Aijō Daijin?), governing over Loving Island.[4]
appareance: Cornstarch's original concept art.

Name: Charlotte Counter
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 85.
description: Charlotte Counter is the sixth son and the 11th child of the Charlotte Family and the second quintuplet brother of Opera, Cadenza, Cabaletta, and Gala.[3] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[4]
appareance: Counter concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Cracker
Note: Real appearance revealed in Chapter 838.
description: "Thousand Arms" Charlotte Cracker[4][9] is the tenth son and 15th child of the Charlotte Family and the oldest triplet brother of Custard and Angel.[10] He is also one of the Three Sweet Commanders of the Big Mom Pirates and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Biscuits (ビスケット大臣, Bisuketto Daijin?), governing Biscuits Island.
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the first half of the Whole Cake Island Arc.[3]

Name: Charlotte Custard
Note: Her full name was revealed in Episode 855.
description: Charlotte Custard is the sixth daughter and 16th child of the Charlotte Family and the middle triplet sister of Cracker and Angel.[5] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[4]
appareance: Despite her age, Custard is a slim, young-looking woman who has fair skin, brown eyes, short violet hair adorned with a flower. She wears a purple-pink bodysuit with matching elbow-length gloves and belt around her waist. She also wears a large, fluffy light pink cape with pink polka dots around her shoulders.[2]

Name: Charlotte Dacquoise
Note: His name was revealed in the caption of Episode 834. His full name was revealed in SBS Volume 90.
description: Charlotte Dacquoise[5] is the 24th son and 41st child of the Charlotte Family[2] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3] He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Jam (ジャム大臣, Jamu Daijin?), governing over Jam Island.[4]
appareance: Dacquoise's full appearance.

Name: Charlotte Daifuku
description: Charlotte Daifuku[7] is the third son and fourth child of the Charlotte Family[1] and the middle triplet brother of Katakuri and Oven.[4] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[2] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Beans (豆大臣, Mame Daijin?), governing over Poripori Island.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc.

Name: Charlotte De-Chat
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte De-Chat is the 44th son and the 81st child of the Charlotte Family.[3] He is a hybrid between a human and a fish-man.[2]
appareance: De-Chat is a short and stocky boy. Being of fish-man heritage, he has light purple skin and small fins below his ears. He has a very tall mohawk of brown hair on his head. He does not wear a shirt, wearing only pants and a belt with a large circular buckle.[2]

Name: Charlotte Dolce
description: Charlotte Dolce and Dragee (WT100)[1]
appareance: Charlotte Dolce and Charlotte Dragée are the 45th and 46th sons and the 83rd and 84th children of the Charlotte Family, being the two youngest sons of Charlotte Linlin, and are members of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]

Name: Charlotte Dosmarche
Note: His name was first mentioned in Chapter 898, and he was identified by the credits of Episode 835.
description: Charlotte Dosmarche[5] is the 14th son and 23rd child of the Charlotte Family and the younger triplet brother of Nusstorte and Basskarte.[4] He also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[3] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Tea (お茶大臣, Ocha Daijin?), governing over Black Island.[4]
appareance: A close up of Dosmarche's face.

Name: Charlotte Dragée
description: Charlotte Dolce and Dragee (WT100)[1]
appareance: Charlotte Dolce and Charlotte Dragée are the 45th and 46th sons and the 83rd and 84th children of the Charlotte Family, being the two youngest sons of Charlotte Linlin, and are members of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]

Name: Charlotte Effilée
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Effilée is the fifth daughter and ninth child of the Charlotte Family, the youngest quadruplet sister of Mondée, Amande, and Hachée, and a snakeneck-human hybrid.[5] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Effilée is a tall, thin, woman who, like all snakenecks, possesses a long neck. She has a square head and long, wavy blue hair. On her torso she only wears an open dark purple jacket, which ends halfway down her chest exposing her cleavage, as well as a bandolier across her chest. She also wears dark purple vertically striped pants and a dark purple bowler hat, as well as an ammunition belt on her waist.[2]

Name: Charlotte Flampe
description: Charlotte Flampe is the 36th daughter[6][7] and 77th child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates,[2] serving as the Captain of the Special Attack Unit (特攻隊長, Tokkō-taichō?, Viz: "Kamikaze Captain"). She is also Totto Land's Minister of Honey (はちみつ大臣, Hachimitsu Daijin?), governing over Rokumitsu Island,[3] and the President of the Katakuri Fan Club (カタクリファンクラブ会長, Katakuri Fan Kurabu Kaichō?).[1]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a minor antagonist during the Whole Cake Island Arc.

Name: Charlotte Fuyumeg
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Fuyumeg is the 34th daughter and 74th child of the Charlotte Family[5] and the tenth of the Charlotte Decuplets to be born.[1] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2]
appareance: Fuyumeg is an average-sized young woman with long brown hair styled in a braid with a pink bow on top. She wears a pink sleeveless dress with a blue ribbon, white gloves, horizontally-striped pink and white leggings, and red-pink high heels.[1]

Name: Charlotte Gala
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 85.
description: Charlotte Gala is the ninth son and the 14th child of the Charlotte Family and the youngest quintuplet brother of Opera, Counter, Cadenza, and Cabaletta.[1]
appareance: Gala's anime concept art.

Name: Charlotte Galette
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 843.
description: Charlotte Galette is the 18th daughter and the 42nd child of the Charlotte Family and the older twin sister of Poire.[8] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[4] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Butter (バター大臣, Batā Daijin?),[2] governing over Margarine Island.[5]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc.

Name: Charlotte Hachée
Note: She was officially introduced in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Hachée is the fourth daughter and eighth child of the Charlotte Family, the third quadruplet sister to Mondée, Amande, and Effilée,[5] and a snakeneck-human hybrid.[3] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[4]
appareance: Hachée is a tall, thin woman who possesses a long neck, like all snakenecks. She has long, wavy hair, and she wears a hat that obscures her left eye. She also wears long pants and shirt which are both striped vertically.

Name: Charlotte Harumeg
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Harumeg is the 33rd daughter and 73rd child of the Charlotte Family[5] and the ninth of the Charlotte Decuplets to be born.[1] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2]
appareance: Harumeg is around twice as tall as her average-sized decuplet sisters. She has long brown hair which covers her eyes and is styled in bunches with a pink bow on top. She wears a pink sleeveless dress with a green ribbon, white gloves, horizontally-striped pink and white leggings, and red-pink high heels.[1]

Name: Charlotte High-Fat
Note: His name was revealed in the captions of Episode 841. His full name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte High-Fat[5] is the 20th son and 33rd child of the Charlotte Family[2] and the older twin brother of Tablet.[4] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Full view of High-Fat.

Name: Charlotte Joconde
description: Charlotte Joconde is the 27th daughter and 59th child of the Charlotte Family[1] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2] She was also a member of Charlotte Oven's army to intercept the Straw Hat Pirates on Cacao Island.[1]
appareance: Joconde is a short woman with very long, bushy blonde hair. She wears a frilly strapped light green dress over a green shirt, as well as a knight's helmet with a long spike on top. She also wears gauntlets and armor on her legs too.[1] She rides a helmeted horse as a mount.[4]

Name: Charlotte Joscarpone
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 86 and Chapter 880.
description: Charlotte Joscarpone is the 29th daughter[6] and 63rd child of the Charlotte Family, the younger twin sister of Charlotte Mascarpone, and a Snakeneck-human hybrid.[2] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Joscarpone's concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Kanten
Note: His name was revealed in the captions of Episode 839. His full name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Kanten[7] is the 27th son and 48th child of the Charlotte Family[4] and the eldest triplet brother of Kato and Montb.[6] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[5] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Agar (寒天大臣, Kanten Daijin?), governing over Jelly Island.[6]
appareance: Kanten is a very obese man with a wide head and no neck. The top of his head is longer and shaft-shaped, and is covered by bandages that also cover his right eye. His mouth contains only a few teeth that are spaced widely apart. He has extremely long and curly dark green hair that reaches to the small of his back and is wider than his body. He does not wear a shirt, only wearing black pants with an X-shaped belt that resembles caution tape, as well as bandages around his arms.[3]

Name: Charlotte Katakuri
Note: He was first mentioned by a Whole Cake Island resident in Chapter 843.
description: Charlotte Katakuri is the second son and third child of the Charlotte Family[3] and the elder triplet brother of Daifuku and Oven.[5] He is also one of the Three Sweet Commanders of the Big Mom Pirates[4] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Flour (粉大臣, Kona Daijin?), governing over Komugi Island.[5]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, Katakuri is the secondary antagonist in the second half of the Whole Cake Island Arc. He, alongside his younger siblings Charlotte Brûlée and Oven, become temporary and reluctant allies of the Red Hair Pirates and the Straw Hat Pirates during One Piece Film: Red.

Name: Charlotte Kato
Note: His name was revealed in the credits of Episode 843. His full name was revealed in SBS Volume 90.
description: Charlotte Kato[6] is the 28th son[3] and 49th child of the Charlotte Family and the middle triplet brother of Kanten and Montb.[5] He also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[4] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Seeds (シード大臣, Shīdo Daijin?), governing over Tanega Island.[5]
appareance: Kato is a very tall and slim man. His head heavily resembles a pumpkin, being dark orange and covered in vertical creases, with dark green hair that resembles leaves and a stem on top. His eyes are slits and his mouth is extremely wide and thin, giving him the appearance of a jack-o-lantern. He wears a black shirt with target patterns on it, a thin purple cape, round gray pads on his shoulders, and gray armor plates on his forearms. He also wears a short kilt and leg armor that goes up to around where his kilt ends.[2][7]

Name: Charlotte Laurin
Note: His name was revealed in the captions of Episode 834. His full name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Laurin is the 18th son and 29th child of the Charlotte Family and the younger twin brother of Compo.[2] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Laurin is a thin man with olive skin. He has several scars across his arms and forearms. He covers most of his face with a black top hat bearing a pink skull, with the skull's eye sockets holed out for his sight or possibly a Homie. He wears metal lederhosen with an orange pearl at the waist, held up by dark blue suspenders, short torn black pants, torn black boots, and an orange ascot. He also wears a single dark grey glove on his right hand.[1]

Name: Charlotte Linlin
Note: She was first mentioned by Kid in Chapter 581. Her real name was revealed by Pappag in Chapter 610.
description: Charlotte Linlin,[18] better known as "Big Mom",[19] is the captain of the Big Mom Pirates[6] and was formerly one of the Four Emperors ruling over the New World, as the only female member of the group.[3][1] She is the queen of the archipelago nation Totto Land,[6] a place she seeks to form into a utopia where all the world's races can live together in peace without discrimination or segregation.[20] She is also the matriarch of the Charlotte Family,[5] whose children make up the ministers of her nation and the core infrastructure of her crew.[21]
appareance: Big Mom wields the Soru Soru no Mi, which allows her to steal the souls of others and implant them in inaminate objects, resulting in the unique race of creatures known as homies, who happily serve her. Big Mom possesses three special homies: the bicorne Napoleon, the sun Prometheus, and the thunder cloud Hera. Hera's position was formerly owned by another thunder cloud, Zeus, but Big Mom grew tired of Zeus' continued failures and created Hera to replace him.[22]

Name: Charlotte Lola
Note: Her full name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Charlotte Lola[5] is the captain of the Rolling Pirates and the 23rd daughter and 53rd child of the Charlotte Family. Her mother is the former Emperor Charlotte Linlin[2] and her father is Linlin's 25th husband, Pound. She is the younger twin sister of Chiffon[7][8] and Gotti's wife.
appareance: She was Totto Land's Minister of Chocolate (チョコレート大臣, Chokorēto Daijin?) before she ran away after being arranged to marry Prince Loki of Elbaph.[3] Wanting to marry for love, she proposed so many times to the point of being called "Marriage Proposal Lola" until she finally married Gotti. She was a member of the Thriller Bark Victim's Association after her shadow was stolen by Gecko Moria and placed into a warthog zombie also named Lola.

Name: Charlotte Maple
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Maple is the 26th daughter and 57th child of the Charlotte Family,[5] the youngest quadruplet sister of Mobile, Marble, and Myukuru, and a Longarm-human hybrid.[4] She also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3] She was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.[2]
appareance: Maple's color scheme in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Charlotte Marble
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Marble is the 24th daughter and 55th child of the Charlotte Family, the second quadruplet sister of Mobile, Myukuru, and Maple, and a Longarm-human hybrid.[5] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2]
appareance: She was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.[1]

Name: Charlotte Marnier
Note: Her name was revealed in the credits of Episode 834. Her full name was revealed in SBS Volume 90.
description: Charlotte Marnier[7] is the 13th daughter and 32nd child of the Charlotte Family[4] and the younger twin sister of Mozart.[5] She also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[3] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Yeast (酵母大臣, Kōbo Daijin?), governing over Kibo Island.[4]
appareance: Marnier concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Mascarpone
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 86 and Chapter 880.
description: Charlotte Mascarpone is the 34th son and 62nd child of the Charlotte Family,[4] the older twin brother of Joscarpone, and a Snakeneck-human hybrid.[2] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[3] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Tableware (食器大臣, Shokki Daijin?), governing over Cutlery Island.[4]
appareance: Mascarpone's concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Mash
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Mash is the tenth daughter and 26th child of the Charlotte Family[5] and the middle triplet sister of Moscato and Cornstarch.[4] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Mash's original concept art.

Name: Charlotte Melise
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Melise is the 17th daughter and 40th child of the Charlotte Family[4] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Melise is a woman with a set of matching deer-like antlers on her head, accompanied by long, flowing hair that reaches below her waist. She wears a fancy dress with a very wide and puffy skirt. She also has relatively thin arms.

Name: Charlotte Mobile
Note: His name was revealed in the credits of Episode 833. His full name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Mobile is the 31st son and 54th child of the Charlotte Family, the elder quadruplet brother of Marble, Myukuru, and Maple, and a Longarm-human hybrid.[2] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[4] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Tasting (味見大臣, Ajimi Daijin?), governing over Futoru Island.[2]
appareance: Mobile is a tall man with light skin, and a long, pointy nose. He has reddish-brown hair arranged as an upside down triangular shape, with the two horizontal angles ending with an upward curl. He also has a thin pencil mustache. He wears a puffy high collar suit with pink and burgundy vertical lines, a yellow scarf, and wears a brown and yellow cape.[1]

Name: Charlotte Mondée
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Mondée is the second daughter and sixth child of the Charlotte Family, the eldest quadruplet sister of Amande, Hachée, and Effilée, and a snakeneck-human hybrid.[5] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Mondée is a thickset woman with a fat face and neck; this fat obscures the long neck seen in those of snakeneck descent. She has long, wavy, teal hair and wears a yellow buttoned gown as well as a wide-brimmed black hat on her head that has pink flowers around it.[2] At the tea party, Mondée wore prominent lipstick,[6] although her lips look quite thin without it.

Name: Charlotte Mont-d'Or
Note: His name was fully revealed in Chapter 843.
description: Charlotte Mont-d'Or (WT100)[1]
appareance: "Scribe" Charlotte Mont-d'Or[4] is the 19th son and 30th child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[5] He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Cheese (チーズ大臣, Chīzu Daijin?), governing over Cheese Island.[3]

Name: Charlotte Montb
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Montb[3] is the 29th son and 50th child of the Charlotte Family and the youngest triplet brother of Kanten and Kato.[3] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[4]
appareance: He was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.[2]

Name: Charlotte Moscato
description: Charlotte Moscato is the 16th son and 25th child of the Charlotte Family[2] and the eldest triplet brother of Mash and Cornstarch.[5] He also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[4] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Gelato (ジェラート大臣, Jerāto Daijin?),[2] governing over Ice Island.[5]
appareance: Moscato's concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Mozart
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Mozart is the 12th daughter and 31st child of the Charlotte Family[5] and the elder twin sister of Marnier.[4] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: Mozart is a thin woman with very long dark maroon hair, which is partitioned into two large horn-shaped braids to the left and right of her head which resemble a jester's hat; parts of these braids are pink. She has purple eyes. She wears a pink collared shirt with horizontal purple stripes, a maroon skirt, striped tights, and a light purple cape.[2]

Name: Charlotte Myukuru
Note: Her name was revealed in an anime promotion poster.
description: Charlotte Myukuru[5] is the 25th daughter and 56th child of the Charlotte Family,[3] the third quadruplet sister of Mobile, Marble, and Maple, and a longarm-human hybrid.[6] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2]
appareance: Myukuru's concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Newgo
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 89.
description: The Charlotte Decuplets are the 36-40th sons and 30-34th daughters of the Charlotte Family, making up the 65-74th children in the family, and are all officers of the Big Mom Pirates.[2][3] They are the largest group of Big Mom's children born in a single birth.[4]
appareance: They were first mentioned in SBS Volume 85,[4] but were not identified until they gathered on Cacao Island.[2]

Name: Charlotte Newichi
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: The Charlotte Decuplets are the 36-40th sons and 30-34th daughters of the Charlotte Family, making up the 65-74th children in the family, and are all officers of the Big Mom Pirates.[2][3] They are the largest group of Big Mom's children born in a single birth.[4]
appareance: They were first mentioned in SBS Volume 85,[4] but were not identified until they gathered on Cacao Island.[2]

Name: Charlotte Newji
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: The Charlotte Decuplets are the 36-40th sons and 30-34th daughters of the Charlotte Family, making up the 65-74th children in the family, and are all officers of the Big Mom Pirates.[2][3] They are the largest group of Big Mom's children born in a single birth.[4]
appareance: They were first mentioned in SBS Volume 85,[4] but were not identified until they gathered on Cacao Island.[2]

Name: Charlotte Newsan
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: The Charlotte Decuplets are the 36-40th sons and 30-34th daughters of the Charlotte Family, making up the 65-74th children in the family, and are all officers of the Big Mom Pirates.[2][3] They are the largest group of Big Mom's children born in a single birth.[4]
appareance: They were first mentioned in SBS Volume 85,[4] but were not identified until they gathered on Cacao Island.[2]

Name: Charlotte Newshi
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Newshi is the 39th son and 68th child of the Charlotte Family[8] and the fourth of the Charlotte Decuplets to be born.[3] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[4]
appareance: Newshi is similar in appearance to his decuplet brothers, but noticeably taller and larger than the others. He has purple hair that goes down to his neck, small beady eyes, and a button nose. He wears a pink suit over a red shirt, a yellow tie, white pants, and a lilac bowler hat. In the manga, when gathered at Cacao Island, he wore a bow tie instead.

Name: Charlotte Noisette
Note: His name was revealed in the credits of Episode 833. His full name was revealed in SBS Volume 90.
description: Charlotte Noisette[7][4] is the 15th son and 24th child of the Charlotte Family[5] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3] He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Finance (大蔵大臣, Ōkura Daijin?), governing over Kinko Island.[4]
appareance: Noisette concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Normande
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Normande is the 38th daughter and the 82nd child of the Charlotte Family. She is a dosundada, a hybrid between a human and a dwarf.[2][4]
appareance: Normande is a very small girl with fair skin, purple eyes, and brown hair with yellow flowers in it. She wears a blue dress and has large, fairy-like wings. Like dwarves, she has a tail and her dress extends to cover most of it.

Name: Charlotte Nougat
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Nougat is the 41st son and 75th child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[4][3]
appareance: He was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.[2]

Name: Charlotte Nusstorte
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 882.
description: Charlotte Nusstorte[6] is the 12th son and 21st child of the Charlotte Family and the eldest triplet brother of Basskarte and Dosmarche.[4] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[3][2] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Transport (運輸大臣, Un'yu Daijin?), governing over Package Island.[4]
appareance: Nusstorte is a large man with a massive head compared to the rest of his body. He has a very thick mustache and wears a pair of sunglasses. He also wears a purple commodore jacket with gold and green epaulettes and a large indigo bicorne with a face that has an identical mustache. In comparison, his head and bicorne together are nearly the same height as the rest of his body. He is also seen with a brown tobacco pipe and carries his sword behind his back.[1][4]

Name: Charlotte Nutmeg
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Nutmeg is the 30th daughter and 70th child of the Charlotte Family[5] and the sixth of the Charlotte Decuplets to be born.[1] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2]
appareance: Nutmeg is an average-sized young woman with long brown hair kept loose with a pink bow on top. She wears a pink crop top with a red ribbon, blue hotpants, white gloves, horizontally-striped pink and white leggings, and red-pink high heels.[1]

Name: Charlotte Opera
Note: His name was fully revealed in Chapter 843.
description: Charlotte Opera is the fifth son and the tenth child of the Charlotte Family and is the eldest quintuplet brother of Counter, Cadenza, Cabaletta, and Gala.[7] He also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[4] and served as Totto Land's Minister of Whipped Cream (生クリーム大臣, Nama Kurīmu Daijin?, Viz: "Minister of Cream"), governing over Noko Island.[2][5] His current status is unknown after having his lifespan removed by a rampaging Big Mom.[8]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Whole Cake Island Arc.

Name: Charlotte Oven
description: Charlotte Oven[8] is the fourth son and fifth child of the Charlotte Family[1] and the younger triplet brother of Katakuri and Daifuku.[6] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[3] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Browned Food (こんがり大臣, Kongari Daijin?, Viz: "Minister of Baking"), governing over Yakigashi Island.[4]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc. He, alongside his siblings Charlotte Brûlée and Charlotte Katakuri, become temporary and reluctant allies of the Red Hair Pirates and the Straw Hat Pirates during One Piece Film: Red.

Name: Charlotte Panna
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Panna is the 28th daughter and 61st child of the Charlotte Family[5] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3] She was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.[2]
appareance: Panna is a tall young woman with long, reddish-pink hair. She has large, round eyes, long eyelashes, and predominant, round ears. She has long arms and legs. She wears a red dress with a prominent high collar, a crescent pattern on it, a yellow scarf, and a light-colored belt. She has a large bow on her back, and she wears large mammalian gloves. She also wears dark-colored boots.[5][1]

Name: Charlotte Perospero
description: Charlotte Perospero[9] is the eldest child of the Charlotte Family[7] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[4] He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Candy (キャンディ大臣, Kyandi Daijin?), governing over Candy Island.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc and a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Charlotte Poire
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 88.
description: Charlotte Poire is the 19th daughter and the 43rd child of the Charlotte Family, the younger twin sister of Galette,[5] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2]
appareance: Poire is a woman with shoulder-length fuchsia wavy hair. She has round eyes and an extremely large mouth that displays a set of very sharp teeth. On her head she wears a hat that appears to be the skin of a panda's head; the hat is stitched on the sides, and the stitches start right where her mouth ends. She wears a low-cut dark dress with small frills on the top, and over it she wears an open coat which is lined with fur, especially around the neck.[1]

Name: Charlotte Praline
description: Charlotte Praline is a half-human and half-hammerhead shark mermaid, the 21st daughter and 47th child of the Charlotte Family,[1] and the younger twin sister of Prim.[4] She was also Totto Land's former Minister of Design (デザイン大臣, Dezain Daijin?), having governed over Unique Island until her defection.[2]
appareance: She married Aladine sometime in the past two years, and became a member of his crew, the Sun Pirates, cutting off ties with her family and working against them in the process.[1][6]

Name: Charlotte Prim
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Prim is the 20th daughter and 46th child of the Charlotte Family, the older twin sister of Praline,[4] and an octopus mermaid-human hybrid.[6] She is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3]
appareance: She was also a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.[2]

Name: Charlotte Pudding
Note: Her name was first mentioned by Capone Bege in Chapter 812. She was first identified in Chapter 850.
description: Charlotte Pudding is the 35th daughter and the 76th child of the Charlotte Family,[2] an officer of the Big Mom Pirates,[3] and a hybrid between a human and a member of the Three-Eye Tribe.[8] She also works as a chocolatier and the owner of cafe "Caramel" on Cacao Island,[4] as the candidate for the vacant position of Minister of Chocolate (チョコレート大臣, Chokorēto Daijin?).[9] She was once Sanji's arranged fiancée, per the political agreement between their families.[2] She is currently held captive by the Blackbeard Pirates.[10]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she was initially a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc, but after genuinely falling in love with Sanji, she became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates to help them escape from her mother, Charlotte Linlin.[11] She is also a supporting character in the Germa 66's Ahh... An Emotionless Excursion cover page serial.[12]

Name: Charlotte Raisin
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 894.
description: Charlotte Raisin is the 33rd son and 60th child of the Charlotte Family[2] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[3] He was a member of Big Mom's enraged army sent to fight Monkey D. Luffy,[1] and later joined Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Luffy on Cacao Island.[2]
appareance: Raisin is a very tall man, standing about as tall as his brother Yuen and towering over most of the soldiers on Cacao Island. He has long spiky white hair as well as a pink line that vertically ran down his face across each eye.

Name: Charlotte Saint-Marc
Note: His name was revealed in the credits of Episode 832. His full name was revealed in SBS Volume 90.
description: Charlotte Saint-Marc (WT100)[1]
appareance: Charlotte Saint-Marc[7] is the 22nd son and the 38th child of the Charlotte Family[3] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[5][4] He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Essence (エッセンス大臣, Essensu Daijin?), governing over Flavor Island. He is the older twin brother of Basans.[6]

Name: Charlotte Smoothie
Note: She was first mentioned by a Whole Cake Island resident in chapter 843.
description: Charlotte Smoothie[7] is the 14th daughter and 35th child of the Charlotte Family,[1] the older triplet sister of Citron and Cinnamon,[8] and a longleg-human hybrid.[9] She serves as one of the Three Sweet Commanders of the Big Mom Pirates and as Totto Land's Minister of Juice (ジュース大臣, Jūsu Daijin?),[1] governing over 100% Island.[4]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a major antagonist in the Whole Cake Island Arc.

Name: Charlotte Snack
Note: He was first mentioned by Charlotte Brûlée in Chapter 837. His name was revealed by Pound in Chapter 843.
description: Charlotte Snack[7] is the 25th son and 44th child of the Charlotte Family[1] and the older twin brother of Bavarois.[5] He is also an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[4] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Fries (フライ大臣, Furai Daijin?), governing over Potato Island.[5]
appareance: He was one of the crew's Four Sweet Commanders until he lost his position when he was defeated by Urouge sometime in the last two years.[3] He was also a member of Charlotte Oven's army to intercept the Straw Hat Pirates on Cacao Island.[1]

Name: Charlotte Tablet
Note: His name was revealed in the credits of Episode 832. His full name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Tablet is the 21st son and 34th child of the Charlotte Family and the younger twin brother of High-Fat.[2] He also is an officer of the Big Mom Pirates[4] and serves as Totto Land's Minister of Toppings (トッピング大臣, Toppingu Daijin?), governing over Topping Island.[2]
appareance: Tablet's concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Wafers
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.4.
description: Charlotte Wafers is the 37th daughter and the 79th child of the Charlotte Family.[2]
appareance: Wafers's original concept art.

Name: Charlotte Wiro
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Wiro is the 43rd son and the 80th child of the Charlotte Family.[3] He is a Human-Snakeneck hybrid.[2]
appareance: Wiro's full appearance.

Name: Charlotte Yuen
description: Charlotte Yuen is the 35th son and 64th child of the Charlotte Family and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[2] He was a member of Charlotte Oven's army to ambush Monkey D. Luffy on Cacao Island.[1]
appareance: Yuen's concept art from the anime.

Name: Charlotte Zuccotto
Note: His name was revealed in the captions of Episode 839. His full name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.5.
description: Charlotte Zuccotto is the 11th son and the 18th child of the Charlotte Family[6] and an officer of the Big Mom Pirates.[5] He also serves as Totto Land's Minister of Alcohol (酒大臣, Sake Daijin?), governing over Liqueur Island.[6]
appareance: Zuccotto's original concept art.

Name: Chess
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 135.
description: Chess[3] is a former minister of defense serving under Wapol.[2] After the attack of Blackbeard, he became a pirate alongside his king, until their subsequent return to Drum Island.
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Drum Island Arc.

Name: Chesskippa
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Chesskippa the Hanger-on[2] is a pirate captain from Robin's past.[3]
appareance: He is a middle aged man with a bald head. One of his most notable features is his scar that goes over his left eye. He wears a pink shirt with black streaks, which look like splits. Over his shirt he wears a white coat, with yellow, furry pads on the shoulders.[3]

Name: Chessmarimo
description: Chessmarimo is a fusion of Chess and Kuromarimo, created by Wapol's Baku Baku Factory.
appareance: Chessmarimo in the Grand Line Team in One Piece: Going Baseball.

Name: Chew
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 75.
description: Chew[6] is a smelt-whiting fish-man and an officer of the Arlong Pirates.[2] He is also a former member of the Sun Pirates.[3] He is one of the major antagonists of the Arlong Park Arc.
appareance: Chew is muscular, blue skinned, and has thick lips.[1]

Name: Chichilisia
Note: Cover story character.
description: Chichilisia is the leader of the Niho Navy and the father of Uholisia.[1]
appareance: Chichilisia is a large man, although Chinjao towers over him. He wears a robe bearing his romanized name on the left side and the name of the Niho Navy on the right. He also wears a dark cape with a very high collar.[1]

Name: Chicken
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Chicken[5] is the wife of Gyoru and a fishmonger of Foosha Village.[2]
appareance: Chicken is a normal sized, although a bit chubby woman, with dark curly hair and a round face. She seems to be middle-aged as her face has some wrinkles on it. She wears a dark colored apron over a white shirt with the sleeves rolled up. In the Episode of East Blue, she wears a white apron over a blue shirt, instead.[2]

Name: Chicory
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Chicory[4] is a dwarf from the Tontatta Kingdom and a member of the Tontatta Pirates.[1][3]
appareance: Chicory is small and has a fluffy tail, a pointy nose, and long flowing, bright-colored hair. She wears a bright-colored dress with light and dark stripes on the bottom and a large bright-colored hat with a flower on the left side.[1] She also wears a pair of dark-colored high heels.[4]

Name: Chimney
description: Chimney is the granddaughter of Sea Train conductor Kokoro, her only mermaid grandparent, making Chimney 1/4 mermaid.[5] She is the owner of a rabbit named Gonbe (whom Chimney thinks is a cat).[1]
appareance: She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Water 7 and Enies Lobby Arcs.

Name: Chinjao
description: Chinjao,[7] formerly known as "Don Chinjao" and "Chinjao the Drill", is a former pirate, the leader of the Chinjao Family, and the retired 12th leader of the Happo Navy. He also joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: He has a bounty of 542,000,000. Although at first he confronted Luffy for his hatred against Garp, he became his ally during the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Chihaya
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Chihaya[2] is a child who lives in the Flower Capital and attends Sarahebi's classes.[1]
appareance: Chihaya is a young girl with round glasses, a slight double chin, and bright blond hair tied in twintails with red hair ties. She wears a dark blue kimono with black wave patterns.[1]

Name: Chiya
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Chiya[2] was the Shandia Pantri that lived over 400 years ago, who died of Tree Fever.[1]
appareance: Chiya was an old man with a very wrinkled face. He had white thick hair, a thick white beard, tan skin, and a missing tooth. Because of the Tree Fever, part of the left side of his face had green blotches on it.[1]

Name: Cho
Note: She first appeared as a silhouette in Chapter 940.
description: "Moonflower" O-Cho is a yakuza boss who was in charge of the Ringo region in Wano Country. She was imprisoned in Udon by the Beasts Pirates, but was freed when Luffy took over the prison.[1][2]
appareance: Cho is an average-sized woman with fair skin and dark indigo hair that is arranged in an exaggerated Tōrōbin Shimada that resembles a butterfly, but also has some of her curly hair loose and covering her right eye. She has simple lavender flower tattoos on her right shoulder and upper arm. She also appears to wear mascara and lipstick.

Name: Chochinman
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Chochinman[2] is a Gifter of the Beasts Pirates and a member of the crew's surveillance division, the Marys.[1]
appareance: Chochinman in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Chocho
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: O-Chocho[3] is a woman who lives in Okobore Town in Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Chocho's appearance 20 years ago.

Name: Choco Police
description: Choco Police is a police officer in charge of watching over Chocolat Town on Cacao Island.[1]
appareance: Choco Police is a relatively large and plump man, being taller than Pudding in height. He has a disconnected mustache that is relatively pointy and sticks up, as well as a similarly pointy black goatee. He wears a giant hat with brown edges and a cream-like top. He also wears a brown suit, yellow button-up shirt with an orange tie, and beige pants with brown boots. Also, he wears a large pink floral decoration on the left side of his suit.[1]

Name: Chocolat
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Chocolat[4] is a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who masqueraded as Nami.[2]
appareance: Chocolat is a potbellied woman who bears little resemblance with the real Nami. She has a wide face (similar to Sandersonia) and short hair with a bun near top of her head (possibly because in the wanted poster Nami was tying up her hair for the picture). She wears a polka-dotted top (similar to Nami's bikini top in the poster) and a lavender skirt, bearing a rather portly, pot bellied midriff, contrasting Nami's slender figure.

Name: Choi
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Choi[2] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: A concept sketch of Choi.

Name: Chokyumei-no Chosuke
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Chokyumei-no Chosuke[2] is a young boy from the Hakumai region of the Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Chosuke is a young boy with fluffy brown hair. He wears an old green outfit, with visible blue patches and small hash designs.

Name: Chome
Note: Her name was revealed in the credits of Episode 925.
description: Chome[4] is a kunoichi and a member of the Beasts Pirates.[2] She previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[1]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Chouchou
description: Chouchou[5] is a dog from Orange Town, famed for his unceasing vigil over the pet-food shop founded by his deceased owner. He is classified as a Type B creature, "Small Friendly".[6]
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Orange Town Arc.

Name: Chuchun
description: Chuchun is a Super Sparrow ridden by Itomimizu. He and Itomimizu witnessed all the Davy Back Fight games between the Foxy Pirates and the Straw Hat Pirates.
appareance: Chuchun is a big sparrow, several times the size of an average human.

Name: Chuji
description: Chuji is the pet rat of the geisha Some.[1]
appareance: Chuji is a normal-looking rat who possesses light-colored fur and large round ears.[1]

Name: Clapp
description: Clapp was the father of Bartholomew Kuma and a member of the Buccaneers race.[1]
appareance: His family lived in the Sorbet Kingdom until they were all captured and made slaves in Mary Geoise. Clapp was later shot and killed by a World Noble.[3]

Name: Clione
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 83.
description: Clione[2] is a member of the Heart Pirates.[1]
appareance: Clione infected with the Feminization Disease.

Name: Clou D. Clover
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 392.
description: Clou D. Clover,[5] commonly known as Professor Clover (クローバー博士, Kurōbā-hakase?), was the director of the Ohara Library, and a leading authority on archaeology. He was a professor and archaeologist who studied Poneglyphs with his fellow colleagues in the Tree of Knowledge.[1] During his younger years, he was also an infamous explorer known for getting repeatedly caught by the Marines.[2]
appareance: Clover and his fellow archaeologists died 22 years ago for conducting forbidden research on the Void Century, which led the World Government to decimate the island of Ohara through a Buster Call.[6]

Name: Coburn
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Coburn[2] was the leader of the Shandia tribe from 400 years ago.
appareance: Similar to the current Shandia Chief, Coburn was an elderly man, with thick facial hair, eyebrows and long silver hair tied to the sides, plus a pair of small wings like the other Shandia.

Name: Cocoa
Note: Her name was revealed by Demalo Black in Chapter 599.
description: Cocoa was a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who impersonated Nico Robin.[1]
appareance: Unlike the real Robin, Cocoa is a very short and plain woman. She has a similar hairstyle to Robin's (before the timeskip). Her nose is flat, similar to Robin's, but wider between the eyes, and longer. Cocoa wears a plain dark purple dress, carries a purse and bright red high heels. Fake Luffy has asserted her to be the closest in appearance to her duplicate out of the crew; in spite of this, Cocoa has virtually no resemblance to Robin.[1]

Name: Cocox
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Cocox[3] is an animal who lives on the Island of Rare Animals.[1] Like all the animals on the island, he is protected by Gaimon.[4] He is classified as a Type B creature, "Small Friendly".[5]
appareance: Cocox is a mixture of a fox and a rooster. He has whiteish grey fur that is light brown around the eyes. He also has a rooster's crown and wattle. He also has feathers on his backside, and red ears. In the anime, his legs are slightly longer.[1]

Name: Colon
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1132.
description: Colon is the half-human, half-giant son of Scopper Gaban and Ripley.[3][2] He is the self-proclaimed captain of the "Colon Pirates".[4]
appareance: Colon as a newborn baby.

Name: Colscon
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Colscon[2] is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied himself with Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Colscon is a chubby man, with curly brown hair and a thin black mustache. His clothes are similar to that of a mafia boss, with a black coat, a yellow tie, and a moss green button up shirt with vertical lines on it. He also sports a dark brown hat with a feather on it.[3]

Name: Columbus
Note: Cover story character. Her name was first mentioned in Chapter 800.
description: Columbus is a member of the Yonta Maria Grand Fleet.[2][1]
appareance: Columbus in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Comil
Note: His name was revealed on the Cover Page of Chapter 290.
description: Vice Admiral Comil is the commander of Marine Base G-2. He first appeared in Portgas D. Ace's cover story,[2] and later took part in the Summit War of Marineford.[3]
appareance: Comil is a tall, large man with a bald top, but blonde spiky hair flowing downwards on the back of his head, similar to Shiki. He has a mustache and is dark-skinned. His mustache looks like what one usually gets after drinking milk.

Name: Compo
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Compo[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Compo is a large muscular man. He wears a short sleeved shirt, a bandana, a beaded neckless and several bracelets on each forearm.

Name: Concelot
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Concelot[2][3] is a fox mink and one of the Three Inuarashi Musketeers leading the squad.
appareance: Concelot is a fox mink with tan fur, a pointed snout, a round nose, sharp teeth, and long whiskers. He wears the Inuarashi Musketeer Squad uniform of a purple cape lined with red, a black hat with a pink plume, and brown boots. He also wears black pants, a white shirt with a frilly edge at the bottom, black gloves, a black belt with a golden buckle, a fluffy light-blue scarf, and a sword strap over his left shoulder.

Name: Conis
description: Conis[3] is a citizen of Skypiea who befriended Monkey D. Luffy and his crew after their arrival. She is Pagaya's daughter and owner of a cloud fox named Su.[1]
appareance: She is a relatively tall, slender young woman with blonde hair that she wears in two braided pig-tails and two antennae sticking out at the top of her head.

Name: Conney
Note: She was first mentioned in Chapter 908.
description: Conney[2] is the queen dowager of the Sorbet Kingdom as the mother of King Bulldog.[1]
appareance: Conney is a short, wrinkled elderly woman with light hair. She wears an ornate dress, a fur coat and a side cap. Six years ago, her side cap was dark with a light brim, but around three and a half years ago, it is light overall.

Name: Corgi
description: Corgi is a World Government official who took part in the mission to acquire the blueprints of Pluton and escort the prisoners Nico Robin and Cutty Flam to Enies Lobby.[1] He acted as the leader of the forces in the Sea Train, answering directly to the CP9 agents.[3]
appareance: Corgi's concept art from the anime.

Name: Coribou
Note: He was first mentioned by Demalo Black in Chapter 598.
description: "Blood-Splatterer" Coribou is a captain of the Caribou Pirates, along with his big brother Caribou.[2]
appareance: He is famous for killing Marines and was at the Sabaody Archipelago around the time of the Straw Hat Pirates' reunion. He, along with Caribou, another infamous rookie, joined the Fake Straw Hat Crew temporarily. He has a bounty of 190,000,000, making him part of the new generation of rookies, following the path of Luffy and the other Supernovas with bounties over 100,000,000.[3]

Name: Cornelia
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Cornelia[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Concept art of Cornelia.

Name: Cosette
description: Cosette is the head chef employed in the Germa Kingdom's royal household.[1]
appareance: Cossette's concept art from the anime.

Name: Cosmo
Note: Cover story character. His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Sergeant Cosmo[2] is one of the automata created on Karakuri Island by Dr. Tsukimi. Sergeant Cosmo was first introduced in cover story of Enel's Great Space Operations.
appareance: Cosmo in the digital colored manga.

Name: Cosmos
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 54.
description: Cosmos[3] is a member of the Kuja Pirates.[1]
appareance: Cosmos' second outfit during the Amazon Lily Arc.

Name: Cotton
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Cotton[2] is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared in the Riku Royal Army Headquarters beneath the Flower Field.[1]
appareance: Cotton's color scheme in the manga.

Name: Couran
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Couran[3] is the king of the Cameron Kingdom (キャメロン王国, Kyameron Ōkoku?) and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2][3]
appareance: Couran is a middle-aged man with light wavy hair, a short beard, v-shaped eyebrows, droopy eyes, a triangular nose and high cheekbones. He wears royal robes and a crown over his head.

Name: Cowboy
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.

Name: Crocodile
Note: He was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 113.
description: "Desert King" Sir Crocodile[3][13] is a former Warlord of the Sea[7] and the former president of the mysterious crime syndicate Baroque Works,[14] formerly operating under the codename "Mr. 0". During his time as Warlord, Crocodile maintained a public facade of an ally to both the people of Arabasta Kingdom and the Marines, all while running Baroque Works in secret with the express purpose of overthrowing Arabasta via Operation Utopia. When his plot was foiled by the Straw Hat Pirates, [4] he was stripped of his title and imprisoned in the deepest level of the legendary prison Impel Down.[15] His former partner and Vice-President of Baroque Works, Nico Robin, would go on to become a member of the Straw Hat Pirates.
appareance: Crocodile was freed by Luffy from Impel Down in exchange for aiding in the rescue of his brother[16] and went to Marineford to participate in the Summit War.[17] While initially aiming to kill Whitebeard, his contempt for the Marines led him to ally with Luffy and the Whitebeard Pirates. After the war, he and his subordinate Daz Bonez escaped from Marineford and decided to head out to the New World.[18] After the disbandment of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, Crocodile now works as a co-leader of the Cross Guild alongside Dracule Mihawk and under the figurehead leadership of Buggy, who was mistakenly made one of the Four Emperors.[19] Sometime prior to the disbanding of the Warlords, Vegapunk cloned Crocodile as one of the Seraphim to replace the Warlords.[20]

Name: Crocus
description: Crocus[2] is a doctor and the caretaker of the whale Laboon as well as the overseer of the Twin Cape Lighthouse that guides ships coming down from Reverse Mountain into the Grand Line.
appareance: Though he was a lighthouse keeper for most of his life, he spent three years as a doctor serving as a part of Gol D. Roger's crew. According to Silvers Rayleigh, he was the best doctor in the world at the time he joined the Roger Pirates, and the only one able to relieve Roger's disease.[4]

Name: Curiel
Note: His name was revealed by Gecko Moria in Chapter 562.
description: Curiel is the former 10th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.[1][4]
appareance: Curiel's concept art from the anime.

Name: Curly Dadan
Note: She was first mentioned by Portgas D. Ace in Chapter 440.
description: Curly Dadan[4] is a mountain bandit and the boss of the Dadan Family who lives on Mt. Colubo near Foosha Village. She served as the foster mother of Portgas D. Ace and Monkey D. Luffy, who were entrusted to her by Monkey D. Garp,[6][7] and also took care of Sabo too when he moved in.
appareance: Dadan was first mentioned in the Post-Enies Lobby Arc, when Woop Slap read about Luffy and the Straw Hat Pirates waging war on the World Government.

Name: Cyrano
Note: Appeared in the one-shot Monsters.
description: Cyrano is a character in Oda's one-shot, Monsters, and was a swordsman from Shimotsuki Ryuma's past.[1]
appareance: Cyrano's concept art from Monsters: 103 Mercies Dragon Damnation.

Name: D.R.
Note: Appeared in the one-shot Monsters.
description: D.R. was one of the main antagonists in Oda's one-shot, Monsters.[1]
appareance: D.R. has the letters of his name tattooed around his eyes in red and blue, and has short, tufty light purple hair. He wears a purple cape over his attire.

Name: Dachoman
Note: He was named in Episode 937 credits.
description: Dachoman[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Dachoman is a very large man with a long and feathery ostrich-like neck. He wears a spiked helmet and has a scruffy brown beard. He also wears an open short-sleeved and dark-colored leather shirt with shoulder pads and a pair of leather pants.[1]

Name: Daddy Dee
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Daddy Dee[2] is one of the houseparents, alongside Mummy Mee, of a World Government-affiliated orphanage situated on the Conomi Islands.[1]
appareance: Daddy Dee's initial appearance in the anime.

Name: Dagama
description: Dagama is the tactician of the Prodence Kingdom. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1] He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc.
appareance: Dagama is a large chubby man, with a hunchback, and black shaggy eyebrows and a thick shaggy mustache.[1]

Name: Dago
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Dago[2] is one of the Franky Family's Kairiki Destroyers.[3]
appareance: Dago's initial colorscheme in the anime.

Name: Daidalos
description: Daidalos was a giant squid that was close friends with Ikaros Much.[1]
appareance: He was a small pale yellow squid, with fin-like appendages on the top of his head. He had six tentacles, unlike the regular squid that has ten. His tentacles were brown on the underside, with suction cups underneath them. He had a tiny mouth, and black and yellow colored eyes.

Name: Daifugo
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 935.
description: Daifugo[4] is a Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates who served as a vice warden of the Prisoner Mine in the Udon region of Wano Country until his defeat during the prison uprising.[3] After being tamed by Kurozumi Tama, he became an ally of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[2]
appareance: Daifugo's anime concept art

Name: Daigin
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Daigin[4] is a Marine Commodore who led the team that went to Impel Down to capture the intruder, Monkey D. Luffy.
appareance: Daigin has a spiky black beard and sideburns, as well as a scruffy mustache. He wears a Marine hat with flaps on both sides of his head and a piece of armor covering the back. He wears a black double breasted suit with a yellow shirt and a red tie.

Name: Daikoku
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 933.
description: Daikoku[5] is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates.[2] He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Daikon
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Scouting Unit[2]Straw Hat Grand Fleet
appareance: Daikon[2] is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit.[1]

Name: Daisy
description: Daisy[4] is a member of the Kuja Pirates.[1]
appareance: Daisy is a slim woman of average height. She has long, bushy orange hair. She wears an outfit typical to the rest of the Kuja Tribe; this consists of a skimpy green top which appears to be made only from a long piece of cloth which barely covers each breast and tied down with a thin belt, black thigh-high stockings, and matching panties with red cloths buttoned at each side. As a Kuja Pirate, she also wears a white cape that resembles a Marine coat. She is easily distinguished by her wide, perpetual grin.[1]

Name: Dalmatian
description: Vice Admiral Dalmatian[4][3] is one of the many Marine vice admirals to have participated in the Summit War of Marineford.
appareance: With his Devil Fruit powers active, Dalmatian takes the form of a muscular, bipedal dalmatian-human hybrid. The top part of his head from his nose up and his arms and legs are that of a dalmatian: a white dog with black spots all over the body. He also has a long tail. However, the bottom half of his face is human just like most of Zoan users, and he has a blonde-white beard on a wide chin. His torso and neck also seem to remain human. He has yet to be seen in his default human or full dalmatian forms.

Name: Dalton
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 133.
description: Dalton[6][7] is the elected king of the Sakura Kingdom (successor to the Drum Kingdom).[2] He is a former Royal Guard who once served under Wapol.[3]
appareance: He is an ally to the Straw Hat Pirates during the Drum Island Arc.

Name: Damask
description: Damask is a pyromaniac who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: A full body view of Damask in the anime.

Name: Daruma
description: Daruma[4] is a cookie-cutter shark fish-man‎ and an officer of the New Fish-Man‎ Pirates before their downfall and disbandment.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is considered to be a major antagonist in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

Name: Dashiteyaro
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Dashiteyaro[3] is a retainer of the Kurozumi Family[2] and a prison guard who lives in the Flower Capital of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Dashiteyaro is an averaged sized man. He has long, brown hair, tied up in a topknot. He wears a checkered blue kimono, and a green cloak over his shoulders.[1]

Name: Davy Jones
Note: Mentioned only character.
description: Davy Jones is a legendary pirate from long ago who was said to have been cursed by a demon to live on the sea floor. Throughout history, certain pirates have admired and even worshipped this figure, and he is the namesake behind the Davy Back Fight.[1]
appareance: According to Nico Robin, Davy Jones supposedly lived a long time ago. For unknown reasons, he became cursed by the devil and is now believed to live on the sea floor even in the present day. Because of this, the sea floor is also known as Davy Jones' Locker (デービー・ジョーンズのロッカー, Dēbī Jōnzu no Rokkā?), and Davy Jones is considered to "own" everything that sinks into the sea as it lands in his domain. Taking things from other pirates is known as "Davy Back".[1]

Name: Daz Bonez
Note: His real name was revealed by Smoker in Chapter 217.
description: "The Killer" Daz Bonez,[4] alias Mr. 1, is a former bounty hunter[3] and the former highest-ranked male Officer Agent of Baroque Works. His partner was Miss Doublefinger.[1] After escaping Impel Down, he traveled with Crocodile in the New World[7] and later joined Crocodile's new organization, Cross Guild.[2]
appareance: He was a major antagonist during the Arabasta Arc and a tentative ally in the Impel Down and Marineford Arcs.

Name: Decalvan Brothers
Note: Their names were revealed in Episode 460.
description: The Decalvan Brothers are two infamous New World pirates who allied with Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: The Decalvan Brothers appear to be twins (since they share the same birthday), and both wear overalls. Both have wide faces (though one of them is wider than the other) and flowing black hair. The one with the wider face has sharper teeth. Each brother opens one of their eyes which is large and black around the rim, and closes the other which has a scar over it; which eye they open and close are opposite to one another.

Name: Deigoro
