Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Deigoro[2] is a man living in the Wano Country's Flower Capital.[1]
appareance: Deigoro is a middle-aged man with short, dark hair kept in a topknot. He has thick eyebrows, a large nose, and stubble around his mouth.

Name: Delacuaji
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Delacuaji[3] is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied with Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Delacuaji is a round and large man with an unusual body shape, mostly hidden by the chartreuse robe he wears, which has ruffled edges on the arms and seems to cover most of his upper body, even his head, leaving only his face and hands visible. He has a round face with dark colored lips and concentric circles around his eyes, a black goatee on his chin, and teeth quite spaced out one from another, similarly to Bluejam's. His attire also includes a light blue scarf held up by a clasp made up of three linked jewels, an indument that looks like a brown vest, and a pirate captain's hat matching his robe, with a little skull represented on it. He carries around a saber.[1]

Name: Dellinger
description: Dellinger[1] is a combatant and an officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Diamante Army[5] who is a hybrid between a human and a fighting fish fish-man.[6]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Demalo Black
Note: His real name was revealed by a Pacifista in Chapter 601.
description: "Three-Tongued" Demalo Black[5] was the captain of the Fake Straw Hat Crew. He impersonated Monkey D. Luffy to benefit from his reputation,[1] but was later arrested by Sentomaru.[6] Afterwards, he began impersonating Eustass Kid.[5]
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered the main antagonist of the Return to Sabaody Arc, despite the fact that he was little to no actual threat to the protagonists.

Name: Demoni Aiyo
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Demoni Aiyo[2] is a hairstylist who lives in Dressrosa.[1]
appareance: Demoni Aiyo in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Den
description: Den is Tom's younger brother. He is a bering wolffish merman. He is also a shipwright and a Sea Forest researcher.[5]
appareance: Den is a muscular merman with long, curly fair hair reaching down below his shoulders. His long and hooked nose points downward. He has a mustache and a dark, long, pointed goatee. He is almost always seen smiling.

Name: Denjiro
Note: He was first introduced under his alias "Kyoshiro". Real identity revealed in Chapter 973.
description: Denjiro is a samurai from Wano Country and one of the Nine Red Scabbards who served as Kouzuki Oden's retainers.[7] He currently serves as the daimyo of Kibi.[4]
appareance: After becoming grief-stricken over Oden's execution 20 years ago, Denjiro's facial structure changed, and he started going under the name Kyoshiro. With this new identity, he became a yakuza boss and recruited followers to form the Kyoshiro Family. Eventually, he started working for Oden's usurper, shogun Kurozumi Orochi, as his money changer and bodyguard; he would successfully keep his true allegiance to the Kouzuki Family a secret and bide his time until the Scabbards finally reunited to take down Orochi and Kaidou.[2][1][8]

Name: Devil Dias
Note: His full name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Devil Dias[3] is a pirate and the former captain of the Acumate Pirates, but was captured and sold as a slave to the family of World Noble Saint Rosward.[1]
appareance: Dias is a large and muscular man who is large enough to carry a normal-sized woman in one hand. His long black hair stands high, and is arranged into two split ends. He has a devil-looking pair of eyes tattooed on his torso, and a stitched scar right on his stomach. He wore a brown captain's jacket with a gray furred cape, light pants with a double brown belt to hold it up, boots, and a bomb collar. Like all slaves of the World Nobles, he has the Hoof of the Soaring Dragon burned onto his back to forever mark him as "less than human".[1]

Name: Diamante
description: Diamante is one of the top three officers of the Donquixote Pirates.[5] He occupies the Diamond seat of the Donquixote Family and is the leader of the crew's Diamante Army subdivision.[6]
appareance: He was the proprietor of the Corrida Colosseum of Dressrosa, where he earned his title as the "Hero of the Colosseum" (コロシアムの英雄, Koroshiamu no Eiyū?).[7] Due to his actions and role, he is one of the major antagonists in the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Didit
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Didit[2] is a noble living in the Goa Kingdom on Dawn Island. She is the wife of Outlook III, the biological mother of Sabo, and the adoptive mother of Sterry.[1]
appareance: Didit's anime concept art.

Name: Diesel
Note: His name was revealed by Tony Tony Chopper in Chapter 849.
description: Diesel is a Longarm and a member of the Big Mom Pirates.[1]
appareance: Diesel's outfit since the meeting in the Fire Tank hideout.

Name: Diez Barrels
description: Diez Barrels was a Marine officer who defected to become a pirate. Thirteen years ago, he was the captain of the Barrels Pirates while operating in the North Blue until he was killed by Donquixote Doflamingo during an attempt to sell the Ope Ope no Mi to the Marines.[1] He was also the father of X Drake.[3]
appareance: Barrels was a large, fair-skinned man with a prominent chin, pointed nose, and small ears. He had short orange hair, much like his son, that is slicked back, a predominant widow's peak, and sideburns. He wore a dark-colored buttoned shirt and a light colored pirate-style coat.

Name: Dirt Boss
Note: Cover story character.
description: The Dirt Boss is a giant mole awoken by Gedatsu during his work for Goro in his cover story.[1]
appareance: Dirt Boss in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Disc J
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Disc J[4] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[3]
appareance: Disc J in the anime.

Name: Disco
description: Disco is the owner of the now-bankrupt Human Auctioning House at Grove 1 in Sabaody Archipelago.[5]
appareance: Disco is a thin, eccentric man who has long silver hair, a cleft chin, stubble beard and mustache. He wears a purple coat, pink scarf, a tall yellow hat with flower patterns around the bottom, and his trademark star-shaped glasses.[1]

Name: Dive
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Dive[3] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Dive's original concept art.

Name: Dobby Ibadonbo
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Dobby Ibadonbo[3] is a man imprisoned in Level 6 of Impel Down.[2]
appareance: Dobby Ibadonbo is a tan-skinned, muscular man with a pointed nose, slightly-protruding brow, sharp jaw, and upward-pointed ears. He has circles under his eyes, a large scar on his right cheek, a fish-shaped tattoo on his forehead above his right eye, and his right arm is covered in tattoos. He wears golden earrings and a prison uniform.[2]

Name: Doberman
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook.
description: Vice Admiral Doberman[4] is a veteran Marine officer. He was one of the five Vice Admirals who led the Buster Call against Enies Lobby,[1] and also took part in the Summit War of Marineford.[5] Two years later, he is one of the nine Vice Admirals that took part in the Egghead Incident.[6]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Enies Lobby and Marineford Arcs, and a supporting antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: Dobon
description: Dobon is a Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates who served as a vice warden of the Prisoner Mine in the Udon region of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Dobon's anime concept art.

Name: Doc Q
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 234.
description: Doc Q,[6] known as "Death God", is the doctor of the Blackbeard Pirates. Ironically, he has a sick body and needs his horse, Stronger (who is just as sick as he is), to get around.[1]
appareance: He is currently one of the Ten Titanic Captains, as the captain of the Ninth Ship.[3]

Name: Dogra
Note: His name was revealed by Curly Dadan in Chapter 584, he is formally identified in Chapter 587.
description: Dogra is a member of Dadan's bandits that are active on Mt. Colubo on Dawn Island. He helped take care of Ace and Luffy for Garp.
appareance: Dogra's most distinctive trait is his short height. He always has a rather annoyed look on his face.

Name: Dogya
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Dogya[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Dogya's color scheme in the anime.

Name: Doha Ittanka II
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Doha Ittanka II[2] is a prisoner from Level 6 of Impel Down.[1]
appareance: Doha Ittanka is an extremely large man, appearing similar in size to a giant (though it's unknown if he actually is one). He has very long and bushy hair, and is missing several teeth. He wears a standard prison jumpsuit, and has chains shackling his wrists.[1]

Name: Doll
description: Doll is a Marine Vice Admiral and Commander of the G-14 Marine Base.[1] She is one of the nine Vice Admirals that took part in the Egghead Incident.[3]
appareance: She serves as a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: Doma
description: "Bohemian Knight" Doma is an infamous New World pirate who worked for Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Doma is a man with black curly hair and a beard that seems to have lines that extend to his eyes. He wears a large red headband and a necklace with big light-blue square jewels on it. His neck appears to have a scar on the lower right, and he sports a large and long light brown coat with a wide dark red collar and cuffs, closed by a belt. He also wears loose blue pants tucked inside simple boots.

Name: Domino
description: Domino is the Head Jailer of Impel Down serving under Warden Hannyabal.[2]
appareance: She is a slim woman with long, wavy blonde hair, with a tuft always covering her right eye, the left being obscured by a pair of sunglasses. She wears a modified version of the militaristic style uniform of many of the staff, consisting of a short pale brown double-breasted jacket worn like a dress over a white shirt with a black tie, all paired with brown boots and dark gloves far longer than the ones worn by the other members of the staff. On her head, she wears a standard Impel Down hat.[1]

Name: Domo-kun
Note: Joke character. He first appeared in God's Gift for the Future. His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Domo-kun and Nnke-kun are aliens planning to conquer the Earth.[2] They are the first joke characters created by Oda. They first appeared in Oda's short story God's Gift for the Future. Later Domo-kun makes an appearance among the Buggy Pirates.[3] Oda answered a question in an SBS and drew both of them.[4] Nnke-kun appeared again alongside Pandaman on the cover of Volume 52.
appareance: Domo-kun is humanoid creature with a pear-shaped head, dark circles on his cheeks and braided dark hair with a ribbon at the end. He wears an orange jumpsuit that covers his entire body apart from his hands.

Name: Donannoyo
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Donannoyo[2] is a Waiter of the Beasts Pirates who serves as a guard in the Prisoner Mine of the Udon region of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Donannoyo is an average-sized man with a prominent nose and lips, spiky purple hair, a short beard and a stubby mustache. He wears a standard Beasts Pirates uniform with ruf-lined shoulder guards and a cape.[1]

Name: Donovan
description: Donovan is one of the fifty mechanics of the Foxy Pirates. Luffy chose their flag instead of one of their shipwrights.[1]
appareance: Donovan in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Donquino
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Donquino[4] was the helmsman[3] of the Roger Pirates.[1]
appareance: Donquino's concept art

Name: Donquixote Doflamingo
description: Donquixote Doflamingo,[4] nicknamed "Heavenly Yaksha",[9] is the captain of the Donquixote Pirates.[14] Before his imprisonment,[15] he was a member of the Seven Warlords of the Sea with a frozen bounty of 340,000,000,[16] as well as the most influential underworld broker under the codename "Joker".[8][2] He is also a former World Noble, descended from the Donquixote Family.[6]
appareance: He is the first son of the late Donquixote Homing[17] and the older brother of the late Rosinante,[18] both of whom he killed out of feeling betrayed by them.[19][18] Doflamingo became the King of Dressrosa after taking the throne from Riku Doldo III eight years before the start of the series.[20] He ruled the country tyrannically until he was stripped of his positions as a Warlord of the Sea and king after he was defeated by Monkey D. Luffy near the end of the Dressrosa Arc. After Doflamingo was arrested by Admiral Fujitora along with most of his crew,[21] he was locked up at Impel Down and placed in Level 6.[22] Vegapunk later cloned Doflamingo as one of the Seraphim to replace the Warlords.[23]

Name: Donquixote Homing
description: Saint Donquixote Homing was the father of Doflamingo and Rosinante. A former World Noble of the Donquixote Family, he withdrew from his position and left Mary Geoise in order to live a normal life with his family. After suffering two years of abuse from prejudiced civilians, Homing was killed by his then ten-year-old son, Doflamingo.[1]
appareance: Homing was a tall man, with dark blonde curly hair which reached to his shoulders, styled in the traditional way of the Celestial Dragons. He sported an impressive mustache, and, unlike his amoral brethren, possessed remarkably kind facial features and a rather thin face. He wore the typical garb of a World Noble during his tenure at Mary Geoise: a thick white suit with medal-like knobs on it, and a blue collar.

Name: Donquixote Mjosgard
Note: His full name was revealed in Chapter 907.
description: Saint Donquixote Mjosgard was a member of the World Nobles, being part of the Donquixote Family descended from the First Twenty who founded the World Government.[4]
appareance: After an attempt to recapture his freed fish-man slaves went awry, Mjosgard met Queen Otohime of Fish-Man Island's Ryugu Kingdom[1] and became their ally and a supporter of their efforts to integrate with humans, opposing the extreme racism typical among World Nobles. During the most recent Levely, he would directly oppose other World Nobles from threatening Otohime's family,[4] which resulted in his execution.[5][2]

Name: Donquixote Rosinante
Note: He was first mentioned by Trafalgar D. Water Law (as "Cora-san") in Chapter 729. His real name was revealed in Chapter 763.
description: Donquixote Rosinante[8][1] was a former World Noble of the Donquixote Family descent,[4] being the second son of Donquixote Homing and the younger brother of Donquixote Doflamingo.[9][8] After his family lost their status as Celestial Dragons and became pariahs, Rosinante was discovered by Sengoku and enlisted into the Marines, eventually reaching the rank of Commander.[1] Upon reuniting with Doflamingo, he feigned muteness and operated as an Elite Officer of the Donquixote Pirates, serving Doflamingo under the codename Corazon[10][11][3] while remaining an undercover Marine.
appareance: Rosinante abandoned his post in an attempt to cure Trafalgar D. Water Law of his Amber Lead Syndrome. He eventually obtained the Ope Ope no Mi, forcing Law to eat it and thus giving him the means to save himself from the disease. However, his cover was blown by the former Corazon, Vergo,[12] and he was subsequently executed by Doflamingo.[13] Rosinante's kindness and sacrifice would serve as driving motivators for Law to one day avenge him by defeating Doflamingo.

Name: Donquixote Shivercalero
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Saint Donquixote Shivercalero[2] is a World Noble from the Donquixote Family and the father of the late Donquixote Mjosgard.[1]
appareance: Shivercalero is an obese man with a bald crown but long, curly, light-green hair flowing from the back of his head. He has a small mustache, a large nose, and buckteeth. His head is shaped like an upright triangle and effectively merged with his torso due to the flab around his neck and chin. He wears a white robe which leaves his hairy chest exposed.

Name: Doran
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 665.
description: Doran is a child who was captured and kept in the Biscuits Room on Punk Hazard.[1] He was freed with the rest of the children by the Straw Hat Pirates.
appareance: Doran is much larger than a normal child because of the experiments done on him in the Biscuits Room. During his time in the Biscuits Room, he wore a light colored sleeveless shirt with matching pants.[1] When Kin'emon gave the Straw Hats and children coats, Doran's coat was light colored, with black buttons, and black fur at the hood and end of the sleeves.[2]

Name: Doringo
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Doringo[2] was a member of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution.[1] His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Doringo is a shorter man with spikey hair, long limbs, and a wide smile. In his first outfit, he wore a two-tone jacket with a light-colored stripe down each dark-colored sleeve, a light-colored bandana, dark-colored shorts and a single sheath that holds both of his swords. Doringo's wings are part of his jacket.[3]

Name: Dorry
description: Dorry the Blue Ogre is a giant from Elbaph and one of the two captains of the Giant Warrior Pirates alongside Brogy.
appareance: Once an active and infamous threat in the seas long ago, Dorry become embroiled in a personal duel over a trivial dispute with his best friend and co-captain Brogy. This duel on Little Garden lasted for a century before being interrupted by the arrival of the Straw Hat Pirates and the machinations of Baroque Works. After finally settling their duel the two giant captains returned to Elbaph and their crew, and later became involved in the Egghead Incident to rescue the Straw Hat Pirates and bring them to safety in Elbaph. During the God's Knights' invasion of Elbaph, Dorry was transformed into a demon by Imu in a bid to annex the island for the World Government.

Name: Dosun
description: Dosun[5] is a hammerhead shark fish-man and was one of the officers of the New Fish-Man Pirates.[2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is considered to be a major antagonist in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

Name: Dotaku
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Dotaku[2] is a samurai who resides in Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Dotaku is an elderly man with blonde sideburns, beard and mustache. The top of his head is bald, and he possesses a scar above his left eye. He wears a gray kimono and coat with dark and light red stripes.

Name: Doubt Brothers
Note: Their names were revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: The Doubt Brothers are Shinuchi[2] of the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: The most prominent trait both of the brothers share are the large wind-up keys sticking upwards out of their heads, which they claim to have had since birth.[2]

Name: Dracule Mihawk
Note: He was first mentioned by Gin in Chapter 48 under his epithet. He was formally introduced in Chapter 50.
description: Dracule "Hawk Eyes" Mihawk[15] is a world-famous pirate who holds the title "Strongest Swordsman in the World".[8]
appareance: Formerly one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea (the first revealed and formally introduced)[3] until the group's dissolution,[4] Mihawk has since become one of the founders of Cross Guild, alongside his former Warlord colleague, Sir Crocodile.[2][16]

Name: Dragon Number Thirteen
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Dragon Number Thirteen[2] was a dragon created by Vegapunk to guard Punk Hazard. He carried out this duty even after Vegapunk and the World Government's departure until he was killed by Roronoa Zoro four years later.[3] He was named by one of the World Nobles.[4]
appareance: Dragon Number Thirteen was a very large dragon, being 70 meters (229 feet) in length.[2] He was covered in red scales, had a long neck and tail, and walked on four stumpy legs; his forelegs were much smaller than his hind legs. He boasted very sharp teeth, two horns on his head that pointed backwards, a pair of wings, and a row of spikes that went along his backside from the top of his neck to the end of his tail.[1]

Name: Dragon Number Twenty-One
Note: Its name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Dragon Number Twenty-One[2] is a dragon created by Vegapunk which resides on Punk Hazard. It was designed to be smaller than Vegapunk's first successful dragon, Dragon Number Thirteen, giving it more quickness.
appareance: It is a minor antagonist in the Punk Hazard Arc.

Name: Draw
Note: He was first introduced in One Piece novel A Volume 1.
description: Draw is a Marine Vice Admiral and the main antagonist of One Piece novel A Volume 1.[1]
appareance: Draw is stated to be a large and well-built man, being about a head taller than Portgas D. Ace. He wears a Marine officer's coat. On his arms, he wears cylindrical attachments that hold his flamethrowers, which when covered by his coat make his arms appear broad.[1]

Name: Drip
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 603.
description: Drip was a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who was posing as the real Sanji.[1]
appareance: Drip disguised as Killer.

Name: Drophy
Note: Her real name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: "Town-Collapser" Drophy,[2] better known by her alias Miss Merry Christmas, is a former officer agent partnered with Mr. 4.[1]
appareance: She was a major antagonist during the Arabasta Arc. After the downfall of Baroque Works, she works as a "princess" at the new Spiders Cafe alongside most of her former colleagues.

Name: Drug Peclo
description: Drug Peclo, also known as the Major Undertaker, is an emperor of the Underworld.[1]
appareance: Peclo's concept art from the anime.

Name: Ducky Bree
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Ducky Bree[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Ducky Bree is an average height, muscular man with skinny libs, a sharp chin, a pointed nose and shaggy, dark-colored hair. He has only been seen with a down-turned mouth. He wears an open, dark-colored shirt with a pattern on the shoulders, dark-colored pants that leave his ankles exposed, dark-colored shoes, and a patterend headband.

Name: Duval
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 492.
description: Duval[3] is the leader of the Rosy Life Riders, who were initially the Flying Fish Riders kidnapping gang in the neighborhood of Fish-Man Island and Sabaody Archipelago.
appareance: He was initially an enemy of the Straw Hats;[1] however, he has since become their ally.

Name: Eddy
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Eddy was the navigator of the Bellamy Pirates.[2]
appareance: He is the bespectacled "pretty boy" of the Bellamy Pirates. He is a tall, blond man with a tan complexion. He wears glasses and a has long black and white jacket with a white t-shirt underneath. He also wears a Log Pose, as he needs it since he is the navigator of the Bellamy Pirates.

Name: Edison
Note: Its name was first seen on a chart in Chapter 1062.
description: Edison, also designated as Punk-03 (PUNK-03（パンク スリー）, Panku-Surī?), is one of the six satellites of Dr. Vegapunk, embodying his aspect of "thinking".[3]
appareance: He is a major companion and ally to the Straw Hat Pirates during the Egghead Arc.

Name: Edward Newgate
Note: He was first mentioned by Smoker in Chapter 157. Better known by his epithet Whitebeard.
description: Edward Newgate,[12] more commonly known as "Whitebeard", was a legendary pirate and the captain of the Whitebeard Pirates. Widely known as the "Strongest Man in the World", he was considered the "Man Closest to One Piece" after Gol D. Roger's death.[7]
appareance: Growing up as an orphan on the island of Sphinx, Newgate went on to become a pirate, eventually joining the legendary Rocks Pirates. Sometime after the Rocks Pirates' disbanding, he went on to form his own crew, taking on the nickname "Whitebeard" and eventually becoming one of the Four Emperors that rule over the New World[4][5]. He shared a friendly rivalry with Roger, to whom he lent one of his crewmmates, Kouzuki Oden, so that Oden could help Roger discover the final island of the Grand Line, a goal that Whitebeard had no interest in. Following Roger's death, Whitebeard became recognized as the strongest man in the world, a fact complimented by having the highest active bounty whilst alive, and the second highest bounty of any pirate in history.

Name: Edward Weevil
Note: He was first mentioned by Brannew in Chapter 700. He appeared as a silhouette in Chapter 801.
description: Edward Weevil,[6] or "Whitebeard Jr.", is a pirate and self-proclaimed son of the late Edward "Whitebeard" Newgate. He is the son of Buckingham Stussy, the self-proclaimed lover of Newgate.[1] He was initiated into the Seven Warlords of the Sea sometime during the two-year timeskip,[2] and served in their ranks until the Warlords' dissolution.[3]
appareance: Weevil was first mentioned by Marine commodore Brannew in a discussion of the, at-time, current Warlord ranks to several high-ranking Marine officers, but was not explicitly named until after Donquixote Doflamingo's defeat.[7]

Name: Eiri
Note: Mentioned only character. He was mentioned by a giant in Chapter 866.
description: Eiri is a giant who resided on Elbaph 63 years ago. He was once severely injured by a young Charlotte Linlin.[1]
appareance: As a giant, Eiri likely possesses great physical strength. However, when Charlotte Linlin hit him, a lot of his bones were broken.[1]

Name: Egana
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Egana[3] is Margarita's employer.[2]
appareance: Egana is a lean man with slicked-back brown hair and a small mustache. He wears a white shirt with a tan collar.

Name: Eggplant Soldier
Note: He was only named in the anime.
description: Eggplant Soldier is a soldier of the Big Mom Pirates, serving as a guard at the Whole Cake Chateau. He was Sanji's helper during his stay at the castle before his planned wedding to Charlotte Pudding.[1]
appareance: Eggplant Soldier's full face with hair shown.

Name: Eikon
Note: Her name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Eikon[2] is a dwarf from the Tontatta Kingdom and a member of the Tontatta Pirates.[1][3]
appareance: Eikon is small in stature and has a large fluffy tail, a pointy nose, and puffy cheeks. She has puffy dark hair that is held up with a bright hairband and wears a striped shirt with a fluffy collar.

Name: Elbow
Note: Mentioned only character. They were first mentioned by Ida in Chapter 1154.
description: Elbow is a individual who resided on Elbaph over 56 years ago and trained Hajrudin to be a warrior.[1]
appareance: Elbow is likely a skilled warrior as they are capable of training others.[1]

Name: Elizabello II
description: "The Fighting King" Elizabello II[5] is the king of the Prodence Kingdom. He is also a fighter who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1] He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc.
appareance: Elizabello is a large muscular man, with a thin beard and a very prominent chin. He has slicked back blonde hair. His lower body portion and legs are mis-proportioned to his upper body build, as they seem to be rather skinny.

Name: Elmy
Note: Her name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Elmy[3] is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied with the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: Elmy is an elderly woman. She has a large mass of long, curly red hair with a small hat on top of it. She wears large amounts of dark purple eyeliner around her eyes. She has pinkish-red lipstick around her mouth, which has several teeth missing. She wears an elaborate pearl necklace just below several folds in her neck. She also wears long bejeweled earrings and a ring on each finger of at least her right hand. She wears a purple blouse.[1]

Name: Emet
Note: Its name was revealed in Chapter 1119.
description: Emet,[3] also known as the Iron Giant, is a robot created around the time of the Void Century who was a friend of Joy Boy. Since that time it has been mostly de-powered, only reactivating in two known instances, the first of which occurred 200 years ago when it nearly attacked Mary Geoise. Afterwards it was smuggled away and kept on Egghead,[1][4] where in the present day it was used to guard Vegapunk's prerecorded video being broadcasted from within itself.[5] After hearing the Drums of Liberation from Monkey D. Luffy, Emet powered back up and aided the Straw Hat Pirates in battling the Five Elders.[6]
appareance: Emet is an ally during the Egghead Arc.

Name: Emma
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Emma is a member of the Kid Pirates.[2]
appareance: Emma is a woman with light colored hair that is stylized with a mohawk on top and two bangs on each side of her face. She wears an open dark jacket, a frilly skirt and high heels.[2]

Name: Emporio Ivankov
Note: He was first mentioned by Bentham in Chapter 532.
description: Emporio Ivankov,[7] or Iva for short, is the "Queen" of the Kamabakka Kingdom, known as "Okama King" and a "Miracle Person".[8] He is one of the Revolutionary Army's founding members,[2] as well as the commander of the G Army, which covers the Grand Line.[9] A former slave of the World Nobles,[10] he escaped during the Native Hunting Competition on God Valley and was responsible for the God Valley Incident along with Ginny.[11]
appareance: He was formerly a prisoner of Impel Down, where he was kept in Level 5, but lived in the secret "Okama Paradise" in Level 5.5.[1] After escaping Impel Down and participating in the Summit War of Marineford, he returned to his post as Queen of Kamabakka Kingdom.[12]

Name: Enel
Note: He was first mentioned by Conis in Chapter 241.
description: Enel is the former tyrannical "God" of Skypiea.[1]
appareance: Previously an inhabitant of Birka, Enel destroyed his homeland through the powers of the Goro Goro no Mi and then proceeded to take over Skypiea with his followers. His ultimate goal was reaching "Fairy Vearth", having constructed a massive airship from Shandora's gold in order to attain said objective.[5] After being defeated by Monkey D. Luffy and yet, nonetheless, successfully arriving on the moon, Enel became its new ruler.[6]

Name: Enishida
description: Enishida is a member of the Kuja and one of Boa Hancock's attendants in her castle. She is a lady's maid.[2]
appareance: Enishida's concept art from the anime.

Name: Epoida
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Epoida[3] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates,[4] before forming his own crew subordinate to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Epoida is a massive, rotund man with long, curly orange hair reaching down to his waist that constantly covers his eyes. He has a round nose that is orange-pinkish in color. His arms are relatively long and thin in comparison to his build. He wears a white brimmed hat on his head and a green and turquoise striped shirt with an elaborate collar. His body shape also resembles that of a caterpillar, with different sections for each stripe of his shirt.

Name: Époni
description: Époni is a nurse in service to the royal household of the Germa Kingdom. She was primarily charged with caring for the late queen, Vinsmoke Sora.[1]
appareance: Époni's concept art from the anime.

Name: Erik
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Erik is a member of the Rebel Army in the Arabasta Kingdom led by Koza. He is from Suiren, a town that had been completely dried out.
appareance: He has long, dark pink hair along with a little stubble on his chin. Erik wears a black top hat and a dark blue coat with badges on the chest and side of the arm.

Name: Erio
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Erio[4] was a member of the Roger Pirates who acted as their information broker (情報屋, jōhō-ya?)[3] until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Erio's concept art

Name: Esta
description: Esta is a citizen of Dressrosa.[1]
appareance: Esta is a young woman. In the anime, her dress is light blue (dark in the manga), and she wears a white frilly skirt with light blue spots. She has brownish orange hair.[1]

Name: Estrid
Note: She was first referenced in Chapter 1139.
description: Estrid was the mother of Loki, as well as the former arranged wife to king Harald, making her Elbaph's latest queen. She was also the daughter of a pureblooded and ancient influential lineage, akin to nobility.[1] She passed away 62 years ago of an unknown illness.[2]
appareance: Estrid's outfit after disowning Loki.

Name: Ethanbaron V. Nusjuro
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1086.
description: Saint Ethanbaron V. Nusjuro[3][4] is a World Noble and one of the Five Elders who publicly head the World Government,[1] holding the title of Warrior God of Finance.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is one of the secondary antagonists of the Egghead Arc. Along with the other Elders, he is one of the main antagonists of the Final Saga and one of the overarching antagonists of the One Piece series.

Name: Ettara Chaunkai
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Ettara Chaunkai[2] is a citizen of Dressrosa.[1]
appareance: Chaunkai in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Eustass Kid
description: Eustass "Captain" Kid[7] is a notorious pirate from the South Blue and the captain of the Kid Pirates.[1] He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation".[8]
appareance: Kid first appeared at the Sabaody Archipelago at the same time Monkey D. Luffy and his crew arrived. Both were described as members of the "Eleven Supernovas", pirates who had congregated on the island who all had a bounty of more than 100,000,000. After briefly fighting alongside Luffy while escaping an attack by the Marines, he fled the archipelago and would later spectate the Summit War of Marineford alongside the other Supernovas.

Name: Farafra
description: Farafra was a member of the Rebel Army led by Koza along with Erik. He lost his right arm and right shoulder while protecting Koza during an enemy attack.[1]
appareance: Farafra is a large man with tan skin, and long unkempt hair, that is black in the anime. He wears a striped black and green military shirt, and a sash. He also sports a blueish-grey turban. He lost his right shoulder while fighting for the rebels. He also has a metallic prosthetic shoulder, most likely to hide the impairment. His character also resembles a hippo, having a flat nose and two teeth that stick out of his lower jaw.

Name: Farul
description: Farul is Cavendish's pet horse and a member of the Beautiful Pirates.[1]
appareance: Farul is a big white horse, almost three heads taller than Cavendish. It sports a long gray mane and a saddle that allows Cavendish to ride on it. There is a loud-speaker made of a Sound Dial on the side of its saddle that Cavendish uses.[1]

Name: Faust
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 86.
description: Faust is a cat mink from North Blue[3] and a member of the Hawkins Pirates, serving as the crew's magician.[1][4]
appareance: Faust is a cat mink with light-colored (black in the anime and in the Digitally Colored Manga Pre-Timeskip, tan in the Digitally Colored Manga Post-Timeskip) fur, a large thin mouth, and yellow eyes. He wears a long, dark blue cloak, a white and red striped shirt, a green sash around his waist, and purple pants. He also wears brown shoes, a white ruff, and a necklace with a cross on it.

Name: Fen Bock
description: Fen Bock of the Gourd is an ex-prisoner. During the Punk Hazard Arc, he worked as a satyr henchman for Caesar Clown.[1]
appareance: Bock has long wild black hair tied back in a ponytail and straight brown horns on his head. His original crippled human legs were replaced with grayish white sheep legs.

Name: Figarland Garling
description: Saint Figarland Garling[3] is one of the Five Elders who publicly head the World Government, holding the title Warrior God of Science and Defense.[2] A World Noble who hails from the Figarland Family, Garling is the biological father of Shamrock, a commander of the God's Knights,[4] as well as the pirate Shanks, of the Four Emperors.[5]
appareance: Garling became the "champion" of God Valley during the battle that took place there 38 years ago, and has since served as Supreme Commander of the God's Knights for decades prior to his promotion to Elder.[1] After the Egghead Incident, Garling was named an Elder to succeed Jaygarcia Saturn, who was killed by Imu due to his failure to stop the escape of Monkey D. Luffy.[2]

Name: Figarland Shamrock
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1137.
description: Saint Shamrock of the Figarland Family is a World Noble and the commander of the God's Knights. He is the son of Saint Figarland Garling, one of the Five Elders of the World Government,[2] and the older twin brother of Shanks, one of the Four Emperors.[3]
appareance: He acts as a minor antagonist in the Elbaph Arc, spearheading the Knights' mission to annex Elbaph and leading the initial invasion.

Name: Fillonce
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Fillonce[3] is an amethyst anthias mermaid[4] and an employee at Mermaid Café.[2]
appareance: Fillonce is a mermaid with a clear blue almost white tail which has an agglomerations of white dot-like markings. And just like Camie, she has prominent lips. Her pink somewhat frizzly hair opens wide with her bangs curling to the right.[2]

Name: Finamore
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Finamore[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Finamore is a short, fair-skinned man with small round eyes, a small nose, and thick lips. He wears a gray turban and scarf, a patterned top, and a light-colored skirt. He also does not wear shoes.

Name: Fishbonen
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Dr. Fishbonen[2] is a Marine naval surgeon (軍医 Gun'i)[3] stationed at Marineford.
appareance: Fishbonen is a tall broad man with a distinctive hair style. He has been seen chewing a fish bone when talking, fitting his theme. He wears a stethescope, blue shirt with light-blue dots, and a yellow scarf. He has a partially visible tattoo on his left arm.[1]

Name: Fisher Tiger
description: Fisher Tiger, known as the Adventurer,[1] was a sea bream Fish-Man and the founder and original captain of the Sun Pirates.[9]
appareance: A well-known explorer, Tiger became a slave for the World Nobles at some point in his adventures.[10] After managing to escape his captors and return to Fish-Man Island, Tiger climbed back through the Red Line to Mary Geoise in order to free his fellow slaves.[11] This act granted Tiger infamy among humans and admiration from his fellow Fish-Men, particularly his long-time friends Jinbe and Arlong.

Name: Flapper
description: Flapper is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit, when he stopped Leo from taking Robin's clothes and belongings.[1] He participated in Operation SOP and became a temporary victim of Sugar's Hobi Hobi no Mi.
appareance: Flapper after being turned into a toy.

Name: Flare
Note: Appeared in the one-shot Monsters.
description: Flare was a character from Eiichiro Oda's one-shot Monsters.[1]
appareance: Flare was a young girl with shoulder-length dark brown hair and dark green eyes. She wears a white shirt with line patterns and an orange apron over it. She looks very similar to Nami before the timeskip.

Name: Footbianco
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Footbianco[2] is one of the Franky Family's Kairiki Destroyers.[3]
appareance: Footbianco's initial colorscheme in the anime.

Name: Forest Boss
Note: Cover story character.
description: The Forest Boss is a mandrill that was first introduced in Gedatsu's cover story.
appareance: Forest Boss's appearance in the digitally colored chapters.

Name: Forliewbs
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Forliewbs[2] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was subordinate to the Whitebeard Pirates.
appareance: Forliewbs is a chubby man with a large rectangular flat nose, facial hair, a scar under his left eye, and wears a crown with some sort of spiral, horn-like objects. He wears an ascot around his neck and some sort of purple shawl around his shoulders. He also wears a purple long sleeved shirt, a pair of light colored pants, and has a sash going across his right side.[2]

Name: Fossa
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 58.
description: Fossa[4] is the former 15th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: Fossa is a large and muscular older looking man, with a bald patch on the top of his head, a white mustache (black in the anime), a scar running diagonally across his face (on the head and forehead in the anime), and a chin that is split in two. He has Whitebeard's symbol tattooed in crimson on his right deltoid, along with three little circles, and he wears an open dark blue sleeveless jacket, with lighter edges, and loose light brown pants tucked inside his boots and are held up by a reddish-brown belt. He carries his weapon of choice; a katana with a square tsuba, on his left hip attached to his belt, but was also seen carrying it over his left shoulder with a long strap. He has been seen smoking a cigar in all of his appearances.[1]

Name: Fourtricks
description: Fourtricks is a Shinuchi in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Due to the nature of his SMILE transformation, much of Fourtricks' body is transformed into a large rooster, although his head is at the chicken's rear end. He wears sunglasses over his eyes and has pronounced lips, and his hair is a massive pompadour resembling a chicken's tail. He has a tattoo of the number 4 on both his left cheek and on the left side of his chicken's head, as well as a tattoo of the word "Tricks" on his forehead over his left eye. He has normal arms stretching down from the top of the chicken's backside, but his legs seem to have transformed into those of a chicken.[1]

Name: Foxy
description: Foxy the Silver Fox is the captain of the Foxy Pirates, and the main antagonist of the Long Ring Long Land Arc.[1]
appareance: In the anime, he is a recurring enemy—and occasional ally—of the Straw Hat Pirates, with major roles in the anime-original Foxy's Return Arc, Spa Island Arc, one installment of the Boss Luffy Historical Special, and the Adventure of Nebulandia special.

Name: Francois
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Francois[2] is a former prisoner of Impel Down and resident of Newkama Land in Level 5.5.[1]
appareance: Francois without his shirt and holding a sword.

Name: Franky
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 335. His birth name, Cutty Flam, was revealed in Chapter 346.
appareance: "Iron Man" Franky[7] is the shipwright of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[2] He is the crew's eighth member and the seventh to join, doing so at the end of the Post-Enies Lobby Arc.[17]

Name: Fuga
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1030.
description: Fuga is a member of the Numbers in the Beasts Pirates, representing the number "two".[2]
appareance: Like the other Numbers, Fuga is immensely tall, towering over even normal giants and being similar in size to an ancient giant, though while sitting Fuga appears to be a good deal shorter than his fellow Numbers Inbi and Zanki.

Name: Fugar
description: "Memorial Blade" Fugar is the bandmaster (船長（バンマス）, banmasu?) of the Social Club, a subordinate pirate crew of the Red Hair Pirates.[1]
appareance: Fugar is an old man with white hair, a long white beard, and a mustache. He has dentures which tend to pop out when he is talking. He wears a bicorne with his Jolly Roger on and a typical captain's coat.

Name: Fugetsu Kisaburo
Note: He was first mentioned in SBS Volume 109.
description: Fugetsu Kisaburo is a swordsmith from the Wano Country who forged the Yakuza Kasen. He is a member of the Fugetsu Family.[1]
appareance: Kisaburo is a master swordsmith, having forged one of the 12 Supreme Grade Blades.

Name: Fugetsu Omusubi
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 101.
description: Fugetsu Omusubi was a samurai who, as a member of the Fugetsu Family, served as the daimyo of the Kibi region[2] until he was imprisoned and killed by Kaidou 20 years ago.[1]
appareance: Omusubi's anime concept art.

Name: Fujin
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 933.
description: Fujin[5] is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates.[2] He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Fukaboshi
description: Fukaboshi is a shark merman and the eldest son of the royal Neptune Family on Fish-Man Island. After he, his father and his brothers were liberated by the Straw Hat Pirates, he allied himself with them against Hody Jones and his crew.[1]
appareance: Fukaboshi is an enormous, muscular shark merman, with a wide chest and large arms. He has a long face, framed by wavy fair blue hair flowing down to his shoulders, a sharp and pointy nose, and a dot of some sort printed on the middle of his forehead. He has gills on his massive neck (although they may just be stripes) and a dark blue tail with light blue polka-dots.

Name: Fukumi
Note: She was first mentioned in SBS Volume 103.
description: Fukumi was the younger sister of Fukurokuju.[1]
appareance: Fukumi was a young girl with light frizzy hair tied in a low ponytail, with bangs on both sides of her face. She had flower hairpieces at the top of the bangs and at the base of the ponytail, and wore a kimono.[1]

Name: Fukurokuju
description: Fukurokuju is a ninja and the previous captain of the Orochi Oniwabanshu[1] before they joined the Beasts Pirates following Orochi's deposition.[2] Though he pledged his team's support to Kaidou, Fukurokuju remained loyal to the surviving Orochi and helped him attempt to get revenge.[6] However, Fukurokuju was ultimately bested in combat by his rival Raizo as his and Orochi's plot failed.[7]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Fukurou
description: Fukurou the Silent[4] is an agent of CP0.[2] Before the time skip, he was previously an agent of CP9.[3]
appareance: He was one of the major antagonists during the Enies Lobby Arc.

Name: Fullbody
description: "Double Ironfist" Fullbody is a Marine lieutenant commander[2] serving under Rear Admiral Hina.[3] He was a Marine Headquarters lieutenant at the start of the series,[1] but was demoted to seaman recruit as a condition when he helped the former Black Cat pirate, Jango, get acquitted for his past crimes[4] (in the anime, it was after getting into a fight with Sanji on the Baratie[8]). During the timeskip, however, he rose back through the ranks to become a commissioned officer once again, being one rank higher than he was to begin with in the series.[2]
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a minor antagonist during the Baratie and Arabasta Arcs. He also is a supporting character during Jango's Dance Paradise Cover Page Serial.

Name: Funkfreed
description: Funkfreed is Spandam's sword, which has been animated by the Zou Zou no Mi, becoming an Elephant Sword (象剣, Zōken?).[2] As such, he also serves as a pet and unofficial bodyguard for Spandam, compensating his master's physical slightness.[4]
appareance: Untransformed, Funkfreed appears as a large and intimidating cutlass-esque sword, typically slung over-the-shoulder by Spandam. Only a few vestiges of his animal form are visible, most notably a pair of tusks set into the guard, and a tail-shaped tassel extending from the pommel.

Name: Furika
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Furika[2] is a citizen of Dressrosa.[1]
appareance: Furika in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Furrari
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Furrari[2] is the king of the Nagagutsu Kingdom and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2] He is the father of Tritobu.[1]
appareance: Furrari is a stocky, elderly man with a wide face accentuated by high cheekbones and a broad, pronounced nose.  His black eyes are small comparatively to his other features. His pale blond hair falls in thick, wavy locks past his shoulders and his similarly-colored mustache extends outward in thick tufts around his mouth.

Name: Fuza
Note: Its name was revealed in Chapter 248.
description: Fuza is the giant Three-length Bird of the Skypiean Priest Shura, who rode on it to get around to the different places throughout Skypiea.[2]
appareance: Fuza is a purple feathered bird with gigantic wings, on its enormous body. Fuza is large enough to carry a full-grown man. It has red feathers around its neck. Its head is white, has a sharpened beak and the eyes are yellow colored. Its tail is further purple colored with lighter extensions to it. The claws underneath its legs are white, with sharp black nails.

Name: Gab
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 101.
description: "Howling" Gab[2] is one of the Senior Officers of the Red Hair Pirates.[1]
appareance: Gab is a large dark-skinned man with shaggy dark brown hair, small beard and pointy teeth giving him a lion-like appearance. In Marineford, he wore what looked like a brown cape.[1] He is also shown wearing a backpack and white t-shirt during the events of the From the Decks of the World: The 500,000,000 Man Arc. In the Elbaph Arc, he wears a cloak.

Name: Gaburu
Note: He was first seen via a photograph.
description: Commander Gaburu (ガブル隊長, Gaburu Taichō?) was a revolutionist commander who led a militia group on an unknown island. His resemblance to Caribou caused misunderstandings in the cover story Caribou's Kehihihihi in the New World.[1]
appareance: Gaburu's appearance in the digitally colored chapters.

Name: Gaikotsu Yukichi
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 53. His face is printed on every 10,000 banknote.

Name: Gaimon
description: Gaimon is a former pirate who currently lives inside a treasure chest on the Island of Rare Animals.
appareance: Gaimon possesses a notably pear-shaped face, green hair, and a pronounced uni-brow. In his youth, he appeared to be a relatively scrawny man of average height.

Name: Gal
Note: He was named in his anime concept art.
description: Gal is a member of the G-5 branch of the Marines.[1]
appareance: Concept art of Gal.

Name: Galaxy
Note: Cover story character. His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: General Galaxy[2] is one of the automata created on Karakuri Island by Dr. Tsukimi. General Galaxy was first introduced in cover story of Enel's Great Space Operations.
appareance: Galaxy in the digital colored manga.

Name: Galdino
Note: His real name was revealed by an Impel Down Guards in Chapter 532.
description: Shawn Gann (1086+)
appareance: "Loan Shark" Galdino,[2][8] alias Mr. 3,[1] is a former officer agent of Baroque Works, partnered with "Miss Goldenweek" Marianne.[5]

Name: Gally
Note: He first appeared in Romance Dawn, Version 1 in 1996.
description: "Crescent-Moon" Gally is the captain of the Gally Pirates, currently active in the East Blue.[2]
appareance: He is notable as a character that predates One Piece proper, serving as the main antagonist of the first Romance Dawn prototype.[6] Since then, he has mostly appeared in non-canon portions of the anime (including[4] a loose adaptation of Romance Dawn), though he was eventually confirmed as a canon character by a manga cameo at the conclusion of the Whole Cake Island Arc.[2][3]

Name: Gama Pyonnosuke
Note: He was named in SBS Volume 95.
description: Gama Pyonnosuke is a toad that sat atop Usopp's head during his stay in Wano Country.[2]
appareance: Gama Pyonnosuke is an average-looking toad with green skin, and three black strips on his head.

Name: Gambia
description: Gambia the Missionary is the staff officer of the Barto Club. He was also a gladiator competing at the Corrida Colosseum for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: Gambia is a slim man with his top front teeth missing. He has jaguar spot tattoos on his upper arms, along with a cross tattoo on his chest. He has light colored hair in a beehive style with sideburns.

Name: Gambo
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1082.
description: Gambo is the deputy commander of the South Army in the Revolutionary Army and the assistant of Lindbergh.[2]
appareance: Gambo is a rotund, egg-shaped man with a large, crescent-shaped mustache, light hair and blushy cheeks. He wears a tack-shaped hat, overalls with a checkered pattern, a buttoned shirt and a bowtie.[1]

Name: Gan Fall
description: Gan Fall[4] is the current God of Skypiea. A venerable figure who served in that role for decades, he was overthrown by Enel and cast out of power for six years. During his exile, he roamed the sky as a mercenary known as the Knight of the Sky.[1][2]
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Skypiea Arc.

Name: Gancho
description: Gancho is the king, also called "Tonta-Chief" (トンタ長, Tonta-Chō?), of the Tontatta Kingdom.[1]
appareance: Gancho, like all the other dwarves, is small and has a large fluffy tail, though unlike his people, he lacks a pointy nose. He has long hair with a long beard. He wears a large crown with a robe and sun glasses. He also uses a walking stick to get around.[1]

Name: Gangaru
Note: His real name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Gangaru[3] is a samurai and member of the Beasts Pirates. He was formerly a member of the Mimawarigumi serving Kurozumi Orochi until Orochi's seeming death.[1][2]
appareance: Gangaru is a man of slightly above average size who is typically hunched over. He wears a blue samurai helmet which covers much of his head. He also wears a light blue kimono with cloud patterns on it, a white cloak with black spiked patterns on the edges, and large gray shoulder pads. He wears geta on his feet.[1]

Name: Ganryu
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Ganryu is a member of the Spade Pirates and a member of the Longarm Tribe.[2]
appareance: Ganryu is a tall, stocky man with a wide abdomen and a thick neck. As a member of the Longarm Tribe, he has double joints in his arms. Ganryu's hair is braided on the top and is put up in two large ponytails on the sides of his head. He wears a dark-colored shirt with a deep cut neckline, a neckerchief, a dark-colored coat with the sleeves rolled up past his first elbow, a pair of striped pants, and striped boots that come to the top of his ankle.

Name: Ganryu
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Ganryu[3] was a member of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution.[1] His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Ganryu's concept art.

Name: Ganzui
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1155.
description: Ganzui was a member of the Rocks Pirates.[2] A smuggler by trade, he lost a Davy Back Fight and subsequently joined Rocks in his pursuits.
appareance: Either during or sometime after the God Valley Incident, he perished, and was subsequently revived by Gecko Moria as Zombie #889, a General Zombie.[1]

Name: Garudan
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Garudan[3] is a samurai and member of the Beasts Pirates. He was formerly a member of the Mimawarigumi serving Kurozumi Orochi until Orochi's seeming death.[1][2]
appareance: Garudan is an average-sized man with long reddish-brown hair. His face is covered by a rabbit mask at all times. He wears a black kimono with orange rope-like patterns on it, as well as a white cloak.[1]

Name: Gatherine
description: Gatherine is a cafeteria worker at Enies Lobby.[1]
appareance: Gatherine is a pale woman, with black hair tied into two pigtails in the back. She has light blue eyes, and red makeup on her cheeks and lips. She has a large chin and large cheeks. She wears a white button up shirt, with a pink skirt.[1]

Name: Gattenshochinosukeo
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Gattenshochinosukeo[2] is a shipwright from the Wano Country who assisted Franky in repairing the rebel's ships.[1]
appareance: Gattenshochinosukeo is a muscular man. He has brown hair that is tied in a topknot, and a short mustache. He does not wear a shirt, but does wear blue hakama pants. On his right shoulder is a floral tattoo.[1]

Name: Gatz
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 709.
description: Gatz[3] is the announcer at the Corrida Colosseum.[1]
appareance: Gatz's appearance is that of a Spartan warrior. He wears a golden helmet with a large dark colored plume and a golden breast plate with a dark colored skirt. He has long brown hair that extends halfway down his back over a cape and a black goatee.[1]

Name: Gazelleman
description: Gazelleman is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1] After being tamed by Tama, he became an ally of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[2]
appareance: Gazelleman's anime concept art.

Name: Gecko Moria
description: Gecko Moria[9] is the captain of the Thriller Bark Pirates and a former member of the Seven Warlords of the Sea[2] who resides on Thriller Bark, the largest ship in the world. His bounty is 320,000,000, which was frozen until he lost his Warlord position.[8]
appareance: In his youth, Moria served as captain of the Gecko Pirates, until a vast majority of its members were killed in a fight against Kaidou of the Four Emperors. This traumatic event led Moria to seek power through an army of zombies, constructed by his subordinate, Dr. Hogback. To that end he stole the shadows of several beings with his Kage Kage no Mi powers, including Brook and several members of the Straw Hat Pirates, bringing him into conflict with them. His zombie army was ultimately destroyed and the captured shadows set free after his defeat but he retained his position as a Warlord and escaped Thriller Bark with the remnants of his crew. He took part in the Summit War of Marineford and sided with the Marines, along with most of the other Warlords.[10] After the end of the war, he was stripped of his title and was to be eliminated by Donquixote Doflamingo,[3] but he managed to escape into the New World.[11] Vegapunk later cloned Moria as one of the Seraphim to replace the Warlords.[12] Two years after the war, he attacked the Blackbeard Pirates on Hachinosu,[13] but was defeated and imprisoned when he refused to join Blackbeard.[14] He was later rescued by Perona with the help of Koby.[15]

Name: Gedatsu
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 254.
description: Sky Boss Gedatsu was one of Enel's priests[1] who punished criminals with the Ordeal of Swamp during Enel's reign.[2]
appareance: He is a major antagonist during the Skypiea Arc, and later the central character from Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life Cover Page Serial. He now works at Ukkari Hot-Springs Resort.

Name: Gem
Note: His real name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Gem of the Border,[5] better known by his alias Mr. 5,[1] was formerly the lowest-ranked officer agent in Baroque Works along with his partner, Miss Valentine.[2] He now works as a fireman at the new Spiders Cafe alongside most of his former colleagues.
appareance: He was one of the main antagonists of the Whisky Peak Arc and the tertiary antagonist of the Little Garden Arc.

Name: Genbo
Note: His name was revealed by Wyper in Chapter 251.
description: Genbo is one of the Shandia warriors that fought to take back the Upper Yard from Enel.
appareance: Genbo is a fat, bald Shandia with a hat that resembles a chef's hat, but with dark yellow and white stripes on it. He wears a grass skirt, much like many of his comrades, and has a large belt with a big buckle hanging from over his left shoulder. His arms are covered by some sort of spotted, similar to that of a giraffe, fur-lined gloves reaching up to his neck, covering even the shoulders. He also has a standard pair of a Shandia's wings on his back.

Name: Genrin
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Genrin[2] is an old man who lives in Ebisu Town.[1]
appareance: Genrin is an elderly man with a very wrinkled face and no teeth. He has little hair remaining apart from a topknot. He wears a purple kimono with green patches and a light green coat with tree patterns.[1]

Name: Genzo
description: Genzo[2] is the sheriff of Cocoyasi Village, and an unofficial but long-serving parental figure to Nami and Nojiko.[1]
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Arlong Park Arc.

Name: George Black
Note: Mentioned only character. Their name was seen on Impel Down's level 5 prisoner list.

Name: George Mach
description: George Mach[1] is a former member of the Foxy Pirates. He fought Mountain Ricky before the third round of the Davy Back Fight.[1]
appareance: George is a medium-height man with an angular face and hair that sticks straight up. He wears boxing gloves, shorts, boots, and the typical Foxy Pirate mask.

Name: Gerd
description: Gerd[3] is a giant from Elbaph[1] and the doctor of the New Giant Warrior Pirates. She was formerly an S-Class ranked mercenary for Buggy's Delivery.[2]
appareance: She is a major ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Elbaph Arc.

Name: Gerotini
description: "Ball Fingers" Gerotini is the captain of the Puddle Pirates, a pirate crew subordinate to the Red Hair Pirates.[1]
appareance: Gerotini is a man with a frog-like appearance. He has an oval-shaped head with short blonde hair that connects to a short beard at the sideburns. His eyes are squinted, his nose is completely flat and his upper lip is pointy at the middle. The tips of his fingers are ball-shaped, giving him his epithet. He wears a light green top hat and a tuxedo with a bowtie.[1]

Name: Giberson
description: Giberson, known as "The Concealer", is a veteran warehouseman and one of the emperors of the Underworld.[2]
appareance: Giberson's concept art from the anime.

Name: Gig
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Gig[3] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Gig is an obese man sporting liberty spikes and a crooked smile. He wears a pearl necklace and a leather jacket.

Name: Gill Bastar
Note: He first appeared as the protagonist of Wanted!. He was revealed to be the same character in SBS Volume 112.
description: Gill Bastar was the main character of the one shot Wanted!. He has an extremely high bounty gained from killing many people in self defense.[1]
appareance: Later on, Gill became a member of the Rocks Pirates. After his death, his corpse was taken by Gecko Moria and he became a General Zombie.[4][3]

Name: Gimlet
description: Gimlet was the infant son of Senor Pink and Russian.[1]
appareance: Gimlet in the digitally colored manga.

Name: Gin
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 45.
description: Gin the "Man-Demon"[1] is a pirate and the Combat Commander (戦闘総隊長, Sentō sōtaichō?) of the Krieg Pirates. He is initially introduced as a mere combatant of Krieg before his actual rank and abilities are made clear.[4]
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered the secondary antagonist of the Baratie Arc, although he eventually ends up aiding Monkey D. Luffy and Sanji.

Name: Gina
description: Gina is the female carpenter of the Foxy Pirates.[1][2]
appareance: A full body view of Gina.

Name: Ginko
Note: She is named in Episode 608 credits.
description: Ginko[2] is a little girl who lived on Punk Hazard. She was one of the children Momonosuke met when he came to the island.[3] She is only named in the anime.[2]
appareance: Ginko is a little girl, with short brown hair, and wears a white shirt. Due to her being a recent arrival to Punk Hazard, she has not had the growth transformation that others have.[1]

Name: Ginnosuke
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Ginnosuke[2] is a child who lives in the Flower Capital and attends Sarahebi's classes.[1]
appareance: Ginnosuke is a young boy with a round nose and pink hair. The top of his head is bald, leaving hair tied in a topknot in the back, long sideburns, and bangs with an ahoge on his forehead. He wears a light blue kimono with sharp, dark blue triangle patterns arranged in circles.[1]

Name: Ginny
description: Ginny[5] was the former East Army commander of the Revolutionary Army, having joined the group alongside Bartholomew Kuma 22 years ago, back when they were known as the Freedom Fighters.[6] She was the mother of Jewelry Bonney.[7]
appareance: She was previously a slave from the Porco Kingdom who was forced to take part in the Native Hunting Competition on God Valley 38 years ago.[1][3] She and Emporio Ivankov were responsible for orchestrating the God Valley Incident as a means of escaping the Native Hunting Competition.

Name: Ginrummy
description: Ginrummy is a Shinuchi[2] of the Beasts Pirates.[4]
appareance: Ginrummy's concept art from the anime.

Name: Giro Chintaro
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Giro Chintaro[2] is a samurai from Wano Country who was appointed as the kaishakunin for Zorojuro's seppuku ritual.[1]
appareance: Chintaro is an average-sized man with prominent eyebrows, nose and chin. He has a stubble of a beard and black hair tied in a topknot, but the top of his head is bald. He wears a black kimono and light blue hakama with his kimono sleeves with a tasuki.

Name: Giolla
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 714.
description: Giolla[4] is an officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Trebol Army.[5][6]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Gion
Note: Better known by her alias Momousagi.
description: Gion,[2] better known by her alias Momousagi, is a Marine vice admiral.[1]
appareance: Gion's concept art from the anime.

Name: Giovanni
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Giovanni[2][3] is a zebra mink and one of the Three Inuarashi Musketeers leading the squad.
appareance: Giovanni is a tall Zebra mink with black and white patterned fur, a long neck, a long snout, and shoulder-length blond hair. He wears the Inuarashi Musketeer Squad uniform of a purple cape lined with red, a black hat with a pink plume, and brown boots. He also wears black pants, a white shirt with a frilly edge at the bottom, black gloves, a black belt with a golden buckle, an orange scarf, and a sword over his left shoulder.

Name: Gismonda
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 104.
description: Gismonda[2] is a masked agent of CP0.[1]
appareance: Gismonda's concept art from the anime.

Name: Gladius
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 723.
description: Gladius is an officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Pica Army.[5][6]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Gloriosa
Note: She was first introduced as Elder Nyon. Her real name was revealed by Boa Hancock in Chapter 517.
description: Gloriosa,[3] more commonly known as "Elder Nyon",[1] is an advisor of sorts to the current empress of the Kuja tribe, Boa Hancock. Gloriosa is a former empress and captain of the Kuja Pirates from three generations prior to Hancock.[3] She is also a former member of the legendary Rocks Pirates.[2]
appareance: Gloriosa is remarkably diminutive in height, with very thick lips, and is wrinkled from old age. She also wears some kind of sea-green bubble belt apparently meant to hold up the spotted-print short skirt that all Kuja wear. Also, like most Kuja, she wears a cape. Her hair is white, and she wears a pink flower on the left side of her head.[1]

Name: Glove
description: Commander Glove[2] is one of the Marine commanders that helped in the Buster Call on Enies Lobby. He was quickly defeated by Franky during the Buster Call at Enies Lobby.
appareance: Glove has brown puffy hair and a slight beard. He wears a metal brace around his face and is dressed in the standard Marine soldier outfit with an overcoat. Commander Glove also wears a Marine cap and blue boxing gloves.[3]

Name: Glutbunny
Note: It was first mentioned as the "Ear God" in Chapter 1127. Its real name was revealed in Chapter 1129.
description: Glutbunny, also known as the Ear God, was a giant rabbit that lived in the Land of Gods and was revered by its residents.[2][1] It was killed by Luffy and eaten by the Straw Hat Pirates' Monster Trio.[3]
appareance: The Ear God's skeletal remains.

Name: Gode
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Sage Gode[1] is one of the three Birkan clergymen who lived on Skypiea and served Enel.
appareance: As a Birkan, Gode has wings along with a long, bushy black beard and matching hair. He was wearing yellow bracelets on his arms. He was seen to carry a book under his arm as well.

Name: Going Merry
Goki
Note: His name was revealed by Scratchmen Apoo in Chapter 991.
description: Goki is a member of the Numbers in the Beasts Pirates, representing the number "five".[2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Gol D. Roger
Note: His real name was revealed by Kureha in Chapter 154.
description: Gol D. Roger,[7][3] more commonly known as Gold Roger,[1] was a legendary pirate who, as captain of the Roger Pirates, held the title of Pirate King and possessed the legendary treasure known as the One Piece.[1] He was also the lover of Portgas D. Rouge and the biological father of Portgas D. Ace.[8]
appareance: Roger was the first pirate in history since Joy Boy to circumnavigate the Grand Line, culminating in reaching its final island which he named Laugh Tale. However, knowing that his life was limited by an incurable disease, Roger disbanded his crew and turned himself in to be executed. Though the World Government staged the execution as a public spectacle to discourage piracy, Roger used his final words to ensure the opposite, openly declaring that the One Piece belonged to anyone that could find it. As such, he singlehandedly began the Great Pirate Era.[1][9]

Name: Goldberg
Note: He was mentioned by a giant in Chapter 866.
description: Goldberg[6] is a giant from Elbaph[3] who is the cook of the New Giant Warrior Pirates and was formerly an S-Class ranked mercenary for Buggy's Delivery.[1]
appareance: He is a major ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Elbaph Arc.

Name: Goldfish Princess
Note: Cover story character.
description: The Goldfish Princess is a character in the Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll cover story.
appareance: The Goldfish princess as seen in the game One Piece: Ocean's Dream!

Name: Gomorrah
description: Gomorrah is one of the two gigantic King Bulls owned by the Franky Family, the other being Sodom.[1]
appareance: As a King Bull, Gomorrah is a much larger version of the normal Yagara Bulls in Water 7: an aquatic horse with fins in place of legs, while it wears odd sunglasses that most of the other Franky Family members wear.

Name: Gonbe
description: Gonbe is known as Chimney's pet cat, although he is actually a rabbit.[1]
appareance: Gonbe thinks he is a cat but obviously has the body of a rabbit, including long ears and a cotton-tail. He is mostly light blue with a cream-colored face and front. Like his master, he constantly has a wide grin on his face.

Name: Goo
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Captain Goo[2] is a pirate captain who, along with his crew, had their shadows stolen by Gecko Moria.[1]
appareance: A full body view of Goo.

Name: Googly-Eyed
Note: Their name was revealed in Episode 567's credits.
description: Googly-Eyed[1][4] is a Sea King.[2] It is one of the six Sea Kings that speak to Shirahoshi when she fully manifests the power of Poseidon.[5]
appareance: Googly-Eyed is a large Sea King that resembles a giant frog. It has yellow skin with a pale underbelly, a prominent dorsal fin, and green, googly eyes.[2] In the Digitally Colored Manga, his body is completely yellow and his eyes are white.

Name: Gorilla
description: Captain Gorilla is a Marine officer who was sent to investigate the Nightmare of Baldimore accidentally caused by Franky.[1]
appareance: Captain Gorilla's facial features closely resemble a gorilla. He has hairy sideburns and a big, particular nose that resembles those of gorillas. On his head he wears a standard Marine cap. He is dressed in an attire fitting the cold climate of the island he was sent to investigate. He sports a fur-lined cape with the Marine insignia on it and epaulets over what looks like a long coat with pockets on it. On his back he carries a standard flintlock rifle.[1]

Name: Gorishiro
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 997.
description: Gorishiro is a gorilla that is attached to Mizerka's body due to her consumption of a gorilla SMILE.[2]
appareance: Gorishiro, as he is initially depicted in the anime

Name: Goro
Note: Cover story character.
description: Goro is Toto's younger brother and Koza's paternal uncle. He appeared in Gedatsu's cover story.[1]
appareance: Goro in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Gorobe
description: Gorobe is a citizen of Okobore Town in the Kuri region of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: He is a man with wrinkled skin and some missing teeth. He wears his hair in a bun, and as an inhabitant of Wano, he wears a kimono, decorated with rhombuses.

Name: Gotti
description: "Hit Man" Gotti[5] is an assassin, a combatant in the Fire Tank Pirates,[2][3] and the husband of Charlotte Lola.[6]
appareance: Along with his crew, he is a temporary ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Whole Cake Island Arc. He is also one of the central characters in "Gang" Bege's Oh My Family Cover Page Serial.

Name: Grabar
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Grabar[2] is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit. She is Leo's grandmother.[1]
appareance: Grabar is an average-sized stout female dwarf with a wrinkled face, raised cheekbones, and a light colored tail. She has light colored hair tied back into two bun-like ponytails. She wears a light colored sleeveless shirt, dark colored pants, a dark colored belt, a dark colored hair band, dark glasses, and has a tattoo on her right arm.[1]

Name: Gram
Note: Her name revealed in Color Walk 4.
description: Gram[2] was one of the archaeologists of Ohara.[1]
appareance: Gram was a young average sized girl, with short blond hair under a purple cap. She wore a coat that matched her hat, with a light blue shirt underneath that was darker blue at the collar, and had four white buttons.[1]

Name: Great Michael
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Great Michael[2] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: A portrait of Great Michael.

Name: Guernika
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1053, although his identity was not clear until SBS Volume 104.
description: Guernika[3][2] was a masked agent of CP0.[1] While in Wano Country for negotiations with Shogun Kurozumi Orochi,[4] Guernika played a crucial role in the Raid on Onigashima. On the World Government's order, he interfered in the duel between Kaidou and Monkey D. Luffy, resulting in the latter's temporary loss,[5] for which he was murdered by Kaidou as punishment.[6]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he was a supporting antagonist during the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Guillotine
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1108.
description: Guillotine[3] is a Marine Vice Admiral and one of the nine that took part in the Egghead Incident.[1]
appareance: He serves as a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: Gurutaro
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Gurutaro[3] is a samurai who was part of the Mimawarigumi 41 years ago.[2] He was also a retainer of the Kouzuki Family.[1]
appareance: Gurutaro is a thin man of significant height, reaching up to the nearly thirteen-feet Oden's shoulders. He has long, brown hair that he keeps in a ponytail, and wears a dark yukata with a leaf design and the white coat typical of Mimawarigumi members.

Name: Gyaro
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook. He is formally introduced in Chapter 492.
description: Gyaro is a member of the Macro Pirates. He is a pop-eyed goldfish fish-man. He was also a member of the Sun Pirates, before its disbanding.[2]
appareance: Gyaro as a member of the Sun Pirates.

Name: Gyogyo
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1097.
description: Gyogyo[4] is a member of the Bonney Pirates. He was once a resident of the Sorbet Kingdom, having been a friend of Bartholomew Kuma and Ginny since childhood.
appareance: After the Summit War of Marineford, he was arrested by Admiral Akainu following his crew's defeat against the Blackbeard Pirates.

Name: Gyoro
description: Gyoro, Nin, and Bao were a trio of oddly shaped Soldier Zombies that were first seen reporting to Moria about the Straw Hats' arrival.[1]
appareance: They are relatively small Soldier Zombies and they are all roughly the same size as Chopper when he is when using his Brain Point. Gyoro is the zombie that looks like a one-eyed samurai with an ovular head. Nin is the pinkish-red zombie archer with a triangular head. Bao is the yellow zombie that looks like some sort of super hero with a bucket shaped head.[2]

Name: Gyoru
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Gyoru[4] is a fishmonger in Foosha Village and the husband of Chicken. Luffy bought fish from him when he was a kid.[1]
appareance: Gyoru is an average sized middle aged man with black hair, a widow's peak, and a spiky tuft of hair on the top of his head. He has small round eyes, thick eyebrows, and stubble on his chin. He has always been seen sporting a large smile. He wears a yellow shirt with a black apron over it and a pink rope tied around his head. 12 years ago, he lacked stubble.[1]

Name: Gyro
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 611.
description: Crab-Hand Gyro is the captain of the Gyro Pirates from South Blue that was on its way to the New World before an unfortunate meeting with the New Fish-Man Pirates.[1]
appareance: Gyro is a skinny man of average height with a child-like, oval face, and a square nose. He has two red distinctive spots on his cheeks, dark hair, beard and mustache, he's missing a tooth and has what appears to be a massive four leaf clover on top of his head. He also has well-developed pectorals and abdominal muscles.[1]

Name: Hack
description: "Hundredth Dan" Hack is a Japanese soldierfish fish-man[7] and a member of the Revolutionary Army, which he serves as combat instructor. He went to Dressrosa to investigate the arms trafficking there[3] and competed at the Corrida Colosseum for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: Hack is a fish-man with yellow skin that has brown spots on the upper part of his head, along with scales under his eyelids, sharp teeth, and gills on the sides of his neck.
