The fish-man has a muscular stature, with long light blue flowing hair and a thick blue mustache. Similar to Kuroobi, he wears an open gi with a black belt.

Name: Hack
Note: His name revealed in Color Walk 4.
appareance: Hack[3] was one of the archaeologists of Ohara.[2]

Name: Hajrudin
Note: He was first mentioned by Maynard in Chapter 705.
description: Hajrudin[1] is a giant warrior described as being from the "new generation" of Elbaph.[7] He is the illegitimate son of the late King Harald and his lover Ida, as well as the older half-brother of Prince Loki.[8][9]
appareance: A century after the Giant Warrior Pirates' disbandment, Hajrudin formed the New Giant Warrior Pirates in an attempt to revive the legendary crew;[10] they formerly served as S-class pirate mercenaries for Buggy's Pirate Dispatch Organization.[2] Hajrudin competed in the Corrida Colosseum on Dressrosa, where he would team up with Monkey D. Luffy and the Straw Hat Pirates to overthrow Donquixote Doflamingo's regime. Following this, Hajrudin swore his crew's allegiance to Luffy and became the captain of the sixth ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[3]

Name: Hakowan
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Hakowan[2] is Wapol's pet dog, acquired after Wapol was permanently deposed from Drum Island.
appareance: Hakowan before Wapol altered him.

Name: Hakugan
Note: His name was revealed by Trafalgar D. Water Law in Chapter 1064.
description: Hakugan[4] is the helmsman of the Heart Pirates.
appareance: Hakugan is an average-sized man with light brown hair. He covers his face with a white mask featuring a smile design, and like most members of the Heart Pirates, he wears a white boiler suit with the crew's jolly roger on the left breast.

Name: Ham Burger
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 905.
description: Ham Burger is the king of the Ballywood Kingdom, acting as chairman of the most recent Levely.[2]
appareance: Ham Burger is a stern-looking older man with prominent cheekbones, a pointy pink nose, and a square jaw. He has bushy black hair and beard.

Name: Hamburg
description: Hamburg is a combatant of the Foxy Pirates and also the leader of the Groggy Monsters.[3] Along with Porche, he was one of Foxy's first crewmates.[4]
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the Long Ring Long Land Arc.

Name: Hamlet
description: Hamlet is a Shinuchi in the Beasts Pirates.[1] During the raid on Onigashima, he was tamed by the power of the Kibi Kibi no Mi and joined the side of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[3]
appareance: Hamlet's outfit during the post-raid festival.

Name: Hammond
description: Hammond is a member of the New Fish-Man Pirates. He is a Daggertooth pike conger Fish-Man.[2]
appareance: He serves as a supporting antagonist in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

Name: Han
description: Han-ko is a child from Ebisu Town.[1]
appareance: Han is a small child with a round head, small eyes, a small round nose, and dark colored hair with a top knot. He is missing a front tooth, and he has snot dripping out of his nose.

Name: Hana
description: O-Hana[2] is a citizen of Wano Country, residing in the Flower Capital.[1]
appareance: Hana in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Hanafuda
Note: He was first alluded to in Chapter 1100 and named in SBS Volume 109.
description: Hanafuda, also known as the "King of Lizards", was a former Warlord of the Sea and affiliate of the Beasts Pirates who was defeated by Portgas D. Ace four years ago. Following his expulsion and eventual death at the hands of rival pirates, his Warlord position was given to Bartholomew Kuma.[1][3] He was also the father of Ulti and Page One.[4][5]
appareance: Hanafuda was an extremely tall and muscular man. He had thick light-colored hair, partly coming out from under a dark, pointed hat that covers most of his face. He wears a long, knee-length, dark jacket with several buttons and extremely prominent shoulder pads in the shape of raised elbows, which is unbuttoned and exposes his chest. He wore metal gloves on both hands, a belt that crosses his chest diagonally, light-colored trousers with irregular rectangular patterns with a wide metal belt over a fur-lined belt, and tall dark boots.

Name: Hangan
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Hangan[2] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Sketch of Hangan.

Name: Hanger
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Hanger is an employee at Robecca Hanberg, a clothing store in Loguetown. Nami tried on all of his best clothes, but did not buy any.[1]
appareance: Hanger in Set Sail Pirate Crew!.

Name: Hanji
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Hanji[2] is a resident of Wano Country who has been running a pawn shop for over 10 years.[1]
appareance:
Hanji is a portly man with a thick neck, drooping eyes, a large mouth, and a thin mustache. He has chin-length brown hair that curls outward on the sides, and he has a topknot.
Hanji wears a teal kimono with green rippled patterning, and a burgundy coat.[1]

Name: Hanji
Note: His name was revealed in the captions of Episode 947.
description: Hanji is a former prisoner of Udon's Prisoner Mine.[2]
appareance: Hanji is a middle-aged man with tanned skin and a scar over his left eye. He has lavender-colored hair and is mostly bold at the top apart from a orange flame-like mohawk. At Udon, he wears the standard prisoner outfit.

Name: Hannyabal
description: Hannyabal[4] is the warden of Impel Down. Formerly the Vice Warden,[3] he was promoted to Magellan's position following the mass breakout.[2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Impel Down Arc.

Name: Hanzo
Note: His name was revealed by Shinobu in Chapter 933.
description: Hanzo[6] is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates.[2] He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Happa Yamao
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 76.
description: Happa Yamao[1] is a civilian of Water 7 whom Usopp bought wood and supplies from in order to repair the Going Merry. He is an old bandit turned carpenter who moved to Water 7 from the "Gourmet City", Pucci.[2]
appareance: A full body view of Happa.

Name: Happygun
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Happygun[2] is an infamous New World pirate who was subordinate to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Happygun is a tall man with long black hair, a long pointed nose, and a triple pointed chin. He wears a purple coat with pink inner edges that exposes his chest.

Name: Hara
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Hara[2] is a resident who lives in the Flower Capital of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Hara is a stocky man with a double chin and lumps under and above his eyes. He has long, curly brown hair which is tied in a topknot but loose on the sides. He wears light green kimono with yellow dots and light blue line patterns, as well as a gray cape with green leaf patterns.[1]

Name: Harald
Note: He was first mentioned in Chapter 1130.
description: Harald was the most recent king of Elbaph and the father of Hajrudin and Loki. He was murdered 14 years ago, allegedly by his son Loki.[2][4]
appareance: Harald was a broad-shouldered giant who sported jagged eyebrows and a curved double-line tattoo framing his left temple. Due to his lineage as a descendant of ancient giants, Harald was taller than most modern giants and was born with a pair of horns poking from his head.

Name: Haredas
Note: His name was revealed in Episode 418 credits. He is formally introduced in the manga in Chapter 592.
description: Haredas is an old man who lives in Weatheria.[1] He was Nami's tutor in weather-manipulation during the timeskip.
appareance: Haredas is an old man who has a long, white beard and long, straight hair of the same color, that fall on his back. He wears a blue pointed hat that matches his wizard-like robe, which stretches down to his feet. In the manga, he is fairly tall, whereas in the anime, he is rather short. Sometimes, Haredas' eyes are shown large and shining, much like Nyon's when she admires Hancock's cuteness.[1]

Name: Hareji
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Hareji[4] is a former prisoner of Udon's prisoner mines.[1] In the past, he was a resident of the Flower Capital.[3] In the anime credits and closed captions, he was named Tetsu (テツ?).[5]
appareance: Hareji is a man of average height with a crescent-shaped scar on the left side of his face. He has turquoise hair formed in a pompadour at the front and a topknot at the back. At Udon, he wore a standard prisoner outfit.[1]

Name: Haritsu Kendiyo
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Haritsu Kendiyo[2] is a pirate captain whose crew was captured by the Kid Pirates as they tried to escape back to Paradise from the New World.[1]
appareance: Kendiyo is a large man, bigger than Kid, and slightly fat as well. He has bushy brown hair and a scraggly beard, and wore a red captain's coat over a white shirt and brown pants. He has a sword over his back.

Name: Haruta
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 58.
description: Haruta[4] is the former 12th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: Haruta's concept art from the anime.

Name: Hasami
Note: His name was revealed by Nami in Chapter 180.
description: Hasami is a giant desert crab from Sandy Island, and a friend of Matsuge the camel.[1] Originally an inhabitant of the deserts near Rainbase, he currently works as an employee of Ukkari Hot-Spring Island.
appareance: He serves as an ally to the Straw Hat Pirates during the Arabasta Arc.

Name: Hatcha
Note: He first appeared as a silhouette in Chapter 980.
description: Hatcha is a member of the Numbers in the Beasts Pirates, representing the number "eight".[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Hatchan
Note: Also known by his nickname "Hachi".
description: Hatchan,[7] nicknamed "Hachi" (ハチ, Hachi?), is an octopus fish-man who was an officer of the Arlong Pirates before their defeat,[1] and a member of the Sun Pirates before that.[3]
appareance: After the rest of the Arlong Pirates were arrested, Hatchan was the sole member to escape,[8] and went on many adventures which ended in him opening a floating takoyaki restaurant[2] and meeting up again with the Straw Hat Pirates.

Name: Hatsume
Note: Her real name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Hatsume[3] is a samurai and member of the Beasts Pirates. She was formerly a member of the Mimawarigumi serving Kurozumi Orochi until Orochi's seeming death.[1][2]
appareance: Hatsume's concept art from the Anime.

Name: Hattori
description: Hattori is Rob Lucci's pet pigeon, and initially acted as the target of his ventriloquism.[1][3]
appareance: Hattori is a white pigeon and is always seen wearing a light red tie while Lucci was undercover as a shipwright and a black one afterwards.[1][3] He wore a light green coat identical to his master's while Lucci wore his during the Sea Train ride to Enies Lobby and the meeting at the Tower of Justice.[6]

Name: Hawkman
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Hawkman[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Hawkman is a man of average size. Due to the SMILE that he consumed, a large green hawk is present on the back of his body, acting as a sort of hood over his head, and possessing large wings. Unlike other Gifters, he does not possess a pair of horns. He wears a blue-green fur coat over his shoulders, red pants, brown boots, and a belt bearing the symbol of the Beasts Pirates.[1]

Name: Heat
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook
description: Heat[4] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Heat has long light blue, shaggy hair. His mouth stretches to the sides of his face like a Glasgow smile. He has black sunken eyes and visible bone ridges on his forehead. There are stitched scars at his chin, mouth-line, and the high point of his cheeks. Tattoos resembling barbed wire run along his shoulders, arms, and neck.

Name: Helmeppo
description: Lieutenant Commander Helmeppo[6] is a Marine officer and the son of ex-Marine Captain "Axe-Hand" Morgan. Once a civilian who shamelessly exploited his father's status,[1] he (together with Koby) underwent extensive training under Vice Admiral Garp[8] to become a full-fledged serviceman,[9] currently holding the rank of lieutenant commander.[2] He is also a member of the secret group known as SWORD.[10]
appareance: Due to his actions during his initial appearance, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Romance Dawn Arc. He and Koby are also the protagonists of Diary of Koby-Meppo Cover Page Serial.

Name: Heppoko
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Heppoko[3][4] is a member of the Alvida Pirates and the triplet brother of Peppoko and Poppoko.[2]
appareance: Heppoko is a tanned skinned man, with a large forehead and short black hair. He also has a black mustache and goatee. He wears a green short sleeved shirt.

Name: Hera
Note: His name was written on his back along with his participant number.
description: Hera is a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum that competed for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: Hera is a tall man with thick muscles. He is bare-chested and barefoot. He wears a spiked ridge helmet, studded wristbands, and a dark paludamentum. The back of his paludamentum bears his name and participant number. He also carries a longsword.

Name: Hera
description: Hera the Thundercloud is a thundercloud homie created by Big Mom at Wano Country as a replacement for Zeus. She is a special kind of homie, having received a soul fragment from Big Mom herself,[1] and serves as one of her personal weapons, alongside Prometheus and Napoleon.
appareance: Hera typically takes the form of a small, puffy yellowish cloud. She possesses a notably long and pointy nose, as well as pronounced eyelashes, lips, and blush marks on her cheeks. She possesses long strands on her head resembling hair, and her "hairdo" is parted toward the right side of her face and covers her right eye.

Name: Heracles
description: Heracles is a strange warrior that used to reside in the Greenstone forest in the Boin Archipelago. He trained Usopp in the use of Pop Greens for two years.[1]
appareance: Heracles is dressed in a beetle-stylized armor that looks like a hero costume with a mask that covers his face, a mantle, and a purple cape. He has a round-shaped body with relatively thin arms and legs.[1]

Name: Herb
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Herb[2] was a Shandia from 400 years ago. She was Kalgara's wife and Mousse's mother.[1]
appareance: She was an average sized woman, with black hair tied in a bun in the back, with decorative feathers in it and two strands hanging down. She wore a grey shirt, with white frills at the bottom, and a long reddish brown skirt that went to her ankles. Over her shirt she wore a small dark red coat, with no sleeves draped over her shoulders and buttoned with one button, and white fringe on the button.[1]

Name: Hewitt
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Hewitt was the chef of the Bellamy Pirates.[2]
appareance: He wears a blue coat and has tan skin. His hair is black and has an angry expression. He also has the number "21" tattooed on the right side of his forehead.

Name: Hibari
description: Hibari is a Marine Commander and a member of SWORD.[1]
appareance: Hibari is a young woman of regular stature. She has blonde hair with bangs  worn in a ponytail. Her Marine uniform consists of a white military pocketed shirt that exposes her midriff, green gloves, orange military boots and sea foam green camo pants with a tri-colored cloud pattern of blue, white, and turquoise, with the latter's right side ripped to reveal yellow and orange striped leggings. She also wears pink headphones with blue stripes over her ears, a black belt with pink heart-shaped buckles around her torso, and a brown backpack with a blue hanging teddy bear called "Kopy-senpai" (コピー先輩, Kopī-senpai?, VIZ: "Mr. Kopy").[1][4]

Name: Hidayu
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Hidayu is a samurai who allied with the Kouzuki Family.[3] After waiting 20 years for the return of the Nine Red Scabbards, he affiliated with the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance to raid Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Hidayu is a stocky, tan-skinned man with navy blue hair that is shaved, a slight widow's peak, and think eyebrows, a mustache and goatee that look like kumadori makeup. He wears a brown kimono with an orange circular pattern on it. He sometimes wears a white scarf over his head or a light-colored cloak with a zig-zag pattern on the sleeves.[1][4] He has a reverse crescent moon tattoo on his ankle.[3]

Name: Higuma
description: Higuma was a bandit and the leader of the Higuma Bandits (ヒグマ山賊団, Higuma Sanzoku-dan?), active in the mountains of Dawn Island.[2] He was the first antagonist to be introduced in the series, and the first of three in the Romance Dawn Arc (third of three in the anime).[1][6]
appareance: Higuma was a tall, well-tanned man with black hair, a black goatee, and an X-shaped scar above his right eye. He wore a long red coat over a white shirt, black trousers, and a golden necklace.[1]

Name: Hihimaru
Note: Its name was revealed/given in Chapter 911.
description: Hihimaru is a baboon that was formerly a guard for the Beasts Pirates before being tamed by Tama.[2]
appareance: Hihimaru's anime concept art.

Name: Hikkomitsukumai
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Hikkomitsukumai[3] is a retainer of the Kurozumi Family[2] and a prison guard who lives in the Flower Capital of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Hikkomitsukumai is an averaged sized man. He has a somewhat flat face, with long, blond hair, tied up in a topknot. He wears a light blue kimono with a patterned cloak over his shoulders.[1]

Name: Hikoichi
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.

Name: Hildon
description: Hildon was a Wild Zombie that resembled a stitched-up vampire.[1] He appeared to act as a messenger in-between the members of Thriller Bark's Mysterious Four, reporting to them noteworthy events that were happening throughout the island ship before it fell.[2]
appareance: Hildon's concept art from the anime.

Name: Hilmungardr
description: Hilmungardr is a giant serpent that lives in the Land of Gods.[1]
appareance: Hilmungardr is a massive serpent, larger than most normal people, with dark stripes along its back. It wears a shiny helmet atop its head.[1]

Name: Himuro
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Himuro[3] is a samurai and a member of the Beasts Pirates.[2] He was previously a member of the Mimawarigumi, which served as the police force of the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Hina
description: "Black Cage" Hina is a Marine Rear Admiral and a former classmate of Vice Admiral Smoker.[4] She currently leads the Black Cage Corps, a unit (containing Jango and Fullbody[8][9] among others) tasked with patrolling the seas around the Arabasta Kingdom.
appareance: Originally introduced as a captain, she was promoted to the rank of rear admiral some time after the Summit War of Marineford.[3]

Name: Hinokizu
Note: Mentioned only character. He was first mentioned by Eustass Kid in Chapter 1056.
description: Hinokizu is the name given to a mysterious man possessing a burn scar. He is rumored to possess the Road Poneglyph which was once on Fish-Man Island and whose location is now unknown. He is said to sail on an all-black ship.[2]
appareance: Hinokizu has yet to make a confirmed appearance. It is only known that he possesses a burn scar somewhere on his body, from which he received his name.[1]

Name: Hip
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Hip[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Hip is a woman with short light colored hair. She wears a short sleeved dark shirt and a light tank top with some writing on it.

Name: Hippan Natte
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Hippan Natte[2] is a Waiter of the Beasts Pirates who serves as a guard in the Prisoner Mine of the Udon region.
appareance: Natte is a shorter man, with an average build. He has dark hair fashioned like the horns of a bull, and goggles that he wears on his forehead. He wears an open purple shirt that leaves his chest exposed along with a set of gray pauldrons on his shoulders, as well as a pair of blue pants.[1]

Name: Hippie
Note: He originally appeared in Weekly Shonen Jump 2000 Issue 8, and was canonized in Chapter 1122.
description: Hippie the Skull Curry is the captain of the Endurance Curry Pirates.[1]
appareance: Hippie is a man with a light hair and a full beard connected to his sideburns. He wears a top hat with a skull attached to the front and a scarf wrapped around the crown. He also wears striped pants, a belt, a sailor tie and a captain's coat with no shirt.

Name: Hippo Gentleman
Note: His name was revealed by Perona in Chapter 466.
description: Hippo Gentleman was a Wild Zombie who worked under Perona.[1] He was the vice commander of the Wild Zombies.[2]
appareance: Hippo Gentleman's outfit in the Boss Luffy Historical Arc.

Name: Hiramera
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 65.
description: Hiramera is an olive flounder mermaid and a dancer in the Mermaid Café.[2][1]
appareance: Hiramera's color scheme in the manga.

Name: Hiriluk
description: Dr. Hiriluk[3] was a quack doctor from Drum Island, as well as Tony Tony Chopper's father figure.[4] He was also a former thief.[5]
appareance: He died seven years ago by drinking an explosive formula—a form of preemptive suicide, as his life was already curtailed by both disease and external threats.

Name: Hiro Gomon
Note: He originally appeared in Weekly Shonen Jump 2000 Issue 8, and was canonized in Chapter 1122.
description: Hiro Gomon is a member of the Endurance Curry Pirates.[1]
appareance: Gomon is a man with a thin dark mustache and round eyeglasses. He wears dark baggy pants, an iron helmet and iron cape, bracelets, and shoes made from iron strips.[2]

Name: Hiroshi
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Hiroshi[2] is a resident of Bakura Town in Wano Country who runs a restaurant alongside Wakasa; the two of them own a tanuki named Saikoro which the sumo wrestler Urashima forced to be cooked and served to him.[1]
appareance: Hiroshi is an older man with dark gray hair that is gathered into a topknot. He wears a vertically-striped gray and dark green kimono.[1]

Name: Hitsugisukan
Note: His name and full appearance were revealed in Chapter 967.
description: Duke Hitsugisukan is a sheep mink and the former ruler of the Mokomo Dukedom before Inuarashi and Nekomamushi.[2]
appareance: Hitsugisukan's concept art from the anime.

Name: Ho
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Dr. Ho[3] is the palace medic of Arabasta's royal family. He seems to hold Drum medicine in high regard.[2]
appareance: Dr. Ho is a rather aged man, who wears a long cyan robe which covers most of his body, as well as a lilac scarf/cloak. He also wears a tall circular hat, similar to a fez, although instead of tapering into the conventional fez shape, it seems to expand in a shape similar to the center of an hourglass. He has white facial hair, which takes the form of a medium-length full beard starting below his nose carrying on past his chin. He has full lips, which are shown through his beard. He also wears circular glasses similar to those worn by Kuro.[2]

Name: Hocha
Note: His name was revealed in Color Walk 4.
description: Hocha[2] was one of the archaeologists of Ohara.[1]
appareance: Hocha was a tall man, with small eyes and a large nose. He had long black hair, and wore a blue jacket with a black shirt underneath.

Name: Hocker
Note: Name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Hocker[3] was the owner of the Pet Food Shop in Orange Town and the owner of Chouchou.
appareance: Hocker was an elderly man with a moderately wrinkled face, short purple hair, and beard. He wore a light red shirt, white pants, normal brown shoes, and a red wool cap. He is depicted as skinny and tall in the anime, but in the manga, he is depicted as short and chubby.

Name: Hody Jones
Note: He was officially introduced in Chapter 611.
description: Hody Jones[1] is a great white shark fish-man,[8] the captain of the New Fish-Man Pirates before their downfall,[3] and a former soldier of the Neptune Army.[4]
appareance: He is an admirer and militant believer of Arlong's ideals,[9][10] and the main antagonist of the Fish-Man Island Arc.

Name: Hoe
description: Hoe is the pet whale of King Neptune who uses him as a means of transportation. The only word he can say is his own name.
appareance: Hoe is a large dark whale with a light underbelly. He has a set of rounded teeth and round eyes. Nami described him as "cute".[1]

Name: Hogback
Note: He was first mentioned by Hildon in Chapter 444.
description: Doctor Hogback is the world-renowned "Genius Surgeon"[3] who joined the Thriller Bark Pirates under the employment of Gecko Moria[6] and assisted him in creating his undead army.[7] He was one of the Mysterious Four[2] and one of the major antagonists of the Thriller Bark Saga. He also acts as the de facto main antagonist in the anime only Great Mikoshi Race Arc.
appareance: Despite his round torso, Hogback has very thin arms and legs. His somewhat long nose resembles a beak or knife, and he has notably sharp and long canine teeth and ears. His face has a scar in the shape of a semi-circle that goes above his eyes and connects both corners of his mouth, which is usually grinning widely, and he keeps his black hair slicked back. On the left side of his neck is a black tattoo consisting of two slashes connected to two swirls lying side-by-side on his shoulder. Hogback wears a fishnet vest, purple leather pants, a thick black tie, and a pair of purple gloves, which cover his long, claw-like fingers. He also wears a white surgical mask under his chin, a pair of very small black gold-rimmed sunglasses, a violet feathery cape that is black on the inside,[8] and a pair of purple high-heeled boots.[1]

Name: Hoichael
Note: He was first mentioned by Tilestone in Chapter 366.
description: Michael and Hoichael are two troublemaker children in the backstreets of Water 7. They idolize Franky, and even dress like him and use his motto as their own: "Mm, super!!", and similarly idolize Paulie.[4] However, their backstreet delinquency has earned them ire from at least Tilestone and Peepley Lulu.[5] Before the timeskip, they were part of class 6-5 of the Water 7 Back Alley Elementary School (ウォーターセブン裏町小学校, Wōtā Sebun Uramachi Shōgakkō?, VIZ: "Water Seven Back Alley Elementary School") backstreet elementary school.[4]
appareance: Michael has short spiky hair. He wears a red vest with a green pattern that looks like grass. He also wears a yellow shirt underneath that has his name and a white circle. The middle of the circle has red and white.[4]

Name: Hoisassa
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Hoisassa[2] is a retainer of the Kurozumi Family.
appareance: Hoisassa is an average-sized man with a human upper-body and a horse lower-body. He has brown hair tied in a topknot, with a prominent widows peak. He wears a white kimono with the Kurozumi Family crest sewn into the sides.[1]

Name: Holed'em
Note: He was first mentioned by Gazelleman in Chapter 914.
description: Holed'em[3] is a Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates, who resides in Bakura Town.[2] He is the son of Norinosuke, a Wano Country citizen.[4]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc and a minor antagonist in the Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage cover story.

Name: Holy
Note: His name was revealed by Ohm in Chapter 251.
description: Holy is a dog raised and trained by Ohm. In addition to being Ohm's pet, he is a skilled martial artist in his own right.[1][3]
appareance: Holy is a pale-furred dog somewhat similar to Chouchou in overall appearance, though much larger (enough to comfortably carry an average-sized man on his head). He has a black nose, and is usually seen with tongue hanging out.

Name: Home
Note: Its name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Home[2] is a bull that acted as a steed for Ashura Doji.[1]
appareance: Home is an extremely large bluish-black bull with a bushy blue tail. It has a cloth with the Mt. Atama Thieves symbol tied around its neck with a red rope, as well as a piece of green fabric and a seat for Ashura Doji on its back.[1]

Name: Hongo
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 101.
description: Hongo[4] is the one of the Senior Officers and the doctor[3] of the Red Hair Pirates.[1]
appareance: Hongo is a lean man with dirty blonde hair, which is tied up into a small ponytail. He has a stitched scar on the left side of his forehead.[2] His outfit consists of an open coat showing his torso.

Name: Honner
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Atsuki Tani (Episode of Skypiea)
appareance: Dr. Honner[2] was the doctor aboard Mont Blanc Noland's expedition fleet 400 years ago.[1]

Name: Hop
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Hop[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Hop is a woman with long light colored hair tied in a high ponytail. She wears an open dark jacket and a skirt.

Name: Horseman
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Horseman[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates and an attendant of Bao Huang.[1]
appareance: Horseman is an average-sized man with tanned skin and a visible abdominal muscle. Due to his SMILE ability, his head is that of a white horse with a gray mane. On his head, he wears a metal helmet with a yellow crest. He also wears a black leather vest, a fur coat, dark green pants, light brown gloves, and dark brown boots.[1]

Name: Hotei
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 986.
description: Hotei is the former captain of the Mimawarigumi, a samurai police force in Wano Country that served the shogun Kurozumi Orochi until he was deposed by Kaidou.[2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Hotori
description: Hotori and Kotori are the younger brothers of Satori. They are lieutenants of the Divine Soldiers, an army of 50 warriors under the command of Yama, their leader, and Enel.[1] They are minor antagonists during the Skypiea Arc.
appareance: Hotori and Kotori are twin brothers that look and dress exactly the same, and have some similarities to their older brother, Satori. They have bodies shaped like giant balls, and they wear white jumpsuits, with a white sash. They wear orange shoes and orange gloves. They also have yellow sunglasses that cover up their eyes completely. Behind them, they wear magenta ribbons, and on their heads they are bald. As part of Divine Soldiers they have goat-like noses, ears, and horns. They also have the same wings as all Birkans.

Name: Hototogisu
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 108.
description: Hototogisu[2] is a Marine Vice Admiral and a subordinate of Vice Admiral Tsuru.[1]
appareance: Hototogisu is a regular-sized, young woman with light hair. Like many Marines, she wears her high-collared sailing coat draped over her shoulders. She also wears a bucket hat with the Marine logo engraved on it and a loose tie with her spotted shirt.

Name: Hound
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1108.
description: Hound[3] is a Marine Vice Admiral and one of the nine that took part in the Egghead Incident.[1]
appareance: He serves as a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: House
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: House[3] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: House is a woman with wild hair, with some of it arranged in the shape of a small pair of horns above her head. She wears a leather jacket over a knee-length dress, which sports a cross design printed on its front.[1]

Name: Hublot
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Hublot[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Concept art of Hublot.

Name: Humphrey
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Humphrey[2] is a bartender at Sabaody Archipelago.
appareance: Humphrey is a large man with fuzzy black hair (with a bald spot in the front) and sideburns. He wears a white shirt that is unbuttoned.

Name: Hustle
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Hustle is a member of the Krieg Pirates and a combat instructor.[2]
appareance: Hustle in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Hyota
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: The Tsumegeri Guards were four men who drank the Hero Water and attempted to take down Crocodile, but failed and died from the water's side effects shortly after Crocodile refused to even fight them to give them an honorable death.[1]
appareance: The Tsumegeri Guards wore the armor similar to the regular Arabasta Royal Guards but with the addition of a turban with a duck headband and wings on each sides. They wear what appears to be war paint, with one line that goes down to the nose as their common mark.[1]

Name: Hyougoro
Note: His full name was revealed in Chapter 934.
description: Hyougoro of the Flower[7][8] is the former yakuza boss of the Flower Capital and the most famous yakuza in Wano Country during the Kouzuki Family's reign.[3] During Kurozumi Orochi's reign, he was imprisoned in Udon's prisoner mines until he was freed by Monkey D. Luffy. As a prisoner, he was known as Grandpa Hyo (ヒョウじい, Hyō-jii?).[1]
appareance: Hyougoro is a small, elderly man with a cyan tuft of hair and goatee that resemble small flames. He has a blue tattoo covering his shoulders and upper back that resembles a vest with pink flower patterns and a border.

Name: Hyoutauros
Note: His name is mentioned by Luffy in Episode 582.
description: Hyoutauros[3] is a jaguar centaur and member of the Centaur Patrol Unit on Punk Hazard.[1]
appareance: Hyoutauros' face up close.

Name: Hyouzou
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 610.
description: Hyouzou[7] is a poisonous blue-ringed octopus merman. Prior to his imprisonment, he was a mercenary[3] and working as the New Fish-Man Pirates' assassin,[2] and later became one of the officers. Hyouzou was also known as the best swordsman on Fish-Man Island.[4]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is considered to be a major antagonist in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

Name: Ibiributsu
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Ibiributsu[2] is a Waiter of the Beasts Pirates who serves as a guard in the Prisoner Mine of the Udon region of Wano Country. He is in charge of exchanging meal tickets for kibi dango.[1]
appareance: Ibiributsu is a stocky man with thick eyebrows, a prominent nose and a short beard. He wears a spiked leather hat resembling an aviator hat, spiked shoulder guards lined with fur, and dark belted pants.[1]

Name: Ibusu
description: Ibusu is a supposed pirate captain who affiliates and trades with the Donquixote Pirates.[1] As his ship is later discovered to be a trading vessel for the Doerena Kingdom, it is unknown if he is truly a pirate captain.[2]
appareance: Ibusu is a short man with a long, unkempt beard and thick lips. He wears a pirate captain's jacket and hat with his crew's jolly roger—a standard skull with crossbones—on it and a white, frilled shirt underneath.

Name: Iceburg
description: Iceburg[7] is the president of the Galley-La Company and the mayor of Water 7.[2][3]
appareance: He was formerly one of Tom's Workers, being one of Tom's two apprentices alongside Franky. He is a central character for the Water 7 Arc and the Water 7 Saga as a whole, due to being the original inheritor of the Pluton blueprints given to him by Tom which CP9 sought after.

Name: Ichika
description: The Medaka Mermaid Quintuplets are five young Japanese rice fish mermaids who are friends with Camie. Their names are Ichika (イチカ?), Nika (ニカ?), Sanka (サンカ?), Yonka (ヨンカ?), and Yonka Two (ヨンカツー, Yonka Tsū?).[1]
appareance: The Quintuplets' size in comparison to Camie.

Name: Ida
description: Ida is a giant hailing from Samuwanai Island in the South Blue who once worked at a circus in the Bunt Kingdom. She was a lover of King Harald of Elbaph, and the mother of his firstborn, Hajrudin.[1]
appareance: Ida was a slender giant woman with average facial features, including freckles, full lips and a well-defined round nose. She had long, light-colored hair with a messy cowlick at the front, curly side locks and tied in a ponytail at the back.

Name: Ideaman
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Ideaman is a member of Krieg Pirates. He is the Staff Officer of Planning.[2]
appareance: Ideaman is an average-sized man, with tan skin and purple hair that juts out of his head, with a tiny oil lamp at the end, similar to an anglerfish's lure. He wears an orange and black striped shirt.[1]

Name: Ideo
description: "Destruction Cannon" Ideo[9] is an XXX-rank boxer[6] and a member of the Longarm Tribe,[10] as well as the captain of the Ideo Pirates[4] and of the fourth ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[3] He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi,[1] where he met three other gladiators with whom he would form the then-XXX Gym Martial Arts Alliance,[3] as well as Monkey D. Luffy, to whom he eventually pledged his loyalty.[5]
appareance: He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc, and one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.

Name: Igaram
Note: His real name was revealed introduced by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 110.
description: Igaram[4] is the captain of the Arabasta royal guard (captain of Arabasta security in the English dub).[2] He aided Nefertari Vivi in infiltrating Baroque Works as a Frontier Agent and took on the codename Mr. 8.[3] He was partnered with Miss Monday.[3] He is also Terracotta's husband.[6] He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Whisky Peak (after being a minor antagonist) and Arabasta Arcs.
appareance: Igaram is a tall man with a small red nose and has blond hair in a style that resembles a powdered Wig.[1]

Name: Ikaros Much
description: Ikaros Much[4] is a giant squid fish-man and was an officer of the New Fish-Man Pirates before their downfall and disbandment.
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is considered to be a major antagonist in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

Name: Ikkaku
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 83.
description: Ikkaku[2] is a member of the Heart Pirates.[1]
appareance: Ikkaku's full appearance.

Name: Ikkaku
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Ikkaku[2] is an announcer who commentates sumo matches in Bakura Town in Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Ikkaku is an average-sized man with blonde hair that is tied into a topknot and slicked upward in the front. He wears a black kimono with red leaf-like patterns on it, as well as a pair of sunglasses over his eyes.[1]

Name: Imu
Note: Their name was revealed in Chapter 908.
description: Imu is the supreme ruler of the World Government, who occupies the Empty Throne and whom even the Five Elders bow to and serve.[2]
appareance: Imu's existence has been kept an absolute secret within the government and from the world at large for centuries, to maintain the lie that there is no singular ruler of the world, until they were discovered by Sabo of the Revolutionary Army during the most recent Levely.[3] With the ambition of bringing the Great War to a decisive conclusion, Imu directed their subordinates to procure Dr. Vegapunk's invention, the Mother Flame,[4] and ordered the God's Knights to annex Elbaph in an invasion that Imu personally participated in.[5]

Name: Inazuma
Note: He reveals his name in Chapter 537.
description: Inazuma[5] is a newkama and the deputy commander of the G Army in the Revolutionary Army, serving under Emporio Ivankov as his right hand man.[6]
appareance: While Inazuma's appearance is based on current gender, Inazuma's basic appearance is the same for both genders. Inazuma has clothes and hair that is orange on one side and white on the other.[7] On top of Inazuma's forehead, there is a distinct lightning bolt shaped scar that goes over Inazuma's right eye. Usually Inazuma is seen with a glass of wine being held in his left hand, and sporting a particular pose, even while fighting, and even continues to hold the wine glass while using his Devil Fruit ability.

Name: Inbi
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1030.
description: Inbi is a member of the Numbers in the Beasts Pirates, representing the number "one".[2]
appareance: Like the other Numbers, Inbi is immensely tall, towering over even normal giants and being similar in size to an ancient giant.

Name: Indigo
description: Dr. Indigo is the scientist of the Golden Lion Pirates and the secondary antagonist of the tenth One Piece movie. He is the one who created Boss and the other monstrous animals under Shiki's dominion.[3]
appareance: Indigo is a very tall man with a clown-like appearance. He has indigo hair, with two particularly large tufts at the side of the head, and his face is white, with purple lines near his eyes, presumably some sort of make-up. He is pot bellied, with thin limbs, and a muscular torso, making his body resemble a volumetric flask. On his forehead, he has a pair of purple round-shaped eyeglasses. He wears a large yellow polka dotted indigo scarf and indigo-striped shoes (similar to Kuro's) that make a farting noise every time he takes a step. He also wears indigo overalls that exposes his chest, with two lines of buttons on the front, and a lab coat over them. On his hands there is a pair of brown gloves. It seems that in his twenty years, he did not change much in appearance, aside from his scarf being orange with a lined pattern, and he did not wear glasses on top of his forehead.

Name: Inhel
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Inhel[2] is a dwarf from the Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared in the Riku Royal Army Headquarters beneath the Flower Field.[1]
appareance: Inhel's color scheme in the manga.

Name: Inoichibannosuke
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Inoichibannosuke[2] is a firefighter who works for the fire department Igumi (い組?), which he claims is the best in Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Inoichibannosuke is a balding man with a tall row of black hair on top of his head resembling a mohawk, as well as hair on the sides of his head slicked toward each side. He wears a low-cut dark blue sleeveless shirt with the symbol of the Igumi on the front in red; the shirt narrows in a trapezoidal shape up toward the top and the front and back of it are held together by strings. Inoichibannosuke also wears light blue shorts lined with fur at the bottom, black leggings, and sandals.[1]

Name: Inuarashi
Note: He first appeared shadowed in Wanda's flashback in Chapter 806.
description: Duke Inuarashi is a canine mink. He was one of the two rulers of the Mokomo Dukedom,[7] dubbed the "Ruler of Day",[11] holding the position from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM.[14] He currently serves as the daimyo of Kuri.[6]
appareance: Inuarashi and Nekomamushi served as retainers for the Kouzuki Family of Wano Country,[8] as members of Kouzuki Oden's Nine Red Scabbards.[4] The pair also followed Oden as he travelled with the Whitebeard Pirates and Roger Pirates.[5] Pedro has claimed Inuarashi and Nekomamushi must not be allowed to die because "the world is waiting for them".[15]

Name: Inukai
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Inukai[2] is a Wano Country official.[1]
appareance: Inukai is a man with very thick black eyebrows and a pointy black mustache. He has long brown hair that curls on the sides and is tied in a topknot at the back. He wears a light green kimono with small green dots, and a green coat with yellow-brown circle patterns.[1]

Name: Inuppe
Note: His name was revealed in the One Piece Manga Volume 48.
description: Inuppe[3] was a Wild Zombie on Thriller Bark in the service of Gecko Moria. He was animated with Sanji's shadow[1] and eventually assigned to guard Hogback.[4]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Thriller Bark Arc.

Name: Ipponmatsu
description: Ipponmatsu[2] is the owner of an arms shop in Loguetown and Ipponume's husband. He was the former owner of both Sandai Kitetsu and Yubashiri.[1]
appareance: He is a short man with black hair that goes to the sides of his head. He has tan skin and wears a blue shirt. His nose is red.

Name: Ipponume
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Ipponume[3] is Ipponmatsu's wife.[2]
appareance: Ipponume's anime concept art.

Name: Isa
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Isa[2] is a Shandia woman and Aisa's mother.[1]
appareance: Isa is a middle-aged woman with short, brown hair. She wears a long, tan dress with a brown vest and brown shoes.[3] When she was younger, she wore a long brown dress with red dots.[1] Like all Shandia, Isa has the short wings associated with their species.

Name: Iscat
Note: Its name was revealed in Chapter 1128.
description: Iscat is a giant cat previously locked in the Land of Gods' diorama, where it ruled Bigstein Castle.[2] It is the Sun God's pet.
appareance: Iscat is a massive cat, larger than a normal person. It has a regal attire, donning a crown atop its head, and robes on its back. During its short battle with the Straw Hats, the crown was destroyed.[1]

Name: Ishigo Shitemanna
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Ishigo Shitemanna[3] is an appraiser in Water 7.[2]
appareance: Shitemanna in One Piece: Burning Will.

Name: Ishilly
Note: Her name was called out by another mermaid in Chapter 612.
description: Ishilly is a striped beakfish mermaid who lives on Fish-Man Island and was first seen in Mermaid Cove.[1] She is an employee at Mermaid Café.
appareance: Ishilly's concept art from the anime.

Name: Island Eater
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Island Eater[1] was a giant goldfish that inhabited the sea near Little Garden. He was said to be the main reason ships leaving the island never reached their destination.[4] He was classified as a Type C creature, "Big Savage".[5]
appareance: Island Eater in Unlimited Cruise.

Name: Islewan
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Islewan[3] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates,[4] before forming his own crew subordinate to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Islewan is a massive man whose face greatly resembles that of a walrus, with massive tusks and a large chin. He has black circles around his eyes and a scar under his right eye. Long blonde hair flows on the back of his neck from under his metal helmet, he wears a black and red captain's coat and long gloves almost reaching to his shoulders. He also sports an armor consisting of a barrel-like breastplate and shoulder pads, with porthole-like openings on them.

Name: Issho
Note: His alias was revealed by Sakazuki in Chapter 700. His real name was revealed in Chapter 705.
description: Issho, better known by his alias Fujitora, is an Admiral in the Marines.[3] Once the captain of a guard force in the former Aoi Kingdom,[4] he was conscripted through a World Military Draft during the two-year timeskip, being appointed to fill one of the Admiral vacancies caused by Kuzan's resignation and Sakazuki's promotion alongside his co-worker Ryokugyu.[9] A proponent of "Humane Justice", Fujitora notably spearheaded a campaign for the abolishment of the "Seven Warlords of the Sea" system,[10] which came to pass during the most recent Levely.[11]
appareance: Fujitora was first mentioned by Sakazuki when the latter was discussing plans to deal with Monkey D. Luffy and Trafalgar Law on Dressrosa.[2] His following mission and actions on Dressrosa made him the first Admiral to physically appear post-timeskip and the secondary antagonist of the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Isuka
Note: She was first introduced in One Piece novel A Volume 1.
description: "Nailing" Isuka is a Marine Ensign that confronted the Spade Pirates during their time of activity.
appareance: Isuka concept art.

Name: Itomimizu
description: Itomimizu is the former Foxy Pirates' game official and serves as the announcer and commentator of the Davy Back Fight events. He rides on a very large bird named Chuchun.
appareance: Itomimizu is a scrawny man with very distinct facial features. He has a round, pink nose, no chin and a broad mouth that makes up most of his face.

Name: Ivan X
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.

Name: Iwatobi
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Iwatobi is the king of the Whiteland Kingdom (ホワイトランド王国, Howaitorando Ōkoku?) in the North Blue[3] and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2]
appareance: Iwatobi’s second color scheme in the anime.

Name: Iyan'eno Chinode
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 107.
description: Iyan'eno Chinode is a writer for the fashion column "Streetcorner Collection" in the World Economy News Paper.[2]
appareance: Chinode's profile.

Name: Izou
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 58.
description: Izou was the former 16th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates[2] and prior to this, a retainer of the Wano Country daimyo Kouzuki Oden. He was the older brother of fellow retainer Kikunojo.[4]
appareance: He was an ally in both the Marineford and Wano Country Arcs, the latter of which he would ultimately lose his life fighting CP0 agent Maha to prevent him from chasing the Straw Hats.

Name: Jabari
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Jabari[2] is a CP6 agent.[1]
appareance: Jabari is a serious-looking man who sports sunglasses and parted light hair. As part of his job to infiltrate the World Economy News Paper, he donned Attach's clothes and a latex mask of the reporter.

Name: Jabra
description: Jabra[4] is an agent of CP0.[2] He was previously an agent of CP9,[3] being the third strongest of this agency.[7]
appareance: He was one of the major antagonists during the Enies Lobby Arc.

Name: Jack
Note: He was first mentioned by one of his subordinates in Chapter 692.
description: Jack the Drought is a giant grouper fish-man,[5] an All-Star of the Beasts Pirates as one of Kaidou's three closest confidants, and captain of the Mammoth, prior to its destruction.[2] He was formerly the ruler of Kuri region in Wano Country.[4]
appareance: He was first briefly mentioned when being notified of Caesar Clown's capture by viewers of Caesar's broadcast of the Punk Hazard incident.[9] Due to his actions and role, he is the main antagonist of the Zou Arc, and a major antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Jack-in-the-Box
Jacksonbanner
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Jacksonbanner[3] was the musician of the Roger Pirates[2] until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Jacksonbanner's concept art.

Name: Jaguar
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Jaguar[3] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Jaguar is a large muscular man with light colored hair. He wears a tank top which right side is dark colored and the right is light colored with dark circles, and an image of a panda at the center, shorts and boxing gloves.

Name: Jaguar D. Saul
description: Jaguar D. Saul is a giant and former Vice Admiral who deserted the Marines[2] and happened to wash ashore on Ohara.[1]
appareance: During the Buster Call that destroyed Ohara 22 years ago, he risked his life to protect a young Nico Robin and ended up frozen by fellow former Vice Admiral Kuzan.[8] While Robin and the World Government presumed that he had died, he had actually survived. After collecting the books that Ohara's scholars sacrificed themselves to save, he brought them to Elbaph and went into hiding,[5] after which he stayed and became a history teacher for the Walrus School, located on Elbaph's "Sun World" level.

Name: Jaki
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 989.
description: Jaki is a member of the Numbers in the Beasts Pirates, representing the number "four".[2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Jalmack
description: Saint Jalmack is a World Noble who visited the Goa Kingdom twelve years ago.[1]
appareance: He acts as a minor antagonist during the Post-War Arc, causing Sabo's long-term amnesia and apparent death.

Name: Jango
description: The subject of this article is sometimes called Django.
appareance: Jango the Turncoat is a hypnotist and Marine lieutenant commander[3] serving under Rear Admiral Hina. Formerly the first mate—and for a time captain—of the Black Cat Pirates known as "One-Two" Jango,[2][4] he enlisted in the Marines after finding an unlikely friendship with Fullbody, who helped him to secure a pardon.[10]

Name: Jarul
description: "Mountain Beard" Jarul is a giant and former co-captain of the Giant Warrior Pirates, alongside Jorul. Along with Jorul, he is known as a hero of the giants,[1] and after Jorul's death, Jarul is currently the oldest giant in the world.[2]
appareance: He has a great-great-granddaughter, Ylva, who is a student at the Walrus School.[5]

Name: Jaygarcia Saturn
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1073.
description: Saint Jaygarcia Saturn[6][7] was a World Noble and a scientist by trade.[4] Serving as one of the Five Elders who publicly head the World Government,[1] he held the title Warrior God of Science and Defense during his tenure.[3]
appareance: Living and holding the title of Elder for over two centuries, Saturn was a central figure in the Egghead Incident, where he personally led the Marine siege on Egghead with the goal of assassinating Dr. Vegapunk.[8] However, due to Saturn's failure to stop Monkey D. Luffy from escaping, Imu stripped him of his immortality, resulting in his death. His position as one of the Five Elders was granted to Figarland Garling.[9]

Name: Jean Ango
description: Jean Ango, also known as Jean the Bandit, is a bounty hunter. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: Jean Ango is a tall, bulky man with small, piercing eyes and a large nose. He wears a green cactus-looking mouth guard, and sports a large sombrero with a red and yellow pattern on the rim and a green cactus on top.

Name: Jean Bart
Note: His name was revealed by Trafalgar D. Water Law in Chapter 505.
description: Jean Bart is a pirate who was originally introduced as Saint Rosward's slave, being part of his Pirate Captain Collection.[1] He currently serves under Trafalgar Law as a member of the Heart Pirates after being freed from the World Noble.[3]
appareance: Jean Bart is a large man with a fierce looking face comparable to a guard animal. His size surpasses that of Jinbe by roughly two to three times, being able to catch and carry him easily. He has flame-shaped tattoos on his forehead and a scar running above his right eye. He often bares his teeth. He has large sideburns that line the sides of his face as well as a long mane that runs down his back.

Name: Jean Goen
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Jean Goen is a prisoner on Level 1 of Impel Down.[2]
appareance: Goen is an average size man with brown hair. He has a large z shaped scar running from his right temple, through the right eye and across the nose, a light stubble, and several missing teeth. As all Impel Down prisoners, he wears a black and white stripped shirt and pants, which are ragged and torn. He also has chained cuffs on his wrists.[2]

Name: Jean Noueilles
Note: Introduced as "Captain Porcupinefish" in Chapter 635. His real name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Jean Noueilles,[3] also known as Captain Porcupinefish,[4] is a porcupinefish fish-man and a member of the now disbanded New Fish-Man Pirates. He was the commander of the Sea Urchin Armor Spine Squad.[2]
appareance: In the anime, he is named "Harisenbon" (ハリセンボン, Harisenbon?), based on his "Captain Porcupinefish" alias.

Name: Jeep
Note: Her name was revealed in the captions of Episode 889.
description: Jeep[2] is the king of the South Fire Kingdom (南ファイアー王国, Minami Faiā Ōkoku?)  and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely. He is also the father of Wheel.[1][2]
appareance: Jeep’s second color scheme in the anime.

Name: Jeet
description: Jeet[5] is a criminal and a former bounty hunter who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi, along with his partner, Abdullah.[1] He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc. After the battle with the Donquixote Pirates at Dressrosa, he joined the XXX Gym Martial Arts Alliance, which later converted to a pirate crew called the Ideo Pirates.[3][2]
appareance: Jeet has a scar down the left side of his face. He has dark hair under a light-colored turban. He also wears a pinstriped shirt and a dark beaded necklace. He is usually seen licking his sword with a bloodthirsty smile.

Name: Jerry
description: Jerry is a Cipher Pol agent of CP6. He was found as head of security of the Puffing Tom's seventh passenger car, which Sanji invaded to rescue Nico Robin. He comes from Karate Island in the South Blue, and claims to be a boxing champion.[1]
appareance: He was one of the antagonists during the Sea Train voyage in the Water 7 Arc.

Name: Jero
Note: He was named in his anime concept art.
description: Jero is a member of the G-5 branch of the Marines.[1]
appareance: Concept art of Jero.

Name: Jesus Burgess
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 234.
description: Jesus Burgess,[7] better known as the "Champion", is the helmsman[3] and one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates, as the captain of the First Ship.[2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Jaya Arc, a supporting antagonist in the Impel Down, Marineford, and Dressrosa Arcs, a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

Name: Jew Wall
Note: Mentioned only character. Their name was first mentioned in Chapter 222.

Name: Jewelry Bonney
description: Jewelry Bonney,[9] also known as the "Big Eater", is a pirate from the South Blue and the captain of the Bonney Pirates.[1] She is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation" and the only female member of the group.[10]
appareance: Bonney is the daughter of Ginny and the adopted daughter of Bartholomew Kuma,[11] the former King of the Sorbet Kingdom (making her Sorbet's former princess). Thanks to experiments conducted by Jaygarcia Saturn of the Five Elders, Bonney acquired the powers of the Toshi Toshi no Mi,[12] which allows her to manipulate the age of herself and others at will. She also inherited the Sapphire Scales disease from her mother, forcing her to live inside Kuma's church through her early childhood.

Name: Jibuemon
description: Jibuemon is a former retainer from Kibi serving under the Kouzuki Shogunate. As a hatamoto, he directly served under the former shogun, Kouzuki Sukiyaki.[1]
appareance: Jibuemon in his Beasts Pirates disguise.

Name: Jigoku Benten
Note: Her name was revealed in the credits of Episode 925.
description: Jigoku Benten[6] is a kunoichi and a member of the Beasts Pirates.[3] She previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[2]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Jigokukamabuta Megatenpanchiro
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Jigokukamabuta Megatenpanchiro[2] was a retainer of Shimotsuki Family under the Daimyo of Hakumai, Shimotsuki Yasuie.[1]
appareance: Megatenpanchiro is a light-skinned man with blonde hair combed into a widow's peak. It has small round eyes and red spiral patterns on its cheeks. He wears a light green kimono and a long sleeveless vest with high shoulder pads, with the Shimotsuki family symbol embroidered on the left side.

Name: Jigoro
description: Jigoro of the Wind was a General Zombie on Thriller Bark in the service of Gecko Moria. He was animated with Zoro's shadow[1] and eventually assigned to guard Hogback.[5]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Thriller Bark Arc.

Name: Jigra
description: Jigra was an organ trader and a member of the Underworld who attempted to attack the Big Mom Pirates.[1] In the anime, he is also part of the Organ Dealing Assassination Group[2]
appareance: Jigra was an average-sized man with turquoise hair, slightly balding at the forehead. He has a long mustache that resembles a breadstick, and wears goggles over his eyes and a light fedora on his head. He also wears a dark purple suit, dark purple pants, and dark shoes.[1]

Name: Jinbe
Note: He was first mentioned by Yosaku in Chapter 69.
appareance: "Knight of the Sea" Jinbe[1] is the helmsman of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[3] He is the tenth member of the crew and the ninth to join, doing so during the Wano Country Arc.[16]

Name: Jiron
description: Jiron is the deputy commander of the North Army in the Revolutionary Army and the assistant of Karasu.
appareance: Jiron's anime concept art.

Name: Jobo
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Jobo[2] is a citizen of Mock Town.[1]
appareance: He is a normal sized man, with stubble on his chin and upper lip. He has a large nose, and longish black hair. He wears a hat with a bandana underneath, and has a small scar under his right eye. Evidently a drunkard, his face is often flushed and lethargic-looking.

Name: Johanna
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1147.
description: Johanna is a student at the Walrus School on Elbaph.[1]
appareance: Johanna is a young girl with light, shoulder-length hair. She displays a pair of black horns, as evidence of her Ancient Giant heritage.

Name: John
Note: He was first mentioned by Buggy in Chapter 233.
description: Captain John was a famous pirate captain who was once a member of the infamous Rocks Pirates prior to forming his own crew.[2] He was notable for collecting one of the most significant treasures in the world; his fabled treasure cave and the riches within, which are notably long sought after by Buggy.[3]
appareance: After his death, his corpse was found by Dr. Hogback and modified into one of the General Zombies for Gecko Moria.[1]

Name: John Giant
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: John Giant is a Vice Admiral in the Marine Headquarters,[2] and the first giant to ever enlist in the Marines.[6]
appareance: John Giant is a giant, and towers over regular soldiers. He is shown to have curly brown hair with a large bulbous chin. Unlike most giants who have a more heavy rounded stature, John is one of the few giants to look mostly human.

Name: Johnny
description: Johnny[3] along with Yosaku are old friends and former bounty hunting partners of Roronoa Zoro.
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Baratie Arc and the Arlong Park Arc.

Name: Jorge
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Jorge[2] was the head of the Judicial Ship that sailed to Water 7. He was the one who judged Tom for his support of the Pirate King Gol D. Roger.[1]
appareance: Jorge was an elderly man, with a large white mustache and beard. He has a wrinkled face, and sported a purple cap that matches his judge robes.

Name: Jörmungandr
description: Jörmungandr is a giant serpent from Elbaph mythology. It was manifested into reality from the fear of one of the Walrus School children[1] by Rimoshifu Killingham, using the power of his Devil Fruit.[2]
appareance: The Jörmungandr manifested into reality takes the form of a massive serpent that dwarfs even the giants. It has a dark mane running across its body, a mouth full of sharp teeth, and a long forked tongue.[1]

Name: Jorul
description: "Waterfall Beard" Jorul was a giant and former co-captain of the Giant Warrior Pirates, along with Jarul. He was known as a hero of the giants and one of the world's oldest warriors.[1]
appareance: 63 years ago, Jorul was mortally wounded during an attempt to stop a young, rampaging Charlotte Linlin, leading to his eventual death soon after.

Name: Joseph
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 104.
description: Joseph[2] is a masked agent of CP0 and a Longarm tribesman.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Joshu
Note: Its name was revealed in SBS Volume 106.
description: Joshu[2] is a cat and Edison's assistant on Egghead.[1]
appareance: Joshu is a small cat with light-colored fur. It walks on two legs and wears a dark-colored, long-sleeved shirt and dark-colored pants.[1]

Name: Joy Boy
Note: His name was read on a Poneglyph by Nico Robin in Chapter 628.
description: Joy Boy was a man from the Great Kingdom born 900 years ago at the start of the Void Century, as well as the first pirate in history.[1] An extremely relevant figure in the Void Century, Joy Boy played an important role in the history of Fish-Man Island and left behind a certain item of unimaginable value on the last island of the Grand Line, thus becoming a legendary and remembered figure in the world.
appareance: He was first mentioned on the Poneglyph read by Nico Robin while at the Sea Forest.[2]

Name: Jozu
description: "Diamond" Jozu[4][8] is the former 3rd division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates,[2] serving as one of the crew's most prominent members.
appareance: Jozu is a big, very muscular, broad-chested, heavily-armored and dark-skinned man, called a giant by Crocodile. Even when standing in a hunched position, he is roughly twice Crocodile's height. He has a long face with black stripe-like patterns for a beard and hairstyle. His legs are relatively thin in comparison to his muscular arms. He appears battle-hardened and has a perpetual scowl on his face. The dark armor he wears and his hair style are very similar to that of an Aztec warrior, with red-bolted dark shoulder pads (the bolts were later changed to gray). On his chest he has a green cuirass, whose front and back portions are connected by metal straps that go over both his collarbones. The cuirass' color was later changed to a rusty red color. Around his waist there is a big, elaborated golden belt, worn over what looks like a green skirt similar to the ones worn by Aztecs, with golden decorations near the edge. He also wears what look like studded, black and gold large-buckled shoes or boots and matching black studded pants. During the Summit War of Marineford, he lost his right arm when Aokiji froze him and the arm broke off.[9]

Name: Judy
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Judy[4] is Marie's fiancé. He was shot by Charlos when he tried to rescue her.[2]
appareance: Judy is a young man with shaggy light brown hair. He wore a blue shirt along with a white apron with the kanji for "alcohol" written on it. He also wore a pair of yellow pants with square patterns.[2]

Name: Jugemu Jugemuko
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Jugemu Jugemuko[2] is a young girl from the Hakumai region of the Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Jugemuko is a young girl with dirty blonde hair, which she keeps in pigtails. She wears an old pink outfit, with visible patches and a floral design. She carries her baby sibling on her back in a knapsack.

Name: Jujiro
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Jujiro is a samurai who allied with the Kouzuki Family.[3] After waiting 20 years for the return of the Nine Red Scabbards, he affiliated with the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance to raid Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Jujiro is a slim, fit man with narrow eyes, thin eyebrows, and a scar over his left eye. He has shoulder-length purple hair. Jujiro wears a pink kimono with burgundy spots on it and a purple cloak.[1] He has a reverse crescent moon tattoo on his ankle.[3]

Name: Juki
Note: His name was mentioned by X Drake in Chapter 990.
description: Juki is a member of the Numbers in the Beasts Pirates, representing the number "ten".[2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Julius
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Julius is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.[1][2]
appareance: Julius is a short chubby man, with a pear-shaped, wrinkled face and a bushy mustache. He wears a small tricorne with the sides flopped over, which features a Jolly Roger on it, made up of a skull and two curved horns. He wears a coat tied closed with short ropes and a cannon on each shoulder, attached with straps wrapped over his back and torso.

Name: Jumper
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Jumper[4] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Jumper is a man of average size. His most distinguishing trait is his helmet in the shape of an American football, with a white and red-striped design, and an arrow pointing down toward his face. Like other Gifters, he has a pair of horns sticking out of it as well. He wears a yellow shirt with letters "SB" on it, purple gloves, and a purple scarf. He appears to have a tattoo on his left arm, with a spotted and striped blue-yellow design.[1]

Name: Junan
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Junan[2] is a codfish fish-man[3] and a cashier at Pappag's Criminal Brand store.[1]
appareance: Junan is a fish-man with grey skin and a long neck, with red stripes coming from the back of his neck, and blond hair. His hair style is round, but pointed at the top, with blond sideburns. He has a light green fin on the back of his neck. He wears a tuxedo under a black coat with yellow buttons, a white shirt, and a purple bowtie.[1]

Name: Kabu
Note: Real appearance revealed in Chapter 711.
description: Kabu is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who is the leader of the Yellow Kabu Squad[5] and a member of the Tontatta Pirates.[3]
appareance: Like all the other dwarves, Kabu is small and has a large fluffy tail and a pointy nose. He appears to be older and chubbier than the other dwarves. He also has a lot of facial hair. He sports a dark coat, with a double breasted button up shirt, and scarf.[2]

Name: Kadar
description: Rear Admiral Kadar is a Marine Rear Admiral at the G-2 Marine base from fifteen years ago. His current location and rank are unknown.[1]
appareance: Kadar in his youth as a marine.

Name: Kagero
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Kagero is a priest and samurai who allied with the Kouzuki Family.[3] After waiting 20 years for the return of the Nine Red Scabbards, he affiliated with the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance for the Raid on Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Kagero in his Beasts Pirates disguise.

Name: Kagikko
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Kagikko is a member of the Krieg Pirates and a locksmith.[3]
appareance: Kagikko in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Kaidou
Note: He was first mentioned by Gecko Moria in Chapter 456. Part of his face was seen in Chapter 693 color spread.
description: Kaidou of the Beasts,[8][18][14][10] renowned as the world's "Strongest Creature",[19][11] is the Governor-General of the Beasts Pirates[6][14] and was formerly one of the Four Emperors that ruled over the New World.[5] He is also the father of Yamato.[20][21][22]
appareance: Once a promising child soldier at the service of the Vodka Kingdom decades ago, Kaidou was drafted against his will by the Marines but managed to escape and start a career in piracy. He was invited by Edward Newgate to join the legendary Rocks Pirates as an apprentice,[4] where he met and befriended Charlotte Linlin. During the God Valley Incident when the Rocks Pirates met their downfall, Linlin provided Kaidou with the rare Mythical Zoan-type Devil Fruit, the Uo Uo no Mi, Model: Seiryu.[23] He was imprisoned several times by the Marines, including being a test subject on Punk Hazard where he met and recruited his first mate King. He eventually formed his own pirate crew and built it up into a powerful military force determined to challenge the World Government and change the world.[24]

Name: Kairen
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 65.
description: Kairen is a righteye flounder mermaid and an employee of the Mermaid Cafe.[2]
appareance: Kairen is a mermaid with a somewhat wide face, red lipstick, and long, flowing blonde hair. She wears a white, revealing bikini, with a purple stripe-like pattern on it, that looks similar to the marine's "MÖWE" logo.[1]

Name: Kairiken
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Kairiken[3] is a bounty hunter at Sabaody Archipelago.[1]
appareance: Kairiken's full appearance in the anime.

Name: Kairo Kureyo
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Kairo Kureyo is a prisoner on Level 5 of Impel Down.[3]
appareance: Kureyo has frozen spiky hair and wears a prisoner uniform that is almost completely covered in ice.

Name: Kaku
description: Kaku[12] is a masked agent of CP0.[2] He was previously an assassin of CP9, operating undercover in order to obtain the Pluton blueprints from Iceburg.[5] While undercover, he acted as one of the five foremen of Galley-La Company's Dock One, specializing in mechanics, diagnostics, and housecalls.[6]
appareance: He is a major antagonist in the Water 7 and Enies Lobby Arcs, and a supporting antagonist in the Egghead Arc, later turned reluctant temporary ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the latter Arc.

Name: Kaku
description: Kaku[2] is a gangster who is a member of the Kyoshiro Family in Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Kaku's anime concept art.

Name: Kakukaku
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 43.
description: Kakukaku[2] is a resident of Water 7 who was among the townspeople as they discussed the attempted murder of Iceburg.[1]
appareance: Kakukaku is a man with rectangular and square-like features, such as his rectangular head with black hair and his rectangular nose. He has a small necklace around his neck and wears two layers of clothing with a pair of pants that have a spiral design. In the digitally colored manga, his short-sleeved shirt is red with outer edges that are yellow, his button-up long-sleeved undershirt is brown, and his pants are green with the spiral designs being yellow. In the anime, however, he sports a brown short sleeved shirt over a red button-up undershirt.

Name: Kakunoshin
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Kakunoshin is a samurai who allied with the Kouzuki Family.[3] After waiting 20 years for the return of the Nine Red Scabbards, he affiliated with the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance to raid Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Kakunoshin is an adult man of average height with short, light brown hair, thick eyebrows, and long sideburns. He wears a blue yukata with a light blue diamond design on its collar and a yellow sash, as well as a dark blue overcoat.

Name: Kalgara
Note: He was first mentioned by Braham in Chapter 249.
description: Kalgara[2] was a warrior of the Shandia who lived on Jaya around 400 years ago. He was renowned among his people as the "Great Warrior of Shandora" and feared as the "Demon of Shandora" by outsiders.[1] During his life, he befriended the later infamous explorer Mont Blanc Noland, and the two promised to meet again. However, both men met tragic ends before this promise could be fulfilled.[4]
appareance: Kalgara died in battle against the Skypiean forces after a part of Jaya was sent to the sky by the Knock Up Stream.[4] Until his final moments, he regretted being unable to ring the Golden Bell to signal their presence to Noland. His legacy lived on after his death, as a statue of him was erected in the Hidden Cloud Village.[5] His bloodline also continued through his daughter Mousse,[6] and Wyper is his descendant.[7]

Name: Kalifa
description: Kalifa[1] is a agent of CP0.[2] Before the timeskip, she was a an agent of CP9;[5] operating undercover as Iceburg's secretary at the Galley-La Company.[4] She is also Laskey's daughter and the older sister of Alpha.[10][11]
appareance: She was one of the major antagonists during the Water 7 and Enies Lobby Arcs.

Name: Kamakiri
description: Kamakiri is one of the Shandia warriors that fought to take Upper Yard from Enel. After the timeskip, he joined the God's Guards under Wyper.[2]
appareance: Kamakiri is a muscular, tan-skinned man with a Mohawk hairstyle and a pair of big, round sunglasses with red lenses and white frame. He also has two big and colored earrings hanging from his ears. On his back he has a pair of classical Shandia wings associated with their species. Kamakiri wears a grass skirt, similar to the ones worn by his companions, but with a red and green elaborate belt around the waist. He also sports a light red fur vest and a necklace that seems to be made of some animal's claws or teeth.

Name: Kamakirigirl
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Kamakirigirl[3] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1] During the Raid on Onigashima, she was tamed by the power of the Kibi Kibi no Mi and joined the side of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[2]
appareance: Kamakirigirl is a tall, slender woman. Her clothing is relatively limited, only wearing up two pieces of purple metal breastplated armor with shoulder guards, a purple thong, purple boots, and kneepads. Her hair is pink, and like most other Gifters, she has a pair of small, black horns on her head. On her arms are multiple circular tattoos. Due to her SMILE, her hands are replaced with massive, curved blades, similar to a praying mantis.[1]

Name: Kamekichi
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Kamekichi[2] is a newspaper deliveryman in the Flower Capital who announced reports of Kamazo the Manslayer and Ushimitsu Kozo.[1]
appareance: Kamekichi is a slim man with round eyes, a large mouth, pointed ears, and a round chin. He has dark hair styled in a bob with a topknot.[1]

Name: Kamijiro
Note: His name was revealed by Holed'em in Chapter 917.
description: Kamijiro is a lion's head, legs, and tail that are attached to Holed'em's body due to his consumption of a lion SMILE.[1][2]
appareance: Kamijiro's entire body consists only of a lion's head, two legs, and a tail growing from Holed'em's stomach. His mane is striped and circular. The tuft of his tail is also striped and is about the size of his head.[2]

Name: Kaneshiro
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
