description: Kaneshiro is the shipwright of the Arlong Pirates[3] and a goldfish fish-man.[5] He was previously a member of the Sun Pirates.[2]
appareance: Kaneshiro when his crew invaded the Conomi Islands 10 years ago.

Name: Kanezenny
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Kanezenny[2] is an elderly farm woman from Nico Robin's past.[3]
appareance: Kanezenny is an elderly woman with large eyes, small ears, a crooked nose, wide chin, lumpy cheeks, and a wide smile. She tied her long hair into a ponytail, and wore a light purple dress with dark purple spots and a brown jacket over it.[3]

Name: Kappa
description: Kappa is a young shoeshine-boy in Nanohana.
appareance: Kappa is a young boy who wears a white turban with orange beads around it. He has a blue cloth around his neck, and wears a blue robe with green sleeves. He wears brown belts around his torso where he carries stones. He has a bag that he carries on his back with various weapons, including a hammer, bat, and club.

Name: Karasu
Note: His name and full appearance were revealed in Chapter 904.
description: Karasu is a member of the Revolutionary Army, serving as one of its executive officers and the commander of the North Army.[2]
appareance: Karasu is a tall, muscular, and bald man who wears half of a plague doctor mask on his face that acts as a loudspeaker. He wears an open dark feather coat similar to those worn by the Beast Pirates that leaves his chest exposed, dark pants, and a sash around his neck. His overall attire gives him a crow-like theme and appearance.

Name: Karin
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1147.
description: Karin is a student at the Walrus School on Elbaph.[1]
appareance: Karin is a young girl with long light hair arranged in a ponytail. She has a long, protruding nose and wears a pair of headphones.[1]

Name: Karma
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Karma[3] is an octopus fish-man[2] and the captain of the Takotopus Pirates, an infamous New World pirate crew subordinate to the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: Karma is an octopus fish-man whose most distinctive trait is the large dark pink octopus he wears on his head and his six arms, but unlike Hatchan and Octopako, his arms lack suction cups nor does he have an elongated mouth. He has a red circle right in the middle of his forehead and a black goatee. He wears a striped shirt with ripped sleeves, a standard pirate's sash and loose pants similar to Buggy's

Name: Karoo
description: Karoo[2] is Nefertari Vivi's pet super spot-billed duck, a fleet riding bird (one of the fastest modes of transportation available in the Arabasta Kingdom).[1] Alongside his owner Vivi, Karoo infiltrated the organization known as Baroque Works. With her, he ended up traveling with the Straw Hat Pirates for most of the Arabasta Saga after their cover was blown. He is the leader of the Super Spot-Billed Duck Troops in Arabasta.
appareance: Karoo is a duck of yellow-brown plumage, with black-tipped wings and tailfeathers. Typical of his species, he bears a black band around his bill and stands roughly as tall as the average human; his feet are tetradactyl, with ostrich-like talons (unlike the webbed feet of normal ducks).

Name: Kasa
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Kasa[2] is an elderly woman from Raijin Island.[1]
appareance: She is a short, wrinkled, elderly woman in a cloak.[1]

Name: Kasagoba
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Kasagoba[2] is a marbled rockfish fish-man and was a member of the now disbanded New Fish-Man Pirates prior to their downfall.[1] In the anime, he is named Kasagon (カサゴン, Kasagon?).[3]
appareance: He is a stocky, beige fish-man with brown spots on his thick neck. He has pink trailings with yellow on the tips on his head and neck. He also appears to wear a white tank top and vertically striped pants. He also has a very large grin.[1]

Name: Kashii
description: Kashii,[6] together with Oimo, was one of the two giants who guarded the front gate of Enies Lobby[2] for over fifty years until he and Oimo realized they were tricked by the World Government.[4] He is a member of the Giant Warrior Pirates. He and Oimo became major allies to the Straw Hat Pirates during the Enies Lobby Arc and Egghead Arc.
appareance: Kashii is a giant who wears viking attire, has long dark hair and a big semi-bearded chin. He sports orange suspenders, which hold up an orange and black kilt with yellow buttons on it; otherwise, his torso and arms are bare, exposing well-toned muscles. He has big black boots that go up his shins, as well as an orange helmet with a tan brim and two small tan striped around the middle. The top of the helmet has light blue frills reminiscent of a mohawk, supported by a tan protrusion along the center, and two small horns are on the sides. He is usually seen with his axe.[2]

Name: Kashigami
description: Kashigami was a giant snake that lived on Jaya four centuries ago. It was worshiped by the Shandia as a god until it was slain by Mont Blanc Noland.[1] It is the grandparent of Nola, who lives on the land in the present day.[3]
appareance: Kashigami was nearly identical in appearance to its grandchild Nola, being an utterly massive light blue snake who was hundreds of meters long and wide enough to rival manmade structures in size. It had light blue skin with dark blue stripes, and possessed strands of light blue hair-like appendages on its sides as well as a pair of whiskers on its face. Its eyes were yellow with narrow pupils, and it had a long forked tongue.[1]

Name: Katsuzo
description: Katsuzo was a citizen of Wano Country. He died 41 years before the present day, and his cremated body was used by Kouzuki Oden to cook a pot of oden.[1]
appareance: Katsuzo and Kouzuki Oden were frequent drinking buddies.[2] Their friendship ran deep enough for Oden to hold a personal mourning after Katsuzo's passing, despite his family's complaints.[1]

Name: Kawamatsu
Note: He was first mentioned by Kin'emon in Chapter 921.
description: Kawamatsu the Kappa is a Japanese puffer fish-man[9] who is a yokozuna-ranked sumo wrestler. As a child, he was shipwrecked in Wano and orphaned soon afterwards. After Kouzuki Oden rescued him from an attempted lynching, he went on to serve as one of Oden's Nine Red Scabbards until Oden's death 20 years ago.[1]
appareance: After spending 7 years watching over Oden's daughter Hiyori, Kawamatsu was imprisoned by the Beasts Pirates for 13 years until Monkey D. Luffy ultimately freed him. He then reunited with the Nine Red Scabbards and joined their effort to fight Kurozumi Orochi and Kaidou and avenge Oden.[10][4] Following Kouzuki Momonosuke's ascent to shogun, he serves as the daimyo of Hakumai.[3]

Name: Kaya
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 24.
description: Kaya is a young woman who lives in the largest mansion in Syrup Village on the Gecko Islands. She is a close friend of Usopp and is currently studying to become a doctor.[1]
appareance: She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Syrup Village Arc.

Name: Kazekage
Note: His name and its spelling were revealed in SBS Volume 97.
description: Kazekage[4] is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates.[2] He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Kazenbo
description: Kazenbo was a flaming ghost-like entity created by Kurozumi Kanjuro, with the power of the Fude Fude no Mi, for the purpose of destroying Onigashima. It was created to symbolize the "burning hatred" (燃える怨念, moeru onnen?) of the Kurozumi Family against those who wronged them.[1]
appareance: Kazenbo was a massive ethereal being, having the ability to fluctuate in size to the point of taking up the entire height and width of large corridors. It started out transparent at the bottom, but became much darker and more opaque towards the top, where it possessed two glowing eyes. Large flames burned along its edges.[1]

Name: Kebi
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Kebi[1] was a member of the Sand-Sand Clan along with Vivi, Koza and Okame.
appareance: Kebi as a child.

Name: Kechatch
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Kechatch[2] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was subordinate to the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: Kechatch is a man with long yellow hair and a pointed nose that wears a black pirate hat with a Jolly Roger on it. He also wears a black pirate coat with yellow cuffs and a yellow garment with black holes underneath.[1]

Name: Keith
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Keith[3] is a monkey mink and a member of the Guardians who protect the Mokomo Dukedom at night.[1]
appareance: Keith is an average-sized monkey mink with a curled tail and brown fur. He wears a black suit with a black tie, a light-colored shirt, black pants, and a black top hat on his head. He also wears a red ascot and two black paw gauntlets on his hands.[1]

Name: Kentauros
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.

Name: Kelly Funk
description: Kelly Funk is an assassin from the Mogaro Kingdom and Bobby Funk's older brother. He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: Kelly Funk is an average-sized man, just tall enough to reach his brother, Bobby Funk's, chest. He is seen bare-chested with red star tattoos across his left shoulder. He has somewhat shaggy black hair with a wavy forelock that sticks up. He wears red gloves[1] and trousers with black and red vertical stripes.

Name: Kerville
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 399.
description: Three-Headed Baskerville is the Chief Justice of Enies Lobby, in service of the World Government.[1] Ostensibly a three-headed man, "he" is actually three men—Bas, And, and Kerville—who are such close friends that they prefer acting as one body.[3][2]
appareance: The three men comprising Baskerville wear identical uniforms—blue, single-breasted coats with gold trim and brown gloves—over their abnormally-built bodies:

Name: Kiba
description: Kiba is a giant from Elbaph and the principal of the Walrus School. He is a former member of the Giant Warrior Pirates.[1]
appareance: A close-up of Kiba's face in his principal outfit.

Name: Kibagaeru
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Kibagaeru[1] was the captain of the Fanged Toad Pirates until he lost to Foxy at the Davy Back Fight and joined his crew but eventually left sometime during the Timeskip. Due to his anime-exclusive actions, he can be considered one of the main antagonists of the Foxy's Return Arc.
appareance: Kibagaeru as a member of the Foxy Pirates.

Name: Kibin
Note: His name was revealed in Episode 475 credits.
description: Commodore Kibin[3] is a Marine officer that participated in the Summit War of Marineford.[1]
appareance: While his canon name and rank are unknown, he was given the name "Kibin" and the rank Commodore in the anime.

Name: Kiev
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook.
description: Kiev is a member of the Franky Family.
appareance: Kiev wears a normal Franky Family's uniform and has a beard and a hair crest. He has two tattoos of a star on each side of his shoulders. He, like every member, is seen wielding a sword. He is somewhat muscular.

Name: Kikipatsu
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Kikipatsu is a member of the Blackbeard Pirates.[2]
appareance: Kikipatsu is a round middle-aged man with a  large nose and a thick, blond, fluffy beard that looks like cotton candy.[2] He wears a bandana, a vest and pants held by suspenders.

Name: Kiku
Note: Mentioned only character. Her name was seen on an arena battle board on Amazon Lily.
description: Kiku[2] is a member of the Kuja. She is never seen but her name appears on the match-ups of the arena battle board.[1]
appareance: Little is known about Kiku's abilities, but, since her odds of winning were 5:1, it can be presumed that she is weaker than her opponent, Shion.[1]

Name: Kikunojo
description: Kikunojo of the Lingering Snow, more commonly referred to as Kiku, is a samurai from Wano Country and a retainer for the Kouzuki Family, serving as one of Kouzuki Oden's Nine Red Scabbards.[2] She is also the younger sister of Izou and the daughter of the dancing school head of the Hanayanagi School (花柳流, Hanayanagi-ryū?) in Ringo.[5]
appareance: After traveling forward in time, she worked as a tea house poster girl in Okobore Town while gathering information for the planned rebellion.[1][6] She participated in the Raid on Onigashima where she battled Kaidou alongside the other Scabbards, losing her left arm to one of Kaidou's attacks.[9] Following Kouzuki Momonosuke's ascent to shogun, she serves as the daimyo of Ringo.[4]

Name: Kikyo
description: Kikyo is a Kuja warrior from Amazon Lily.[1]
appareance: Kikyo is a slim normal-sized Kuja woman with tan skin and long black hair arranged in a ponytail.

Name: Killer
description: "Massacre Soldier" Killer[9] is a pirate from the South Blue and a combatant of the Kid Pirates. He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation".[10] After the timeskip, his bounty has been raised from 162,000,000 to 200,000,000.[8]
appareance: Following the confrontation with Kaidou, Killer ate a defective SMILE[11] and took on the alias of Kamazo the Manslayer, a street murderer in Wano Country[4] who secretly acted as an assassin working for the shogun, Kurozumi Orochi,[3] until the shogun discarded him after he had failed his mission to kill Toko.[12] He later reunites with his crew and becomes an ally member of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance during the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Kimel
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Kimel[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Kimel is a short man with a pointed nose. He wears a light-colored top with a frilled collar and puffy sleeves. He also wears light-colored pants, light-colored shoes, and a light-colored hat with triangles on the front of it.

Name: Kin'emon
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 664.
description: "Foxfire Kin'emon"[8] is a samurai from the region of Kuri in Wano Country,[5] a retainer of the Kouzuki Family,[2] the leader of the Nine Red Scabbards,[4] the husband of Tsurujo, and a former thug.[12] He was born 56 years before the present day, but traveled 20 years forward in time when he was 36 years old.[7]
appareance: Due to Wano Country having been taken over by Kurozumi Orochi, an ally of Kaidou of the Four Emperors, Kin'emon set out on a seafaring quest to recruit warriors for his cause, bringing alongside him his master, Kouzuki Momonosuke, as well as two of his comrades. After a series of misadventures, Kin'emon ended up on the island of Punk Hazard, where he met and joined forces with the Straw Hat Pirates, posing as Momonosuke's father during the journey to Zou.

Name: Kinbo
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Kinbo[2] is a boy who lives in Okobore Town of Kuri with his mother Yame and his little brother.[1]
appareance: Kinbo is a small boy with round eyes and nose, and dark brown hair which is very short apart from a tuft in the back. He wears a tattered green kimono with yellow patches.[1]

Name: Kinderella
Note: Her real name was revealed in Chapter 906.
description: Kinderella,[4] also known as Miss Universe, is a woman who married Wapol after he became the head of his own corporation. Two years after that, she became the queen of the Evil Black Drum Kingdom when Wapol became its king.[2]
appareance: Kinderella is a tall, slender woman with purple hair whose mouth is often seen open. She wore long purple dresses, and was seen by others as beautiful. After becoming the queen, she added a dark cape with bat wings on the shoulders, a hood with a crow design, long light-colored gloves, and an eye-mask.[1][2]

Name: King
Note: He first appeared as a silhouette in Chapter 920.
description: King the Conflagration is one of the three All-Stars of the Beasts Pirates and Kaidou's right-hand man.[5] Born as Arber,[3] he is a member of the near-extinct lunarian race from the Red Line, noted for their ability to create fire.[6][7][8][3]
appareance: He was a prisoner and test subject on Punk Hazard 34 years ago, where a sample of his Lineage Factor was extracted from him before he was freed and recruited by Kaidou. That same genetic material would be used by Dr. Vegapunk decades later as a key component in the creation of the Seraphim.[9]

Name: Kingbaum
description: Kingbaum is a tree homie, a member of the Big Mom Pirates, and the master of the Seducing Woods on Whole Cake Island.[1] However, he was forced to serve the Straw Hat Pirates due to them possessing Charlotte Linlin's Vivre Card.[4]
appareance: Kingbaum is an extremely large tree homie with a wide light gray trunk and a large amount of blueish gray foliage. He has small eyes, a very long and pointy nose, a very long handlebar mustache, a mouth full of sharp teeth, a large tongue, and two rather small arms that cannot even reach across his body.[1]

Name: Kinga
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Kinga[3] is an infamous New World pirate who was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates[4] before forming his own crew subordinate to Whitebeard.[3]
appareance: He is a rather tall man with brown hair and a thin mustache. His hair sticks up into the air, and he wears an open blue shirt.[1]

Name: Kingdew
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 58.
description: Kingdew[4] is the former 11th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.
appareance: Kingdew is a large tanned man with short blonde hair and hollowed-out cheeks. He wears a pair of long, armored blue gauntlets. He also wears a brown cape that he seems to have pierced to his shoulders, and black and golden yellow striped pants tucked inside simple boots, with a light blue sash around his waist. On the right side of his chest there is a large, elaborate tattoo, which seems to incorporate a dark blue Whitebeard's iconic mustache in it.

Name: Kinoko
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Kinoko[4] is a former prisoner on Level 5 of Impel Down[2] and is currently a member of the Buggy Pirates, joining after his escape from Impel Down and the Summit War of Marineford.[3]
appareance: Kinoko is a very large, corpulent man, with tan skin, a round nose, small eyes, a large mouth, and a predominant lower lip. For the size of his abdomen, he has rather short, skinny limbs. He also has brown hair that comes to a peak at the top. He wears a standard prisoner suit with black and white horizontal stripes.[2]

Name: Kirinkodanuki
Note: It was named in its anime concept art.
description: Kirinkodanuki[2] is an animal who lives on the Island of Rare Animals.[1] Like all the animals on the island, he is protected by Gaimon.[3]
appareance: Kirinkodanuki's anime concept art.

Name: Kirintauros
Note: His name is listed in the credits for Episode 582.
description: Kirintauros[2] is a giraffe centaur and member of the Centaur Patrol Unit on Punk Hazard.[1]
appareance: Kirintauros' face up close.

Name: Kisegawa
description: Kisegawa is a geisha from the Flower Capital of Wano Country. She once possessed the blueprints of Kaidou's fortress on Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Kisegawa is a youthful-looking woman with large dark-brown eyes, Indian red lipstick and golden blonde hair that is gathered at the back with four, pastel flowers. She had light-red fingernails and wears an kimono with white and light-purple vertical stripes.[1]

Name: Kitton
Note: His name was revealed in Episode 418 credits.
description: Kitton is a boy who lives in Karakuri Island. He has a grandfather who takes care of him, as well as a cyborg dog named Taroimo.[1]
appareance: Kitton is seen wearing a parka, a pair of boots, and a gun during his first appearance. Later on in his house, he is seen wearing a sweater. His house appears to be a mechanical looking igloo.[1]

Name: Kiwi
description: Mozu and Kiwi, also known as the Square Sisters due to their square-like hairstyle, are two members of the Franky Family very loyal to Franky, who went with him everywhere and tended to mimic every pose he did.[2]
appareance: They are both allies of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 and beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc (starting off as minor antagonists in the former). Currently, they jointly manage Blueno's old bar in Water 7.[6]

Name: Koala
description: Koala[7] is a high ranking officer of the Revolutionary Army, serving as the Fish-Man Karate assistant instructor. She started as a slave on Mary Geoise, but was then set free by Fisher Tiger's rampage. She sailed along with the Sun Pirates to reach her home town. Approximately two years later, she left her family to join the Revolutionary Army, where she often works alongside both Sabo and Hack.
appareance: She first debuted as a child during a flashback in the Fishman Island Arc. She made her reappearance during the Dressrosa Arc.[2]

Name: Kobe
description: Kobe is a resident of the Flower Capital in Wano Country and the landlord for the Longhouses. He once possessed the blueprints of Kaidou's fortress on Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Kobe is an elderly man with a mostly bald head,  all of his light-grey hair is kept in the back although there is still enough to make a topknot. He wears a olive-green dotted kimono over a navy coat with a light-blue diamond patterns. As well as round, small glasses on his face. He smokes a pipe.[1]

Name: Koby
description: Koby the Hero[13] is a Marine Captain[3] who trained together with Helmeppo under Vice Admiral Garp's supervision. He is currently a member of the Marine special forces unit SWORD.[14]
appareance: He was formerly an involuntary cabin boy for the Alvida Pirates until he was liberated by Monkey D. Luffy, becoming the first person Luffy befriended on his travels. He reunited with Luffy during the Post-Enies Lobby Arc, after becoming a fully-fledged Marine. During the timeskip, Koby earned fame as a hero for his actions through the Rocky Port Incident.[15] After a failed attempt to arrest Boa Hancock, he became a prisoner of the Blackbeard Pirates[16] until escaping with the help of Perona, his colleagues at SWORD, and his mentor Garp.[17]

Name: Koda
Note: Cover story character. Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook. She made a cameo appearance in Episode 381 in a newspaper.
description: Koda[3] is a Marine Chef, Kyuji's wife and mother of Moda.[4]
appareance: Koda is a short, relatively pudgy woman who wears a marine apron and a dotted shirt.[1]

Name: Koito
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Koito[2] is a young girl residing in Ebisu Town of the Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Koito has a rather wide mouth with large teeth, and is missing a tooth in the right side. She has brown hair done in a bun.

Name: Koiwa
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Koiwa[2] is a man who lived in the Wano Country 41 years ago.[1]
appareance: Koiwa is a thin man of average height. He wears a top with a cloud design and a dark hood with shurikens on it, as well as a metal mask covering his eyes.

Name: Kojuro
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Kojuro is a samurai who allied with the Kouzuki Family.[3] After waiting 20 years for the return of the Nine Red Scabbards, he affiliated with the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance to raid Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Kojuro is a man of medium height, but wide at the shoulders. He has a square face, black eyebrows and shoulder-length pink hair. Kojuro wears a purple kimono with dark blue piping and a light yellow cape with a pattern of light green spirals. He also has a reverse crescent moon tattoo on his ankle.[1]

Name: Kokoro
description: Kokoro is an icefish mermaid [5] and the stationmaster for Shift Station, a Sea Train station near Water 7.[1] She was also Tom's secretary during the days of Tom's Workers.[2]
appareance: Kokoro poses as a human, hiding her mermaid physique because her tail fin forked in two around the age of 30 and allowed her to walk on land.[5] She has a granddaughter named Chimney, who accompanies her everywhere.[1]

Name: Komachiyo
Note: Its name was revealed in Chapter 911.
description: Komachiyo is a komainu that resides in the Kuri region of Wano Country.[3] It has been Kurozumi Tama's best friend since their childhood.[4][5]
appareance: Komachiyo is a very large four-legged creature, being several times bigger than a normal-sized human. As a komainu, it resembles a hybrid of lion, dog, and pig, with its fur being flame-shaped. It also possesses two relatively short fangs.[1]

Name: Komakkov
Note: He was first mentioned in SBS Volume 108.
description: "Winter Cuisine" Komakkov is a chef under the employment of the Marines as one of its Four Head Chefs.[1]
appareance: Komakkov appears to be a portly, wrinkled, middle-aged man with a prominent nose and chin, as well as long, wavy black hair. He wears a relatively small chef's hat and a pair of dark-lensed goggles.

Name: Komane
description: Komane is the deposed princess of the Lulusia Kingdom, being the daughter of the former king Seki.[2][3]
appareance: Komane is a fit woman of average height, with black long hair with two hair rose ornaments. She wears a dark colored strapped short dress, light skirt, and dark high heel shoes. She also has a dark coat.[1]

Name: Konbu
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 686.
description: Konbu (Funimation)
appareance: Konbu is a child who lived in Punk Hazard's Biscuits Room.[2] He was freed with the rest of the children by the Straw Hat Pirates.

Name: Kong
Note: He is formally introduced in Chapter 594.
description: Kong[5] is the Commander-in-Chief of the World Government.[2] He was a Fleet Admiral of the Marines at the time of the Battle of Edd War twenty-seven years ago.[1] Some time after, he was promoted while Sengoku eventually became the new Fleet Admiral.
appareance: Kong is an extremely muscular, broad-chested, tan-skinned, strong-shouldered elderly man who has his whitened hair and beard arranged in an array of spikes, and some fuzz on both sides of his face, similar to a lizard's spine. He also has a stitched scar under his left eye.

Name: Kop
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook.
description: Kop[3] is a member of the Franky Family.
appareance: Kop is a very tall and thin man. He has a rectangular shaped face and a triangle shaped nose. He has a piece of orange cloth tied around his head.

Name: Koshi Falcon
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Koshi Falcon[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Koshi Falcon is a larger man. Due to the SMILE that he consumed, he possesses a pair of large, pink wings on his lower back. Unlike other Gifters, he does not possess a pair of horns. He wears a simple white tank-top, white pants, and white boots. He has brown hair in a mohawk style, with a pointed mustache, and a tattoo on his left arm.[1]

Name: Kotatsu
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Kotatsu[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Kotatsu is a large lynx, as big as a fully grown panther. He has a hunched back, thin limbs, and a dark-colored belt.

Name: Kotetsu
Note: Mentioned only character. He was mentioned by Tenguyama Hitetsu in Chapter 912.
description: Kotetsu was a swordsmith who crafted the cursed Great Grade sword Nidai Kitetsu.[1] He is an ancestor of the present-day Kouzuki Family in Wano Country, namely Sukiyaki, Oden, Momonosuke, and Hiyori.[2]
appareance: Kotetsu's appearance is unknown.

Name: Kotori
description: Hotori and Kotori are the younger brothers of Satori. They are lieutenants of the Divine Soldiers, an army of 50 warriors under the command of Yama, their leader, and Enel.[1] They are minor antagonists during the Skypiea Arc.
appareance: Hotori and Kotori are twin brothers that look and dress exactly the same, and have some similarities to their older brother, Satori. They have bodies shaped like giant balls, and they wear white jumpsuits, with a white sash. They wear orange shoes and orange gloves. They also have yellow sunglasses that cover up their eyes completely. Behind them, they wear magenta ribbons, and on their heads they are bald. As part of Divine Soldiers they have goat-like noses, ears, and horns. They also have the same wings as all Birkans.

Name: Kouzuki Hiyori
Note: She was identified in Chapter 938.
description: Kouzuki Hiyori[7][6] is the daughter of the late Kouzuki Oden and Kouzuki Toki and the younger sister of Kouzuki Momonosuke.[8][9]
appareance: To hide her identity, Hiyori became known as Komurasaki,[10] working as an oiran of the tayu (太夫, tayū?) rank, the highest of all.[2] However, after she angered Kurozumi Orochi, Denjiro (in his disguise as Kyoshiro) staged a killing of Komurasaki in order to keep Hiyori safe.[11][9] She is the one who gave her late father's legendary sword Enma to Roronoa Zoro in exchange for Shusui.

Name: Kouzuki Momonosuke
Note: He was first mentioned by Kin'emon in Chapter 658. His full name and true identity revealed in Chapter 817.
description: Kouzuki Momonosuke[11] is the current shogun of Wano Country.[4] A member of the Kouzuki Family, he is the son of the late daimyo of Kuri Kouzuki Oden and his wife Toki, the grandson of the former shogun Sukiyaki, and the older brother of Hiyori.
appareance: Momonosuke was born 28 years ago while his parents were sailing with the Whitebeard Pirates.[5] Though rightfully the heir to the shogunate after Oden, the Kouzuki Family was deposed by the Kurozumi Family during Oden's travels, and attempts were made on Momonosuke's life by Kurozumi Orochi's administration.[12] Oden was executed when Momonosuke was 8, and Orochi and Kaidou began waging open warfare to eliminate the Kouzuki bloodline. To keep Momonosuke safe, Toki sent him 20 years forward in time with several of his retainers.[13]

Name: Kouzuki Oden
Note: He was first mentioned by Kin'emon in Chapter 817. He appeared as a silhouette in Episode 893.
description: Kouzuki Oden[7] was the daimyo of Kuri in Wano Country and the son of the former shogun Kouzuki Sukiyaki, being a member of the Kouzuki Family. He was the husband of Kouzuki Toki and the father of Momonosuke and Hiyori. Additionally, he was the leader of a group of legendary and powerful samurai known as the Nine Red Scabbards, with all of them serving as his retainers and most trusted allies.[2]
appareance: For 5 years of his life, Oden set out to sea and became a pirate, serving as the 2nd division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates[10] and later becoming a member of the Roger Pirates. After finding Joy Boy's treasure on Laugh Tale, Oden journeyed home and made it his goal to open Wano's borders to the world by finally taking his father's place as shogun.[11] However, he met opposition from his usurper Kurozumi Orochi and the pirate Kaidou, who executed him 20 years before the present, in an event known as the Legendary Hour.[3]

Name: Kouzuki Sukiyaki
Note: He was introduced as Tenguyama Hitetsu in Chapter 912. His real name was first mentioned by Kin'emon in Chapter 920. They were revealed to be the same person in Chapter 1053.
description: Kouzuki Sukiyaki[6] is the former shogun of Wano Country. He is the father of the late daimyo of Kuri, Kouzuki Oden, as well as the grandfather of current shogun Kouzuki Momonosuke and Hiyori. The descendant of the legendary swordsmith Kotetsu, he is a swordsmith by hobby[7] and crafted one of Roronoa Zoro's swords, Sandai Kitetsu,[8] as well as Ame no Habakiri, which was previously wielded by Oden and currently by his son, Momonosuke.
appareance: Around three decades before the present day, he was deposed from the shogunate and imprisoned by the usurper Kurozumi Orochi. Escaping sometime after Oden's execution 20 years ago, Sukiyaki went into hiding and lived as a hermit under the name Tenguyama Hitetsu; he resided in Amigasa Village in Kuri and raised the young girl Kurozumi Tama as his ward.[1] After Orochi was overthrown and his grandson Momonosuke took power, Sukiyaki revealed his identity to his family and their retainers, but chose to remain hidden from the general public due to his shame over what he allowed to happen to Wano.[9]

Name: Kouzuki Toki
Note: She first appeared as a silhouette in Episode 893.
description: Kouzuki Toki,[4] née Amatsuki, was the wife of the daimyo of Kuri, Kouzuki Oden and the mother of Kouzuki Momonosuke and Kouzuki Hiyori.[5]
appareance: She was born around 830 years before the present day. By the time she was 26 years old, she jumped forward in time with her Devil Fruit ability and arrived 30 years before the present when she met Oden[2] and stayed with him for 10 years until he was executed. She was killed during the destruction of Oden Castle.[1][6]

Name: Koyama
Note: It was named by Kouzuki Oden in Chapter 963.
description: Koyama, as named by Kouzuki Oden and his retainers,[1] is a white boar and the child of the Mountain God that lived in the forests of Wano Country as late as thirty years ago. In what became known as the Mountain God Incident, it was kidnapped from its parent and later stolen by Kin'emon.[3][4] It later became a retainer of the Kouzuki Family alongside its parent.[2]
appareance: Koyama's larger size compared to Oden and his retainers.

Name: Koza
description: Koza is princess Nefertari Vivi's childhood friend. As a child, he was the leader of the Sand-Sand Clan.[4] As an adult, he became the leader of the Arabasta Rebellion.[3] He later became the environmental minister of the Arabasta Kingdom.[2]
appareance: Koza is a young blond man from the Arabasta Kingdom.

Name: Koze
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Koze and Packy were members of the Yes Pirates.[1]
appareance: Koze is the thin and tall man with short purple hair, a wide mouth and his tongue sticking out. He wore an A-shirt with various colored fruit-patterns on it, light-colored pants with a pirate sash, a gauntlet on his right forearm, and normal shoes.

Name: Krieg
Note: He was first mentioned by a Marine in Chapter 44. He was formally introduced in Chapter 46.
description: "Ruler of the East Blue" (東の海（イースト･ブルー）の覇者, Īsuto Burū no Hasha?)[6];"Foul Play Krieg" (ダマし討ちのクリーク, Damashi-uchi no Kurīku?)[6]
appareance: Don Krieg is the admiral of the Krieg Pirates, widely reputed as Foul-Play Krieg for his underhanded methods.[1] At his height, he was also known as the Pirate Fleet Admiral, commanding a fleet of fifty ships (totaling some 5,000 pirates) throughout the East Blue.[6]

Name: Kujaku
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1080.
description: Kujaku is a Marine Rear Admiral[5] stationed at Marine Base G-14[1] and also a member of SWORD. She is the granddaughter of Marine Vice Admiral Tsuru.[5]
appareance: Kujaku was first introduced during the "Gang" Bege's Oh My Family Cover Page Serial as a brief antagonist. She made her proper debut in the main series during the Egghead Arc.

Name: Kukai
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Kukai is a samurai and member of the Spade Pirates.[2]
appareance: Kukai is an average-sized man with light-colored hair, sloping eyes, and pointed ears. He wears a kimono and a wide-brimmed hat.

Name: Kumadori
description: Kumadori[4] is an agent of CP0.[2] Before the time skip, he was an agent of CP9.[3] He is also the son of Kumadori Yamanbako.[8]
appareance: He was one of the major antagonists during the Enies Lobby Arc.

Name: Kumadori Yamanbako
Note: She was first mentioned in SBS Volume 44.
description: Kumadori Yamanbako is the mother of Kumadori who was an assassin like him which means Kumadori followed her footsteps. Kumadori made lots of poetry about his mother in heaven, but in reality she is still alive.[1]
appareance: Yamanbako is an old woman who has long pink hair like her son. She also has similar facial features, such as pale skin, dark lips, a dark crease on her upper lip, and a stubby nose. She wears a dress with frills on the collar and some sort of writing of the front. She also wears dark colored hair clips and makes a peace sign with her hands.[1]

Name: Kumae
Note: Its name was revealed in SBS Volume 66.
description: Kumae was a bear introduced in SBS Volume 66. It was shown to be Perona's pet when she was young.[1]
appareance: Kumae is a bear about the size of a human child. It wears a spiked collar with a name tag at the bottom and a striped hat.

Name: Kumagoro
description: Kumagoro is a resident of the Flower Capital in Wano Country. He once possessed the blueprints of Kaidou's fortress on Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Kumagoro is a man who appears to be of average height, and he has pale-purple hair gathered into a topknot. He wears a dark-orange kimono with lighter-orange vertical stripes.[1]

Name: Kumaguchi Ichiro
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 53. His face is printed on every 5,000 banknote.

Name: Kumashi
description: Kumashi was a stuffed bear zombie of the Thriller Bark Pirates who acted as Perona's servant[2] and the commander-in-chief of the Wild Zombies[3] prior to being purified by Usopp.
appareance: Kumashi is a large Wild Zombie resembling a patchworked teddy bear. His body is composed of white, light blue, and orange cloth with bandages over his lower body, legs, and arms. He wears an oversized white and blue cap on his head and a surgical mask over his mouth, he also has bloodshot eyes suggesting he does not have eyelids.[1] There is a zipper on his back that leads to his hollow interior, which is spacious enough that Usopp, Nami, and Tony Tony Chopper all hid within Kumashi at the same time.[2]

Name: Kuni
description: Kuni is a gangster and a member of the Kyoshiro Family in Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Kuni's anime concept art.

Name: Kunyun
Note: She was first heard laughing in Chapter 978.
description: Kunyun is a member of the Numbers in the Beasts Pirates, representing the number "nine".[1]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Kureha
Note: Also known as Doctorine.
description: Dr. Kureha[6] is an elderly doctor who works on Drum Island. She is referred to as "witch" by some people.
appareance: She is Tony Tony Chopper's mentor and adoptive mother, taking him under her care after the death of Hiriluk. She is also head of the Isshi-100.[7]

Name: Kuro
Note: He was introduced with his alias, Klahadore. His real name was revealed by Jango in Chapter 26.
description: Kuro of a Hundred Plans is the captain of the Black Cat Pirates.
appareance: After faking his own capture and execution,[7] he assumed the alias Klahadore and infiltrated Syrup Village's wealthiest family, acting as servant and caretaker to their young daughter Kaya[8] with the intent of seizing her fortune.[9] His scheme would ultimately be thwarted by Kaya's friend Usopp and the Straw Hat Pirates who came to his aid.[10]

Name: Kurokoma
Note: His appearance was revealed in Road To Laugh Tale Vol. 4.
description: Kurokoma was a yakuza of the Flower Capital in Wano Country. Forty-one years before the present day, he was the head of his family.[1]
appareance: Kurokoma was not shown in the manga. In concept sketches, he is depicted as a man with a long pointed nose and spiky dark hair which is gathered into a large topknot. He possesses a scar on the right side of his face running from his eye to his cheek, and carries a cigar.[2]

Name: Kuromarimo
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 135.
description: Kuromarimo[3] was the magistrate during Wapol's rule on Drum Island, and was the highest-ranking law officer below Wapol.[2] After fleeing Drum Island to escape Blackbeard's attack, Kuromarimo became part of the Bliking Pirates.
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Drum Island Arc.

Name: Kuroobi
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 75.
description: Kuroobi[6] is a ray fish-man and an officer of the Arlong Pirates,[2] who was once a member of the Sun Pirates.[3] He is one of the major antagonists of the Arlong Park Arc.
appareance: Kuroobi has the typical appearance of a martial artist with a dark blue gi and a black belt. His hair is tied into a straight ponytail. His Sun Pirates tattoo is on the right side of his chest.[1] Whether this tattoo covers a slave mark is currently unknown.

Name: Kurosawa
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Kurosawa is a samurai who allied with the Kouzuki Family.[2] After waiting 20 years for the return of the Nine Red Scabbards, he affiliated with the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance to raid Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Kurosawa is a middle-aged man of average build with tan skin, a large nose, and long eyebrows that curl upward at the outer ends. He often wears an expression with a frowning smile and furrowed brow. He has long black hair tied back in a ponytail, a widow's peak, and a long, black beard. Kurosawa wears a dark green kimono with a sun pattern on the sleeves, a dark collar, and striped hakama.[1] During the raid on Onigashima, he wears a light-colored kimono with a circular pattern on it and dark-colored hakama.[3]

Name: Kurotsuru
Note: Cover story character. His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Dr. Kurotsuru,[2] also named "Dr. Black Beard" based on the same name on the lapel of his coat,[1] is a doctor who appeared in Ace's cover story.
appareance: Kurotsuru as he appears in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Kurozumi Higurashi
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 969.
description: Kurozumi Higurashi was a member of the Kurozumi Family and a major supporter of Kurozumi Orochi.[1][3] She was killed by Kaidou for her interruption in his fight with Kouzuki Oden.[4]
appareance: Due of her actions and role, she was a major overarching antagonist in the Wano Country Arc and Saga.

Name: Kurozumi Kanjuro
Note: His full name was revealed in Chapter 974.
description: Kurozumi Kanjuro, nicknamed "Evening Shower" Kanjuro,[7] was a samurai from Wano Country and a member of the Kurozumi Family. After losing his parents, he was instructed by Kurozumi Orochi to operate undercover within the Kouzuki Family. Kanjuro became Kouzuki Oden's retainer and one of the Nine Red Scabbards while secretly aiding Orochi in his rise to power and efforts to eliminate the Kouzuki bloodline, by feeding him information.[2][3]
appareance: He would continue to do so until he revealed himself as Orochi's spy just before the Raid on Onigashima, leading to his former comrades engaging in battle with him until he was lethally wounded by Kin'emon during a final skirmish, dubbing it his final act.[12]

Name: Kurozumi Orochi
Note: He was first mentioned by Kin'emon in Chapter 818. His name was revealed by Kin'emon in Chapter 909.
description: Kurozumi Orochi[4] was the former shogun of Wano Country and one of the last members of the Kurozumi Family.[3]
appareance: Persecuted in his youth due to his grandfather's failed attempt to seize the shogunate from the Kouzuki Family, Orochi encountered some relatives who helped him formulate another attempt to become shogun. This plan succeeded, with Orochi deposing the Kouzuki Family around three decades before the present day after allying with Kaidou of the Four Emperors.[2] Orochi ruled Wano tyrannically until he was deposed by none other than Kaidou, who betrayed him to seize Wano for himself;[6] Orochi survived Kaidou's attack and tried to kill everyone on Onigashima out of spite but was then killed after two encounters with the Kouzuki Family's Nine Red Scabbards who he knew had been prophesied to overthrow him.[7][8]

Name: Kurozumi Semimaru
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 969.
description: Kurozumi Semimaru was a member of the Kurozumi Family and a major supporter of Kurozumi Orochi.[1][3]
appareance: Semimaru was an elderly balding man with long white hair and a long beard.

Name: Kurozumi Tama
Note: Her full name was revealed in SBS Volume 105.
description: Kurozumi Tama,[2] commonly known as O-Tama (お玉?), is a girl from the region of Kuri in Wano Country. She is a kasa weaver working under Tenguyama Hitetsu,[1] as well as a kunoichi in training under the apprenticeship of Shinobu.[6] She is the last known survivor of the Kurozumi Family.[2]
appareance: Tama befriended Portgas D. Ace four years ago, having wished to join his crew at the time. She is a major ally of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance during the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Kuzan
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 318. Better known by his former epithet Aokiji.
description: Kuzan,[6][12] better known by his alias Aokiji,[13] is one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates, as the captain of the Tenth Ship.[2][5] Before joining Blackbeard's crew, he served as a Marine Admiral,[1] having been taught by Monkey D. Garp.[5] He was nominated by Sengoku for the position of Fleet Admiral; however, after fighting Sakazuki for the position and losing, Kuzan resigned from the Marines.[14][4]
appareance: Kuzan was the antagonist of the second part of Long Ring Long Land Arc; in the anime, he is instead one of the main antagonists of the Foxy's Return Arc. He is later a secondary antagonist of the Marineford Arc, a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

Name: Kyo
Note: He was first mentioned by Sengoku in Chapter 957. His real name was revealed in Chapter 1156.
description: Kyo,[1] also known as Silver Axe, is a mobster-turned-pirate, a former member of the Rocks Pirates,[2] and a rival of Shiki.[1]
appareance: Over 38 years ago, Kyo appeared as a tall and well-built man. His hair was of a light shade and kept in a short crop with sideburns, his full-lipped mouth was usually in a scowl, and his broad chin had an X-shaped scar in the middle. A dark tattoo spread across the left front of his torso: two strokes forming an X above what resembled a five-petaled half-flower motif. For attire, Kyo donned a dark-colored kimono patterned with double-bladed axe shapes of light color, held closed by a light sash, as well as dark gloves and sandals; slung over his shoulders was a long, hooded, light-colored coat trimmed at the bottom with a dark flaming tongue pattern,[1] and featuring the kanji 凶 for Kyo's name on (at least) the left breast portion.[3] Kyo's eyes were covered by dark sunglasses, each lens marked with a bold X, and on his back was strapped his massive, single-bladed axe.[1]

Name: Kyros
Note: He was introduced in his toy form as Thunder Soldier. His real name and appearance were revealed in Chapter 704. His true identity was revealed by Leo in Chapter 739.
description: Kyros[7] is a legendary gladiator who fought in the Corrida Colosseum until he left to become captain of the royal army of Dressrosa.[8] He was later turned into a toy, causing everyone to forget his existence, becoming a One-Legged Soldier (片足の兵隊, Kata-ashi no Heitai?), also known as the "Thunder Soldier of Rage".[9] He is the former captain of the Riku Royal Army (リク王軍, Riku Ō Gun?),[10][11] the father of Rebecca,[12] the husband of Scarlett and the son-in-law of Riku Doldo III.[13]
appareance: He spent ten years as a toy before being freed by the success of his own Operation SOP.[14] After helping bring down the Donquixote Pirates, Kyros currently lives with Rebecca.[15]

Name: Kyuin
description: Kyuin is a former member of the Donquixote Pirates, and the former boss of the SMILE Factory on Dressrosa.[1]
appareance: Kyuin is a very large woman with twintails that wears a coat and a dress with the word "SMILE", moreover, she wears a luchador mask covering most of her head and face—a feature common amongst Donquixote Pirates subordinates. On her right upper forearm is a tattoo of the kanji for the word "Factory" (工場, Kōjō?).[1]

Name: Kyuji
Note: Cover story character. His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook. He made a cameo appearance in Episode 381 in a newspaper.
description: Kyuji[3] is a Marine chef, Koda's husband, and Moda's father.[1]
appareance: Kyuji in the Digitally Colored Manga

Name: Kyukyu
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Dr. Kyukyu[2] is a doctor in Water 7. He examined Iceburg after he was shot by the CP9.
appareance: He is a partly bald man with a red nose and a medical cross on his forehead. He has a bushy mustache and bushy hair. He wears a sleeveless shirt, and dark colored pants.

Name: Laboon
Note: His name was revealed by Crocus in Chapter 103.
description: Laboon[3] is an Island Whale the Straw Hat Pirates encounter immediately after entering the Grand Line. He is native to the West Blue and is classified as a Type A creature, "Big Friendly", and at the top of both the size and friendliness scale.[6]
appareance: 50 years ago, after being separated from his pod as a baby, Laboon became a close companion of the Rumbar Pirates, but he had to be left behind under Crocus's care due to the dangers of the Grand Line. The pirates promised they would come back for Laboon someday, so the whale still awaits their return to this day. As a former and the only surviving member of the Rumbar Pirates, it is Brook's ultimate goal to reunite with Laboon.

Name: Lacroix
Note: His name was revealed by Marines in Chapter 555.
description: Vice Admiral Lacroix is a Marine vice admiral and a member of the Giant Squad.
appareance: He is one of the few giants seen so far that does not have unusual facial features or a beard. Like many giants, he has a large, bulky belly. He wears a Marine hat and a double-breasted suit with his sleeves rolled up, along with a purple tie. Like all high-ranking Marines, he wears a standard Marine coat draped over his shoulders.

Name: Lacuba
description: Lacuba[6] is a pirate famed as a devious tactician, with a bounty of 17,000,000.[2]
appareance: Lacuba is a tall man with a brown coat and hat. He has long black hair and a beard, and has his crew's jolly roger tattooed on his chest.[2] After he attempted to commit suicide by biting his tongue off, the tip of his tongue was flattened.[3]

Name: Lady Tree
description: Lady Tree is a tree homie living in the Seducing Woods on Whole Cake Island.[1] She's also Kingbaum's fiancée.[2]
appareance: As her name suggests, Lady Tree is a tree homie. She has full lips and long eyelashes, with her red foliage high on her head. She uses two slim branches as hands.

Name: Laffitte
description: Laffitte,[8] nicknamed "Demon Sheriff",[5] is the navigator[2] and the Titanic Captain of the Blackbeard Pirates' Fifth Ship.[5] He is also a former West Blue policeman known for countless acts of police brutality, which resulted in his exile from that sea.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Jaya Arc, a supporting antagonist in the Impel Down and Marineford Arcs, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

Name: Lao G
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 702.
description: Lao G[5] is an officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Diamante Army.[6]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Laskey
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Laskey[2] is a former CP9 agent and the father of current Cipher Pol agents Kalifa and Alpha.
appareance: A close up of Laskey's face.

Name: Lassoo
description: Lassoo is Mr. 4's gun that consumed a Devil Fruit through some unknown method which allows it to become a living dog. He is classified as a Type D creature, "Small Savage".[4]
appareance: Lassoo is a sandy-brown gun, similar to a bazooka, that has handles on the sides and a contoured barrel.

Name: Lemoncheese
Note: Her name was revealed in the captions of Episode 889.
description: Lemoncheese[3] is the queen of the Bestland Kingdom (ベストランド王国, Besutorando Ōkoku?) and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2][3]
appareance: Lemoncheese's initial color scheme in the anime.

Name: Leo
Note: Real appearance revealed in Chapter 711.
description: "Warrior" Leo is a dwarf from the Tontatta Kingdom and the leader of the "Tonta Corps " (トンタ兵長, Tonta-heichō?),[4] which was later reformed as a pirate crew now known as the Tontatta Pirates, with Leo now acting as the captain.[9] He is the captain of the fifth ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[3]
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Dressrosa Arc, and one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.

Name: Leonero
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Leonero[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Leonero is a tall man with a large rounded jaw, pointy ears, and long legs. He wears a pinstripe jumpsuit, light-colored shoes, a top hat, and sunglasses. In Wano Country, he wore a dark-colored suit.

Name: Lilith
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1062.
description: Lilith, also designated as Punk-02 (PUNK-02（パンク ツー）, Panku-Tsū?), is one of six satellites of Dr. Vegapunk, embodying his aspect of "evil".[3]
appareance: She is a major ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Egghead and Elbaph Arcs, and ultimately the only Vegapunk to escape with them after the Egghead Incident.[4]

Name: Lily
description: Lily was a member of the Bellamy Pirates. She was first seen with Sarquiss on Jaya Island. She was the only member of the minor crew members in Bellamy's crew that was openly named.[1] Lily appeared in most of the events the crew were involved with during the Jaya Arc. She was last seen when Doflamingo came to punish Bellamy.
appareance: Lily when she was younger.

Name: Limejuice
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 101.
description: Limejuice[3] is one of the Senior Officers of the Red Hair Pirates.[1]
appareance: Limejuice is a relatively thin yet muscular man with blond hair. His trademark features are his nut-shaped hat with a Jolly Roger on it, and his white gloves, objects he retains in both of his appearances in the past and present. By the time of the Summit War of Marineford, he added to his attire a coat draped over his shoulders like a cape and a pair of sunglasses covering his eyes. His hair has grown longer, almost reaching down to his waist, and he has a stern expression.[4]

Name: Linaria
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 108.
description: "Igniting" Linaria[2] is the captain of the Night Butterfly Pirates, a crew subordinate to the Red Hair Pirates.[1]
appareance: Linaria is a young woman described as beautiful. She has long, light hair that is straight at the roots and curly at the ends, with a dark flower adorning it. She wears a vertically striped captain's coat and lipstick.

Name: Lindbergh
description: Lindbergh, or "Lind" for short, is a cat mink[3] and the commander of the Revolutionary Army's South Army.[4]
appareance: Lindbergh is a short cat mink, standing about half as tall as Belo Betty. He has somewhat dark-blue cyan colored hair, a pink nose and cream-colored fur.

Name: Lines
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Seaman First Class Lines is a former subordinate of Fullbody from his time as a lieutenant.[4]
appareance: Lines has the standard Marine appearance, including the white shirt and Marine hat. In the anime, he had black hair, but in the manga, he has light-colored hair.[1]

Name: Lionbuta
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook.
description: Lionbuta[2] is an animal who lives on the Island of Rare Animals.[1] Like all the animals on the island, he is protected by Gaimon.[3]
appareance: Lionbuta is a mixture of a lion and a pig, with a pink pig body and brown lion mane.[1]

Name: Lip Doughty
description: Lip "Service" Doughty[2] was one of the rookies who had joined the ranks of the Fake Straw Hat Crew. He had a bounty of 88,000,000.[1]
appareance: Doughty is a tan skinned man with a pointed head and a rectangular chin jutting out from it. He wears a tricorne hat with his Jolly Roger on it; underneath it is long, curly black hair. He wears a shirt and polka-dotted pants, has a foulard around his neck, dons a sash around his waist, in which he keeps some of his numerous weapons, and sports a cape. He has big lips, but very small nose and eyes, and is almost always seen scowling.[1]

Name: Little Oars Jr.
description: Little Oars Jr. (also referred to as Oars III on his flag)[5] is the captain of the Little Pirates,[2] a descendant of Oars, and a former subordinate of the Whitebeard Pirates. He is among the several New World pirates that aided the Whitebeard Pirates in saving Ace from execution by the World Government.[1]
appareance: Little Oars Jr. is an abnormally large giant, standing at around 60 meters tall, which is about three times the size of a typical grown giant.[2][6] His nickname is a tribute to his ancestor Oars who was taller. His overall shape and silhouette resembles his ancestor greatly: large forearms and hands, small lower body and barrel-like gut. His skin is yellow-green and he has orange hair reaching down to his legs, which are quite small in comparison to his large belly and hairy forearms. He has large fangs and horns pointing upward, black triangle-like marks just above his eyes, and some stubble on his chin. He also wears three skulls on a beaded necklace rather than a belt, but the most notable item among his effects is a gigantic kasa hat that Ace made for him,[7] which is usually seen resting on his back in a similar fashion to Luffy.

Name: Loki
Note: He was first mentioned in Chapter 858.
description: Loki is the prince of Elbaph, being the son of King Harald and Queen Estrid, as well as the younger half-brother of Hajrudin.[8] Known as the "Accursed Prince" and the "Shame of Elbaph", he is believed by Elbaph's giants to have killed his father in order to obtain an unspecified Devil Fruit, leading to his imprisonment.[9] Loki refers to himself as the Sun God, a deity worshiped by Elbaph's populace, and claims he will be the one to "end the world".[1]
appareance: He was once arranged to marry Charlotte Lola, which would have allied Elbaph with the Big Mom Pirates, until Lola ran away.[2] He is a major character in the Elbaph Arc.

Name: Lola
description: Lola was a Wild Zombie created by Dr. Hogback and animated by Gecko Moria's powers, using the shadow of Charlotte Lola.[3]
appareance: Lola was a zombie stitched together from the remains of a warthog. She had pink skin and a large, skeletal mouth with two large tusks. She had a small scar connecting her two nostrils and wore red lipstick, as well as a wedding dress with golden metal shoulder pads and corsets.[1]

Name: Lonz
Note: His name was revealed by Marines in Chapter 556.
description: Vice Admiral Lonz is a Marine vice admiral who is also part of the Giant Squad.
appareance: Lonz is a giant who wears what appears to be a medieval helmet with a T-shaped visor, and has long dark hair. His Marine coat is white with red wrist cuffs and a pair of steel pads that are positioned on his shoulders. Beneath this, he wears a gray suit with brown pants and a lighter gray shirt beneath the suit. Around his waist, he wears a gigantic fur belt that seems to be where he sheathes his battle-axe. Lonz's face was briefly shown when Whitebeard shattered his helmet with a quake bubble, but it was barely visible for the few seconds it was seen.

Name: Lord of the Coast
description: The Lord of the Coast[1] is a Sea King that inhabits the waters of Dawn Island, typically near Foosha Village.[6] He is classified as a Type C creature, "Big Savage".[7]
appareance: The Lord of the Coast is fairly small in size compared to other Sea Kings.[8] However, he is still large enough to swallow a grown man whole.

Name: Louis Arnote
Note: Mentioned only character. He was first mentioned in Chapter 115.
description: Louis Arnote is an explorer and one of the people whose adventures are recorded in Brag Men, a book of Grand Line tales.[1]
appareance: Arnote is famous for giving Little Garden its name.[1] Though implied to be a true tale due to its inclusion in Brag Men, it is considered by the rest of the world to be a mere fantasy.[3] Arnote has also visited Elbaph and written a description of its grandeur, though he warned people not to overstay their welcome for unknown reasons.[4]

Name: Lucky Roux
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 5.
description: Lucky Roux[6] is one of the Senior Officers, and the cook of the Red Hair Pirates.[7][8][4]
appareance: Lucky Roux has a round body shape, and he is always seen eating a rack of meat. He is shown wearing goggles over his eyes at all times. Out of the entire crew, he appears to have changed the least over the years and shows little in the way of aging. In every appearance, Roux is smiling happily no matter how serious the situation is, such as Shanks clashing with Whitebeard.

Name: Lu Feld
Note: His name was first mentioned by a resident of Nuts Island in Chapter 859.
description: Lu Feld,[6] known as the "God of Fortune", is the "Loan Shark King" (闇金王, Yamikin-Ō?). He is a member of the Lu Feld Conglomerate (ルフェルド財閥, Ru Ferudo Zaibatsu?),[2] the former financer of MADS,[3] and an emperor of the Underworld.[1]
appareance: Lu Feld is a rotund man with large ears, nose, and lips, and a scar between his eyes. His teeth are rounded and have large gaps between them. His hair is arranged in cornrows, alternating between blonde and dark, and he wears a small pair of glasses and smokes a cigar. He wears a vivid purple suit with a rose attached to his left breast, as well as a dark purple fur coat.[1]

Name: Lulis
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Lulis[3] is a marine angelfish mermaid[4] and is an employee at Mermaid Cafe.[2]
appareance: Lulis without her diving mask.

Name: Machvise
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 702.
description: Machvise[1] is an officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Diamante Army.[6]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Macro
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook. He was formally introduced in Chapter 492.
description: Macro is a pelican eel fish-man and the captain of the Macro Pirates.[2] He first appeared in Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll cover story.[1] He was also a member of the Sun Pirates.[3]
appareance: Macro as a member of the Sun Pirates.

Name: Macro
Note: Cover story character. His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Colonel Macro[2] is one of the automata created on Karakuri Island by Dr. Tsukimi. Colonel Macro was first introduced in the cover story of Enel's Great Space Operations.
appareance: Macro in the digital colored manga.

Name: Madilloman
description: Madilloman is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Madilloman is a very large muscular man with a somewhat hunched appearance. He has a long and thin bald head and possesses a long round black beard that is consistent in length from one ear to the other. He wears a tiny gray vest held up by a large buckle that runs across his chest, dark pants, pinkish gloves and shoes with a long lining of fur on the tops with bandages around the knees. Due to his consumption of an armadillo SMILE, he carries a purple armadillo's shell on his back, with a large tail and small hindlegs being visibly attached on the back.[1]

Name: Mag
Note: He is named in Chapter 1143, but only individually identified in Chapter 1147.
description: Mag is a student at the Walrus School on Elbaph.[1]
appareance: Mag is a young boy with short light-colored hair rising from the top of his head. He is much larger than the other Walrus School children, towering over all of them. He wears a fur cloak with no shirt and a pair of goggles.

Name: Magellan
Note: He was first mentioned by Hannyabal in Chapter 526.
description: Magellan[3] is the vice warden of Impel Down.[2] He was formerly the chief warden,[1] but after his failure to stop the jail's one and only mass-breakout, he was replaced by Hannyabal and demoted to vice warden.[2]
appareance: He is the main antagonist during the Impel Down Arc.

Name: Magra
Note: His name was revealed by Curly Dadan in Chapter 584. He was formally identified in Chapter 587.
description: Magra is a member of the Dadan Family that are active on Mt. Colubo on Dawn Island. He helped take care of Ace and Luffy for Garp.
appareance: Magra's overall appearance resembles that of a chicken. He has what appears to be a wattle on his chin, and a comb on his bald head. He has a mustache and sideburns, and big eyelashes, similar to Franky's. He's always seen with a rather worried look on his face.

Name: Maha
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1041.
description: Maha[3] is a masked agent of CP0.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Maidy
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Maidy[3] is a servant of the Nefertari Family, working as a lady's maid in Alubarna Palace.[2]
appareance: Maidy is a middle-aged woman with short brown hair and dark eyes. She wears a purple short-sleeved dress with white frills around the neck and sleeves, a white hat with an intricate cream-colored design on the front, and round cream-colored earrings.[2]

Name: Maki
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Maki is a member of the Blackbeard Pirates.[2]
appareance: Maki in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Makino
description: Makino is a bartender from Monkey D. Luffy's home town, Foosha Village. She is the owner of Partys Bar and the mother of an unknown child.[1][2]
appareance: Makino is a young woman of average height with brown eyes and black hair (dark green in the anime) that goes up to just above her shoulders. When she was first introduced, ten years before the current storyline, she wore a yellow kerchief, an orange blouse with black sleeves and a long light blue skirt and orange sneakers with white soles. Although her clothing changes with her appearances, they are usually similar to the ones she was introduced with. By the time she met Ace, she wore a white blouse with no sleeves, and underneath it a pink-striped shirt.[1]

Name: Makino's Child
Note: Their moniker was officialized in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Makino's child is an unnamed baby born to Makino and an unknown man during the two-year timeskip.[1][3]
appareance: The child is a small baby with short, dark green hair. It wears a yellow hooded bodysuit which covers its entire body apart from the hands and head. In the Digitally Colored Manga, its hair is dark brown and the bodysuit light blue.

Name: Makko
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Ensign Makko[2] is a senior member of Hina's death squad who was on one of the ships that attacked the Straw Hat Pirates as they fled Arabasta.[1]
appareance: Makko has a shaved head with a semicircle hairline. He has been sporting this hairstyle since his days as a young Marine. He also has a thick scar on the right side of his forehead that did not exist before he enlisted in the Marines. In addition, he has what appear to be three lines at the bottom of each of his eyes, which may be his eyelashes. He sports a Marine coat and shirt that is standard among Marine officers.

Name: Manboshi
description: Manboshi[5] is an opah merman and the third son of the royal Neptune Family on Fish-Man Island.[2]
appareance: Manboshi is a rotund, stocky and large merman (shown when he spoke with Madame Shyarly). Like his brothers, he has a polka dot tail, with a black variation along with white polka dots and red scales. He also has brown hair and red fins on his head.

Name: Mani
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Mani was a combatant of the Bellamy Pirates.[2][1]
appareance: She is a curly-haired, dark-skinned woman with thick lips and dark colored eyes. She sports a long sleeve white collar shirt decorated with blue feathers, dark purple pants and sandals.[1]

Name: Manjaro
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Manjaro[4] is a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew and masqueraded as Roronoa Zoro.[2] When the crew switched to posing as the Kid Pirates, Manjaro impersonated Heat.[5]
appareance: Manjaro's disguise as Heat.

Name: Manmayer Gunko
Note: Her given name was revealed in Chapter 1136, and her full name was revealed in the volume version of Chapter 1137.
description: Saint Gunko of the Manmayer Family is a World Noble and a member of the God's Knights.[2][3]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a major antagonist in the Elbaph Arc.

Name: Mansherry
description: Mansherry[5] is a dwarf and the princess of the Tontatta Kingdom.[1] She is the daughter of Gancho, the king of the Tontatta Kingdom.
appareance: Mansherry has very thick and wavy blonde hair, partially tied up in two buns, that covers her body and tail. She wears a short white dress with stockings and shoes of the same color. Her eyes are light blue.

Name: Marco
description: Marco the Phoenix[6][11] is the former 1st division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.[2] Once starting out as an apprentice on the crew,[4] he eventually came to be Whitebeard's closest confidant and right-hand man.[12] After his captain's death during the Summit War of Marineford, Marco assumed leadership of the Whitebeard Pirates until the crew's disbandment following the Payback War.[13]
appareance: In the year since the disbandment, Marco worked as a doctor in Whitebeard's home village on Sphinx;[3] following the Raid on Onigashima, during which Marco acted as an ally to the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance, Marco permanently retired from piracy, returning to his duties as a doctor on Sphinx.[14] Marco is a major ally during the Marineford and Wano Country Arcs.

Name: Marcus Mars
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1086.
description: Saint Marcus Mars[3][4] is a World Noble and one of the Five Elders who publicly head the World Government,[1] holding the title of Warrior God of Environment.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is one of the secondary antagonists of the Egghead Arc. Along with the other Elders, he is one of the main antagonists of the Final Saga and one of the overarching antagonists of the One Piece series.

Name: Margarita
description: Margarita is the owner of the shadow that was inserted into Victoria Cindry's corpse twelve years ago.[1]
appareance: Margarita's full appearance.

Name: Marguerite
description: Marguerite[3] is a member of the Kuja tribe living on the island of Amazon Lily. She, along with Aphelandra and Sweet Pea, saved Luffy after he ate mushrooms that completely covered his body.[1] During the timeskip, she became a member of the Kuja Pirates.[2]
appareance: Marguerite is a young Kuja lady who is tall for her age. She has short, unruly blond hair, long slender legs, and a slim, curvaceous figure.

Name: Mari
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Mari[3] is the king of the Czacho Kingdom (チャコ王国, Chako Ōkoku?) and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2][3]
appareance: Mari is a middle-aged man with a large, triangular nose, prominent lips and a full beard. He appears to be balding, with hair only present at the sides of his head coupled with a pronounced forehead, although the anime gives him a head full of hair.

Name: Maria Napole
Note: Her name was announced by an unseen announcer in Chapter 649.
description: Maria Napole is a largehead hairtail mermaid[2] and a famous singer considered the pride of Fish-Man Island.[1]
appareance: Full-view of Maria Napole.

Name: Marianne
Note: Her real name was revealed in Vivre Card. Also known as Miss Goldenweek.
description: Marianne,[5] also known as the "Flag-Bearer of Freedom" and more commonly by her alias Miss Goldenweek, is a former officer agent of Baroque Works and the partner of Mr. 3.[4] She is currently working as a painter at the new Spider's Cafe alongside many of her former colleagues.[3]
appareance: She is the secondary antagonist of the Little Garden Arc and the protagonist in Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works".

Name: Marie
description: Marie is the thirteenth wife of Saint Charlos. Before being enslaved by Charlos, she worked as a nurse in the Sabaody Archipelago, and was the fiancée of Judy.[1]
appareance: Marie is a young woman with shoulder-length black hair and large dark eyes (depicted as dark brown in the anime). She is seen wearing a light pink nurse uniform that reached her upper thighs, with a red medical cross on the left side of her chest. She also wore a matching light pink nurse's cap, pink lipstick, a gold engagement ring on the middle finger of her right hand, and a pair of white pumps.[1]

Name: Marilyn
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 35.
description: Marilyn[2] is a woman that lives in Skypiea. She was Miss Skypiea forty-two years ago.
appareance: Marilyn is a rather chubby woman with dark brown curly hair. Part of her hair is put up like antennae like other Skypiean people. She wears a dark purple dress, with a black belt. She also wears dark red lipstick.[1]

Name: Marin
description: Marin is a male slave who was forced to dress as a mermaid by his owner.[1]
appareance: Marin is a large, overweight man. He dresses like a woman, with long blonde hair and makeup. He has stubble around his mouth and sports a swimsuit that covers his chest. He wears a fake mermaid tail, and has a slave chain around his neck.[1]

Name: Mario
description: Mario is a dog that tore off the arm of a toy citizen of Dressrosa.[1]
appareance: He is a brown dog, with floppy ears and a red studded collar.[1]

Name: Marlon
description: Don Marlon was a member of the Rocks Pirates and a mafia don from the West Blue. He joined Rocks D. Xebec after losing a Davy Back Fight.[1]
appareance: Marlon was a stocky man of large stature. His most prominent feature was a protruding, square jawline. He had squinty eyes, a scribbly mustache and full lips.

Name: Marshall D. Teach
Note: He was first mentioned in Drum Island in Chapter 133. He is formally introduced in Chapter 234. Most commonly referred to by his epithet Blackbeard.
description: Marshall D. Teach,[18] most commonly referred to by his epithet "Blackbeard",[2] is the admiral of the Blackbeard Pirates,[8] and one of the Four Emperors that rule over the New World.[3] He is the son of infamous pirate Rocks D. Xebec, which is only known to a small number of individuals, including his own crew and the Five Elders.[19][20] He is also the only known person in history to wield the powers of two Devil Fruits.[21]
appareance: Teach started out his pirate career as an apprentice of the Whitebeard Pirates, then later became a member of the crew's 2nd Division.[6] However, he murdered Thatch, the 4th Division Commander, in order to steal the Yami Yami no Mi, a rare darkness-based Logia Devil Fruit with the power to nullify the Devil Fruit abilities of others.[7] He then fled from Whitebeard's crew and, after defeating the infamous 2nd Division Commander Portgas D. Ace and handing him over to the Marines,[4] was awarded a position among the Seven Warlords of the Sea. He only held the position briefly, though, using it to infiltrate the great underwater prison Impel Down and escaping with multiple infamous Level 6 prisoners recruited into his crew. Upon arriving at the Summit War of Marineford,[5] he resigned from his position and murdered Whitebeard, mysteriously stealing his quake-generating power. This, along with his victory in the Payback War[22] and conquest of the majority of Whitebeard's territories during the timeskip, resulted in his acknowledgement as one of the Four Emperors, as well as him being considered a part of the "Worst Generation" along with the eleven Supernovas.[23] After the Rocky Port Incident, he turned the island of Hachinosu into his base of operations with the ambition of having it officially accepted into the World Government as the Blackbeard Kingdom.[24][25]

Name: Marumieta
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 47.
description: Marumieta is the only[3] daughter of Bimine, the mayor of Pucci.[2]
appareance: Marumieta has long light-colored hair tied in a curling ponytail. She wears a semi-formal dress and a tiara.[2] She had binoculars in both of her appearances.[1][4]

Name: Mash
description: Mash is a giant octopus that appeared in Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll.[1]
appareance: Mash is a giant octopus who wears mushroom-shaped hat.[3] Inside his hat, he has a compartment that he can store things in, such as the Takoyaki recipe and sauce.[4]

Name: Mashikaku
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Chief Petty Officer Mashikaku[4] is a subordinate of Smoker and Tashigi. However, it is unknown if he remained with the two after they transferred to G-5 as he is not seen with the G-5 Marines.
appareance: Mashikaku's facial structure resembles that of a monkey, with bushy brown hair and sideburns, tanned skin, and a square jaw. His signature features are his sideburns that are curved and pointed inwards towards his face and his mouth that is pointed upwards when closed. He wears the standard Marine shirt and cap. In the manga, he wears epaulettes which may serve to differentiate himself in rank as a Chief Petty Officer. In the anime, however, he lacks the epaulettes and so, in terms of uniform, looks no different from a common Marine sailor.[1]

Name: Masira
description: "Salvage King" Masira[4] is the boss (園長（ボス）, bosu?) of the Masira Pirates and the head of a simian ship salvage operation near Jaya Island. His sworn brother is Shoujou and both of them are members of the Saruyama Alliance, headed by Mont Blanc Cricket. He and Shoujou are both fans of Mont Blanc Noland's exploits and the fairy tale book based on them.
appareance: He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Jaya Arc.

Name: Masked Deuce
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.1.
description: Masked Deuce is an alias used by the first member of Ace's pirate crew, the Spade Pirates, usually referred to as just "Deuce" or "Deu". He abandoned his real name, which remains unknown, but is known to have come from a prominent East Blue family of medical professionals.[2] Despite nominally being the head of the crew besides Ace, Deuce could struggle being respected by the crew, often relying on Skull and Mihar, the crew's other officers.[3] Deuce also came to be referred to as "Doc" by at least Whitebeard after being integrated into the medical staff of the Whitebeard Pirates.[4]
appareance: In the non-canon One Piece episode A, Deuce became a journalist for "Big News" Morgans after the dissolution of the Whitebeard Pirates, specializing in the Straw Hat Pirates and the Revolutionary Army. Despite Morgans' protests, he refused to publicize his writings on Ace.[5]

Name: Massui
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Massui[2] is a Waiter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Massui is a muscular man with tan skin and a square jaw. He has a scar on the right side of his neck. Massui wears a dark blue cape with a brown fur collar, blue pants, and a brown belt with a gold and green buckle. He also wears a mask with bat ears on it, as he is not yet a Gifter.[1]

Name: Master
