Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: The Master[2] is a digger who works on an unnamed island in Paradise.[1]
appareance: The Master is an average-sized man with thick eyebrows, a stubble and prominent lips. His hair is short and curls inwards at the ends.

Name: Master of the Waters
description: The Master of the Waters is a large Sea King that inhabits the waters around Long Ring Long Land.[1]
appareance: The Master of the Waters is a giant yellow serpentine Sea King, with red spots and fins on its head and sides. It is huge, as all Sea Kings are. It has a lot of sharp, pointed teeth, two small eyes, a big tongue, and flat nostrils.[1]

Name: Mato
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1135.
description: Mato[3] is a giant bartendress from Elbaph.[1]
appareance: Mato's appearance as a child, 44 years ago.

Name: Matryosaka
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: The Matryo Princesses are the princesses of the Roshwan Kingdom.[1] Their names, in order from largest to smallest, are Matryosaka (マトリョーサカ?),[2] Matryosuka (マトリョースカ?),[3] Matryoseka (マトリョーセカ?),[4] and Matryosoka (マトリョーソカ?).[5]
appareance: The princesses heavily resemble matryoshka dolls, with each one being thickset and ranging in size. Matryosaka is the largest, followed by Matryosuka, Matryoseka, and Matryosoka. One spectator at Red Port called them "cute."

Name: Matryoseka
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: The Matryo Princesses are the princesses of the Roshwan Kingdom.[1] Their names, in order from largest to smallest, are Matryosaka (マトリョーサカ?),[2] Matryosuka (マトリョースカ?),[3] Matryoseka (マトリョーセカ?),[4] and Matryosoka (マトリョーソカ?).[5]
appareance: The princesses heavily resemble matryoshka dolls, with each one being thickset and ranging in size. Matryosaka is the largest, followed by Matryosuka, Matryoseka, and Matryosoka. One spectator at Red Port called them "cute."

Name: Matryosoka
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: The Matryo Princesses are the princesses of the Roshwan Kingdom.[1] Their names, in order from largest to smallest, are Matryosaka (マトリョーサカ?),[2] Matryosuka (マトリョースカ?),[3] Matryoseka (マトリョーセカ?),[4] and Matryosoka (マトリョーソカ?).[5]
appareance: The princesses heavily resemble matryoshka dolls, with each one being thickset and ranging in size. Matryosaka is the largest, followed by Matryosuka, Matryoseka, and Matryosoka. One spectator at Red Port called them "cute."

Name: Matryosuka
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: The Matryo Princesses are the princesses of the Roshwan Kingdom.[1] Their names, in order from largest to smallest, are Matryosaka (マトリョーサカ?),[2] Matryosuka (マトリョースカ?),[3] Matryoseka (マトリョーセカ?),[4] and Matryosoka (マトリョーソカ?).[5]
appareance: The princesses heavily resemble matryoshka dolls, with each one being thickset and ranging in size. Matryosaka is the largest, followed by Matryosuka, Matryoseka, and Matryosoka. One spectator at Red Port called them "cute."

Name: Matsuge
description: Matsuge[4] is a camel who accompanied the Straw Hat Pirates during the Arabasta Arc. He is classified as a Type-A creature, "Big Friendly".[5]
appareance: Matsuge is a light brown camel who wears a bridle and saddle. His saddle is square shaped, with a fur seat. Under the seat is a purple blanket, with a yellow stripe with an orange diamond pattern on it. There is also a silver seat with an orange cloth on it. Matsuge has noticeable eyelashes on the bottom of his eyes, which he is named after.

Name: Maujii
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Maujii[3] is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom and the aide of Princess Mansherry.[1]
appareance: Maujii's color scheme in the manga.

Name: Maynard
description: Maynard the Pursuer is a vice admiral who appears in the Dressrosa Arc. He was registered as a gladiator to compete at the Corrida Colosseum for the Mera Mera no Mi, but was defeated before he could participate.[1]
appareance: Maynard is a muscular, broad-chested man with dark hair tied up in a wild ponytail that sticks out to one side. He also has a dark beard and a mustache.

Name: MAX Marx
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: MAX Marx[2] was a member of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Marx's concept art.

Name: Mayushika
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Mayushika[3] is one of the Shandia warriors who fought against Enel.
appareance: Mayushika is a bald, tanned man, with dark, red tattoos on his face, upper arms, chest, and knees. He has white wings on his back, like other Shandia, and wears a dirty, white cloth around his waist held up by a grey rope, and it hangs down to his feet. Under the cloth he wears a dark, brown, grass skirt. He also wears the same dial skates worn by Wyper. He carries a polearm that is attached to what appears to be massive, white, animal antlers.

Name: McGuy
description: "Thunder Lord" McGuy is an infamous New World pirate who allied with Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: McGuy has a long face with a big nose and prominent chin, along with a defined jawline and wavy blonde hair reaching to his waist, and a black mustache shaped like a lightning bolt. He sports a blue shirt with loose sleeves and ruffled edges under a black vest. Due to his legs not being visible enough in the manga, in the anime he was given dark bermuda shorts and an orange sash decorated by a silver colored ornament with a red jewel in it.

Name: McKinley
description: McKinley is a member of God's Guards (previously known as the White Berets), Skypiea's police force.[1] He initially serves as a minor antagonist in the Skypiea Arc, but later becomes an (indirect) ally to the Straw Hat Pirates.
appareance: McKinley is a tall, well-built Skypiean man who bears the typical wings, as well as a small scar under his left eye. He wears the standard White Beret uniform, consisting of the namesake beret, a short-sleeved shirt, cloud-patterned flared-hip jodhpurs, and black boots; his rank is distinguished by a cape-like overcoat, similar to those worn by pirate and Marine captains.[1]

Name: Meadows
description: Meadows participated in a competition at the Corrida Colosseum as a gladiator to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: A full body view of Meadows in the anime.

Name: Mecha-Shark
description: The Mecha-Shark is a cyborg shark created by Vegapunk[1] alongside the Sea Beast Weapons.
appareance: The Mecha-Shark is a massive, metallic shark, with jaws large enough to eat entire ships in one bite. It has round eyes, a pointed snout, and large, pointed teeth. Like a normal shark, its bottom side is a lighter color than its dark top half. Its fins are attached to its body with hinges and are marked with the number “03.” It has the word “VEGAPUNK” branded on the side of its abdomen, and a star-shaped symbol on its tail.[1]

Name: Megalo
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Megalo is a shark that lives on Fish-Man Island. He is the beloved pet of princess Shirahoshi[3] and former pet of the Neptune Army.[2]
appareance: Megalo is a black shark with a white underbelly. He wears a shirt from the Criminal fashion line.

Name: Mero
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 65.
description: Mero is a smelt-whiting mermaid and an employee of the Mermaid Cafe.[2][1]
appareance: Mero is a young mermaid with long, flowing blue hair, with a yellow flower attached to the right side and blue eyes. She wears a revealing purple flower pattern bikini. Her fishtail has the color of pearl blue.[1]

Name: Merry
Note: His name was revealed by Kaya in Chapter 31.
description: Merry is Kaya's butler, and the original designer of the Going Merry.
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Syrup Village Arc.

Name: Mezasuzowan Pisuo
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Mezasuzowan Pisuo[2] is a member of the Germ Pirates.[1]
appareance: Pisuo in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Michael
Note: He was first mentioned by Tilestone in Chapter 366.
description: Michael and Hoichael are two troublemaker children in the backstreets of Water 7. They idolize Franky, and even dress like him and use his motto as their own: "Mm, super!!", and similarly idolize Paulie.[4] However, their backstreet delinquency has earned them ire from at least Tilestone and Peepley Lulu.[5] Before the timeskip, they were part of class 6-5 of the Water 7 Back Alley Elementary School (ウォーターセブン裏町小学校, Wōtā Sebun Uramachi Shōgakkō?, VIZ: "Water Seven Back Alley Elementary School") backstreet elementary school.[4]
appareance: Michael has short spiky hair. He wears a red vest with a green pattern that looks like grass. He also wears a yellow shirt underneath that has his name and a white circle. The middle of the circle has red and white.[4]

Name: Mihar
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: "Indoor" Mihar[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates and, subsequently, the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: Mihar is a tall man with tan skin, light blonde hair, thin limbs and slight shoulders. He has a tattoo on his left cheek. He wears a wide-brimmed, reddish-brown hat with a yellow band around the base of the crown, glasses, and a bright yellow, open jacket with a brown collar and cuffs. The sleeves of his jacket appear to be rolled up to his forearms. Underneath the jacket, he wears a white, low-cut shirt. His hands are covered in yellow gloves, and he wears pink shorts with a dark belt and dark boots. Over the belt, he has a blue sash with a swirling pattern in orange and white.

Name: Mikazuki
description: Mikazuki[3] is the captain and only named member of the Big Helmet Pirates. He has a bounty of 36,000,000.[1]
appareance: He wears a large spherical helmet similar to Kokoro's, apart from the fact that it has a crescent moon on it. He also has large canine teeth resembling a demon. His facial appearance is that of a middle aged man and his hair color is white.[1]

Name: Mikio Itoo
Note: Joke character.
description: Mikio Itoo is a background joke character created by Eiichiro Oda, and arguably the first Easter Egg featured in One Piece.[4]
appareance: He is a caricature of Mikio Ito (いとうみきお, Itō Mikio?), a Yokohama-born manga creator whom Oda knew as a fellow assistant to Nobuhiro Watsuki. Like Oda, Ito went on to publish his own series in Weekly Shonen Jump, such as Normandy Secret Club and Mysterious Murasame-kun.

Name: Mikita
Note: Her name was first revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: "Courier" Mikita,[5] more commonly known by her alias Miss Valentine,[1] is a former officer agent who was partnered with Mr. 5.[2] As of now, she is currently working as a chocolate lady alongside most of the other Baroque Works members at the new Spiders Cafe.
appareance: She is one of the main antagonists of the Whisky Peak Arc and a major antagonist of the Little Garden Arc.

Name: Miles
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Miles is a trumpetfish merman[2] and a trumpeter in a swing jazz orchestra from Fish-Man Island.[1]
appareance: Mile's appearance in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Milky
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 82. First seen via photo in Chapter 807.
description: Milky[3] is a reindeer mink and a member of the Guardians.[2]
appareance: Milky's full appearance.

Name: Millet Pine
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Millet Pine[4] was the torturer (拷問係, gōmon-gakari?)[3] of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution.[1]
appareance: Pine is a very short man with light hair and a large beard. He wears a horned helmet with the right horn broken off, a dark shirt and light trousers with a large belt.[1] Overall, he resembles the typical figure of a viking.

Name: Milo
Note: He was first introduced as Onepoco. His real name was revealed in Chapter 743.
description: Milo is a citizen of Dressrosa. While he was a toy, he was known as "Onepoco".[1]
appareance: Milo as Onepoco.

Name: Minatomo
Note: Joke character. He was first mentioned in SBS Volume 7.
description: Minatomo-san is a traveling carpenter (in)famously obsessed with repairing any broken door he sees. A native of Wano Country, he left with Shimotsuki Kouzaburou and Furiko 55 years ago and resettled in the East Blue.[3] One of his relatives, also known as Minatomo, remains in Wano.[4]
appareance: He originated in the SBS as a joke used by Eiichiro Oda to "explain" an art oversight in Chapter 1 (namely, a door at Partys Bar reappearing intact minutes after Higuma kicked off its hinges).[1][5] Since then, the anime has periodically used him as an Easter Egg (not unlike Pandaman) in crowd shots and the like.[2] Interestingly, he has never appeared in the manga proper, with even an identical carpenter in the Wano Country Arc identified as a separate person.

Name: Minatomo
description: Minatomo is a legendary carpenter in Wano Country and the leader of a guild that Franky joined to get access to the blueprints of Kaidou's fortress.[2] He is related to another person, whose name is also Minatomo, who is a descendant of someone who traveled from Wano to East Blue.[3]
appareance: Minatomo's anime concept art.

Name: Minister of the Left
description: The Minister of the Left is a catfish merman in service of King Neptune. While it is not clear what his job entails, it appears to involve some sort of administrative and military duties. His actual name is currently unknown.
appareance: The Minister of the Left is a short, rather rotund merman with light blond waist-length hair. He has a long beard and, like a catfish, two large whiskers for a mustache.

Name: Minister of the Right
description: The Minister of the Right is a seahorse merman in service to King Neptune. While it is not clear exactly what his job entails, he appears to have some administrative and military duties. He also appears to be a guard or commander as he and the other guards hurried to the princess when she needed help. His actual name is unknown.
appareance: He is a seahorse merman, having ridges along his back and the sides of his face, as well as a curly orange tail like a seahorse rather than a standard merman's fishtail. His mouth also protrudes forwards like a seahorse's.

Name: Minochihuahua
Note: Cover story character.
description: Minochihuahua is the newest Jailer Beast in Impel Down. He is a Zoan Devil Fruit user who ate a fruit that allows him to turn into a chihuahua.
appareance: In his Zoan form, Minochihuahua is a giant bipedal chihuahua with small eyes, a runny nose, and wears shorts. Unlike the other guards, he is clothed on his upper-body and wears a tangzhuang. He also wears a chain wrapped around the left hip of his shorts, headphones around his neck, and spiked bracelets.[1]

Name: Minokoala
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 533.
description: Minokoala is one of the five Jailer Beasts of Impel Down. He is an "awakened" Zoan Devil Fruit user that ate a fruit that allows him to turn into a koala.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Impel Down Arc.

Name: Minorhinoceros
description: Minorhinoceros is one of the five Jailer Beasts of Impel Down. He is an "awakened" Zoan Devil Fruit user, having eaten a Devil Fruit that allows him to turn into a blue rhinoceros.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Impel Down Arc.

Name: Minoruba
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Minoruba[3] is a bounty hunter on Sabaody Archipelago.[1]
appareance: Minoruba is a rather pudgy man with brown hair parted to form both a small mohawk and a neck-length hair style, who wears a black coat and plaid pants. He also has notably visible stubble around his chin and lips.[1]

Name: Minotaurus
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 532.
description: Minotaurus is one of the five Jailer Beasts in Impel Down and the first one to appear. He is an "awakened" Zoan Devil Fruit user who ate a fruit that allows him to turn into a Holstein cow.[2]
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Impel Down Arc.

Name: Minozebra
description: Minozebra is one of the five Jailer Beasts of Impel Down.[3] He is an "awakened" Zoan Devil Fruit user that ate a fruit that allows him to turn into a zebra.[4]
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Impel Down Arc.

Name: Misery
description: Misery is a homie created by Big Mom as an attack during the Raid on Onigashima. She is formed from the Maser Saber combination of Prometheus, Hera, and Napoleon.[1]
appareance: Misery takes the form of a giant phantom-like woman composed of flames and lightning. She has long, flowing hair, a pointy nose, and sharp nails. Lightning forms bracelet-like circles around her wrists and the bottom half of her body is one long tail without legs.

Name: Mishoin Cashible
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Mishoin Cashible[2] is a salesman based in Water 7 who rents bulls to ferry people around the canals.[1]
appareance: Cashible is an average-sized, somewhat thickset man. He has a pig-like nose and has long, unkempt black hair, a thin mustache, and a goatee; he wears a small pair of glasses that rest on his nose well below his eyeline. He wears a casual v-neck button down shirt and dark pants.[1]

Name: Miss Catherina
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Miss Catherina[6] is a former Baroque Works Millions agent who was stationed at Whisky Peak alongside her partner, Mr. Beans.[7] She worked under the Frontier Agents Mr. 8, Miss Monday, Mr. 9 and Miss Wednesday.[3]
appareance: Miss Catherina's color scheme in the Manga.

Name: Miss Father's Day
description: Miss Father's Day was a Frontier Agent, who along with Mr. 7, was part of the "sniping" pair who apparently are deployed for jobs by the Baroque Works where sniping is necessary.[1] Due to her actions, she is a minor antagonist in the Arabasta Arc.
appareance: Miss Father's Day's concept art from the anime.

Name: Miss Friday
description: Miss Friday is a vulture and a member of the criminal organization Baroque Works, being a part of The Unluckies (13日の金曜日（アンラッキーズ）, Anrakkīzu?) along with Mr. 13. They were a team that served as messengers for Mr. 0 and were also responsible for executing any Baroque Works agents that fail their missions.[1] She is classified as Type D creatures, "Small Savage".[4]
appareance: Miss Friday is a large, black-feathered vulture, with white feathers toward the neck. Her skin is pink, and her beak is a light yellow. She wears a yellow aviator cap dotted with red flowers and black goggles.[1]

Name: Miss Monday
description: Miss Monday is the code name of a former frontier agent of Baroque Works and partner to Igaram (Mr. 8 at the time) during his infiltration of Baroque Works.[1] Due to her actions, she is a supporting antagonist in the Whisky Peak Arc. After the fall of Baroque Works, she stayed at Whisky Peak, and eventually bore a son with Mr. 9.[4]
appareance: Miss Monday is a tall, muscular woman with dark skin and pink hair pulled into short twin-tails. She wears a short dress with a magenta and white diamond pattern, and three green flowers.[1]

Name: Miss Mother's Day
Note: Mentioned only character. She was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 155.
description: Miss Mother's Day is the partner of Mr. 6 and a Frontier Agent in the Baroque Works rankings. She was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi,[1] who explained how Baroque Works was organized to the Straw Hat Pirates.
appareance: Miss Mother's Day's appearance is unknown, as neither she nor her partner are seen in the series.

Name: Miss Saturday
Note: Mentioned only character. She was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 155.
description: Miss Saturday is the partner of Mr. 12 and a Frontier Agent in the Baroque Works rankings. She was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi,[1] who explained how Baroque Works was organized to the Straw Hat Pirates.
appareance: Miss Saturday's appearance is unknown, as she was not seen in the series.

Name: Miss Thursday
Note: Mentioned only character. She was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 155.
description: Miss Thursday was the partner of Mr. 11 and a Frontier Agent of Baroque Works. She was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi during her explanation to the Straw Hat Pirates on the organization of Baroque Works.[1]
appareance: Miss Thursday's appearance is unknown, as she has not been seen in the series.

Name: Miss Tuesday
Note: Mentioned only character. She was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 155.
description: Miss Tuesday is the partner of Mr. 10 and a Frontier Agent in the Baroque Works rankings.
appareance: She was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi,[1] who explained how Baroque Works was organized to the Straw Hat Pirates. Neither she nor her partner are seen in the series, but a concept art of her is available.[2]

Name: Miyagi
description: Miyagi is a goat mink[1] and one of Inuarashi's subjects.[3]
appareance: Miyagi's concept art from the anime.

Name: Mizerka
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 997.
description: Mizerka is a Shinuchi in the Beasts Pirates.[2] During the raid on Onigashima, she was tamed by the power of the Kibi Kibi no Mi and joined the side of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[3]
appareance: Mizerka is a slim young woman of average height with shoulder-length blonde hair that has tips curve upwards and she has a pair of thin and straight light-colored horns on her head which point somewhat to the sides like other Gifters.

Name: Mizuira
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Mizuira[4] was a little girl from Ohara. She was the daughter of Oran and Roji, the niece of Nico Olvia, and the cousin of Nico Robin.
appareance: Mizuira was a little girl with a large smile. She had blonde curly hair, with a ribbon in it.

Name: Mizuta Madaisuki
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 53.
description: Mizuta Madaisuki was the older of the two Mizuta Twins, identical twin brothers of the Rumbar Pirates. He and his brother, Mawaritosuki, were identified by Oda in a SBS question. A fan asked why one of the Rumbar Pirates that died singing had a sword in his skull. Oda explained that this was because they were two identical pirates who died two separate ways.[1][2][3]
appareance: Full-body view of Mizuta Madaisuki.

Name: Mizuta Mawaritosuki
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 53.
description: Mizuta Mawaritosuki was the younger of the two Mizuta Twins, identical twin brothers of the Rumbar Pirates. He and his brother, Madaisuki, were identified by Oda in a SBS question. A fan asked why one of the Rumbar Pirates that died singing had a sword in his skull. Oda explained that this was because they were two identical pirates who died two separate ways.[1][2][3]
appareance: Mawaritosuki wears polka-dot shirt with blue dots. He also has brown hair with a front part that is long, goes up, and hangs down. As an identical twin, he and Madaisuki share all of the same physical characteristics, except for differences in clothing. Mawaritosuki has less dots on his shirt than Madaisuki.

Name: Moai
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Moai[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Moai is a large man with light colored hair tied in a ponytail. He wears a tattered light color tank top, a beaded neckless, a dotted bandana, a beaded belt and low hanging pants.

Name: MocDonald
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: MocDonald[3] was a Wild Zombie who lived on Thriller Bark.[4]
appareance: He was a tree who came to life after having a shadow put inside of it. He had what somewhat resembled a human face, with a long nose and a big mouth. He had human hands with a pair of roots acting as legs. He had a tiny shrub near his roots.

Name: Mocha
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 665.
description: Mocha is a little girl who was held captive on Punk Hazard.[1] She was freed with the rest of the children by the Straw Hat Pirates.
appareance: Mocha is much larger than an average little girl because of the experiments done to her. She has a large head that is not very proportionate to her body, big purple eyes, and wavy, unkempt, black hair.[1] She wore a white colored sleeveless dress during her time in the Biscuits Room and a coat outside when Kin'emon gave them all warm clothes.[3]

Name: Mochi
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Mochi[1] is a Skypiean on Angel Island and Moyle's son.
appareance: Apart from an average Skypiean appearance - two antennae and a set of wings - Mochi is a small boy with puffy brown hair. He wears a green tunic with pink hearts down his left side, along with a brown belt.

Name: Moda
Note: She made a cameo appearance in Episode 381 in a newspaper.
description: Moda is a milk maiden[6] from the Lulusia Kingdom that Ace met during his cover story. She is the daughter of Koda and Kyuji.
appareance: Following the destruction of her homeland, Moda was enlisted by the Revolutionary Army.

Name: Mohji
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 12.
description: Mohji the Beast Tamer[6] is a pirate and the first mate of the Buggy Pirates and a member of the Buggy and Alvida Alliance. He is a pet tamer, usually accompanied by his pet lion Richie.[3] He was a member of Buggy's Delivery, and now currently a member of Cross Guild.
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered the secondary antagonist of the Orange Town Arc, and a minor antagonist in the Loguetown Arc.

Name: Momonga
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook. He was formally introduced in Chapter 516.
description: Kent Williams (One Piece Film: Red)
appareance: Vice Admiral Momonga[5] is a Marine officer and the Base Commander of the G-1 Marine Base.[2] He was one of the five Vice Admirals who had led the Buster Call on Enies Lobby.[1]

Name: Momoo
description: Momoo[5] is a giant sea cow from the Grand Line, and the first Sea Beast seen in the series.[6][7] He is classified as a Type A creature, "Big Friendly".[8]
appareance: Originally, he was utilized by the Arlong Pirates as a method of intimidation towards the residents of the Conomi Islands. After Arlong's defeat, he was captured and employed as a draft animal by the Caribou Pirates.

Name: Monda
description: Monda is a Star Shark and is one of the pet animals of the Foxy Pirates.[1]
appareance: Monda is an orange shark with yellow stars on him in the upper side of his body. It wears a red mask-like hood with black stripes. In the manga his underbelly is dark orange.

Name: Monet
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 662.
description: Monet was a scout and assistant for Caesar Clown and his underlings in the research facility on Punk Hazard.[7] She was, in truth, a member and officer[3] of the Donquixote Pirates and was sent as a deep cover agent by Doflamingo.[2][8] She was also the older sister of Sugar.[9]
appareance: Due to her mission and actions, she could be regarded as the tertiary antagonist of the Punk Hazard Arc.

Name: Monjii
description: Monjii[2] is a monkey mink.[1]
appareance: Monjii is an elderly monkey mink with long, white eyebrows and a mustache connected to a chest-length beard. He wears a dark cloak, a hat, and baggy striped pants.[1]

Name: Monjiro
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Monjiro is a samurai who allied with the Kouzuki Family.[3] After waiting 20 years for the return of the Nine Red Scabbards, he affiliated with the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance to raid Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Monjiro is a short man with droopy eyes, a wide nose, and a green mustache that covers his mouth. He also has green hair with long, bushy sideburns and green eyebrows. Monjiro wears a green kimono with blue hakama. He also wears a red beaded necklace and a black sugegasa hat with a white chin strap, and he carries a box on his back.[1] He has a reverse crescent moon tattoo on his ankle.[3]

Name: Monkey D. Dragon
Note: His full name was revealed by Monkey D. Garp in Chapter 432.
description: Monkey D. Dragon,[10] also known as the "Rebellious Dragon",[7] is the infamous supreme commander[6] of the Revolutionary Army (originally the Freedom Fighters).[3] A former Marine, his discontent with the organization's outlook on justice—particularly after the Ohara Incident—led him to oppose the World Government in its entirety.[4] Having campaigned toward its overthrow over thirty years, he is currently labeled the "World's Worst Criminal".[5]
appareance: Dragon is the father of Monkey D. Luffy and the son of Monkey D. Garp, and likewise born in the Goa Kingdom.[2] He was also responsible for saving Sabo's life after a World Noble attack, eventually raising the boy into his second-in-command.

Name: Monkey D. Garp
Note: He is formally introduced in Chapter 432.
description: Monkey D. Garp,[12] also known as "Garp the Fist",[7] is an extremely famous and powerful Marine Vice Admiral. He is the father of Monkey D. Dragon,[13] the paternal grandfather of Monkey D. Luffy,[14] and the adoptive grandfather of Portgas D. Ace. He was responsible for overseeing Ace's birth and raising a young Luffy, before entrusting them both to the Dadan Family.
appareance: A contemporary of Gol D. Roger in his prime, Garp came to be known as the only Marine that could seriously challenge the Pirate King, with feats to match; his participation in the God Valley Incident, in particular, won him the title "Hero of the Marines". His prestigious career has not only afforded him multiple promotion offers to Admiral, but the freedom to refuse (due to his deep hatred and contempt for World Nobles) without consequence.[15] At the same time, he has mentored many younger Marines into prominence, including once-Admiral Kuzan and SWORD members Koby and Helmeppo.[16]

Name: Monkey D. Luffy
description: Straw Hat Grand Fleet;Four Emperors;Clan of D.;Dadan Family (former);Baratie (temporary, former);[3]Impel Down (former);Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance (disbanded)
appareance: Luffy-tarou[6] (ルフィ太郎, Rufitarō?, English versions: "Luffytaro")[7]Luffy-no-Umi (ルフィの海, Rufinoumi?)[8]Joy Boy (ジョイボーイ, Joi Bōi?)[9]

Name: Monster
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Monster[7] is one of the Senior Officers and musicians[5] of the Red Hair Pirates.[4] He first appeared playing with his crew at the Partys Bar.[2]
appareance: Monster is a relatively large monkey with tiny eyes and head fur tied up into a topknot. Like many monkeys, he has brown fur over most of his body, but has white fur on his stomach, face and hands.[2]

Name: Mont Blanc Cricket
description: Mont Blanc Cricket[2] is an inhabitant of Jaya, living in a small home behind the façade of a castle. He is the distant descendant of Mont Blanc Noland[4] and the "Last Boss" (最終園長（ラストボス）, Rasuto Bosu?) of the Saruyama Alliance.[1]
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Jaya Arc, and led the Saruyama Alliance in helping them reach Skypiea.

Name: Mont Blanc Noland
Note: He was first mentioned in a book in Chapter 227.
description: Mont Blanc Noland[2] was an admiral (提督, Teitoku?) in the Lvneel Kingdom[3] and a famous explorer who made multiple trips into the Grand Line. He discovered a city of gold on Jaya, but found upon returning there with Lvneel's king that it had disappeared, causing him to be executed. He was then memorialized in a fairy tale as a liar and trickster.
appareance: Noland was a brown haired man whose most distinct feature is a large chestnut on his head. This feature was passed down to his descendants.[4] He was a well built man who often wore a high-collared black coat, closed by a belt, and an orange scarf. Cricket was right to suggest that he is so far removed from the main family that he bares no resemblance to him at all. While Noland had tanned skin, Cricket is very pale; while he had brown hair, Cricket is blonde; and while Noland had a roundish nose and pleasant face, Cricket has a small pointed nose and a longish face.

Name: Moodie
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Moodie[4] is a woman who Fullbody took to the Baratie.[2]
appareance: Moodie is a relatively tall, slender woman, with blonde hair put back, with only two parts hanging down in front. She has brown eyes and wore light red lipstick. During the Baratie Arc, she wore a reddish-pink sleeveless dress that showed off her cleavage.[2]

Name: Moon Isaac Jr.
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Moon Isaac Jr.[3] was a member of the Roger Pirates and their tactical staff officer (戦術参謀, senjutsu sanbō?)[2] until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.[1]
appareance: Isaac's concept art.

Name: Moqueca
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Moqueca[3] is the king of the Samba Kingdom (サンバ王国, Sanba Ōkoku?) in the South Blue and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2][3]
appareance: Moqueca is a short, rotund middle-aged man with a thin mustache. He wears a frilly shirt, a bead necklace, robes and a colorful, feathered hat resembling a palm tree.

Name: Morgan
Note: He was first mentioned by Helmeppo in Chapter 3.
description: "Axe-Hand" Morgan[4] is a former Marine captain, the father of Helmeppo and the first significant Marine officer to appear in the storyline.[1] After his defeat by Monkey D. Luffy and Roronoa Zoro, he was stripped of his rank for his many abuses of power.
appareance: He is the third antagonist of the Romance Dawn Arc, serving as the main antagonist of the Shells Town subsection. He is also the main antagonist of the Diary of Koby-Meppo cover-page serial.

Name: Morgans
Note: He was first mention by a King Soldier in Chapter 859.
description: "Big News" Morgans is the president of the World Economy News Paper and one of the emperors of the Underworld.[3]
appareance: His first appearance was during the Whole Cake Island Arc, as one of the more high-profile guests in Big Mom's Tea Party. Since then, Morgans has been a frequent figure in the world's ongoings, usually by being the first to report on them to the general public.

Name: Morley
Note: She first appeared as a silhouette in Chapter 801.
description: Morley of Fur is a giant and a newkama,[4] as well as the commander of the West Army in the Revolutionary Army.[1]
appareance: Morley's existence was first alluded by Emporio Ivankov during the Impel Down Arc, as the one responsible for the creation of Newkama Land.[5]

Name: Mornin
description: Mornin[2] is the mayor of Syrup Village, and one of several villagers who used Usopp's antics as a makeshift alarm clock.
appareance: Mornin is an old man who is bald on the top with gray hair on the sides and back of his head. He has a curved pointed nose and a gray mustache. He also wears a collared shirt and round-shaped glasses.

Name: Mororon
description: Mororon is the queen of the Tajine Kingdom and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[1]
appareance: Mororon is a slender and regal-looking woman with teal eyes. Her pale blonde hair is gathered in an updo with sidelocks that curl at her cheeks and a thinner lock of hair on each side of her face that reach pass her shoulders.

Name: Mosa
description: Mosa is a mysterious friend of Loki.[1]
appareance: Nothing is known about Mosa's features as the character has yet to make an appearance.

Name: Mosh
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Mosh[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Mosh is a very large man, comparable to Jean Bart in size.[1] His hair is light-colored and arranged in a ponytail, with a prominent bang covering the left side of his face. He wears a feathered coat adorned with spikes at the shoulders (similar to Kid's own captain coat before the timeskip) and a shirt with the picture of a guitar printed on it.

Name: Motobaro
description: Motobaro is the pet bison of Duval.[1] He is used by Duval as a steed, and can also swim on water.
appareance: Motobaro is a very large bison, with relatively small limbs and short horns in contrast with his big head and body. Typically, Motobaro is ridden by Duval with a special saddle. Aside from the side pockets where Duval's harpoon cartridges can be stored on it, there are motorcycle handle bars similar to those worn by the flying fish of Duval's men. With these, Duval rides Motobaro as if he's riding a large motorcycle. When traversing across water, Motobaro is fitted with a special breathing apparatus that resembles the front of truck with two exhaust pipes at the side.[4]

Name: Mottled
Note: Their name was revealed in Episode 567's credits.
description: Mottled[1][4] is a Sea King.[2] It is one of the six Sea Kings that speak to Shirahoshi when she fully manifests the power of Poseidon.[5]
appareance: Mottled is a large Sea King that resembles a massive moray eel. Its dorsal fin is light blue while its body features a signature black and white mottled pattern.[2]

Name: Motzel
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 8.
description: Mr. Motzel[3] is a gourmand and one of the known customers of the Baratie.[1]
appareance: Motzel is an overweight man, with large lips and brown hair (grey in the anime) that is curled up. He has a flat nose, round eyes, and thick eyebrows. He wears a purple shirt, with either a swirl or floral design.

Name: Mounblutain
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Mounblutain[4] was a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew who masqueraded as Sogeking.[2]
appareance: Mounblutain wearing his Sogeking mask in the anime.

Name: Mountain God
Note: It was named Yama-san by Kouzuki Oden in Chapter 963.
description: The Mountain God, respectfully called Yama-san (山さん, Yama-san?, VIZ Media: Yama) by Kouzuki Oden and his retainers,[2] is a giant boar that lived in the forests of Wano Country as late as thirty years ago. In what became known as the Mountain God Incident, it was cut down by Kouzuki Oden during its attack on Flower Capital,[4] but it ultimately survived the ordeal.[2] It later became a retainer of the Kouzuki Family alongside its child, Koyama.[3]
appareance: The Mountain God is an enormous white boar the size of an entire mountain. It has two large tusks and a bunch of sharp teeth that stick out from its lower lip.

Name: Mountain Ricky
description: Mountain Ricky[1] is a former member of the Foxy Pirates. He fought George Mach before the third round of the Davy Back Fight.[1]
appareance: Ricky is a short, fat man with a stubby nose, missing teeth and curly dark hair. He wears boxing gloves, shorts, elbow sweat bands, and the typical Foxy Pirate mask.

Name: Mouseman
description: Mouseman is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates. He resides in Bakura Town.[1]
appareance: Mouseman's anime concept art.

Name: Mousse
description: Mousse was the daughter of Kalgara and Herb[3] and was considered the most beautiful of the Shandia women on the island of Jaya four hundred years ago.[4]
appareance: Mousse's concept art from the anime.

Name: Mouthto Mouthyan
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Mouthto Mouthyan[2] is a citizen of Dressrosa.[1]
appareance: Mouthyan is a young, blonde man who wears a blue shirt. Because of Kyuin, he ended with a large lipstick mark over his face.

Name: Moyle
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Moyle[4] is a Skypiean and the father of Mochi. He originally worked for Gan Fall in the Divine Squad, but after Enel took over, he and the other members were forced to work in God's Army[3] until they were betrayed and almost killed.[5]
appareance: Moyle's appearance in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Mozambia
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Vice Admiral Mozambia[3] is a high ranking Marine Officer who attended the meeting with the Seven Warlords of the Sea to discuss the issue with Crocodile's replacement.
appareance: A younger Mozambia in the Marines.

Name: Mozu
description: Mozu and Kiwi, also known as the Square Sisters due to their square-like hairstyle, are two members of the Franky Family very loyal to Franky, who went with him everywhere and tended to mimic every pose he did.[2]
appareance: They are both allies of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 and beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc (starting off as minor antagonists in the former). Currently, they jointly manage Blueno's old bar in Water 7.[6]

Name: Mr. 6
Note: Mentioned only character. He was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 155.
description: Mr. 6 is the partner of Miss Mother's Day and the top Frontier Agent in the Baroque Works rankings. He was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi, who explained how Baroque Works was organized to the Straw Hat Pirates.[1]
appareance: Mr. 6's appearance is unknown, as neither him nor his partner are seen in the series. It is assumed that the number 6 plays a major part of his design, similar to the other Frontier Agents' designs.

Name: Mr. 7
Note: He was first mentioned by Daz Bonez and Zala in Chapter 190.
description: Mr. 7 was a frontier agent of Baroque Works. He died on duty when he attempted to forcefully recruit Roronoa Zoro to the organization.[2] His position was filled by the next Mr. 7.
appareance: The first known Mr. 7 was a round headed man with a number seven tattoo on his left cheek.[1]

Name: Mr. 7
description: Mr. 7 is a former Frontier Agent of Baroque Works, being half of a sniper duo along with his partner, Miss Father's Day. He replaced the previous agent of the same codename when the latter died in the line of duty.[2] Due to his actions, he is a minor antagonist in the Arabasta Arc.
appareance: Mr. 7's concept art from the anime.

Name: Mr. 9
description: Mr. 9 is the code name of a former Frontier Agent and bounty hunter of Baroque Works, and Miss Wednesday's former assigned partner during her infiltration.[2] Due to his actions, he is one of the main antagonists of the Reverse Mountain Arc, and a supporting antihero in the Whisky Peak Arc.  After the fall of Baroque Works, he stayed at Whisky Peak, and eventually bore a son with Miss Monday.[4]
appareance: Mr. 9 is a young man who wears a golden crown on top of his red hair and has his agent number written on his cheeks. He wears a green suit with white lace along with a ruffled red scarf. His attire makes him look like a prince or a king, but he is neither.

Name: Mr. 10
Note: Mentioned only character. He was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 155.
description: Mr. 10 is the partner to Miss Tuesday and a Frontier Agent in the Baroque Works rankings.
appareance: He was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi,[1] who explained how Baroque Works was organized to the Straw Hat Pirates. Neither him nor his partner are seen in the series, but concept art of him does exist.[2]

Name: Mr. 11
description: Mr. 11 was a Frontier Agent for Baroque Works[1] and the partner of Miss Thursday.[4]
appareance: Mr. 11's face close-up.

Name: Mr. 12
Note: Mentioned only character. He was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 155.
description: Mr. 12 is the partner of Miss Saturday and a Frontier Agent in the Baroque Works rankings. He was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi, who explained how Baroque Works was organized to the Straw Hat Pirates.[1]
appareance: Mr. 12's appearance is unknown, as neither him nor his partner are seen in the series. It is assumed that the number 12 plays a major part of his design, similar to the other Frontier Agents designs.

Name: Mr. 13
description: Mr. 13 is an otter and a member of the criminal organization Baroque Works, being a part of The Unluckies (13日の金曜日（アンラッキーズ）, Anrakkīzu?) along with Miss Friday. They were a team that served as messengers for Mr. 0 and were also responsible for executing any Baroque Works agents that fail their missions.[1] He is classified as Type D creatures, "Small Savage".[4]
appareance: Mr. 13 is a small, brown-furred otter with white fur around his snout. He wears a long-sleeved, light blue jumpsuit with purple dots, as well as black sunglasses.[1]

Name: Mr. Beans
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Mr. Beans[5] is a former Baroque Works Millions agent who was stationed at Whisky Peak alongside his partner, Miss Catherina.[6] He worked under the Frontier Agents Mr. 8, Miss Monday, Mr. 9 and Miss Wednesday.[2]
appareance: Mr. Beans is a small boy with short blonde hair. He wears light green shorts, brown shoes, and a white short sleeve shirt with a "Wanted" picture of Pandaman.[1][4]

Name: Mr. Love
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Mr. Love[2] is one of Baroque Works' Billions[citation needed] who posed as a member of the Rebel Army.[1]
appareance: Mr. Love in the Colored Manga.

Name: Mr. Mellow
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Mr. Mellow is one of the only identified members of Baroque Works' Billions.[3]
appareance: He is apparently the leader of at least some of the Billions, as he ordered an unsuccessful attack on Portgas D. Ace and oversaw the murder of Mr. 11.[4][2]

Name: Mr. Momora
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Mr. Momora[2] was a member of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Mr. Momora's concept art.

Name: Mr. Sacrifice
Note: Mentioned only character. His name was seen on a gravestone on Whisky Peak.

Name: Mr. Shimizu
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Mr. Shimizu[5] was a Baroque Works Millions agent stationed at Whisky Peak. He worked under the Frontier Agents Mr. 8, Miss Monday, Mr. 9 and Miss Wednesday.[2]
appareance: Mr. Shimizu a man with short black hair with a stubble on his upper lip and chin. He wears a white shirt and a rope around his forehead.

Name: Muchana
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Muchana is a doctor who currently works in Impel Down's medical room.[2][1]
appareance: Muchana is a man with black hair who wears an Impel Down uniform that consists of a white suit, garnet gloves, a shirt with the Impel Down symbol on the lapels, and a black tie. Being part of the medical team, he wears a doctor's mask that covers part of his face, and a white cap with a small Impel Down symbol on one side.

Name: Muginn
description: Muginn is a giant raven that lives in the Land of Gods.[1]
appareance: Muginn is a massive raven, larger than a ship like the Thousand Sunny. It wears a proportionally large skull atop its head.[2]

Name: Mugren
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Colonel Mugren[2] was a member of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Mugren's concept art.

Name: Mukkashimi Tower
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 75.
description: Mukkashimi Tower[2] is a spectator at the Corrida Colosseum.[1]
appareance: Mukkashimi Tower at age 27.

Name: Mummy
description: Mummy is a sorcerer who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: A full body view of Mummy in the anime.

Name: Mummy Mee
Note: Her name was revealed in Blue databook.
description: Mummy Mee[2] is one of the houseparents, alongside Daddy Dee, of a World Government-affiliated orphanage situated on the Conomi Islands.[1]
appareance: Mummy Mee's initial appearance in the anime.

Name: Muret
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Muret was the doctor of the Bellamy Pirates.[3][2]
appareance: Muret in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Muti
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Muti[2] is Koala's mother.[1]
appareance: Muti is a middle-aged woman with long, wavy brown hair and a round face. She wears a windowpane sea green shirt and dark pants.

Name: Nakaiwa
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Nakaiwa[2] is a man who lived in the Wano Country 41 years ago.[1]
appareance: Nakaiwa in Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Nako
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Dr. Nako is a doctor from Cocoyasi Village.[1] He is an ally of The Straw Hat Pirates during the Arlong Park Arc.
appareance: Nako is an elderly man with a wrinkled face, grey hair, grey eyebrows, and a grey mustache and goatee. He wears a bandanna with a red cross, a common symbol for medical personnel (which is edited out in the 4Kids dub) and sunglasses. He wore a striped light green and dark green shirt under a doctor's coat with a red cross on the side of the right sleeve.

Name: Nami
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 9.
appareance: "Cat Burglar" Nami[12] is the navigator of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[4] She is the third member of the crew and the second to join, doing so during the Orange Town Arc.[20] She is the adoptive sister of Nojiko after the two were orphaned and taken in by Bell-mère.

Name: Namur
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 58.
description: Namur[4] is a fish-man and the former 8th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: Namur's concept art from the anime.

Name: Nanday
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Nanday[3] is the infant son of Mr. 9 and Miss Monday.[1]
appareance: Nanday is a small baby with messy black hair. He wears a light blue onesie and a golden crown over his head.

Name: Nangi
description: Nangi is a member of the Numbers in the Beasts Pirates, representing the number "seven".[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Napoleon
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 853.
description: Napoleon the Bicorne is a homie taking the form of a bicorne hat that is worn by Big Mom.[5] He can also become a sword homie that Big Mom uses in combat.[8] He is a special kind of homie, as he received a soul fragment from Big Mom herself,[5] and serves as one of her personal weapons alongside Prometheus and Hera, and formerly Zeus.
appareance: Napoleon is an extremely large pink bicorne hat with a Jolly Roger on the front; the Jolly Roger consists of a skull with yellow eyes, two crossed knives, and a curled white mustache. He emotes through the skull of the Jolly Roger, seeing with its eyes and talking with its mouth. Napoleon also has a yellow stripe around his top, and a fastener on his left side.[2][9]

Name: Nash
Note: Their name was revealed in Chapter 1145.
description: Nash is a giant shield homie that is owned by Goldberg of the New Giant Warrior Pirates.[1]
appareance: Nash in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Nashi
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Nashi[3] is the king of the Ringo Kingdom (リンゴ王国, Ringo Ōkoku?) and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2][3]
appareance: Nashi is a middle-aged man with puffy cheeks, a hunchback and long, light-colored hair that is pulled up to his crown.

Name: Natto
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Natto[1] was a member of the Sand-Sand Clan along with Vivi, Koza, Okame, and Kebi.
appareance: As a child, he wore an un-buttoned shirt, with black spots near the bottom, and a black stripe at the end of the short sleeves. He wore a sash, with shorts, and sandals. He appears to have a scar above his right eye, and also has black hair and a bandage on his stomach.

Name: Nazu Ketagari
Note: Joke character. He was first mentioned in SBS Volume 94.
description: Nazu Ketagari is a Vice Admiral and the head of a Marine Headquarters division in charge of assigning epithets to Marines, including the Admiral aliases.[1]
appareance: Ketagari has a long, thin face with an angular jaw, hooked nose, and small, round eyes. He has rosy cheeks, small ears, and full lips, and the corners of his mouth are upturned. He has has dark hair that is pulled into pig-tails and a long, thin mustache. Ketagari wears a standard Marine cap and coat.

Name: Needle God
Note: Its name was revealed in Chapter 1128.
description: The Needle God is a giant hedgehog that lives in the Land of Gods, within Bigstein Castle.[1]
appareance: The Needle God is a massive hedgehog, with a friendly appearance. When enraged, it uses its spines to appear larger.[1]

Name: Nefertari Cobra
description: Nefertari Cobra[5] was the 12th king of the Arabasta Kingdom,[6] the former patriarch of Nefertari Family, husband of the late Nefertari Titi and father of Nefertari Vivi. He was related to Nefertari D. Lili, one of the First Twenty monarchs who founded the World Government, and secretly bore her initial D. in his name.[7]
appareance: He was a major character throughout the Arabasta Arc and a two-time participant of the Levely, having played a key role in the vote that led to the dissolution of the Seven Warlords of the Sea in the latest one. During the latest Levely, Cobra was murdered by Imu and the Five Elders after learning about the former's existence and sacrificing himself so Sabo could escape.[8]

Name: Nefertari D. Lili
Note: Her full name was revealed in Chapter 1085.
description: Nefertari D. Lili was the queen of the Arabasta Kingdom during the time of the Void Century, being one of the twenty monarchs credited with the founding of the World Government. Unlike the other nineteen monarchs, Lili chose not to become a World Noble and move to Mary Geoise, but before she could return to her home country, she mysteriously vanished.[1] Aside from that, little is known about her except that she had a younger brother who succeeded her as ruler of Arabasta.
appareance: Lili is the earliest known carrier of the Will of D., being supposedly the main individual responsible for the presence of the poneglyphs around the world. For this reason, her actions could be considered a major driving force of the overall plot of the series.

Name: Nefertari Titi
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Nefertari Titi[2][3] was the queen of the Arabasta Kingdom, Nefertari Cobra's wife, and Nefertari Vivi's mother.
appareance: Twenty-four years before the start of the series, Titi bore a striking resemblance to her daughter's current appearance; they both have flowing blue hair (though Vivi ties hers in a ponytail at times), slender bodies, and dark eyes. In fact, Vivi is supposedly the spitting image of her mother, so much so that when she was dressed up for her coming of age ceremony, Cobra almost mistook Vivi for her late mother.[1]

Name: Nefertari Vivi
Note: Her real name was revealed by Mr.5 in Chapter 110.
description: Nefertari Vivi[10] is the princess of the Arabasta Kingdom.[2] She is the daughter of Nefertari Cobra and Titi, and along with the rest of her family, she bears the initial D. in her name.[11] During her childhood, Vivi was part of the Sand-Sand Clan, being the vice-leader of the group led by her friend Koza.
appareance: Vivi debuted as one of the main antagonists of the Reverse Mountain Arc as a Bounty Hunter, under the Baroque Works codename Miss Wednesday.[1] During this time, she was partnered with fellow Frontier Agent, Mr. 9. However, after the events of the Whisky Peak Arc, Vivi and her pet duck Karoo ended up joining the Straw Hat Pirates for most of the Arabasta Saga once she was discovered to be a spy plotting against Baroque Works.

Name: Neggy
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Neggy[3] is the queen of the Gingaball Kingdom (ギンガボール王国, Gingabōru Ōkoku?) and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2][3]
appareance: Neggy is a tall, slim woman with a long neck, a similarly long face, a protruding chin and dark, wavy hair that reaches down beyond her waist.

Name: Negikuma Maria
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Negikuma Maria[2] is a resident of Drum Island, and friend of Dalton.[1]
appareance: Maria's face up close.

Name: Nekomamushi
description: Master Nekomamushi is a feline mink and the guardian of the Whale Forest on Zou,[7] dubbed the "Ruler of Night"[6] as he formerly ruled over the Mokomo Dukedom from 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM.[12]  He and Inuarashi serve as retainers for the Kouzuki Family of Wano Country,[8] as members of the Nine Red Scabbards.[4]
appareance: Alongside Inuarashi he was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates and Roger Pirates, serving under Kouzuki Oden.[5] Pedro has claimed that he and Inuarashi must not be allowed to die because "the world is waiting for them".[13] After Kaidou's fall from power, Nekomamushi became a Yakuza boss. [14]

Name: Nekozaemon
description: Nekozaemon was a cat created by Kurozumi Kanjuro using the power of the Fude Fude no Mi. It was created to aid him, Kin'emon, and Bariete scale Zunesha's leg to reach Zou, though it ultimately failed in its goal.[1]
appareance: Nekozaemon was a large white cat with brown spots across its body and yellow eyes.

Name: Neoki
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Neoki[2] is a Waiter of the Beasts Pirates who serves as a guard in the Prisoner Mine of the Udon region.
appareance: Neoki is a taller man, with a muscular build, and a pronounced jaw. He has puffy purple hair, and a metallic mask he wears over the top half of his face. He wears an open purple shirt that leaves his chest exposed along with a set of gray pauldrons on his shoulders, as well as a pair of blue pants. In addition, he has a tattoo on the lower-right side of his chest reading, "BOUTTO 4TEL".[1]

Name: Neptune
description: King Neptune is a coelacanth merman and the king of the Ryugu Kingdom on Fish-Man Island.[1] He is also the current patriarch of the Neptune Family, father of Fukaboshi, Ryuboshi, Manboshi, and Shirahoshi,[2] and the husband of the late Queen Otohime.
appareance: Neptune is a giant-sized and muscular coelacanth merman. He has a red nose, small eyes, and long thick orange curly hair (despite his age of seventy) and beard. Both his chest and arms are covered with hair. He is bare-chested and has matching black tattoos on both arms, which looks like a spiral with wavy protrusion designs around it.[1]

Name: Nerine
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 54.
description: Nerine[3] is a member of the Kuja from Amazon Lily.[1]
appareance: Nerine is a brown haired, wide headed lady who dresses in purple skimpy clothes.

Name: Nero
description: Nero the Sea Weasel was the newest agent of CP9.[2] He was first introduced on the Puffing Tom, where he helped to escort Nico Robin to Enies Lobby.[1]
appareance: He was one of the antagonists during the Sea Train voyage in the Water 7 Arc.

Name: Nerona Imu
Note: Mentioned only character.
description: Saint Imu of the Nerona Family[2] was one of the twenty monarchs who founded the World Government after the Void Century 800 years ago. It has been theorized by Emporio Ivankov that this person and the mysterious Imu, who secretly occupies the Empty Throne, may actually be one and the same, possibly having gained eternal life by way of the Ope Ope no Mi's Perennial Youth Operation.[2]
appareance: Being one of the twenty founders of the World Government, Imu ruled the world alongside the rest of the royal families' heads 800 years ago.[2]

Name: Nezumi
description: Captain Nezumi is a Marine captain of the 16th Branch in the East Blue.[1] Highly corrupt, he covered up the vast majority of Arlong's actions in the Conomi Islands in exchange for bribe money.
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered the secondary antagonist of the Arlong Park Arc. He is also the one responsible for officially making Monkey D. Luffy a wanted criminal to the World Government by requesting his first ever bounty.

Name: Nico Olvia
description: Nico Olvia was the mother of Nico Robin,[1] the older sister of Oran and paternal aunt of Mizuira,[5] and an archaeologist from Ohara who studied the Poneglyphs two decades ago.[2]
appareance: While travelling around the ocean with a group of fellow archaeologists, Olvia was captured by the Marines for conducting forbidden research. She was able to return to Ohara and briefly reunite with her daughter with the help of Jaguar D. Saul, before perishing alongside the other Ohara archaeologists due to the Buster Call.[6]

Name: Nico Robin
Note: Her real name was revealed by Crocodile in Chapter 177.
appareance: Nico Robin,[17] also known by her epithet "Devil Child"[7] and the "Light of the Revolution",[8] is the archaeologist of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[3] She is the seventh member of the crew and the sixth to join, doing so at the end of the Arabasta Arc. She temporarily left the crew during the Water 7 Arc but rejoined during the Enies Lobby Arc.

Name: Nigeratta
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Nigeratta[3] is a man from Nico Robin's past.[2]
appareance: Nigeratta is a middle-aged man with shoulder-length black hair parted to the sides, a mustache of matching color, a crooked nose, long chin, and small, slit-like eyes.[2]

Name: Nightcrab Girl
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Nightcrab Girl[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Nightcrab Girl in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Nika
description: The Medaka Mermaid Quintuplets are five young Japanese rice fish mermaids who are friends with Camie. Their names are Ichika (イチカ?), Nika (ニカ?), Sanka (サンカ?), Yonka (ヨンカ?), and Yonka Two (ヨンカツー, Yonka Tsū?).[1]
appareance: The Quintuplets' size in comparison to Camie.

Name: Nika
Note: He was first mentioned by Who's-Who in Chapter 1018.
description: Nika is the name of a legendary warrior revered as the Sun God by slaves from ancient times and whose existence is tied to Elbaph mythology and folklore. He was first mentioned by Who's-Who, who heard about the legend from a prison guard during his imprisonment by the World Government.[1]
appareance: According to Dr. Vegapunk, Nika's existence is only recorded in the most ancient of texts, having been otherwise erased in more modern documents.[4] Nika's legend has also been passed down for generations in the nearly extinct Buccaneer race, and a form of his legend appears to have been passed down among Elbaph giants, who also worship him and hold festivals in honor of the "Sun God".[5][6]

Name: Nin
description: Gyoro, Nin, and Bao were a trio of oddly shaped Soldier Zombies that were first seen reporting to Moria about the Straw Hats' arrival.[1]
appareance: They are relatively small Soldier Zombies and they are all roughly the same size as Chopper when he is when using his Brain Point. Gyoro is the zombie that looks like a one-eyed samurai with an ovular head. Nin is the pinkish-red zombie archer with a triangular head. Bao is the yellow zombie that looks like some sort of super hero with a bucket shaped head.[2]

Name: Ninjin
description: Ninjin (Odex)
appareance: Ninjin is a former member of the Usopp Pirates, along with Piiman and Tamanegi, before Usopp joined the Straw Hat Pirates.[1]

Name: Ninth
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook
description: Ninth[2] is a New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: A sketch of Ninth.

Name: Nitro
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 827. He was first identified in Chapter 850.
description: Nitro[3] is a jelly homie that is often seen with Charlotte Pudding.[2]
appareance: Nitro is a small piece of blue jelly with a human-like face. It wears a fedora.[2]

Name: Nnke-kun
Note: Joke character. He first appeared in God's Gift for the Future. His name was revealed in the Blue databook. His first appearance in One Piece was in SBS Volume 31.
description: Domo-kun and Nnke-kun are aliens planning to conquer the Earth.[2] They are the first joke characters created by Oda. They first appeared in Oda's short story God's Gift for the Future. Later Domo-kun makes an appearance among the Buggy Pirates.[3] Oda answered a question in an SBS and drew both of them.[4] Nnke-kun appeared again alongside Pandaman on the cover of Volume 52.
appareance: Domo-kun is humanoid creature with a pear-shaped head, dark circles on his cheeks and braided dark hair with a ribbon at the end. He wears an orange jumpsuit that covers his entire body apart from his hands.

Name: Noble Croc
Note: His name was revealed by Tony Tony Chopper in Chapter 849.
description: The Noble Croc[4] is a crocodile homie that lives in the Seducing Woods on Whole Cake Island.[1]
appareance: Noble Croc's concept art from the anime.

Name: Nodoi Wakan
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Nodoi Wakan[2] is a Waiter of the Beasts Pirates who serves as a guard in the Prisoner Mine of the Udon region.
appareance: Wakan is an average-sized man, with a heavier build. He has green hair that he fashions out of the top of his helmet. He wears an open purple shirt that leaves his chest exposed along with a set of gray pauldrons on his shoulders, as well as a pair of dark-green pants.[1]

Name: Nokokuwa Police
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Nokokuwa Police[2] is a Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates[1] and part of the Armored Division led by Sasaki.[3]
appareance: During the Raid on Onigashima, he was tamed by the power of the Kibi Kibi no Mi and joined the side of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[4]

Name: Nokotti
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Nokotti[2] is a Waiter of the Beasts Pirates who serves as a guard in the Prisoner Mine of the Udon region. She acted as the gyōji during the Sumo Inferno held by Queen.[1]
appareance: Nokotti's full appearance.

Name: Nojiko
description: Nojiko is the owner of a mikan farm in Cocoyasi Village and is the adoptive older sister of Nami.[5] They were raised together by their adoptive mother, Bell-mère.[6]
appareance: She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Arlong Park Arc.

Name: Nola
Note: Her name was revealed in the Yellow databook databook.
description: Nola,[6] known to many as the Master of the Sky,[2] is a giant snake who lives on Upper Yard in Skypiea. Having lived for over four centuries, the snake was once the companion of Kalgara and Mont Blanc Noland back when Upper Yard was still part of Jaya. It is the grandchild of the snake Kashigami, whom the Shandia once worshiped as a god.[3]
appareance: Nola is an extremely massive light blue snake who is hundreds of meters long and large enough to swallow multiple humans and even buildings whole with ease; its width rivals that of the immensely large trees on Upper Yard and its stomach was mistaken for a cave by Luffy.[7] Nola's backside is lined with dark blue stripes, and the sides of its body are lined with long, light blue hair; it also has a pair of long whiskers by its nose. Nola has yellow eyes with narrowed black pupils, and in its mouth it has a set of four long fangs in addition to a long forked tongue.[1]

Name: Nora Gitsune
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Nora Gitsune[4] is a fox who filled the role of the "pet" for the Fake Straw Hat Crew, who did not know that the real Chopper is the crew's doctor and is given human-traits by the Hito Hito no Mi.[2]
appareance: Nora Gitsune is a light brown fox with black legs. He has a curled mustache and a chain-leash around his neck. He also wears a hat similar to Chopper's, but without the 'X' mark on the front.

Name: Noriko
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card databook.
description: Noriko[2] is a nori maker who lives in Ebisu Town.[1]
appareance: Noriko is an elderly woman with a wrinkled face and a white kerchief on her head. She wears a purple kimono.[1]

Name: Norinosuke
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Norinosuke[2] is a self-proclaimed shaman from the Flower Capital of the Wano Country[1] and the father of Beasts Pirates officer Holed'em.[2]
appareance: Norinosuke's full body.

Name: Nosgarl
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Nosgarl[2] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Concept art of Nosgarl.

Name: Nubon
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Nubon[3] is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit.[1]
appareance: Nubon is a normal sized dwarf with a stubby, round nose, thick lips, and dark lines beneath his eyes. He has bushy, light-colored hair under a large, round hat and a dark-colored mustache. He wears a long sleeved shirt with a tie and overalls.

Name: Nugire Yainu
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Nugire Yainu was the shipwright of the Black Cat Pirates and the crew member who was killed by the Marines three years prior to Kuro enacting his plan.
appareance: Yainu has a square-shaped face with small, round glasses with his black hair combed back neatly. He wears a red shirt with his crew's jolly roger on the front, with regular pants and shoes.

Name: Nure-Onna
Note: Her name was reveled in Chapter 1020.
description: Nure-Onna[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates who works under Black Maria.[1]
appareance: Nure-Onna is a woman with a round face, round eyes with prominent lashes, a pointed nose, and long black hair that is parted in the middle. As a Hognose Snake Gifter, she has a large, snake-like mouth with fangs and a long forked tongue. Her neck is long and spotted, and she is often crouched low with her hands on the ground. She wears a dark-colored kimono with a spotted pattern on it, and she has a flower in her hair above her left ear.[1] In her base form, she wears a green kimono adorned with light yellow circle patterns with dark yellow circles dots with five in each circle and a dark blue obi around her waist. She also wears white tabi.

Name: Nyasha
Note: Its name was revealed in SBS Volume 87.
description: Nyasha[2] is a giant cat owned by the Vinsmoke Family that pulls their royal carriage.[1]
appareance: Nyasha concept art from the anime.

Name: Nyornyo Nyarmani
Note: He first appeared in SBS Volume 110.
description: Nyornyo Nyarmani is a famous fashion designer from the Nagagutsu Kingdom. He is the creator of a high-end fashion brand which shares his name, "Nyornyo Nyarmani".[1]
appareance: Nyarmani is an elderly cat mink with a relatively human-like face filled with wrinkles. Otherwise, he has typical cat features such as a furry body, short overhead fur, a flat snout, whiskers and slitted pupils.[1]

Name: Oars
description: Oars the Continent-Puller was an infamous ancient giant who was born over 500 years prior to the current storyline.
appareance: After he died, his body was unearthed by the Thriller Bark Pirates and used to create the 900th Zombie of Gecko Moria's zombie army.[1] Due to his massive size even among most giants, Oars was the sole zombie to be classified as a Special Zombie.[2] As the member of Moria's army animated using the stolen shadow of Monkey D. Luffy, he was a major obstacle that the Straw Hat Pirates had to overcome during their adventure on Thriller Bark. He is the direct ancestor of Little Oars Jr.[10]

Name: Octopako
description: Octopako is an octopus fish-woman whom Hatchan tried to win over during his cover story, Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll.[1]
appareance: As an octopus fish-woman, Octopako has six arms and two legs, making a total of eight appendages, all of which are slender.

Name: Ochoku
Note: He was first mentioned by Sengoku in Chapter 957.
description: Ochoku is a former member of the Rocks Pirates.[2] Following his time with the crew he became the ruler of Hachinosu, before being overthrown by Blackbeard during the Rocky Port Incident.[3]
appareance: Ochoku is a large man, around the size of Edward Newgate. He has an overall slimy appearance, with light, greasy hair, a prominent widows peak, a long, forked tongue, and pronounced, darkened lips. In addition, his ears are pointed, giving him a devilish look as well. He wears a light, frilled dress shirt, with a matching light cravat, a great coat over his shoulders, and dark pants with a floral design.[1]

Name: Ohm
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 254.
description: Skybreeder Ohm is one of four priests of the former God Enel and a high-ranking member of God's Army. Together with his giant dog steed Holy, he subjected God's enemies to the Ordeal of Iron on Upper Yard. Due to his affiliation and actions, he is a major antagonist in the Skypiea Arc.
appareance: Ohm is a bald and muscular man of relatively average height with somewhat tanned skin. As a Birkan, he has a pair of small wings sprouting from his back which extend down to near his waist. He has a small mustache and beard around his mouth, and wears a pair of small sunglasses over his eyes. He also wears a green sleeveless shirt, gray pants with several pockets, a long and flowing white sash around his waist similar to the one worn by his master, and dark leather boots with bandages around the soles.[1]

Name: Oide
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Oide[2] is a little girl who lives in Sphinx. She is the owner of Tama.[1]
appareance: Oide is a little girl with blushy cheeks, brown pigtails and brown eyes. She wears a short, orange long-sleeved dress and a round wool hat with dots on the brim.[1]

Name: Oimo
description: Oimo is a giant from Elbaph and a member of the Giant Warrior Pirates under Dorry and Brogy.[3] He has a grandson attending the Walrus School on Elbaph; Olav.[6]
appareance: After being captured by the Marines 50 years ago, he and his comrade Kashii were tricked into serving as the guards of Enies Lobby's main gate. During the Enies Lobby Arc, Oimo and Kashii defected against the World Government and allied themselves with the Straw Hat Pirates, Galley-La Company, and Franky Family.[3]

Name: Oiwa
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Oiwa[2] is a man who lived in the Wano Country 41 years ago.[1]
appareance: Oiwa is a plump man with short, brown hair stuck up to either side of his head, a topknot, thick eyebrows, and a frequently blushing nose. He has a row of large round teeth in his mouth, and a crescent-shaped scar across his eyebrow near his left eye. He wore a kimono with a floral pattern and a white coat before being robbed by Kin'emon,[1] and a striped kimono after. For a short period of time before the striped kimono was found, Oiwa wore a loincloth.[3]

Name: Okame
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Okame[3] was a member of the Sand-Sand Clan along with Vivi and Koza.[1]
appareance: She is a skinny woman with red makeup on her cheeks and short black hair. She wears a long pink sleeveless dress, that has purple stripes around the waist, and the kanji 砂, meaning sand. She wears a white hat, and carries a large sword on her back.[2]

Name: Okome
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Okome[3] is the first mate and the only known member of the Hokahoka Pirates.[3]
appareance: Okome is a tall, but fat man with wide cheeks compared to a thin forehead, but seemingly no hair. He wears a yellow tricorne with a bowl of rice from Doskoi Panda on top of it, a purple captain's coat over the rest of his unseen attire.[2]

Name: Olav
Note: He is named in Chapter 1144, but only individually identified in Chapter 1147.
description: Olav is a student at the Walrus School on Elbaph.[1] He is the grandson of Oimo.[2]
appareance: Olav is a young boy with a large, round face. He wears a fur coat, a belt with a large, round buckle, and black gloves. Additionally, he has a large, uniquely-shaped helmet with two horns and a top piece resembling a Roman pluma.

Name: Oli
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1079.
description: Crone Oli is a pirate captain subordinate to the Red Hair Pirates.[1][2]
appareance: Oli's full appearance.

Name: Oliva
Note: He was first introduced in One Piece novel A Volume 2.
description: Oliva is the former boss of Port Chibaralta Island, which was part of Whitebeard's territory. However, he was deposed by Portgas D. Ace due to partaking in the slave trade.[1]
appareance: Oliva wore a flashy striped suit showing his rippling muscles and a gorilla costume mask over his face. He also wore thick rings of pure gold on all fingers.

Name: Omasa
Note: He first appeared as a silhouette in Chapter 940.
description: "Blood-Writing" Omasa is a yakuza boss who was in charge of the Udon region in Wano Country. He was imprisoned in Udon by the Beasts Pirates, but was freed when Luffy took over the prison.[1][2]
appareance: Omasa is a large man with light colored hair, with two braids at the front of his face and bells at the end of them. He has thin whiskers and a large scar over his right eye.[1]

Name: Onigumo
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook. He was formally introduced in Chapter 542.
description: Vice Admiral Onigumo is a Marine officer, and one of the five vice admirals who led the Buster Call on Enies Lobby.[1] His name was revealed in the third databook.[4]
appareance: Onigumo is a tall man with a cold face and eyes that are always semi-closed. He is usually seen smoking a cigarette, has long brown hair, and wears an ancient war helmet with a small, traditional Japanese dragon on it, and a long red plume hanging from it. Under his Marine coat he wears a double-breasted gray suit over a dark green shirt with a silver tie. He also has a golden loop earring on his left ear.[1]

Name: Onimaru
Note: Debuted as a human named Gyukimaru; his real name and appearance was revealed in Chapter 953.
description: Onimaru is a komagitsune who was once the companion of the late daimyo of Ringo, Shimotsuki Ushimaru.[3]
appareance: After the death of his master, he joined forces with Kawamatsu in collecting weapons for the final battle against Kaidou and protecting them from robbers. After Kawamatsu was captured, Onimaru posed as a human known as Gyukimaru on Oihagi Bridge, stealing weapons from people while continuing to guard the graves.[3][1][2]

Name: Oran
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Oran[3] was the husband of Roji, the father of Mizuira, the younger brother of Nico Olvia and the maternal uncle of Nico Robin.[1]
appareance: Oran had black hair in a combover, a thin curled mustache, and slight stubble on his chin. He wore glasses along with a collared shirt, sweater, and bowtie.

Name: Orlumbus
description: "Massacre Ruler" Orlumbus is a former adventurer who is the admiral of the Yonta Maria Grand Fleet from the Standing Kingdom[3] and the captain of the seventh ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[4] He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1] After the final battle against Donquixote Doflamingo, Orlumbus pledged his loyalty to Monkey D. Luffy and became a pirate.[4]
appareance: He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc, and one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.

Name: Ossamondo
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Ossamondo[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Ossamondo's color scheme in the anime.

Name: Otohime
Note: She was first mentioned by Jinbe in Chapter 615.
description: Queen Otohime was a goldfish mermaid, the queen of the Ryugu Kingdom, the wife of king Neptune,[2] and the mother of Fukaboshi, Ryuboshi, Manboshi, and Shirahoshi.
