appareance: Otohime was a political activist who worked hard for union and peace between fish-men plus merfolk and humans, dreaming of having her people emigrate from the Sea Floor to the surface. Ten years ago, she was assassinated by Hody Jones, who had framed a human pirate as the instigator of the deed. She is one of the two posthumous overarching protagonists of the Fish-Man Island Arc (alongside Fisher Tiger).

Name: Ottoland
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Ottoland[2] is one of the Franky Family's Kairiki Destroyers.[3]
appareance: Ottoland's initial colorscheme in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Outlook III
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Outlook III[2] is a noble of the Goa Kingdom on Dawn Island. He is the husband of Didit, the biological father of Sabo, and the adoptive father of Sterry.[1]
appareance: He has black hair and much like his son, he wears a top hat with the only differences being the feathers, a flower, and what appears to be a silver-lined band on the hat. He has a thin black mustache and wears a suit with a flower on each lapel, with the one on the left having feathers similar to the ones seen on his hat. He also wears an ascot underneath his suit's jacket.

Name: Packy
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Koze and Packy were members of the Yes Pirates.[1]
appareance: Koze is the thin and tall man with short purple hair, a wide mouth and his tongue sticking out. He wore an A-shirt with various colored fruit-patterns on it, light-colored pants with a pirate sash, a gauntlet on his right forearm, and normal shoes.

Name: Pagaya
description: Pagaya[2] is Conis' father and a native to Skypiea who fixed the waver that Nami rides.[1]
appareance: Pagaya is a Skypiean man of average height. He is almost bald but has the typical Skypiean hair antennae sticking out. He has a strange round beard covering his mouth, and he is always shown with closed eyes, however he seems fully able to both see and talk. His hair antennas and beard are dark brown, along with his eyebrows. He wears the typical Skypiean robes, in his case a brown yellow one with a light yellow collar, and light yellow at the end of where the sleeves would be, if it had any, it also has a black leaf like design.

Name: Page One
description: Page One[4] is a former member of the Tobiroppo, the strongest Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates.[1] He is the son of the former Warlord of the Sea Hanafuda and younger brother of fellow former Tobiroppo Ulti.[5][6] Following the downfall of the Beasts Pirates, Page One and his sister became followers of Yamato after being saved from Who's-Who.[7]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Palms
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Palms[3] is an infamous New World pirate who worked under the Whitebeard Pirates.
appareance: Palms is a slim man with curly black hair and black circles around his eyes, which make him resemble a panda, his overall animal theme. On his head and shoulders he has an indument apparently made of panda fur, with the animal's head on his own as a head-covering. He wears a pair of shoulder pads secured by straps that run diagonally across his bare muscular chest, and dons long, striped gloves, almost reaching to his shoulders. Around his waist he seems to have yet another indument made of fur, but this one is spotted similarly to a leopard's.

Name: Pandaman
Note: Joke character. His name was revealed in SBS Volume 6.
description: Pandaman is a joke character created by Eiichiro Oda, and one of the most prominent easter eggs in One Piece.
appareance: Originally designed for a Kinnikuman character creation contest,[5] Pandaman has gone on to make cameo appearances in many manga chapters, anime episodes, films, and more. He is particularly prominent in several of the video games, even being playable in the first Grand Battle! and its immediate sequel.

Name: Pandawomanmi
Note: Joke character. Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 55.
description: Pandawomanmi is the female version of Pandaman. She first appeared in the Amazon Lily Arc where Pandaman would not be allowed (as men are forbidden on Amazon Lily).[2]
appareance: She has Sailor Moon-style "dumpling" hair. She appears on Volume 52's cover under the dust jacket beating up Tomato Gang and another person. In order to keep her appearances less obvious, like Pandaman, her features are often vague. She wears a black bikini style top and her body appears more human than Pandaman's, giving her the resemblance of a young woman.

Name: Pandora
description: Pandora is a sun homie that was created by Carmel, who placed a portion of her soul into a fire on Elbaph with the power of the Soru Soru no Mi.[1]
appareance: Pandora as flames.

Name: Pankuta Dakeyan
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Pankuta Dakeyan is a prisoner in Impel Down.[2]
appareance: Dakeyan is a tan-skinned man with a shaved head and broad shoulders. He has small eyes, prominent lips, a square jaw, and a scar running down the right side of his face. He wears a black-and-white striped prisoner's uniform and cap.

Name: Pansy
description: Pansy[3][2] is a member of the Kuja tribe.[1]
appareance: Pansy is a large overweight woman with round eyes, a double chin, and a big nose. She wears red lipstick, and has brownish-red hair, flowing in the back, and in two big curls in the front. Pansy wears a wiggly black and yellow stripped top that shows most of her breast and all of her stomach and is always barefoot.

Name: Papaneel
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Papaneel[2] is a barracuda fish-man[3] who lived on Fish-Man Island at the same time as Otohime.[1]
appareance: Papaneel unmasked.

Name: Papas
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Papas[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Papas is an average-sized man with a pointy nose. He is seen wearing a sleeveless hoodie over his head that has vertical stripes on the front.[1]

Name: Pappag
Note: He was formally introduced in Chapter 491.
description: Pappag[2] is a starfish who is Camie's pet and teacher. He is the creator of the Criminal fashion line and is mentoring Camie to be a fashion designer.
appareance: He is an orange starfish that appears to be stitched along his outline. His face is in the middle of his body and he wears a hat similar to a tam hat or rastacap.

Name: Part
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 109.
description: Part[3] is a member of the Bonney Pirates. He was once a resident of the Sorbet Kingdom, having been a friend of Bartholomew Kuma and Ginny since young adulthood.
appareance: After the Summit War of Marineford, he was arrested by Admiral Akainu following his crew's defeat against the Blackbeard Pirates.

Name: Pascia
description: Pashia (Funimation)
appareance: Pascia is a female dancer, who was to be sold at the Auction House.[1]

Name: Patty
description: Patty is one of the main cooks at the Baratie, currently serving as the restaurant's head pâtissier.[3]
appareance: Patty is a large, muscular man with somewhat-oversized forearms (his left upper arm bearing two heart tattoos), prominent lips, and black hair formed in an elaborate goatee around his chin. His Baratie uniform is heavily customized, consisting of a dark double-breasted shirt, matching shorts, and a white apron; these are accompanied by a pink ascot, an earring in his right ear, and a braided hachimaki headband.

Name: Paulie
description: Paulie is the current vice president of the Galley-La Company in Water 7.[3] Before being promoted, he was one of the five Dock One foremen, specializing in rigging, knots, and masts.[4]
appareance: He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 Arc and the beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc.

Name: Pavlik
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Pavlik[2] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was subordinate to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance:
Pavlik is a fat man with short legs and thin arms. He dresses in mafia-style clothing such as a black fedora alongside a white collared shirt with a black tie under black coat.
In the manga, he appears on separate occasions with a slightly different appearance. In his debut, he had a thick gray beard and wore a black pirate captain coat,[1] but he had shorter facial hair and wore a black coat with a white cape over, in subsequent appearances, much like that of his concept art and the anime.[3]

Name: Peachbeard
description: Peachbeard is the epithet of the captain of the Peachbeard Pirates, who are subordinates of the Emperor Blackbeard.[1]
appareance: Peachbeard appears to be a slim man of roughly average height. His face is somewhat narrow, and his jaw is very long, ending in a pronounced chin. He has long flowing hair that reaches down to his chest in waves. As his given name implies, Peachbeard also sports a long handlebar pink mustache which curls upwards at the ends and a long goatee with a slight downward curl. He has some wrinkles around his eyes and mouth and a stitched scar running from his left eye to his left cheekbone.[1]

Name: Pearl
description: Pearl the Iron Wall is the commander of the Krieg Pirates' second unit.[2] Due to his actions, he can be considered the tertiary antagonist of the Baratie Arc.
appareance: A towering man, Pearl's ensemble includes two large iron plates covering his front and backside, as well as two small plates with large pearls embedded in them for strong, blunt attacks. When introduced, he claims that he is "a shield man", but also "a dandy man", referring to the iron plates he wears on his body, as well as his notably handsome face.[2]

Name: Peepley Lulu
description: Peepley Lulu[3] is one of the five foremen of the Galley-La Company's Dock 1 in Water 7.[1] His specialties as a shipwright are pitch, block and tackle, and blacksmithing.[2]
appareance: He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 Arc and the beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc.

Name: Pedro
description: Pedro of the Treetops was a jaguar mink and captain of the Guardians.[4]
appareance: He was the former captain of the Nox Pirates who sailed in search of a Poneglyph, and he earned a bounty of 382,000,000 in the process, but his journey was cut short in Totto Land.[10] He returned to Totto Land to accompany the Sanji Retrieval Team in their quest to rescue Sanji.[11] During the escape from Whole Cake Island, Pedro sacrificed himself to ensure his team's escape, as he believed the Straw Hats will bring about the Dawn of the World.[12]

Name: Pekkori
Note: His name was revealed in Episode 421 credits.
description: Pekkori is the village mayor of Harahettania, the Land of Poverty, situated on Namakura Island in Paradise. He directed the ritual in which he and his people "summoned" Brook, though they were trying to summon the devil.[1]
appareance: Pekkori's anime concept art.

Name: Pekoms
description: Pekoms[8][6] is a combatant of the Big Mom Pirates and a lion mink.[1][4] He is partnered with Tamago, and both are responsible for collecting the monthly payment of sweets from Fish-Man Island in exchange for Big Mom's protection.[1]
appareance: Pekoms originally sailed the seas under Pedro[9] as a member of the Nox Pirates before he and some of the crew joined the Big Mom Pirates.[10][2] During the Whole Cake Island Arc, he betrayed the crew in an attempt to help Monkey D. Luffy escape Totto Land and honor Pedro's self-sacrifice.

Name: Pell
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 167.
description: Pell the Falcon[2] is one of the two head guards in the Arabasta Kingdom that serve under Igaram, the other being Chaka.[1] He is said to be the strongest fighter in all of Arabasta.[4]
appareance: Pell is a tall man with a purple line under each eye that runs down the sides of his face, making him resemble a falcon, his Devil Fruit's animal. Underneath these robes, he is fairly muscular, and has two large, star-shaped scars on his torso.[5]

Name: Pellini
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 73.
description: Pellini[3] is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit.[1]
appareance: Pellini is a normal-sized dwarf with light-colored skin, a triangular nose, narrow inward-slanted eyes, and a large light-colored tail. He wears a tall rectangular hat, a light-colored cape over his shoulders with a light-colored shirt underneath, and dark-colored shorts with light-colored buttons on it. He also wears light-colored gloves, a light-colored belt, and light-colored boots.

Name: Penguin
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 62.
description: Penguin[5] is a member of the Heart Pirates.[1]
appareance: Penguin is an average sized lean man. Like most of the Heart Pirates, he wears a beige overall, with their Jolly Roger displayed on the back and the chest pocket, as well as brown boots. He wears a black cap with a yellow brim, a red pompon on top and his name displayed on the front.[1]

Name: Peppoko
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Peppoko[3][4] is a member of the Alvida Pirates and the triplet brother of Heppoko and Poppoko.[2]
appareance: Peppoko has long blonde hair, blonde eyebrows, and a blonde goatee. He wears an light blue shirt with vertical lines on it and a black lining near the chest. In the anime he also wears a light blue headband.

Name: Perona
description: "Ghost Princess" Perona[7] is the former commander of the Wild Zombies and Surprise Zombies of Thriller Bark prior to its collapse.[3] She was one of the Mysterious Four[2] and one of the major antagonists of the Thriller Bark Saga.
appareance: After the defeat of Gecko Moria's army and during the timeskip, she begrudgingly helped[8] and cooperated with Roronoa Zoro while in Dracule Mihawk's home on Kuraigana Island.[9]

Name: Peterman
description: Peterman is the head of a kidnapping gang called the Hound Pets, located in Sabaody Archipelago,[1] and a minor antagonist of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc.
appareance: Peterman is a large man with a muscular torso and proportionally thin limbs. He has fuzzy black hair, a flat nose, sharp lips, and his shoulders seem to have studs sticking onto them. He wears a brown shirt with a green vest over it, black pants, a yellow coned hat with a white feather that has a red tip on it, and boots with frills.[1]

Name: Petermoo
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Petermoo[4] was the gunner[3] of the Roger Pirates.[1]
appareance: Petermoo is a relatively short man with an egg-shaped body and his legs are extremely thin. Overall, his appearance resembles that of European nobility in the 17th and 18th centuries. He has shoulder-length light curly hair resembling a colonial-era wig and a dark mustache and beard. He has a wide-brimmed hat with a plume on it. He also wears a suit jacket and a kerchief over his shirt, as well as high-waisted pants and a belt with a spiral design on the buckle. He wears boots on his feet.[1]

Name: Pica
Note: His name was revealed by Wicca in Chapter 722.
description: Pica is one of the top three officers of the Donquixote Pirates.[2] He occupies the Spade seat of the Donquixote Family[1] and is the leader of the crew's Pica Army subdivision.[6] Due to his actions and role, he is one of the major antagonists in the Dressrosa Arc.
appareance: Pica is an extremely broad, tall, intimidating and muscular man. It is shown in a flashback that even as a nine-year-old child he possessed a similar hulking frame, while also wearing a silvery metal chainmail headguard and a pale yellow knights helmet, in addition to a white sleeveless t-shirt and black pants, that he would have until adulthood.[7] By the age of 24, he had replaced his makeshift armor from childhood to real golden armor and took to wearing black gloves. His hair is long and lavender, wavy and light, which hangs down to his shoulders. It appears that under his mask, he has a straight mustache. His eyes are yellow. The most distinctive features on his body are his shoulders, which have three (previously two) spikes protruding out of each shoulder blade that appears to be part of his actual flesh; his shoulder grew to this point since he was wearing shoulder guards of such shape since puberty, thus causing them to shape like so.[8] He is considerably taller than normal people, appearing as tall as Trebol and Diamante.[1] There is a tattoo of a (black in the manga, purple in the anime) spade on the front side of both his shoulders.

Name: Pickles
description: Pickles, also known as the "Tackle Machine", is a former combatant of the Groggy Monsters of the Foxy Pirates.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist of the Long Ring Long Land Arc.

Name: Pierre
description: Pierre is a Sky Dot Bird belonging to Gan Fall.[1]
appareance: In his normal form, Pierre is a large pink bird with a red polka dot pattern on his body. He's solid red on the sides of his head, the back of his head, and on his horn-like ears. He also has bandages wrapped around his torso. He has a tab face, with a yellow beak.

Name: Piiman
description: Piiman is a former member of the Usopp Pirates, along with Ninjin and Tamanegi, from before Usopp joined the Straw Hat Pirates.[1]
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Syrup Village Arc.

Name: Pike
Note: He was named in his anime concept art.
description: Pike is a member of the G-5 branch of the Marines.[1]
appareance: Pike is a tan man with beady eyes, a flat nose, thick lips, thick eyebrows, and rounded teeth. He also has scruffy brown hair and a goatee. He wears a brown shirt, blue pants, black boots, a brown cloak with "G-5" printed on it, and a standard white Marine cap that is turned on an angle.

Name: Pinky
description: Monstrous Bird Pinky[3] is a giant bird that appeared in the Orange Town Arc. He is classified as a Type C creature, "Big Savage".[4]
appareance: Pinky is a large, pink bird with a downward-curved, beige beak. He has dark blue feathering on the edge of his wings and tail and on the top of his head. The feathers on the top of his head stick up in the anime. In the manga, he lacks the upward-pointing feathers and is one solid color.[1]

Name: Piper
description: Piper is a giant owl owned by Gerd.[1]
appareance: Piper is a massive owl, about the size of its master's upper body. Its feathers alternate between dark and light, with swirling ones around its eyes.[1]

Name: Pisaro
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Pisaro[4] is the musician of the Arlong Pirates[4] and an ocean sunfish fish-man.[6] He was previously a member of the Sun Pirates.[2]
appareance: Pisaro is a normal sized fish-man, with large lips and light blue skin, and curly brown hair. He wears a purple short-sleeved, button-up open shirt with pink stars on it. He also wears a puffed collar around his neck, a white sash, tan shorts, and sandals, and he is usually seen carrying maracas. He has a red star tattoo on his chest. In the manga, he was overweight, but in the anime, he was quite muscular.

Name: Pluming
description: Saint Pluming is a World Noble.[1]
appareance: Pluming is a man with light hair styled in a bobcut and a traditional World Noble updo at the top. He has thick eyebrows and a long thin mustache. He has no upper teeth apart from two large buckteeth.

Name: Poker
description: Poker is a Shinuchi in the Beasts Pirates.[1] During the raid on Onigashima, he was tamed by the power of the Kibi Kibi no Mi and joined the side of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[3]
appareance: Poker is a rather big man with extremely long light blue hair that reaches down to the floor and drapes over his eyes. He has a pair of bull-like horns on his head and his tongue, due to his Devil Fruit transformation, is forked and also appeared to have two bumps on his chin possibly the appearance of the rattlesnakes' rattle. The only items of clothing he wears are a small, open waistcoat, a loincloth with a belt, and spiked wristbands on both arms and also appears to have a tattoo on his right upper arm that is covered with a bandage into a shape of an X. His legs are transformed into the beginning and end parts of a rattlesnake due to his SMILE transformation, with the middle part spanning over his head between the shoulders.[1]

Name: Pomp
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Pomp[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Pomp's original concept art.

Name: Pomsky
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1108.
description: Pomsky[3] is a Marine Vice Admiral and one of the nine that took part in the Egghead Incident.[1]
appareance: He serves as a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: Poppoko
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Poppoko[3][4] is a member of the Alvida Pirates and the triplet brother of Heppoko and Peppoko.[2][1]
appareance: Poppoko is an overweight man, with a large chin, black hair, and a bit of stubble on his chin. He wears a black and white striped bandana, with a matching short sleeved shirt. His sideburns also come down into a curl.[1]

Name: Poppy
description: Poppy[3][2] is a member of the Kuja tribe.[1]
appareance: Poppy's concept art from the anime.

Name: Porche
description: Porche is a combatant of the Foxy Pirates. She is considered an idol by the crew and is loved by all of the men.[1]
appareance: Due to her actions, she is a major antagonist during the Long Ring Long Land Arc, and a supporting antagonist in the Foxy's Return and Spa Island filler Arcs.

Name: Porchemy
description: Porchemy was a member of the Bluejam Pirates until he was killed by his captain Bluejam for losing to Ace and Sabo.[1]
appareance: Porchemy was a very large man with long whitish blue hair, narrow eyebrow-less eyes, and a broad chest with an open red, ruffle-edged vest. He had tattoos on his left bicep and wore an earring on each ear. He also wore a yellow sash with stripes around his waist and a belt over it. He wore regular pants and boots. He was seen carrying a large sword as well.

Name: Poro
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Poro is a bookstore owner[5] from Orange Town.[2]
appareance: Poro is an elderly man with a wrinkled face. The top of his head is bald, while the sides have short white hair. He has thick eyebrows and a Fu Manchu-style mustache, which are also white. He wears a short-sleeved maroon dress shirt,[2] grey shorts, and maroon shoes. In the anime, his hair is grey, his eyebrows and mustache are dark brown, his shirt is tan, and his shorts and shoes are brown.[3]

Name: Portgas D. Ace
description: Portgas D. Ace,[11] born as Gol D. Ace[6] and nicknamed "Fire Fist" Ace,[5] was the captain of the Spade Pirates[3] before being recruited into the Whitebeard Pirates and becoming its 2nd division commander.[2] The biological son of the late Pirate King Gol D. Roger and Portgas D. Rouge,[12] Ace was put in the care of Monkey D. Garp and Curly Dadan after Roger's death, which is where he became the sworn brother of Monkey D. Luffy[7] and Sabo.[13] Due to Roger's absence from his life, Ace disowned his father and took his mother's surname, ultimately declaring that his captain Whitebeard was his true father.[14]
appareance: Ace's pursuit of his former subordinate Blackbeard for the murder of their crewmate Thatch led to him being captured after their duel on Banaro Island, and he was turned in to the Marines, who held a public execution for him on Marineford due to his heritage; this triggered the Summit War of Marineford. While freed from bondage, Ace would ultimately lose his life at the hands of Admiral Akainu while protecting Luffy.[15]

Name: Portgas D. Rouge
description: Portgas D. Rouge was the mother of Portgas D. Ace and the lover of Gol D. Roger.[1]
appareance: Rouge was a slender woman with long, wavy pink-blonde hair. She wore a pink hibiscus flower in her hair on the left side of her head, and had freckles on her face that were passed on to her son. She also wore a long, short-sleeved, light blue dress that reached down to her feet, and sandals. The anime version shows that her eyes were brown.[1] In Episode 460 and before her introduction in the anime, her hair color was depicted as blonde.[3]

Name: Potato
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1101, and he was properly identified in SBS Volume 109.
description: Potato[2][3] is a member of the Bonney Pirates. He was once a resident of the Sorbet Kingdom.
appareance: After the Summit War of Marineford, he was arrested by Admiral Akainu following his crew's defeat against the Blackbeard Pirates.

Name: Potaufeu
Note: His name was revealed in the captions of Episode 889.
description: Potaufeu[2] is a king and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[1]
appareance: Potaufeu is an average size man with short brown hair and goatee, and light stubble. His face is long and somewhat wrinkled with thick jaw and lips. His droopy eyes gives him a sleepy expression.

Name: Potsun
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Dr. Potsun[2] is an Arabasta doctor who runs an isolated clinic in the desert. He managed to recuperate Pell after his near-fatal sacrifice at Alubarna.[1]
appareance: Potsun wears a white shirt with an opening on the chest. He has tanned skin, a round nose, and black hair that shoots out to his right and left in a triangular shape. His mustache is styled the same way, just smaller. He wears a white hat with a red cross, a common sign for medics.[1]

Name: Pound
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 835.
description: Pound[5] is Big Mom's 25th ex-husband[6] and the father of Charlotte Chiffon and Charlotte Lola.[2] He is also the grandfather of Capone Pez and father-in-law of Capone Bege and Gotti.
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Whole Cake Island Arc. He is also a major character in the "Gang" Bege's Oh My Family serial.

Name: Prince Grus
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1061.
description: Prince Grus is a Marine Rear Admiral stationed at Marine base G-14 and a member of SWORD.[2] His fellow SWORD members also refer to Grus by the title of Prince (王子, Ōji?) which differs from his surname.[2][5]
appareance: Grus was first introduced during the "Gang" Bege's Oh My Family Cover Page Serial as a brief antagonist.[1] He made his proper debut in the main series during the Egghead Arc.

Name: Prometheus
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 844. He was first identified in Chapter 845.
description: Prometheus the Sun is a sun homie that Big Mom summons from her right hand.[2] He is a special kind of homie, as he received a soul fragment from Big Mom herself,[6] and serves as one of her personal weapons alongside Napoleon and Hera, and formerly Zeus.
appareance: Prometheus is a mass of compressed flames[7] with several sunrays surrounding him, giving him the appearance of an abstract drawing of the sun.[2] His eyes and nose are very close together, and are small compared to his large mouth. He has blushy, rosy cheeks and is usually seen with a toothy smile.[1] When he uses his power, his appearance changes, resembling a fireball while his facial features remain, though he can take on a more sinister appearance.[8] While sleeping, Prometheus does not exude any sun rays nor light, instead appearing a mere orb with a face floating in midair.[9]

Name: Pudding Pudding
description: Pudding Pudding[3] was a Marine commodore in the 77th Branch of the Marines.[1]
appareance: Pudding Pudding in his youth as a Marine.

Name: Pudos
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Pudos[2] is a Waiter in the Beasts Pirates who worked as a guard in the Prisoner Mine. He was injured by Kawamatsu after trying to attack Monkey D. Luffy.[1]
appareance: Pudos is a tall man, being fairly larger than Luffy. He has long bushy blonde hair gathered into a ponytail in the back. He wears an open blue shirt that leaves his chest exposed along with a set of spiked gray pauldrons on his shoulders with gold edges and fur lining, as well as a pair of black pants.[1]

Name: Puppu
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Puppu[2] is the captain of a pirate crew who attempted to pillage Nanohana in Arabasta.[1]
appareance: Puppu's Jolly Roger.

Name: Pururu
description: "Trembling" Pururu is the "princess" of the Bourgeois Pirates, a pirate crew subordinate to the Red Hair Pirates.[1]
appareance: Pururu in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: PX-1
PX-4
Note: Its number was revealed in Chapter 511.

Name: PX-5
Note: Its number was revealed in Chapter 601

Name: PX-7
Pythagoras
Note: Its name was first seen on a chart in Chapter 1062.
description: Pythagoras, also designated as Punk-04 (PUNK-04（パンク フォー）, Panku-Fō?), is one of the six satellites of Dr. Vegapunk, embodying his aspect of "wisdom".[3]
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Egghead Arc.

Name: Queen
Note: He first appeared as a silhouette in Chapter 920.
description: Queen the Plague is an All-Star of the Beasts Pirates as one of Kaidou's three closest confidants.[2] He was formerly the ruler of the Udon region in Wano Country.[9] Born as Scien,[7] he previously was also part of the rogue scientific research team MADS before joining Kaidou.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Queen Mama Chanter
Note: Its name was revealed through its model as part of the Grand Ship Collection.

Name: Quincy
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Quincy[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Quincy is a slender woman with curly hair and wearing an elaborate outfit consisting of a round, crown-like hat, a checkered jacket, a giant ribbon around her waist and a light-colored skirt.[1]

Name: Rabbitman
Note: His name was revealed in the credits of Episode 908
description: Rabbitman[2][3] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Rabbitman is a large man. Due to him eating a SMILE, he grew a rabbit face on his chin, with the rabbit's head doubling as his beard, rabbit ears framing his face from both sides, and a large rabbit tail on his back. His hair is shaped like horns worn by most Gifters. He wears a light green shirt, green pants, a brown and orange vest, and brown boots.

Name: Rabiyan
description: Rabiyan[2] is a flying carpet homie that is often seen with Charlotte Pudding.[1]
appareance: Rabiyan in One Piece Bounty Rush.

Name: Raccoon
Note: He was first introduced in One Piece novel A Volume 2.
description: "Pretended Sleep" Raccoon is a Pirate Captain previously active in the West Blue, until he was defeated by the Whitebeard Pirates.
appareance: Raccoon and his crew are greedy, as they tried to eat food in Whitebeard's territory without paying for it. Raccoon is also persistent, as he shot Marshall D. Teach after having been defeated and captured.[1]

Name: Raideen
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 866.
description: Raideen[4] is a former member of the Giant Warrior Pirates. Following the crew's disbandment, he returned to Elbaph where he was shown training Hajrudin 63 years ago.[5]
appareance: Raideen was a giant with light hair which stuck out from the sides of his helmet, which was a warrior's helmet with eyepieces which obscured his eyes.

Name: Raijin
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 933.
description: Raijin[5] is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates.[2] He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Raizo
Note: His name was first mentioned by Kanjuro in Chapter 803.
description: Raizo of the Mist is a ninja from Wano Country and one of the Nine Red Scabbards who served as Kouzuki Oden's retainers.[3] He was born 55 years ago, but traveled 20 years forward in time at the age of 35.[10] Following Kouzuki Momonosuke's ascent to shogun, he serves as the daimyo of Udon.[4]
appareance: He acts as a major ally to the Straw Hat Pirates during the Zou and Wano Country Arcs.

Name: Raki
Note: Her name was revealed by Wyper in Chapter 251.
description: Raki[2] is one of the Shandia warriors that fought to take back Upper Yard from Enel.
appareance: Raki is a tall, black-haired woman, with two large bangs parted to either side of her face on the front, and a long and elaborate ponytail on the back. She has dark green eyes, and her lips are apparently covered with pink lipstick. Like all Shandia, she has two small wings on her back. Raki's outfit consists of a light purple cleavage revealing tunic with a darker pattern that exposes her stomach, and light-red pants, reminiscent of the ones worn by Native Americans, that are open on the inside of her legs. She also has matching colored Skate-type Wavers she wears into battle. After the end of the Skypiea Arc, she wears a more casual version of her outfit.

Name: Rakuda
description: Rakuda is a resident of the Flower Capital in Wano Country. He once possessed the blueprints of Kaidou's fortress on Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Rakuda is a large and muscular man with long and bushy brown hair gathered into a topknot. He wears a yellow kimono with a dark-grey flame-shaped designs on the bottom and has a light-blue, cloud-like tattoo on his upper right arms. He has two scars, one on the right side of his head and the other on his right forearm.[1]

Name: Rakushitemo Terusubehainaika
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Dr. Rakushitemo Terusubehainaika is a scientist[2] and a member of the Germ Pirates.[1]
appareance: Terusubehanaika in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Rakuyo
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 58.
description: Rakuyo is the former 7th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.[4]
appareance: Rakuyo is a tall man with dark blonde dreadlocks. He has a mustache that consists of two straight points angled diagonally. He wears a typical outfit consisting of a yellow coat with green linings, a green vest under an unbuttoned shirt, a standard light green pirate sash, square-patterned pants, and standard boots. His outfit most notably includes a yellow and purple bandanna bearing Whitebeard's mark. He is often seen wielding a unique spiked ball and chain that has a face at the end.

Name: Ramba
Note: His name was revealed by the Marines in Episode 460.
description: Ramba[3] is an infamous New World pirate captain who allied with Whitebeard.
appareance: Ramba is a very tall man, towering over most of his fellow allies, with a slim build. He wears a long, white robe reaching down to his feet, with loose, ruffled-edged sleeves under a dark blue vest and a blue cape with a high collar. He also sports some particular pieces of armor in his attire, these being a pair of golden shoulder pads and his golden yellow, black and white signature crested helm, which has what looks like a Jolly Roger represented on the red part on the front of it and covers the upper part of Ramba's head. He carries around a long sword, fitting his height.

Name: Ramen
Note: His name was revealed in the captions of Episode 889.
description: Ramen[3] is the king of the Kano Country and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2]
appareance: Ramen is a man with a tall bald head that has a Chinese dragon tattooed on the left side. He also has a square jaw and black Fu Manchu mustache.

Name: Rampo
Note: His name was revealed by Leo in Chapter 733.
description: Rampo[4] is a dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom who first appeared on Green Bit.[1] He is one of the two vice-chiefs of the Tonta Corps along with Bomba, under Gancho and Leo.[2]
appareance: Rampo's color scheme in the manga.

Name: Ran
description: Ran[4] is a member of the Kuja Pirates.[1]
appareance: Ran is an average-sized lady who has jet black hair parted on one side with an earring on each ear. She wears long black stockings with straps that reach her matching color panties. Around her waist is a decorative belt of rings that is attached to a small flap of blue cloth to cover her rear. Her top is a small orange flowered tank top with a window hole in the middle that seems almost too small for her size. She carries a quiver of arrows slung around her back with a snake that is usually accompanying her. She wears a overcoat, similar to a Marine, like a cape like many of her fellow crewmates.[1]

Name: Randolph
Note: His name was revealed by Tony Tony Chopper in Chapter 832.
description: "Crane Rider" Randolph is a rabbit homie[3] and a member of the Big Mom Pirates.[1][2]
appareance: Randolph is an average-sized humanoid rabbit, though his limbs are unusually long. He wears a frilly shirt, a dark cape, and a cavalier hat.[2]

Name: Rangram
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Rangram[2] was a member of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Rangram's concept art.

Name: Ratel
description: Ratel is a Marine captain who led an invasion of Sphinx during Marco's absence.[1]
appareance: Ratel is an average-sized man with dark circles under his eyes, prominent lips and nose, and three whiskers on each side of his face. He wears a light-colored suit, a standard marine coat, and a marine cap with round animal ears on it.[1]

Name: Rebecca
description: Rebecca[8] is the daughter of Scarlett and Kyros, the niece of Viola and the granddaughter of Riku Doldo III.[9] She is the former crown princess of Dressrosa,[10] who forfeited her title to live with her father[11] and currently serves as a lady-in-waiting to her aunt, Viola.[2]
appareance: While living under Donquixote Doflamingo's regime, she was imprisoned and forced to fight as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum. She joined a tournament to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi, winning the D Block and battling in the finals before Sabo claimed the Devil Fruit.[1]

Name: Reck
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: Reck[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Reck is a slim man with curly, parted hair and sporting eyeliner. He wears a leather jacket and knee-length pants.[1]

Name: Recycle-Wan
description: The Recycle-Wan is a mechanical dog-like creature that eats scraps and litter on Egghead.[1]
appareance: The Recycle-Wan has a metallic body with a spiked collar around its neck. Its torso has holes for ventilation and a chimney on its back for exhaust smoke. It is unknown whether it is a cyborg or fully mechanical.[1]

Name: Red King
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1107.
description: Red King is a Marine Vice Admiral and one of the nine that took part in the Egghead Incident.[1]
appareance: He serves as a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: Redwolf
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Redwolf[2] is a Gifter of the Beasts Pirates.
appareance: Redwolf is a fair-skinned man with blonde hair, a square jaw and a cleft mouth. He wears frilled shoulder pads with a furred cape, a leather vest, a pair of dark brown gloves, gray pants with a belt, and boots. Due to eating a Wolf SMILE, he has a red furred wolf protruding out of his belly.[1] As a Gifter, he wears a pair of black horns.[3]

Name: Reforte
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Reforte[2] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was subordinate to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Reforte is a man with long yellow-blonde hair and a small stubble on his chin. He wears a white shirt that shows most of his chest in a V shape and also wears a black cape over it that is draped across his shoulders. He also wears a sash and a pair of pants with some sort of design on the sides. Furthermore, he wears a black pork pie hat and a pair of black sunglasses or goggles.

Name: Renona Topakka
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Renona Topakka[3] was a pastel-green wrasse mermaid and the mother of Kawamatsu.[1]
appareance: Topakka was a mermaid with pale greenish skin, blue eyes, and long bright red hair. She wore a short pink kimono with red ring patterns. Due to reaching the age of 30, her tailfin had split into legs.[1]

Name: Reuder
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Reuder[2] is a reporter who witnessed and reported on the events of the Summit War of Marineford from Sabaody Archipelago.[1]
appareance: Reuder is a middle-aged man. He has black hair and a stubbly goatee of the same color. He sports a beige newsboy cap. He wears a gray jacket with a white dress shirt underneath with a loose red tie.[1] He also wears matching gray slacks and a brown belt.[3]

Name: Richie
Note: His name was revealed by Mohji in Chapter 12.
description: Richie[5] is Mohji's pet lion, and a recurring member of the Buggy Pirates in all their various incarnations. He is classified as a Type C creature, "Big Savage".[6]
appareance: He serves as a supporting antagonist during the Orange Town Arc.

Name: Rika
description: Rika is a young girl from Shells Town, and the daughter of Ririka.[1] She currently serves as a waitress at the 153rd Marine Branch.[3]
appareance: Rika is a young girl with black eyes, and dark hair done in pigtails. When she first met the Straw Hat Pirates, she wore a striped one-piece dress with what appeared to be a drawstring hood.

Name: Riku Doldo III
Note: His real name was revealed in Chapter 726.
description: Riku Doldo III[4] is the recrowned king of Dressrosa after the defeat of Donquixote Doflamingo,[5] who dethroned him a decade ago.[2] The current patriarch of the Riku Family, Doldo is the father of the late Scarlett and Viola[7] and the grandfather of Rebecca.[8] During the latest Levely, he was one of the leading figures in the vote for the abolishment of the Seven Warlords of the Sea.[9]
appareance: Doldo entered the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi under the alias of "Ricky".[1]

Name: Rimoshifu Killingham
description: Saint Killingham of the Rimoshifu Family[3] is a World Noble and a member of the God's Knights.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Elbaph Arc.

Name: Rindo
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 54.
description: Rindo[5] is a member of the Kuja Pirates.[1]
appareance: Rindo wears a fancy orange frilled black jacket with purple spiral snake patterns on it. She lets it hang open, revealing her bosom and midriff. Her black hair is cut short and tied back into a bun on top of her head. Like Sanji, she always has a cigarette dangling off the side of her mouth. She wears a loose fitting orange belt which has a yellow and black patterned cloth in front of her waist. Like the other Kuja, she wears long black stockings with straps attached. Her skin bears a slightly darker tan than the rest of the island's residents.[1]

Name: Rint
Note: Her name revealed in Color Walk 4.
description: Rint[2] was one of the archaeologists of Ohara.[1]
appareance: Rint was a middle aged, overweight woman with long shaggy purple hair. She had a reddish-purple hat with a horizontal pink stripe around it. She also wore a shirt with hearts on it, and the sleeves rolled up. Her pants were yellow-green with vertical lines.[1]

Name: Ripley
Note: She was first mentioned in Chapter 1132.
description: Ripley is a giant from Elbaph and a biology teacher at the Walrus School.[1] She is the mother of Colon and common-law wife of Scopper Gaban.[4][3] She is part of the last generation of Elbaph warriors.[1]
appareance: Ripley is a giant woman of slender figure. Her most noticeable trait is a streamlined tattoo that runs down the whole left side of her body, from her left temple to her left foot. She has long, light hair arranged in braids at the front, with bangs partially covering the right side of her face.

Name: Ripper
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Commander Ripper is an East Blue Marine who heads the 153rd Branch. Formerly a subordinate of Morgan, he assumed control after Morgan was defeated by the Straw Hat Pirates.[1]
appareance: Ripper is an average man who wears the normal marine hat, shirt, and pants. However, his ascot is a light green instead of dark blue. He has tanned skin, brown hair, a pronounced jawline, and a brown mustache and beard.

Name: Ririka
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Ririka[4] is a bartender who runs a local bar in Shells Town. She is also the mother of Rika.[1]
appareance: Ririka is a woman of average height and weight. She has brown hair that is usually tied back. She wears a light green dress over a dark green shirt and brown sandals.[1]

Name: Risky Brothers
description: The Risky Brothers were a duo of Wild Zombie squirrels that served under Perona.[1] They were animated from the shadows of two pirates by the same name.[2]
appareance: Risky Brothers concept art from the anime.

Name: Risky Brothers
description: Ian Moore
appareance: The Risky Brothers are two male pirates working as members of the Rolling Pirates under their captain, Lola. They were members of the Thriller Bark Victim's Association, a group of Gecko Moria's victims who banded together. During the time their shadows were stolen from them, they were placed in two squirrel zombies who were also named the Risky Brothers.

Name: Rivers
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Rivers was the gunner of the Bellamy Pirates.[2][1]
appareance: Rivers is a tall man with a good physique. He wears a white hat with long ear-flaps, a dark-red V-neck shirt with grey trousers and brown boots.[1]

Name: Road
Note: He was first mentioned by a giant in Chapter 866.
description: Road is a giant from Elbaph[3] who is the navigator of the New Giant Warrior Pirates and was formerly an S-Class ranked mercenary for Buggy's Delivery.[1] In addition, he rules over a personal diorama full of entrapped humans and giant animals as its "Sun God".[4]
appareance: He served as a minor antagonist in the beginning of the Elbaph Arc, but later became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates.

Name: Rob Lucci
description: Rob Lucci,[1][12] also known as "Massacre Weapon",[6] is a masked agent of CP0.[3]
appareance: Originally, he was introduced as part of CP9, reputed as the assassin unit's strongest member in history.[13] Operating undercover to obtain the Pluton blueprints from Iceburg,[4] he worked as a sawyer, treenail, and bolt specialist for the Galley-La Company's Dock 1 in Water 7.[1]

Name: Robson
description: Robson is Wapol's pet, and personal transport. He is a White Walkie, also known as "Wooly Hippo".[1]
appareance: Robson is a large White Walkie, with long white fur, and an appearance similar to a hippo. He has long legs, and Wapol has placed a saddle on his back for him to ride on.[1]

Name: Roche
Note: His name revealed in Color Walk 4.
description: Roche[3] was one of the archaeologists of Ohara.[2]
appareance: Roche was an average sized man, with brown hair, similar to Thatch. He also had glasses, and wore a white coat with the sleeves partially rolled up. Under his coat he had a red shirt, with a grey color and two yellow buttons.[2]

Name: Roche Tomson
Note: Mentioned only character. Their name was seen on Impel Down level 5 prisoner list.

Name: Rock
Note: His name was revealed by Chadros Higelyges in Chapter 666.
description: The Yeti Cool Brothers are Rock (ロック, Rokku?) and Scotch (スコッチ, Sukotchi?),[2][5] a pair of giant assassins who were employed by Caesar Clown.[1] They are members of a mysterious type of giant.[3]
appareance: They serve as supporting antagonists of the Punk Hazard Arc.

Name: Rocks D. Xebec
description: Rocks D. Xebec,[3] commonly known as simply Rocks, was the captain of the legendary Rocks Pirates.[1] He was the father of Marshall D. Teach, one of the current Four Emperors.[2] His goal in life was to be the King of the World (世界の王, Sekai no Ō?).
appareance: He was a prominent figure four decades ago, before the Pirate King Gol D. Roger came into power, as he had assembled one of the strongest and most infamous pirate crews in history.[4][1] He was ultimately defeated during the God Valley Incident by an alliance formed by Monkey D. Garp and Roger, earning Garp the epithet "Hero of the Marines".[1]

Name: Rockstar
description: Rockstar[3] is a member of the Red Hair Pirates, being relatively new in the crew two years ago.[1]
appareance: Rockstar is a fairly tall and burly man with dark skin and a red liberty-spikes-like hairstyle. He wears a colorful attire composed of a dark-purple, double-breasted coat (with buttons similar to Magellan's), left open on his chest to reveal a light-orange, wide-collared shirt, and a red foulard around his neck. He has a yellow sash tied around his waist, that instead of hanging only on one side, like seen on most of the other pirates, hangs down on both sides. He wears light-blue pants and brown boots and carries around a green-hilted saber, hanging on his left hip from a belt he has over the right shoulder.[1]

Name: Roddy
description: Roddy is a bull mink and a Guardian of the Whale Forest.[2]
appareance: Roddy is a large, orange-skinned bull mink with two large horns, a small nose, and long, messy, light orange, bison-like hair flowing down his back.[3] He wears dark clothing with a light-colored cape draped above his shoulders.[1]

Name: Roji
description: Roji was the wife of Oran, the mother of Mizuira, the sister-in-law of Nico Olvia, and the maternal aunt of Nico Robin.[1][2]
appareance: Roji was a large, widely obese woman with thin limbs, wide and thick lips, small sad beady eyes, and curly red hair. She wore a simple short-sleeved orange shirt and black pants.[2]

Name: Rokkaku
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Lieutenant Junior Grade Rokkaku[4] was one of Axe-Hand Morgan's officers at the 153rd Marine Branch. He currently serves under Commander Ripper.[1]
appareance: Rokakku has tanned skin, with prominent cheekbones and a black (light colored in the manga) goatee. He has a scar above his right eye. He also wears a modified marine uniform with a green tie instead of the standard blue.[1] After the Timeskip, he appears to no longer have his scar.[5]

Name: Rokki
description: Rokki is a member of the Numbers in the Beasts Pirates, representing the number "six".
appareance: Rokki in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Rolling Logan
description: Rolling Logan is an army commander of the Majiatsuka Kingdom.[2] He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: Rolling Logan's concept art from the anime.

Name: Ronja
Note: She is named in Chapter 1143, but only individually identified in Chapter 1147.
description: Ronja is a student at the Walrus School on Elbaph.[1]
appareance: Ronja is a young giant girl with light hair tied in a three-segmented bubble ponytail which curls forwards, resembling the tail of a scorpion. She lacks any upper teeth apart from prominent square-shaped canine teeth. She wears a short fur cape and a patterned dress with light squares formed by dark vertical and horizontal lines.

Name: Roronoa Arashi
Note: He was first mentioned in SBS Volume 105.
description: Roronoa Arashi was the son of Shimotsuki Furiko and Roronoa Pinzoro making him a member of the Shimotsuki Family. He is the father of Roronoa Zoro and the husband of Tera.[1]
appareance: Based on his silhouette, Arashi had spiky hair.[1]

Name: Roronoa Pinzoro
Note: He was first mentioned in SBS Volume 105.
description: Roronoa Pinzoro is a swordsman from a village in the East Blue. He is also the husband of Shimotsuki Furiko, the father of Roronoa Arashi, and the grandfather of Roronoa Zoro.[1]
appareance: Based on his silhouette, Pinzoro had short hair that was spiky in the back.[1]

Name: Roronoa Zoro
Note: He was first mentioned by Alvida in Chapter 2.
appareance: Roronoa Zoro, also known as "Pirate Hunter" Zoro,[9] is the master swordsman (剣豪, kengō?) and combatant of the Straw Hat Pirates, one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet,[4] and is publicly recognized as the right-hand man and number two of his crew's captain, Monkey D. Luffy.[20][21][22][23] Formerly a bounty hunter,[6] he is the second member of Luffy's crew and the first to join it, doing so in the Romance Dawn Arc.[2]

Name: Roshio
description: "Executioner" Roshio[3] is a pirate captain who has a bounty of 42,000,000.[1]
appareance: Roshio's concept art from the anime.

Name: Ross
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Ross[3] is a former combatant of the Bellamy Pirates.[4]
appareance: Ross is a muscular man with the upper-half of his face always hidden by his light-blue baseball cap, which has the letters "ALLR" written on it. He wears a fur-lined dark-brown jacket, a green sash, and spotted green pants.[1]

Name: Rosward
description: Saint Rosward[4] is one of the World Nobles who reside in the Holy City of Mary Geoise. He is the father of Shalria and Charlos.[1]
appareance: Alongside his son and daughter, he is one of the main antagonists of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc.

Name: Rowing
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Rowing[4] was the scholar (学者, gakusha?)[3] of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Rowing's concept art

Name: Roxanne
description: Roxanne was a Baratie customer with whom Sanji spoke.[1]
appareance: She can be barely seen, but she is a young woman. She wears a skirt and blouse.[1]

Name: Rug Bear
Note: Its name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.

Name: Run
description: Run (FUNimation subs)
appareance: Run the Machete is an ex-pirate, who was a henchman for Caesar Clown. He is a spider centaur.[1]

Name: Rush
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Rush[2] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.
appareance: Rush is a man with long blonde hair that wears a horned hat. He wears a jacket that has white spirals on the jacket's yellow sleeves. He is also seen smoking a cigarette.

Name: Russian
description: Russian[2] was Senor Pink's wife and the mother of Gimlet.[1]
appareance: Russian in the digitally colored manga.

Name: Ryuboshi
description: Ryuboshi[5] is an oarfish merman and the second son of the royal Neptune Family on Fish-Man Island.[2]
appareance: He is an extremely tall and thin oarfish merman (shown when he spoke with Madam Shyarly), and is the second tallest of his brothers. He has wide eyes, long wavy dark pink hair, and beaver-like teeth.

Name: Ryuma
Note: His name was revealed by Hogback in Chapter 450.
description: Ryuma was a member of the General Zombies serving the Thriller Bark Pirates. His body came from the legendary Wano Country samurai Shimotsuki Ryuma, which was brought back to life after Gecko Moria infused it with Brook's shadow.[4][5]
appareance: Due to his affiliation and actions, he is a major antagonist in the Thriller Bark Arc.[6]

Name: Ryunosuke
Note: It was named by the Straw Hats in Chapter 804.
description: Ryunosuke was a "Rising Dragon" (昇り竜, Nobori Ryū?) created by Kurozumi Kanjuro using the power of the Fude Fude no Mi. It was created to aid Kurozumi Kanjuro, Kin'emon, Trafalgar Law, and the Straw Hat Pirates in scaling the leg of Zunesha to reach Zou,[1] and received its name from the Straw Hats.[2]
appareance: Ryunosuke was a large pink eastern dragon. Due to its poor composition, it had some physical traits which differed notably from actual eastern dragons, namely the head being indistinct from its body like a worm, a tail resembling a beaver's, and a pig-like snout; Kanjuro's comrades had initially guessed the drawing as a worm, snake, or lizard before it was brought to life. It possessed scales on its body, and a row of rounded spikes along its back. Its legs were extremely short, impeding its mission to climb.[1]

Name: S-Bear
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1068.
description: S-Bear is one of the Seraphim and a clone of Bartholomew Kuma.[1][4]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: S-Hawk
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1068.
description: S-Hawk is one of the Seraphim and a clone of Dracule Mihawk.[1][4]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: S-Shark
description: S-Shark is one of the Seraphim and a clone of Jinbe.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: S-Snake
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1068.
description: S-Snake is one of the Seraphim and a clone of Boa Hancock.[1][4]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: Saber
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Saber[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]  Despite being commonly seen at Ace's side, he was allegedly not a commanding officer. [3]
appareance: Saber is an average-sized, muscular man with slightly tanned skin, long legs, and long brown hair. He has a short, stubbly beard. He wears a blue-gray jacket with a light-color band on the arm, gray pants that cut off above his ankle, and light-colored boots. He also wears a headphones, a brown belt with a circle design, and a cream hat that has a red cross-like emblem on it.

Name: Sabo
Note: He was first mentioned by Portgas D. Ace in Chapter 574.
description: "Flame Emperor" Sabo[5] is the Revolutionary Army's chief of staff, recognized as the No. 2 of the entire organization and outranked only by Supreme Commander Monkey D. Dragon.[2] He is also the sworn brother of the notorious pirates Monkey D. Luffy and the late Portgas D. Ace.[10]
appareance: Raised in nobility by his parents Outlook III and Didit in the Goa Kingdom, Sabo ran away at the age of 10 with the intention of becoming a pirate and writing a book about his travels and met Ace and Luffy while living as a vagabond in Gray Terminal.[10] He tried to set sail just a few months afterward to get away from his family, but had his ship destroyed by the World Noble Saint Jalmack.[11] He was saved by Dragon but lost his memory in the process, and so devoted his life to the service of the Revolutionary Army. However, his memories would return 10 years later after hearing about Ace's death.[12] Two years after regaining his memories, Sabo would reunite with Luffy and also carry Ace's legacy by consuming his Devil Fruit, the Mera Mera no Mi.[13] After storming the Holy Land during the most recent Levely with several other commanders of the Revolutionary Army, Sabo was framed for the assassination of Nefertari Cobra, increasing his notoriety across the world and sparking several rebellions.[5]

Name: Sadi
description: Sadi[2] is a chief guard of Impel Down.[1] She always wants to be addressed as Little Sadi (サディちゃん, Sadi-chan?).[2]
appareance: Due to her actions, she is a major antagonist in the Impel Down Arc.

Name: Sai
description: Sai,[8] also known as Don Sai, is a member of the Chinjao Family and the 13th leader of the Happo Navy,[9] as well as the captain of the third ship of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[3] He is also a martial artist who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi,[1] where he met Monkey D. Luffy, whom he eventually pledged his loyalty to. He is now married to Baby 5, a former officer of the Donquixote Pirates who defected due to falling in love with him.[10]
appareance: He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc, and one of the central characters from The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet Cover Page Serial.

Name: Saikoro
Note: Its name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Saikoro[2] is a tanuki owned by Wakasa and Hiroshi that lives in Bakura Town in Wano Country. [1]
appareance: Saikoro is a brown raccoon dog with a mask-like dark brown patch of fur around its eyes and a large striped tail.[1]

Name: Saitank
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Saitank[3] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates' Armored Division.[1] During the Raid on Onigashima, he was tamed by the power of the Kibi Kibi no Mi and joined the side of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[2]
appareance: Saitank is a muscular man with a square jaw. He wears a light green helmet with spikes in the middle, a sleeveless fur coat with a jewelled chain, metal shoulder plates, a pair of white gloves, and a belt. From the waist down, he is fused to a large rhinoceros, with a metal brace on its horn and a tattoo of a skull with horns on its forehead. On the rhino's back, behind Saitank's upper body, is a large chair with the word "SASAKI" written on it, which Sasaki uses as a throne when commanding the Armored Division.

Name: Sakazuki
Note: He was first mentioned by Nico Robin in Chapter 319. His real name was revealed in Chapter 397. Formerly known by his admiral alias Akainu.
description: Sakazuki,[8] formerly known by his Admiral alias Akainu,[1] is the current Fleet Admiral of the Marines, succeeding the previous Fleet Admiral, Sengoku.[2] During the first half of the series, he was one of the three Admirals,[3] and was the last one out of the three to debut.[9] Upon becoming the Fleet Admiral, one of Sakazuki's first decisions was to relocate Marine Headquarters into the New World in preparation for the New Pirate Age.[10]
appareance: In the manga, Akainu was first mentioned by Nico Robin during the initial encounter with Aokiji.[3] In the anime, he was mentioned earlier by Vice Admiral Jonathan during the anime-only G-8 Arc, which aired after Akainu had been revealed in the manga.[9]

Name: Saki
Note: She was first mentioned by Tonoyasu in Chapter 940. She has only been seen in the anime.
description: O-Saki is a resident of Ebisu Town.[1]

Name: Saldeath
description: Saldeath[2] is one of the Chief Guards of Impel Down. He is the commander of the Blue Gorillas.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist in the Impel Down Arc.

Name: Salome
Note: Her name was mentioned by Boa Hancock in Chapter 575.
description: Salome is Boa Hancock’s personal Snake Weapon.[3]
appareance: Salome is a large white snake with large pink spots running down her body. The underside of her body is pale yellow, with thin horizontal black lines across it. She wears a horned skull with a couple of cracks on top of her head, has blue hair jutting out from the back of the skull, and is usually seen with what appears to be a smile.

Name: Sam
Note: Joke character. His name was revealed in SBS Volume 14.
description: Sam-san is a drunk man from Cocoyasi Village.[1] On many occasions, he wanders around unknowingly when he is drunk.
appareance: Sam is a man that is bald at the top, but has black hair on the sides of his head, and has a black mustache which is straightened down on both ends. He wear a black suit with a white dress shirt and purple tie[2] (white in the anime). His face is usually red due to his drunkenness. He has also been seen carrying a package at times.

Name: Samosa
Note: His name was revealed in the captions of Episode 889.
description: Samosa[2] is a king and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[1]
appareance: Samosa is an average sized man with blond hair. He has a long face, sunken cheeks, and thick lips. He wears a black suit, white shirt, and purple tie.

Name: Samurai Batts
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Samurai Batts is a visitor on Kyuka Island.[3]
appareance: Samurai Batts is a middle-aged man with a topknot that makes him look like a samurai. He has light purple swim shorts with dark purple polka dots. He also has a tattoo on both arms. He is seen carrying a blue and magenta surfboard with him.

Name: Sancrin
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Sancrin the Thief[3] is a member of the Longarm Tribe and Brook's former manager.[2]
appareance: Sancrin has a mustache which he shaved off as Brook's manager and black hair. As a longarm, he has double-jointed elbowed arms. While still a kidnapper, he wore an orange Chinese garb with the kanji 盗 (tō, to steal) on it.[2] As Brook's manager he wore a yellow suit with a red shirt underneath, and a black bow tie. He also wore red sunglasses with blue lenses.

Name: Sandayu
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Sandayu[2] is a bodyguard who worked for the oiran Komurasaki.[1]
appareance: Sandayu is a man of medium height with hard features, thick sideburns, hairy arms, and curly brown hair gathered into a topknot. He wears a dark turquoise kimono with a pattern of green circle and white tasuki. Sandayu also wears a pair of simple sandals.[1]

Name: Sanji
appareance: "Black Leg" Sanji[12] is the cook of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[5] He is the fifth member of the crew and the fourth to join, doing so at the end of the Baratie Arc.

Name: Sanjuan Wolf
Note: His was first mentioned by Emporio Ivankov in Chapter 538.
description: Sanjuan Wolf[6] is an enormous giant, known as "Colossal Battleship" for his size, and was originally one of the legendary criminals who was given a life sentence in Level 6 of Impel Down, as his crimes were so atrocious they had to effectively be erased from history itself. He was initially mentioned briefly by Emporio Ivankov.[7]
appareance: He was eventually freed from prison by Marshall D. Teach, and since then has become a member of the Blackbeard Pirates. He is currently one of the Ten Titanic Captains, as the captain of the Seventh Ship of the Blackbeard Pirates.[2]

Name: Sanka
description: The Medaka Mermaid Quintuplets are five young Japanese rice fish mermaids who are friends with Camie. Their names are Ichika (イチカ?), Nika (ニカ?), Sanka (サンカ?), Yonka (ヨンカ?), and Yonka Two (ヨンカツー, Yonka Tsū?).[1]
appareance: The Quintuplets' size in comparison to Camie.

Name: Sapi
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Sapi[4] is a fish salesman from Loguetown who sold Sanji the blue-finned elephant tuna.[5]
appareance: Sapi is half fish-man and half human.[4] He has a shaved head and a small blue fish fin on the back of his head. He has tan-ish skin, and seems to be quite muscular. He is seen with a large grin, and wears a dark yellow shirt with horizontal lines on it.[2]

Name: Sarahebi
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 95. She was initially named Rokuro in the credits of Episode 909.
description: Sarahebi[4] is a Gifter of the Beasts Pirates who works under Black Maria.[2] She was also a school teacher in the Flower Capital.[1]
appareance: Sarahebi's anime concept art

Name: Sarai
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Sarai[2] was a member of the Takotopus Pirates 30 years ago.[1]
appareance: Sarai is a man of wavy blonde hair that has bangs dropping down to the right side of his face. He has a prominent chin with some stubble. In the manga, he exhibits a tattoo on his left biceps.

Name: Sarfunkel
Note: Cover story character.
description: Sarfunkel is an inhabitant on the Island of Rare Animals. She is described as a barrel woman.[1]
appareance: Sarfunkel in the digitally colored chapters.

Name: Sarie Nantokanette
description: Sarie Nantokanette is the queen of the Goa Kingdom and Sterry's wife.[1]
appareance: Nantokanette's concept art from the anime.

Name: Sarquiss
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 223.
description: "Big Knife" Sarquiss[3] is the former first mate of the Bellamy Pirates, with a bounty of 38,000,000 on his head.[2] His epithet originates from the large dagger he always wields, which bears a strong resemblance to a massive kukri.
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist of the Jaya Arc.

Name: Saru
description: Saru is the pet dog of two of the World Nobles, Saint Rosward and Saint Shalria.[1]
appareance: Saru, like its World Noble owners, wears a helmet to "protect" itself from the outside air that commoners breathe. It has the appearance and color of the toy dog breed pug. However, its legs and body are longer than normal and its tail does not curl.[1]

Name: Sarutobi
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 97.
description: Sarutobi[5] is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates.[3] He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Sasaki
Note: His name and appearance were revealed in Chapter 978. He appeared shadowed in the anime in Episode 954.
description: "Overflowing" Sasaki[3][6] is a bluespine unicornfish fish-man[7] and one of the Tobiroppo, the strongest six Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates.[8] He also leads the crew's Armored Division.[9] Before joining the Beasts Pirates, he captained his own crew[4] called the Sasaki Pirates.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Satori
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 246.
description: Satori of the Forest is one of four former priests of Enel's God's Army, operating the Ordeal of Balls to punish criminals during Enel's reign.[3] He is also the oldest triplet brother of Hotori and Kotori.
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist of the Skypiea Arc.

Name: Sauce
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Sauce[3] is the king of the Jambalaya Kingdom (ジャンバラヤ王国, Janbaraya Ōkoku?)  and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2][3]
appareance: Sauce is a slim man with a puffed up chest. He sports a crescent-shaped facial structure, a large crooked nose, prominent lips and curly hair.

Name: Scales
Note: Its name was revealed in Episode 567's credits.
description: Scales[1][4] is a Sea King. It is one of the six Sea Kings that speak to Shirahoshi when she fully manifests the power of Poseidon.[2]
appareance: Scales' full body.

Name: Scarlett
description: Scarlett was the first daughter of the Riku Family and the former crown princess of Dressrosa until falsifying her own death. She was Viola's elder sister,[6] Kyros' wife,[7] and Rebecca's mother. She was killed by Diamante when Donquixote Pirates took over Dressrosa ten years ago.[1]
appareance: Scarlett looked very similar to Rebecca, wearing her pink hair in a braided ponytail with two pieces hanging down from the sides. She sported a light colored button up dress with frills at the bottom during Rebecca's flashback when they were at the Flower Field.[1]

Name: Schollzo
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook.
description: Schollzo is a member of the Franky Family.[1]
appareance: Schollzo is an average-sized, muscular man, with shoulder-length light purple hair. He sports black shoulder pads with large red stars, blue pants, and dark purple gloves. He also has goggles and a rope across his chest.[1]

Name: Scimitarta
Note: He originally appeared in Weekly Shonen Jump 2000 Issue 8, and was canonized in Chapter 1122.
description: Scimitarta is a member of the Endurance Curry Pirates.[1]
appareance: Scimitarta is a man with curly dark hair covered by a turban with his crew's Jolly Roger drawn on the front.  He wears a striped vest and baggy pants, along with a jewel necklace and bracelets ob his right wrist and upper arm.

Name: Scopper Gaban
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Scopper Gaban, also known as the "Mountain-Eater",[5] is a legendary retired pirate and former navigator[4] of the Roger Pirates.[1] His fame is said to rival that of his crewmates Gol D. Roger and Silvers Rayleigh, being known as the "Left Hand of the Pirate King". After the disbandment of the Roger Pirates and the execution of Roger, Gaban has come to live out his retirement on Elbaph, alongside his partner Ripley and their son Colon, being known to the giant locals as Ya-san.[3]
appareance: First introduced in Buggy's flashback sequence in the Orange Town Arc and later seen in Kouzuki Oden's flashbacks during his time with the Roger Pirates, Gaban made his present-day debut in the series through the "From the Decks of the World" cover story,[7] before eventually playing an active role in the main storyline during the Elbaph Arc.

Name: Scorpionlady
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Scorpionlady[3] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates and a member of the crew's Armored Division.[1] During the Raid on Onigashima, she was tamed by the power of the Kibi Kibi no Mi and joined the side of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[2]
appareance: Scorpionlady in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Scotch
Note: His name was revealed by Chadros Higelyges in Chapter 666.
description: The Yeti Cool Brothers are Rock (ロック, Rokku?) and Scotch (スコッチ, Sukotchi?),[2][5] a pair of giant assassins who were employed by Caesar Clown.[1] They are members of a mysterious type of giant.[3]
appareance: They serve as supporting antagonists of the Punk Hazard Arc.

Name: Scotch
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: "Iron Boy" Scotch[2] is a member of the Beasts Pirates working as the guardian of one of the former Emperor Kaidou's favorite islands.[1]
appareance: Scotch is a large man of great height. He is also a cyborg with modified body parts. His shoulders and head are covered in metal plating and his face is completely white and also appears to be made out of metal. He has a triple-barrel gun in place of his right hand.

Name: Scratchmen Apoo
description: Scratchmen Apoo,[9] also known as "Roar of the Sea", is the captain of the On Air Pirates[1] and was formerly an informant for the Beasts Pirates, led by Kaidou of the Four Emperors.[2][3]
appareance: He is a member of the Longarm Tribe and one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation", being one of the eleven Supernovas who came to Sabaody Archipelago two years ago with a bounty of 198,000,000.[1][10] Two years later, his bounty increased to 350,000,000.[7]

Name: Sea Boar
description: The Sea Boar is a sea creature that debuted in Hatchan's Sea-Floor Stroll.
appareance: The Sea Boar is a large ocean-faring creature, composed of a huge, bulky fish's body with a relatively thin dorsal fin and the head of a boar, complete with tusk, snout, and some hair on top.

Name: Seagull Guns Nozdon
Note: His full name was revealed in SBS Volume 97.
description: Seagull Guns Nozdon[3] is a former member of the Roger Pirates.[2]
appareance: Nozdon is a very tall and muscular man, being significantly larger than the majority of his crew. He is bald and has a dark mark that reaches from his nose to the top of his head. It is unknown if this is hair, a tattoo, or some other marking. He appears to have a similar marking on his left forearm. He has bags under his eyes, a round nose, large lips, and a square chin. His neck is very thick, making his head look slightly lower on his body than normal. He wears a light-colored sleeveless shirt.

Name: Seamars
Note: Cover story character. His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Captain Seamars[2] is the captain of the Space Pirates who appears in Enel's cover story.
appareance: Seamars' color scheme in the digital colored manga.

Name: Seira
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 65.
description: Seira is a bluestriped angelfish mermaid and a dancer in the Mermaid Cafe.[2]
appareance: Seira without her headphones

Name: Seki
Note: His name was revealed in the captions of Episode 889.
description: Seki[4] is the deposed king of Lulusia Kingdom[3] and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[1] He is the father of Princess Komane.[3]
appareance: Seki is a man with a pronounced jawline with fangs for his upper canine teeth, pointed ears, and long dark-blond hair that is combed back. He wears a long dark coat over a purple suit with a white cravat and pink rose boutonniere, dark trousers and white gloves.

Name: Sengoku
description: Sengoku the Buddha[11] is a former Fleet Admiral of the Marines,[2] succeeding Kong and preceding Sakazuki.[5] He retired from his leadership position after the Summit War of Marineford,[3] but remained in the Marines as an Inspector General.[4]
appareance: He was also one of the major figures from the time when Gol D. Roger, the "Pirate King", was still alive, and still continues to be in the present, even after his retirement from the Marines. He raised Donquixote Rosinante into a Marine and treated him like his own son.[12]

Name: Sennorikyuru
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 104.
description: Sennorikyuru is the master of tea ceremonies and is considered the best cook of Wano Country.[2][1]
appareance: Sennorikyuru is a heavy set man with a triple chin and long fingers. His attire include a kimono and a dark cap.[1]

Name: Senor Pink
description: Senor Pink[1] is an assassin and officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Diamante Army.[2][5] He was also the husband of Russian and the father of Gimlet.[6]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Sentomaru
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 511.
description: Sentomaru[5] is a former Marine Officer[2] and the former captain (隊長, taichō?) of the Marines' Science Unit, as well as Dr. Vegapunk's former bodyguard.[3] He turned against the World Government and the Marines by siding with Vegapunk and the Straw Hat Pirates during the Egghead Incident.[7]
appareance: Due to his actions, he can be considered a supporting antagonist in the Sabaody Archipelago Arc and the secondary antagonist of the Return to Sabaody Arc. He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates in the Egghead Arc.

Name: Serizawa
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Serizawa[2] is a dyer and instructor who taught Bellamy in the cover page serial The Stories of the Self-Proclaimed Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[1]
appareance: Serizawa's appearance in the digitally colored chapters.

Name: Seto
description: Seto was one of the Shandia who lived on Jaya four hundred years ago.[1]
appareance: Younger Seto.

Name: Shachi
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 62.
description: Shachi[5] is a member of the Heart Pirates.[1]
appareance: Shachi is an average sized lean man with red (brown in the anime) hair that reaches his shoulders. Like most of the Heart Pirates he wears a beige overall, with their Jolly Roger displayed on the back and the chest pocket, as well as brown boots. He wears a blue hat with a red brim and is always seen wearing sunglasses. There is also a tattoo located on his forearms.

Name: Shaka
description: Shaka, also designated as Punk-01 (PUNK-01（パンク ワン）, Panku-Wan?), is one of the six satellites of Dr. Vegapunk, embodying his aspect of "good".[1]
appareance: He is a major ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Egghead Arc.

Name: Shakuyaku
Note: Also known by her alias, Shakky.
description: Shakuyaku,[3][5] most commonly known by her nickname Shakky, is the bartender of Shakky's Rip-off Bar on the Sabaody Archipelago,[1] where she lives with her husband Silvers Rayleigh.[6]
appareance: Shakky formerly served in the Kuja Pirates as the First Mate of Gloriosa, her captain and the Kuja tribe's empress.
