She later succeeded Gloriosa as both the Kuja Pirates' captain as well as the Kuja's empress, before eventually being succeeded by Tritoma and Boa Hancock.[2] Shakky is known for once being chased by the legendary Marine, Monkey D. Garp, and being sought by the Roger Pirates.[7]

Name: Shalria
description: Saint Shalria[2] is a World Noble, the younger sister of Saint Charlos, and the daughter of Saint Rosward.[1]
appareance: Alongside the rest of her family, Shalria is one of the main antagonists of the Sabaody Archipelago Arc.

Name: Sham
description: Sham is an officer of the Black Cat Pirates.[2] Along with his partner Buchi, he is also the protector of the crew's ship, the Bezan Black, and together they are known as the Nyaban Brothers (ニャーバン・兄弟（ブラザーズ）, Nyāban Burazāzu?).[1]
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a supporting antagonist during the Syrup Village Arc.

Name: Shanba
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Shanba[4] is an inhabitant of Torino Kingdom. He was first seen at the time of Chopper's arrival.[2]
appareance: As an inhabitant of Torino Kingdom, Shanba is rather short and fat, and has black hair and a black mustache. He also has a distinctive eye tattoo on his right arm.

Name: Shandia Chief
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 281.
description: The Shandia chief is the leader of the Shandia tribe.
appareance: The Shandia chief is an elderly man with a gray beard and mustache, and long hair of the same color. He wears the standard Shandia attire, covered by a long robe, and carries a staff, with a tribal mask on the top, and white fur underneath it. On his head, the Shandia chief wears an canine head as a helmet, decorated with feathers, probably a symbol of his status.[1]

Name: Shanks
description: "Red-Haired" Shanks,[10] commonly known as just "Red Hair",[13] is the chief[6] of the Red Hair Pirates[2] and one of the Four Emperors that rule over the New World.[3]
appareance: Born to the Figarland Family of the World Nobles, Shanks is the son of Figarland Garling and the younger twin brother of Shamrock.[5] However, as an infant, Shanks was discovered by the Roger Pirates at God Valley, sometime after the God Valley Incident.[14] Shanks was then adopted and raised onboard the Oro Jackson, beginning his pirate career within Roger's crew as an apprentice alongside Buggy, before forming his own crew following Roger's death 24 years ago[4] and renouncing his birthright as a Celestial Dragon.

Name: Sharinguru
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook.
description: Captain Sharinguru[3][4] is a Marine captain who helped in the Buster Call on Enies Lobby.[1]
appareance: Sharinguru in his youth as a Marine.

Name: Sheepshead
description: Sheepshead is a Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates who was in charge of the Gifters on Zou.[2]
appareance: Sheepshead is a muscular man of tall height with short, light blonde, slicked-back hair and two small black horns on his head like other Gifters. He wears goggles over his eyes and an open black cloak that exposes his bare chest with three straps on his abs and he also wears frilled shoulder pads with furred cape and a chain holding it, and also appears to wear fingerless gloves. There is a scar running the length of his chest, and his left forearm is entirely tattooed with circles with single dots on it. He wears a frilled belt with the Beasts Pirates' Jolly Roger on it and long black pants with knee pads and black boots. When activating his Sheep SMILE his hair becomes long and curly and both hands transforms into ram horns.[2]

Name: Shelly
description: Shelly is Tonjit's hooorse and an animal of Long Ring Long Land.[1]
appareance: Shelly in One Piece Everyday's "Chopper Pedometer.

Name: Shepherd Ju Peter
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1086.
description: Saint Shepherd Ju Peter[3][4] is a World Noble of the Shepherd Family and one of the Five Elders who publicly head the World Government,[1] holding the title of Warrior God of Agriculture.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is one of the secondary antagonists of the Egghead Arc. Along with the other Elders, he is one of the main antagonists of the Final Saga and one of the overarching antagonists of the One Piece series.

Name: Shepherd Sommers
description: Saint Sommers of the Shepherd Family is a World Noble and a member of the God's Knights[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a major antagonist in the Elbaph Arc.

Name: Shiki
Note: He was first mentioned by Sengoku in Chapter 530.
description: Shiki the Golden Lion, also known as the "Flying Pirate",[1] is the admiral and helmsman of the Golden Lion Pirates.[6] He is also a former member of the Rocks Pirates[3] and the first known[7] prisoner to have ever escaped from Impel Down.[1]
appareance: Shiki wreaked havoc on the seas during Roger's time, having commanded the largest pirate fleet of that period. Considered one of Roger's greatest rivals, Shiki desired to conquer the world.

Name: Shikon Kettai
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Shikon Kettai[2] is a member of the Germ Pirates.[1]
appareance: Kettai in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Shimotsuki Furiko
Note: She was first mentioned in SBS Volume 105.
description: Shimotsuki Furiko is a member of the Shimotsuki Family, a direct descendant of the legendary samurai Shimotsuki Ryuma and the older sister of Shimotsuki Ushimaru. She is also the wife of Roronoa Pinzoro, the mother of Roronoa Arashi, and the grandmother of Roronoa Zoro.[1]
appareance: Based on her silhouette, Furiko had long hair and prominent eyelashes.[1]

Name: Shimotsuki Koushirou
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook. His full name was revealed in SBS Volume 105.
description: Shimotsuki Koushirou[1][3] is a member of the Shimotsuki Family and a master swordsman, he was both the teacher of as well as the distant relative of Roronoa Zoro. He is also the father of the late Shimotsuki Kuina[4] and son of Shimotsuki Kouzaburou.[5] He is the master of Isshin Dojo in Shimotsuki Village.[2]
appareance: Koushirou has black hair tied back in a long ponytail, his face is wrinkled and wears glasses with circular frames. He always wears a gray yukata and sometimes he has a beige haori over it with two crossed swords on the left breast.[6]

Name: Shimotsuki Kouzaburou
Note: He was first mentioned by Tenguyama Hitetsu in Chapter 955.
description: Shimotsuki Kouzaburou[3] was a member of the Shimotsuki Family and a swordsmith who crafted the Great Grade Blades, Wado Ichimonji and Enma. He was born in Wano Country, but illegally departed from there 55 years ago[2] and eventually settled down in what became Shimotsuki Village in the East Blue. There, he fathered a son named Koushirou, making him the grandfather of Koushirou's daughter Kuina.[4]
appareance: The last time he was seen alive, Kouzaburou was an old man with a large, thick unibrow that jutted to the sides of his face, a ponytail over a tuft of gray white hair and a beard framing his jawline. He had a scar on his left temple as well.[4]

Name: Shimotsuki Kuina
Note: Her full name was revealed in SBS Volume 105.
description: Shimotsuki Kuina[2] was a childhood friend, relative and rival of Roronoa Zoro. She was the daughter of Shimotsuki Koushirou[6] and the granddaughter of Shimotsuki Kouzaburou[7] making her a descendant of Wano Country's famed Shimotsuki Family.[8] Her death at the age of eleven drove much of Zoro's ambitions as a swordsman, including his development of the Three Sword Style.[1]
appareance: She had short, dark blue hair and large, dark eyes. She wore a light pink short-sleeved shirt with a three-buttoned placket that she left unbuttoned, dark maroon shorts, and brown shoes. In the anime, while training at the dojo, she wore a white sleeveless shirt and cropped dark green pants.[9]

Name: Shimotsuki Ryuma
Note: He first appeared in Monsters. His full name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Shimotsuki Ryuma[7][5] was a legendary, world-famous samurai hailing from the Shimotsuki Family of Wano Country, who lived during Wano's "Country of Gold" era centuries ago. He was revered for his mastery of swordsmanship that earned him the title Sword God, as well as his feat of slaying a dragon.[8][2][9] He is the direct ancestor of Shimotsuki Ushimaru and Roronoa Zoro.[1][10]
appareance: 23 years before the current storyline, Ryuma's consecrated grave in Ringo was ransacked and both his corpse and sword, Shusui were stolen by Gecko Moria.[11] Eventually, his corpse was reanimated by Brook's shadow and turned into a zombie to serve Moria on Thriller Bark,[2][12] until it was destroyed by Zoro himself in a sword duel while his sword was eventually returned to his grave.

Name: Shimotsuki Ushimaru
description: Shimotsuki Ushimaru was a member of the Shimotsuki Family, and the last daimyo of Ringo in Wano Country. He ruled until the takeover of Kurozumi Orochi as shogun 20 years ago.[1] He was a direct descendant of the legendary samurai Shimotsuki Ryuma,[3] the younger brother of Shimotsuki Furiko, and the great-uncle of Roronoa Zoro.[4]
appareance: After failing to depose Orochi, Ushimaru abandoned his name in shame[5] and referred to himself as "So-and-So" (某（なにがし）, Nanigashi?). Alongside fellow daimyo Fugetsu Omusubi and Uzuki Tempura, he helped inspire a young Yamato, the son of their nemesis Kaidou, to pursue his dream of becoming Kouzuki Oden.[6]

Name: Shimotsuki Yasuie
Note: His real name was revealed in Chapter 941 by Kanjuro.
description: Shimotsuki Yasuie,[5] also known as "Yasu the Hedgehog", Tonoyasu, or just Yasu (ヤス, Yasu?), was a member of the Shimotsuki Family and a taikomochi who lived in Ebisu Town near the capital of Wano Country.[1] He was the adoptive father of Toko.[4]
appareance: Back when the Kouzuki Family ruled over Wano Country, Yasuie served as the daimyo of Hakumai.[3] Twenty years after Kurozumi Orochi's takeover of Wano, Yasuie sacrificed himself in an effort to mislead the shogun's forces and enable Kouzuki Momonosuke's revolution to continue.[6]

Name: Shin Detamaruka
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 81.
description: Shin Detamaruka[2] is a citizen of Dressrosa and a former dancer. She is the grandmother of Shin Jaiya.[1]
appareance: Detamaruka is an old woman with white hair and a large number of wrinkles. She wears a pink and purple polka dotted dress.[1]

Name: Shin Jaiya
Note: Her name was revealed in SBS Volume 81.
description: Shin Jaiya[2] is a citizen of Dressrosa. She is the granddaughter of Shin Detamaruka.[1]
appareance: Jaiya is a little girl with a long blonde hair in two pigtails, and brown eyes. She wears a blue long-sleeved dress with white collar. [1]

Name: Shine
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Shine is a Marine Chief Petty Officer who works under the command of Hina.[1][2]
appareance: Shine is a tall, tan-skinned man with broad shoulders who wears the standard Marine uniform of a white shirt with a blue ascot and a Marine cap. On his uniform, there are epaulettes that he wears on his shoulders to signify his rank. He has brown hair and a unique, two-pronged, black goatee that ends in a point. He also wears sunglasses and there is a tattoo of a ship on his left arm.[1][4]

Name: Shinobu
description: Shinobu is a kunoichi from Wano Country and a retainer of the Kouzuki Family,[1][7] having once served in the Oniwabanshu of the Kouzuki Shogunate and trained under Kin'emon as his protégée.[2] She is also the younger sister of Shinosuke.[8]
appareance: She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Shinosuke
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 100.
description: Shinosuke is a ninja who serves the Kouzuki Family.[1] He is Shinobu's older brother.[3]
appareance: Shinosuke resembles his sister in terms of body shape and outfit, wearing a dark blue ninja bodysuit with a spiked green frill around the neck. He has a small brown mustache as well as stubble on his chin. His long hair is gathered into a topknot (this is absent in the anime).[1]

Name: Shion
Note: Mentioned only character. Her name was seen on an arena battle board on Amazon Lily.
description: Shion[1] is a member of the Kuja. She is never seen but her name appears on the match-ups of the arena battle board.[1]
appareance: Little is known about Shion's abilities, but, since her odds of winning were 1:5, it can be presumed that she is stronger than her opponent, Kiku.[1]

Name: Shioyaki
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Shioyaki is a salmon Fish-Man who was a member of the Arlong Pirates and the head of banquets.[3][2]
appareance: Shioyaki is a salmon Fish-Man. He has pink skin, and a fin on the top of his head along with wavy brown hair. He has a black wave tattoo on his forehead. He wears a dark green shirt with a red flower design on it, a blue wrap around his lower body, tan pants, and brown sandals. He also has hair on his forearms.[2]

Name: Shirahoshi
description: Princess Shirahoshi, famous in the world as the Mermaid Princess (人魚姫, Ningyo Hime?),[4] is a giant smelt-whiting mermaid and the princess of the Ryugu Kingdom, as the youngest of King Neptune's children and the only daughter in the Neptune royal family.[2][8]
appareance: Having been locked up and raised inside an impregnable tower for most of her childhood thanks to the constant threat of Vander Decken IX, Shirahoshi wishes to know more about the outside world, following the will of her late mother, Queen Otohime. She is also the current incarnation of the Ancient Weapon Poseidon, to the knowledge of very few.[3][9][10][11]

Name: Shiryu
Note: He was formally introduced in Chapter 542.
description: Shiryu of the Rain[9] is one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates, as the captain of the Second Ship.[5]
appareance: He was originally introduced as the ex-Head Jailer of Impel Down, who had himself been imprisoned on Level 6 death row for his excessive, murderous violence against prisoners.[1] When temporarily released to help Magellan quell the prison riot caused by Monkey D. Luffy and Marshall D. Teach coming to Impel Down,[4] he chose to go against what he was ordered and instead assist the Blackbeard Pirates, ultimately deciding to join them.[2][3]

Name: Shishilian
description: "Full Power" Shishilian[2][4] is a lion mink and the captain of the Inuarashi Musketeer Squad, as well as one of the Three Inuarashi Musketeers leading the squad.[2]
appareance: Shishilian is a lion mink with a curly red[5] mane that falls down to his chest, a long and curly tail, and a swirly black handlebar mustache. He wears a purple cape and a large black hat with a feathery pink plume over a olive colored dress shirt bound with a bandolier, black pants held up by a thick red belt, brown boots with puffy furred pink rims, and purple gloves.[2]

Name: Shoujou
description: "Sonar King" Shoujou[2] is the big boss (大園長（おおボス）, ō bosu?) of the Shoujou Pirates, the head of underwater sonar operations around Jaya's coast, the sworn brother of Masira, and a follower of Mont Blanc Cricket, as part of the Saruyama Alliance. He and Masira were both fans of Liar Noland, the fairy tale concerning Cricket's ancestor, Mont Blanc Noland.
appareance: He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Jaya Arc.

Name: Shu
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook.
description: Captain Shu[3] was one of the Marine captains that helped in the Buster Call on Enies Lobby.
appareance: Shu in his youth as a Marine.

Name: Shura
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 248.
description: "Sky Rider" Shura was one of the four priests of the Upper Yard, who punished criminals with the Ordeal of String during Enel's reign.[2] He rode a giant flying bird named Fuza.[1] He is a major antagonist during the Skypiea Arc.
appareance: Shura resembles a stereotypical aviator from the early 1900s: he has a thin, pointed mustache that splits into two parts; on his head there is an aviator hat decorated with wings, and a pair of goggles on the front. His attire is composed of an orange fur-lined jacket, with puffy brown sleeves split into sections by beige strips of fabric; loose matching orange pants held up by a belt, fur-lined gloves and boots, and a purple scarf around his neck. He's dark haired, and on his back there is a pair of downturned wings, a standard feature of all the inhabitants of Birka. He carries his weapon of choice, a jousting lance, powered by a Heat Dial, and is almost always seen riding his pet giant bird, Fuza.

Name: Shyarly
description: Madam Shyarly[7] is a shortfin mako shark mermaid living on Fish-Man Island. She is the proprietor of the Mermaid Cafe[2] and Arlong's younger half-sister.[5] She used to be a fortune teller until she decided to discard her crystal ball.[3]
appareance: Madam Shyarly is a large mermaid with purple nail polish, red lipstick, and blue eyes with slanted pupils that resemble shark eyes. When angry, her eyes take on an ominous appearance and she shows sharp teeth. She has short black hair that covers over the right side of her face. Her tail is dark blue with a dorsal fin on her lower back where her human and fish halves meet, a white patch below the dorsal fin, smaller fins on the lower front and back, and a lunate caudal fin.  Uniquely, the dorsal of her fish attribute is the front of her tail, with the usual ventral attribute facing the back.

Name: Sicily
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Sicily[4] is a Marine Rear Admiral.[1]
appareance: Sicily is a man with a thin black mustache, brown colored hair and beard, and a scar below his left eye. He wears a classical Marine officer uniform, with the hat provided with plume.[1]

Name: Sig
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1118.

Name: Silvers Rayleigh
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 500.
description: Silvers Rayleigh,[2][9] also known as the "Dark King",[4] is a legendary retired pirate who formerly served as the first mate of the Roger Pirates,[3] being known as the "Right Hand of the Pirate King".[2] He is one of the major figures from the time when Gol D. Roger, the "Pirate King", was still alive.
appareance: After the disbandment of the Roger Pirates and the execution of Roger, Rayleigh became a coating mechanic at the Sabaody Archipelago. Also, at some point after this, he became the husband of Shakuyaku and befriended Hatchan.[10] Through Hatchan, Rayleigh became acquainted with the Straw Hat Pirates and volunteered to coat their ship so that they could continue their journey to the New World.[11] Following the Summit War of Marineford, Rayleigh tutored Monkey D. Luffy in Haki to prepare him for the challenges ahead and two years later saw Luffy and his crew off from Sabaody Archipelago, completing the job he had started for them.[12] After the Seven Warlords of the Sea were disbanded and the Emperor Blackbeard invaded Amazon Lily, Rayleigh personally intervened to put an end to the hostilities and intimidated the Emperor into retreating.[13]

Name: Sind
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 665.
description: Sind is a child who was held captive in the Biscuits Room on Punk Hazard.[1][2] He was freed with the rest of the children by the Straw Hat Pirates.
appareance: Sind became much larger than an average child due to the experiments done on him at Punk Hazard. His head is rather big and not very proportionate to his body. He has blue hair (blond in the anime), that is unkempt and goes over his ears, he also has blue eyebrows (blond in the anime). He wore a sleeveless shirt with shorts,[1] until Kin'emon gave all the children jackets. His jacket was light colored, with a dark colored hood, and fur at the end of the sleeves.[3]

Name: Skaldi
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1144.
description: Skaldi[2] is a student at the Walrus School on Elbaph.[1]
appareance: Skaldi is a young boy with light hair and a pair of horns, a result of his Ancient Giant lineage. He sports a pair of dark goggles over his head and wears a tunic plus furry clothing, including boots and a cape.

Name: Skull
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Skull[2] is a member of the Spade Pirates and, subsequently, the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: Skull is a man with an average build, a hairy chest, and long blue hair. He has an angular chin and a tattoo on his right arm, and he stands with a slight slouch. He wears a cracked skull mask, a red shirt with a skull pattern, bracelets on his wrists and left forearm, and a sash with a skull on it. He also wears black pants with a dark skull on the left leg, skull-shaped necklaces, and dark-colored boots. On his right hip, Skull sports a sword with a striped hilt and a dark sheath.[2]

Name: Sleepy
Note: He was first mentioned in the Green databook.
description: Sleepy[1] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with Whitebeard.
appareance: Sleepy is a overweight man with an oval shaped body. He has full lips, he lacks a nose, his teeth are pointed, and he lacks a chin, similar to a fish, his gaze of numbness is also characteristic, in keeping with his name. He wears a pirate hat at an angle, that seems to have a flower on it. He wears a tuxedo, with a light colored coat, white shirt, and bowtie. He also has dark colored pants.[1]

Name: Smiley
Note: Its name was revealed in Chapter 673.
description: Smiley, more commonly known as Slime (スライム, Suraimu?), was a pet of Caesar Clown. It was created by gathering and compressing the poisonous H2S gas that had spread throughout Punk Hazard and using Vegapunk's process of Zoan Devil Fruit animation to bring it to life.[5][6] It was kept in the Burning Lands before being released.[1]
appareance: Smiley, as its other name "Slime" suggests, was an enormous gelatinous red-violet mass that was compared to a mountain in size. Thanks to its Devil Fruit power it took on the shape of an axolotl with eyes, a mouth, legs, caudal fin and external gills. Smiley was able to subdivide into smaller slimes, however, the smaller slimes did not take on the shape of axolotls.

Name: Smoker
Note: He is formally introduced in Chapter 98.
description: Smoker the White Hunter is a Marine vice-admiral and the commander of G-5 Branch's Unit 01, as well as the overall Base Commander of the G-5 Marine base.
appareance: Originally a ranking captain in Loguetown,[3] Smoker became fixated on Monkey D. Luffy's Straw Hat Pirates for escaping his previously-unbroken authority, and—with his loyal subordinate Tashigi—quit his post to pursue them into the Grand Line. Since then, he has battled the Straw Hats repeatedly, in addition to many larger threats that won him new recognition and promotion through the Marine Ranks.[4][9]

Name: Smooge
description: Smoothie (Funimation)
appareance: "Rebar" Smooge is an ex-prisoner, who was a centaur henchman for Caesar Clown.[1]

Name: Snakeman
Note: His name was revealed in the credits of Episode 908
description: Snakeman[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates.[1]
appareance: Snakeman is an average-sized man. He is bald, but has horns like most Gifters, as well as prominent sharp teeth. He wears a blue shirt, purple cape, red pants, and brown boots. Due to him eating a SMILE, he has a green snake coming out of his abdomen through his belt and a snake tail coming out of his back giving it the appearance that the snake is going through him. He also carries a sword on the left side of his waist.

Name: Sodom
description: Sodom is one of the two gigantic King Bulls (sea horse in the most literal sense) owned by the Franky Family, the other being Gomorrah.
appareance: As a King Bull, Sodom is a much larger version of the normal Yagara Bulls in Water 7: an aquatic horse with fins in place of legs, while it wears odd sunglasses that most of the other Franky Family members wear.

Name: Solitaire
description: Solitaire is a Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates who serves as a vice warden of the Prisoner Mine in the Udon region of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Solitaire's anime concept art.

Name: Some
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1034.
description: O-Some[2] is a geisha who works in Wano Country's Flower Capital.[1]
appareance: Some is a young woman of average size with wavy pink hair that is tied into a bun at the back and has flowers attached on the right side. She wears an orange kimono with an orange and white checkerboard pattern on the top, as well as a yellow obi with a star pattern.[1] Queen considers her to be very beautiful, and states that she is his second choice for a partner behind only Komurasaki.

Name: Sonieh
description: Sonieh is the leader of 50-men mechanic team in the Foxy Pirates. Luffy chose their flag instead of one of their shipwrights.[1]
appareance: Sonieh is an average sized man, with light colored long shaggy hair on the back of his head, and sideburns. He has a small black goatee, stubble on his upper lip, and a round nose. He wears a rope around his forehead, like other craftsmen, and a cap on his head. Like other foxy pirates, he sports a black mask.[1]

Name: Sora
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Sora[2] is a coris mermaid[3] and an employee at the Mermaid Cafe.
appareance: Sora is a mermaid who possesses long blonde hair, with one strand of hair separate from the rest falling down the side of her face, her bangs curling up to the left.[1]

Name: Sora
description: Sora is a fictional character and the main protagonist of the comic Sora, Warrior of the Sea. The character's exploits are based on the actions of Marine heroes, in order to serve as Marine propaganda.[1]
appareance: Sora wears a helmet, a dark cape with a symbol resembling the Marines' and World Government's symbols combined, and light gloves.[1]

Name: Soro
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Soro was Helmeppo's pet wolf and the main reason that Roronoa Zoro was arrested by the Marines at Shells Town.[2] He is classified as a Type C creature, "Big Savage".[4]
appareance: Soro was a light brown wolf with yellow eyes. He had small pupils, a brown nose, and sharp teeth. He was also seen drooling.[2]

Name: Spacey
Note: Cover story character.
description: First Lieutenant Spacey is one of the automata created on Karakuri Island by Tsukimi.[1]
appareance: Spacey's color scheme in the manga.

Name: Spandam
description: Spandam is the former chief of CP9[3] and CP5.[1] He is the son of Spandine, who was also his predecessor as the chief of CP9. He currently serves under CP0.[2]
appareance: He planned to obtain the blueprints for Pluton and bring Nico Robin to justice.[10] Ten years ago, he framed Tom's Workers for a bombing attack on Water 7, which caused Tom to take responsibility and be executed. As revenge, Franky disfigured his face.[11]

Name: Spandine
description: Spandine is the father of Spandam[4] and was CP9's chief 22 years ago during the Ohara Incident.[1] He led the "investigation" in Ohara and was responsible for summoning the Buster Call. Presently, his political power within the World Government is weakening due to an unknown disease he has been stricken with.[5] At some point later, his sickness led to him losing all of his authority within the government.[6]
appareance: Twenty-two years ago, during the Ohara Incident, Spandine had a square jaw, with a slight beard on it. His hair was combed neatly, but with the back flowing. He was wearing a black suit with a peach hued shirt underneath, and a striped coat over it.[1]

Name: Spartan
description: Spartan is a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum who was going to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi, before being defeated by Luffy.[1]
appareance: Spartan is a hulking man with long dark hair that is pulled back. He has a scar running down the right side of his torso from the bottom of his thick neck.[1]

Name: Spector
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Spector[2] is the owner of the Tropical Hotel.[1]
appareance: Spector is a short, pale, middle-aged man who wears a white buttoned-up long sleeve shirt, a cloth around his waist similar to a green apron, and red pants patterned with pink flowers. He has small, thick lips, round eyes, and thick black eyebrows. He also has a tiny mustache that comes out from behind his lips.[1]

Name: Speed
Note: She was first mentioned by Kiku in Chapter 914.
description: Speed[5] is a former Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates stationed in Bakura Town.[2] She has since become a subordinate to Kurozumi Tama due to the latter's Devil Fruit powers[3] and became an ally of the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance.[6] She has been dubbed Umami (ウマ美, Umami?, English version: "Horselina") by Tama and Monkey D. Luffy.
appareance: Speed is a tall woman who, due to her Devil Fruit, resembles a centaur, with the upper body of a human and the lower body of a horse. The right half of her hair is white while the left half is dark-blue. She has purple eye irises, and a furry tail that is dark-blue on the left-side, and white on the right-side. She also has a light-pink piercing on her left long horse ear, and light-pink goggles on her head. She wears a half-white, half-light-blue jacket that exposes her cleavage, with dark-blue shoulder pauldrons, a short dark feather cape, a light-pink pearl-like necklace wrapped around her neck, three sets of turquoise bead bracelets on her left and right wrists, two sets of silver metal armbands on her left and right forearms as well as an additional set on her rear left leg, white gloves on each hand, she wields a longbow but has no quiver of arrows, and has a saddle on the back of her horse body that has a variety of accessories on it (such as satchels and matching turqoise beads).[1] During the events of Yamato’s Cover Story she is shown wearing a kimono, more in line with Wano traditional attire. Whenever she smiles, her mouth resembles that of a horse.[7]

Name: Speed Jiru
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 58.
description: Speed Jiru[4] is the former 14th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: Speed Jiru's concept art from the anime.

Name: Spencer
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Spencer[4] was a member of the Roger Pirates and their intelligence officer (諜報部員, chōhō buin?) until the crew's dissolution.[1][3] His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Spencer's concept art.

Name: Sphinx
description: The Sphinx is a giant sphinx that serves as the boss of Impel Down's Level 2, Beast Hell.[1]
appareance: The Sphinx's concept art from the anime.

Name: Splash
description: Splash and Splatter are two newkama pirate twins. They both willingly donated blood to Sanji when he was dying of severe blood loss.[1]
appareance: Anime concept art of Splash and Splatter.

Name: Splatter
description: Splash and Splatter are two newkama pirate twins. They both willingly donated blood to Sanji when he was dying of severe blood loss.[1]
appareance: Anime concept art of Splash and Splatter.

Name: Spoil
Note: His name was revealed by a Thriller Bark Victim's Association member in Chapter 483.
description: Spoil is the chairman of the Thriller Bark Victim's Association.[1]
appareance: Spoil's concept art from the anime.

Name: Squard
description: "Maelstrom Spider" Squard[2] is an infamous New World pirate and the captain of the Maelstrom Spider Pirates. Squard and his crew were allies of the Whitebeard Pirates and participated in the Summit War of Marineford.[1]
appareance: Squard is a pale, slim man of tall height. He has a bald top, but light-pink wavy hair that flows long downwards. He is often seen sticking his tongue out and has sharp teeth.

Name: Stainless
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Vice Admiral Stainless[4] is a Marine officer who participated in the Summit War of Marineford. In the anime, his name was said to be Kaizeruhige (カイゼルヒゲ, Kaizeruhige?).[5]
appareance: Stainless is a tall man standing at a similar height to Momonga, who is 8'3 or 251 cm, he is also a well built individual. His most distinctive feature is his handlebar mustache. His hair is black and combed back with a scalp lock, but by the time at the meeting in Mary Geoise, it was more straightly combed.

Name: Stalker
description: Lieutenant Junior Grade Stalker is a Marine on Vice Admiral Momonga's ship.[1]
appareance: Stalker is rather portly and has an odd, sickly skin tone. He has fat lips, dark circles around his eyes, bushy brown hair, and wears a white Marine coat and hat.[1]

Name: Stansen
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook
description: Stansen[6] is a giant from Elbaph,[7] who is a shipwright. After being imprisoned in the Auction House, he was freed alongside other slaves by Silvers Rayleigh during the Straw Hat Pirates' assault on the business.[8]
appareance: Afterwards, Stansen became a member and the shipwright of the New Giant Warrior Pirates, and the crew became S-Class soldiers within the mercenary group Buggy's Delivery. Upon his captain Hajrudin pledging his loyalty to Monkey D. Luffy, the crew left the organization.[2]

Name: Stealth Black
description: Stealth Black is a fictional member of Germa 66 portrayed in the comic strip Sora, Warrior of the Sea. His character was based on a Raid Suit created by the Vinsmoke Family that was later given to their estranged third son, Sanji.[1]
appareance: Sanji in his Raid Suit, which apparently heavily resembles Stealth Black.

Name: Stefan
Note: Joke character. He was first mentioned in SBS Volume 58.
description: Stefan is Whitebeard's dog. It is a character invented by Oda when a fan asked him in an SBS if Whitebeard's mustache could be used as a boomerang. Oda answered that Whitebeard probably did whenever he took his dog, Stefan, for a walk.[1]
appareance: Stefan is a white colored dog and bears a crescent-shaped white mustache similar to his master, Whitebeard.[1]

Name: Sterry
description: Sterry[4] is the king of  the Goa Kingdom and the husband of the queen, Sarie Nantokanette.[5]
appareance: He was adopted by Sabo's family at eight years of age, having originally been born in a separate noble family.[1]

Name: Stevie
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Stevie[3] is one of the two sea train organizers in Water 7, along with Bushon.[2]
appareance: Stevie wears a black conductor's hat, along with a black suit with epaulets on it, and a dark tie. He's got brown hair and a mustache of the same color, along with standard-shaped glasses.[2]

Name: Stomp
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.

Name: Strawberry
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook.
description: Vice Admiral Strawberry[5] is a Marine officer, and one of the five vice admirals who led the Buster Call assault on Enies Lobby.[1]
appareance: Strawberry is a relatively straight shaped person with a long beard. He is usually seen with his eyes closed, or at least half-closed. He wears a very long bearskin version of the standard Marine uniform cap due to his head being abnormally long.[6] Like many high-ranking Marines, he has a standard Marine's coat draped on his shoulders like a cape. Under it, and over a shirt left unbuttoned near the neck, he wears a water-green jacket, with pale yellow rope-like ornaments on the chest, and matching pants.

Name: Streusen
description: "Gourmet Knight" Streusen is the executive chef of the Big Mom Pirates,[1] and is also the co-founder of the crew alongside Big Mom herself.[3]
appareance: Prior to meeting Linlin, he was the chef of a pirate crew that has since fallen apart.[3] Since meeting Linlin as a child he has sailed the seas for decades by her side, even accompanying her during her time as a member of the Rocks Pirates.[2]

Name: Stroganoff
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Stroganoff[2] is the king of the Beef Kingdom (ビーフ王国, Bīfu Ōkoku?) and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[1][2]
appareance: Stroganoff is a middle-aged man with a wide face, sporting a smooth, dark mustache and a light-colored, scruffy beard. He wears a pair of sunglasses and a round crown.

Name: Stronger
description: Stronger[4] is the horse that Doc Q rides on. Because Doc Q is seemingly always sick, he rides on Stronger all the time, since the doctor tends to collapse if left unsupported for some time; however, Stronger is just as sick as he is. He is classified as a Type A creature, "Big Friendly".[5]
appareance: Stronger is a pale blue horse with very long legs. He has a white mane that covers his eyes. His ears also stick up out of the unruly mane and he wears a thin brown bridle.

Name: Stussy
description: Stussy is MADS' first-ever successful clone, having been modeled after Miss Buckingham Stussy.[4] She is a masked agent of CP0,[8] although she is actually a spy employed by Dr. Vegapunk and spent years working deeply undercover in the World Government until she was forced to discard her cover,[9] during which she was allegedly killed by the organization.[10] Additionally, while acting as an agent, she operated as an emperor of the Underworld under the epithet "Queen of the Pleasure District".[1]
appareance: Initially, she was a minor antagonist of the Egghead Arc, but later became a major ally to Vegapunk and the Straw Hat Pirates when her background and true allegiance were revealed.

Name: Su
description: Suu (Funimation)
appareance: Su is a Cloud Fox and pet of Conis.[1]

Name: Sugamichi
Note: Its name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Sugamichi and Warazane[2] are two land-dwelling catfish ridden by Fujin and Raijin, respectively.[1]
appareance: Sugamichi and Warazane are pink catfish with round bodies larger than an average human.

Name: Sugar
Note: She was first mentioned by Giolla in Chapter 718. She was identified in Chapter 731.
description: Sugar is a special officer of the Donquixote Pirates' Trebol Army.[2] She was one of the most integral components of Doflamingo's plan in keeping Dressrosa in line, as any dissenters were turned into toys by her Hobi Hobi no Mi powers. She is also the younger sister of Monet.[7] Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist during the Dressrosa Arc.
appareance: Sugar appears to be a ten-year-old girl, but is actually much older, being 22.[3] This halt in aging is due to the effects of her Devil Fruit.[2] She has aquamarine shoulder-length hair and dark blue eyes. During the takeover of Dressrosa, she wore a yellow dress and a cape with bear-like ears on the hood.[8] While she is in the underground world, she wears a white dress with light blue polka dots, a magenta hooded cape with bear-like ears, a monocle shaped and worn like an eyepatch on her left eye, and a small crown, as well as open-toed sandals.[9] Her monocle is pink with a purple lens.

Name: Sukare Karehosui
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Sukare Karehosui is a member of the Germ Pirates and the younger sister of Sukare Tainen.[1][2]
appareance: Karehosui in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Sukare Tainen
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Sukare Tainen[2] is the captain of the Germ Pirates and the older brother of Sukare Karehosui.[1]
appareance: Tainen in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Suke
description: Suke[2] is a gangster who is a member of the Kyoshiro Family in Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Suke's anime concept art.

Name: Sukoshiba Kanishitoru
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Sukoshiba Kanishitoru[2] is a guard working in Impel Down.[1]
appareance: Anime concept art of Kanishitoru.

Name: Sukune
Note: Cover story character.
description: Sukune is a yokozuna-ranked sumo wrestler from Wano Country. He is the older brother of Urashima.[1]
appareance: Like his brother, Sukune is a very large man with a downward-pointed nose and small eyes. He short dark hair that fans out behind his head and is tied into a topknot, thick eyebrows, and a thick mustache and beard.

Name: Suleiman
description: Suleiman the Beheader is a war criminal who joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1] He eventually joined the Beautiful Pirates, serving under Cavendish.[3] He is an ally of Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc.
appareance: Suleiman has straight, blond hair under a large black hat (decorated with a white skull and gold wings in the anime, mostly gold-colored with white accents in the manga), which covers one of his lilac colored eyes; it also has three bird-feathers. He wears a large black coat (dark purple in the anime) with a pointed collar, a pair of military medals, a pair of grey pants (black in the anime) and a pair of dark grey heeled boots.[1] He has a scar that goes across the center of his face.

Name: Sunbell
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Sunbell[2] is a Fish-Man and former member of the Roger Pirates.[1]
appareance: Sunbell is a tall and stout fish-man with webbed hands and a fin at the top of his head. He has large lips and tattoos on his head and arms. He wears light trousers and a Hawaiian shirt.[1]

Name: Surume
Note: He was named by Luffy in Chapter 606.
description: Surume[4] is a kraken[7] and famous giant creature which dwells in the deepest parts of the ocean.[1] He was enslaved by the New Fish-Man Pirates, but later became the pet of Monkey D. Luffy, who was the one who gave Surume his name.[7]
appareance: Surume is a massive, boneless, orange (yellow-orange in the anime), octopus-like creature many times larger than the Thousand Sunny, enough to place the ship on his head like a small hat, and even bigger than Wadatsumi, a fish-man the size of a giant. Unlike a regular octopus, he has a turtle-like head without a beak between the arms. Surume has many tentacles, at least eighteen tentacles (more than double the number of a regular octopus) can be counted.

Name: Suzume
Note: Its name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Suzume[2] is a rooster living in the Tower of Justice.[1]
appareance: Suzume is a small, pure white rooster with a bright red wattle and comb, a yellow beak, and small, beady eyes.

Name: Sweet Pea
description: Sweet Pea is a member of the Kuja tribe living on the island Amazon Lily.[1] During the timeskip, she became a member of the Kuja Pirates.[2]
appareance: Sweet Pea is a very large, corpulent Kuja warrior with a masculine-like build. She wears the traditional skimpy wear of the Kuja warriors, and also carries a snake weapon with her. She wears a coat around her shoulders, like Marine Officers, and has a very square, thick chin. She also wears her hair in pigtails.[1]

Name: T Bone
Note: He was first mentioned by Corgi in Chapter 362.
description: "Ship Cutter" T Bone[5] was a Marine Vice Admiral.[3] As a Marine Captain two years ago, he was a minor antagonist during the Water 7 Arc and confronted the Straw Hat Pirates on the Sea Train route to Enies Lobby. Prior to joining the Marines, he was a royal knight.[2]
appareance: Sometime around the Egghead Arc, T Bone was killed in the Pepe Kingdom for the bounty he received from the Cross Guild.[3]

Name: Taka
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: O-Taka[2] was the wife of Hyougoro. She was killed by Kurozumi Orochi's forces 20 years ago.[1]
appareance: Taka was a middle-aged woman with short, curly hair, blush marks on her cheeks, and lipstick. She wore a purple kimono with stripes and dots and a dark coat with blue flower patterns. She kept a hairpin on top of her hair and also carried a smoking pipe.[1]

Name: Tamikebao
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook
description: Tamikebao[3] is a retainer of the Kurozumi Family[2] and a checkpoint guard at the dock between the Flower Capital and Kuri regions of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Tamikebao is an averaged sized man. He has frazzled black hair tied up in a topknot, and a pencil mustache. He wears a light blue kimono with a blue vest and grey pants.[1]

Name: Tabuhachiro
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Tabuhachiro is an samurai and an ally of the Kouzuki Family.[3] After waiting 20 years for the return of the Nine Red Scabbards, he affiliated with the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance to raid Onigashima.[1][2]
appareance: Tabuhachiro is a large, heavyset old man with narrow eyes, large earlobes, and a wavy, black eyebrows. He has a blue and white flower tattoo on his right shoulder and wears an orange kimono with a white shawl. Like the other rebels affiliated with the Kouzuki Family, he has a moon tattoo on his ankle.[1]

Name: Tacos
description: Tacos is the king of the Shishano Kingdom and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[1]
appareance: Tacos is an older man with dark grey eyes, prominent cheekbones, a big nose and a thick jaw. He has black hair that's tied in a low ponytail behind his neck and a thick mustache that points down at the sides.

Name: Takao
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Takao, also known as O-Taka (お高?), is a kamuro living in the Flower Capital of Wano Country who attended to the oiran Komurasaki alongside Toko.[2][3]
appareance: Takao is a young girl who appears slightly older than her fellow kamuro Toko. She has dark eyes (colored teal in the anime) and dark blue hair styled in a bob cut. She wears a magenta kimono, a white haneri with a pink dot pattern, and a yellow ribbon around her waist.[1]

Name: Take
description: Take is a carp Fish-Man and is a member of the Arlong Pirates.[1] He is the commander of parties.[3]
appareance: Take is a Carp fish-man with light blue skin, long black hair, red lips, bags under his eyes, and a pink fin on the back of his head. He also has a hooked nose and sharp teeth. The tattoo on his forehead is the kanji for "love" (恋, koi?). This is a pun on how, in Japanese, the characters for both both "love" and "carp" can be read as "koi" He also has another tattoo on his chest of an arrow with two swirls. He wears a blueish-purple shirt with yellow wavy lines and green on the end of the sleeves, and a blue sash around his waist.[1]

Name: Tama
description: Tama is a friendly pet sphinx from Whitebeard's home island Sphinx. It is owned by Oide.[1]
appareance: As a sphinx, Tama resembles a lion with a humanoid face, sharp fangs, feathers along its back and arms, and a bushy mane which has a tuft of hair at the top that stands-up right. Unlike the sphinx in Impel Down, Tama is notably smaller, only being about three times larger than Marco.[1]

Name: Tamachibi
description: Tama (Viz)
appareance: Tamachibi is a child Dr. Kureha healed while she was in Cocoa Weed. He lives with his father, who is the owner of Stool, a restaurant in town.[1][2]

Name: Tamago
description: Baron Tamago[2] (also known as Viscount Hiyoko and Count Niwatori in his second and third form respectively) is a knight-ranked combatant of the Big Mom Pirates,[4] who originates from the Longleg Tribe. He and his partner Pekoms were responsible for collecting the monthly payment of sweets from Fish-Man Island in exchange for Big Mom's protection.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist during the Whole Cake Island Arc.

Name: Tamagon
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 45.
description: Tamagon[3] is a member of the Franky Family.[1]
appareance: Tamagon has a rounded body shape and is usually seen wearing goggles. He also wears a waistcoat as well as a red bowtie to match. Like the other members of the Franky Family, his lower body part is covered in bandages.[1]

Name: Tamanegi
description: Tamanegi is a former member of the Usopp Pirates, along with Ninjin and Piiman, before Usopp joined the Straw Hat Pirates.[1]
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Syrup Village Arc.

Name: Tank Lepanto
description: Tank Lepanto is the commander of Dressrosa's Self-Defense Army.[2] He joined as a gladiator at the Corrida Colosseum to compete for the Mera Mera no Mi.[1]
appareance: Tank is a very huge muscular man with disproportionately small legs. He has a thick dark pointed beard. While participating in the Corrida Colosseum, he wears only a left shoulder guard linked by a chain and a dark skirt with a belt and boots.

Name: Tansui
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook. He was formally introduced in Chapter 492.
description: Tansui is a member of the Macro Pirates[1] and a former member of the Sun Pirates.[3] He is an arowana fish-man.[4]
appareance: Tansui as a Sun Pirate.

Name: Tarara
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Tarara[2] is a dwarf from the Tontatta Kingdom.[1]
appareance: Concept art of Tarara.

Name: Tararan
Note: His name was revealed by a Spider Mice in Chapter 455.
description: Tararan was a General Zombie and the Commander of the Spider Mice on Thriller Bark. He was the one that had caught the Thousand Sunny in his webs, forcing the Straw Hat Pirates to enter the island.[1]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Thriller Bark Arc.

Name: Taro
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Taro[2] was a member of the Roger Pirates.[1]
appareance: Taro's other outfit.

Name: Taroimo
description: Taroimo is a cyborg dog from Karakuri Island.[1]
appareance: Taroimo is a light brown dog, with a black nose. He has metal around his neck, with holes, and a disk attached to either front sides, with and orange circle and the number "28" on them. Over his eyes, there is a piece of metal with vertical lines on it, and a red light coming out from it. On his back he has a yellow propeller type thing. Around the top part of his backside is another piece of metal. He also has sharp teeth.

Name: Tashigi
Note: Her name was revealed by Smoker in Chapter 97. She is formally introduced in Chapter 98.
description: Captain Tashigi[5] is a Marine officer serving under Vice Admiral Smoker in the base of G-5,[2] as well as a member and Captain of G-5 Branch's Unit 01.
appareance: She was originally introduced as a Master Chief Petty Officer in Loguetown[3] but was promoted to Ensign[4] after the events in Arabasta.[9] During the timeskip, she was promoted to Captain.[2]

Name: Tate
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Tate[2] is a nurse who worked for the Whitebeard Pirates as part of the crew's medical division.[1]
appareance: Tate is a young, blonde woman with bangs covering one of her eyes. She wears nurse attire, lipstick and leopard-printed stockings.

Name: Tea IV
Note: His name was revealed in the captions of Episode 889.
description: Tea IV[3] is the king of the Eigis Kingdom on the Grand Line and one of fifty monarchs who took part in the Levely.[2][3]
appareance: Tea IV is a man with light blue eyes, long blond hair, a long dark brown handlebar mustache and on his thick chin is a thin goatee that resembles clock hands.

Name: Tegata Ringana
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 81.
description: Tegata Ringana[2] is a doctor on Dressrosa.[1]
appareance: Ringana is a middle-aged man with bushy black hair on the sides of his head and a comb-over on top. He wears glasses and a suit and tie, which is covered by a doctor's lab coat.[1]

Name: Tenjo-Sagari
Note: Her name was reveled in Chapter 1020.
description: Tenjo-Sagari[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates who works under Black Maria.[1]
appareance: Tenjo-Sagari is a slim, tanned woman with very long light green hair. She wears a pink, plain kimono. Because she is a Gifter, Tenjo-Sagari has horns, a long, green and blue snake-like torso, fangs, and a forked tongue.[1][2]

Name: Tensei
Note: Also known by his alias, Kurouma.
description: Tensei, also known by his Marine alias Kurouma, is the director of the Marine Bureau of Investigation.[1]
appareance: Kurouma is a middle-aged man with slicked-back red hair, a somewhat pointed nose, and solid dark eyebrows. He seems to be quite tall, appearing comparable in size to Sakazuki. He wears a black suit, a standard Marine cloak, and a pair of sunglasses.[1]

Name: Terracotta
description: Terracotta is Igaram's wife and the royal head chef who appeared very late in the Arabasta Arc. She is also the royal seamstress.[1] Her friend and helper is Maidy.[3]
appareance: Terracotta is a large woman with curly blonde hair. She looks almost identical to Igaram which prompts some characters to accuse her of being Igaram in drag. Zoro said, "A couple can only look so much alike!" when he first saw her. Terracotta wears a dark red tunic, with a orange lining, that has a white stripe. Under her tunic is a light blue shirt with white buttons. She also wears bright red lipstick. When she cooks, she wears a white headband.[1]

Name: Terry
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Terry is a bartender at a pub in Mock Town.[1] He is not named in the manga, but his name was given in the databooks.[2]
appareance: Terry is a rather round man, with tanned skin. His black hair is shaved on the top, but long in the back. He has a round nose, and a large black mustache that covers his mouth. He wears a short sleeved white shirt, and an orange bandana on his forehead. Terry has red tattoos with wavy and curled designs on both his upper arms.[1]

Name: Terry Gilteo
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Terry Gilteo[2] is an intelligence controller (情報管制官, Jōhō kansei-kan?) of the Revolutionary Army and was stationed at their headquarters on Baltigo.[2][1]
appareance: Terry Gilteo is a man with brown-black hair and a short beard and mustache. He wears a blueish gray cloak over a green jacket and has what appears to be a yellow kangaroo hat with headphones. He also wears black-spotted red pants with a pair of brown shoes and a pair of brown gloves. On the left side of his face, he has a scar. His eyes are also shadowed by his hat and he was seen smoking as well.[1]

Name: Tera
Note: She was first mentioned in SBS Volume 105.
description: Tera was the daughter of a bandit from the East Blue. She is the mother of Roronoa Zoro, as well as the wife of Roronoa Arashi.[1]
appareance: Based on her silhouette, Tera had long hair worn in a ponytail and prominent eyelashes.[1]

Name: Teru
Note: Mentioned only character. He was first mentioned in SBS Volume 11.
description: Mr. Teru is a carpenter who lives in Cocoyasi Village.[1]
appareance: Having built the bar in the women's quarters of the Going Merry, Teru is a skilled carpenter.[1]

Name: Thalassa Lucas
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Thalassa Lucas is the former king of the Ilisia Kingdom, a country in West Blue.[3][1][4]
appareance: Lucas is a middle-aged man with tousled short blond hair and a full, medium-length blond beard. His eyes are black, set beneath furrowed black eyebrows that lend intensity to his stern expression. Thick lips hold a cigar in his mouth.

Name: Thatch
description: Thatch[5] was the 4th division commander,[1] as well as the culinary chef of the Whitebeard Pirates.[2] He was murdered by Marshall D. Teach for his Devil Fruit.[1]
appareance: Thatch was a tall man with a light brown pompadour hairstyle, which went to a point at the back of his head, and a goatee around his chin. He also had a stitched scar running down his face, around his left eye, reminiscent that of Garp. Thatch often dressed in a posh uniform, with calf-long pants and a black belt around his waist, and brown shoes.

Name: Thormann
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1151.
description: Thormann[2] is a member of the Giant Warrior Pirates. He serves as a minor ally during the Egghead Arc, and, after being converted into a demon, a minor antagonist during the Elbaph Arc.
appareance: Like all giants, Thormann is a man of exceptional size, even towering over his crewmates thanks to his elongated neck. His attire seems to be inspired by hoplites, featuring a tunic, pteruges, and a helmet to match, as well as a large coat over his shoulders. He also has a small mustache.

Name: Tibany
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Tibany[5] is an okama from Momoiro Island. He and the other okama chased after Sanji and attempted to convert him into an okama.[2] In the anime, he was called Elizabeth (エリザベス, Erizabesu?).
appareance: Tibany is a very large middle aged man with long blond hair ending in curls who has some stubble on his chin and hairy legs. He has effeminate-looking cyan colored eyes and a very noticeable unibrow and wears a dark red shade of lipstick and a frilly pink blouse with light yellow flower patterns. He also has extremely prominent cheekbones and he can always be seen blushing.[2]

Name: Tilestone
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 336.
description: Tilestone is one of the five foremen of Dock One of the Galley-La Company in Water 7. Tilestone is the last of the foremen to be formally introduced in the story,[2] although he is present from the first scene Galley-La is shown in.[1] His specialties are cabinetry, caulking, and flag making.[2]
appareance: He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 Arc and the beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc.

Name: Togare
Note: His name was called out by Hody Jones in Episode 548.
description: Togare[2] is a Fish-Man that lives in Coral Hill.[1] In the manga, he was an unnamed background character, but he was given a name and his role was expanded slightly in the anime.
appareance: Togare is a bright-yellow-skinned fish-man with fuzzy dark brown hair. He wears a dark red cap and a light blue shirt with even lighter blue pattern.[1]

Name: Tokijiro
description: Tokijiro is a resident of the Flower Capital in Wano Country. He once possessed the blueprints to Kaidou's fortress on Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Tokijiro is a youthful-looking man with tyrian purple hair that sticks up in the front and has a topknot in the back. He wears a coral kimono with peach swirl patterns on it.[1]

Name: Tokikake
description: Tokikake,[2] better known by his alias Chaton, is a Marine vice admiral.[1]
appareance: Tokikake has broad shoulders, an angular jawline, thin eyes, and a sharp nose. He also has a large mouth, high cheekbones, and thick eyebrows. He wears a dark-colored fedora hat, a Marine jacket with a high collar similar to Issho's, a button-down long-sleeved blue shirt underneath with the sleeves partially rolled up, and a necklace that seems to have some kind of charm attached to it. He sports a yellow haramaki on his waist, and wears brown trousers. Like his friend Issho, he wears geta sandals. His Marine jacket has brown sleeve cuffs, matching the color in his alias. His jacket is also unique in that it sports a gridline pattern design. His hat has a band going around it that sports the same gridline pattern. He is often seen smoking a pipe.[1][3]

Name: Toko
description: Toko is a girl who lives in the Flower Capital of Wano Country and is under the care of Kouzuki Hiyori. She is the adopted daughter[2] of the late former daimyo of Hakumai, Shimotsuki Yasuie,[3] and thus a member of the Shimotsuki Family.[4] She worked as a kamuro for Hiyori, who was living as the courtesan "Komurasaki", until Toko angered Shogun Kurozumi Orochi and was driven out of the Flower Capital.[1] After the Beasts Pirates' fall from power and Orochi's death, she returned to live in the Flower Capital with Hiyori.[5]
appareance: Toko is a little girl with a large head and black eyes. She has relatively short pink hair that slopes down into points at the sides and a blunt bang over her eyebrows. She always has a big grin on her face. She wears a red kimono with a purple obi with blush-pink dots around the waist and tied with a small, yellow bow.[1][6]

Name: Tom
description: Tom[4] was a long-horned cowfish fish-man who was known as the most skilled shipwright in the world and the head of his own company, Tom's Workers. He was also Iceburg's[4] and Franky's teacher and Den's older brother. Furthermore, he was well known for being the builder of the Roger Pirates' ship, the Oro Jackson.[5]
appareance: Because of his association with the Pirate King Gol D. Roger, Tom was put on trial by the World Government and found guilty but earned the right for a pardon thanks to his creation of the Sea Train. However, in order to protect his apprentices from a frame up orchestrated by Spandam of CP5, Tom accepted his previous sentence and was escorted to Enies Lobby. He was presumably executed shortly after.[6]

Name: Tomatito
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Tomatito[2] is a musician who lives in Dressrosa.[1]
appareance: Tomatito's appearance in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Tomato Gang
Note: Joke character. His name was revealed in SBS Volume 27.
description: Tomato Gang is a debt collector who is after Pandaman.[2] The two often show up in panels together, as Pandaman is constantly on the run from him. He later hires Pandaman's rival, Unforgivable Mask to help track him down.[4] He carries something that looks like a gun, but there are rumors that it is actually a piece of konbu-maki (コンブ巻き, a type of food consisting of fish wrapped in seaweed and boiled).
appareance: Tomato Gang's appearance in One Piece: Grand Battle! 3.

Name: Tomozo
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Tomozo[2] is a shopkeeper in the Wano Country's Flower Capital who operated 41 years ago.[1]
appareance: Tomozo is a man of average height with a square jaw and a thin mustache. He wears a black hat, glasses on his forehead, and a dark coat with a gem pattern.

Name: Tonjil
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Tonjil[2] is Tonjit's grandson and Tonsfer's brother.[1]
appareance: Tonjil is a young boy with short black hair. He wears a striped tunic held by a sash and a white bandanna that covers his forehead.

Name: Tonjit
description: Tonjit is an elderly nomad belonging to a tribe that lives on Long Ring Long Land.[1]
appareance: Tonjit is an elderly man, with wrinkles and a round white beard. He has small round eyes, a round nose, and is missing one tooth. He has a purple-brown hat, with brown fur lining, and brown cloth on the sides. He wears a yellow tunic, with green lining with a circle design on the end of the sleeves, and side of the chest. He has a purple sash, with a red string hanging down. He wears purple shoes, held on by white strings, and grey on the toe area. He also wears vertical zigzag striped purple and tan pants.[1]

Name: Tonsfer
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Tonsfer[2] is Tonjit's granddaughter and Tonjil's sister.[1]
appareance: Tonsfer is a young girl with shoulder-length black hair tied in a ponytail. She wears a a light tunic with dark blotch patterns at the end of her sleeves.[2]

Name: Tony Tony Chopper
appareance: Tony Tony Chopper, also known as "Cotton Candy Lover" Chopper,[6] is the doctor of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[2] He is the sixth member of the crew and the fifth to join, doing so at the end of the Drum Island Arc. He was temporarily forced to join the Foxy Pirates during the Long Ring Long Land Arc but was quickly returned to Luffy's crew.

Name: Topknot
Note: Its name was revealed in Episode 567's credits.
description: Topknot[1][4] is a Sea King.[2] It is one of the six Sea Kings that speak to Shirahoshi when she fully manifests the power of Poseidon.[5]
appareance: Topknot is a large slug-like Sea King. It's body is a deep purple with a white underside, and it has an orange fin along its back, as well as a purple topknot on its head. Its face is on the underside of its body, causing it to generally remain bent upwards.

Name: Topman Warcury
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1086.
description: Saint Topman Warcury[3][4] is a World Noble and one of the Five Elders who publicly head the World Government,[1] holding the title of Warrior God of Justice.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is one of the secondary antagonists of the Egghead Arc. Along with the other Elders, he is one of the main antagonists of the Final Saga and one of the overarching antagonists of the One Piece series.

Name: Torasaburo
description: Torasaburo was a tiger created by Kurozumi Kanjuro using the power of the Fude Fude no Mi. It was created to aid him, Kin'emon, and Bariete scale Zunesha's leg to reach Zou, fading away after it achieved its goal.[1]
appareance: Torasaburo was a large blue tiger with black stripes, yellow eyes, and a short tail. Due to Kanjuro's supposed poor drawing skills, it's questionable how much it resembled a tiger, and Kin'emon didn't recognize it as such until he learned its name.

Name: Tori
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Tori is a member of the Blackbeard Pirates.[2]
appareance: Tori in the Digitally Colored Manga.

Name: Tosa
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1108.
description: Tosa[3] is a Marine Vice Admiral and one of the nine that took part in the Egghead Incident.[1]
appareance: He serves as a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: Toto
description: Toto is Koza's father and Goro's older brother, who lives in Yuba.[1]
appareance: Originally, Toto was a relatively fat but healthy looking old man. However due to the three year drought brought about by Crocodile's scheme, Toto's body had completely shriveled up from thirst and starvation to a point that he no longer resembled his former self. He has an elderly looking face, and a thick fuzzy mustache. He wears a white wrap around his head, and another grey wrap around his forehead. He wears black robes, that are torn in some places, and a green robe underneath with a dark red lining. Under that, he wears a vertically striped black and white shirt. He also has a turquoise sash, with blue dots.[1]

Name: Totts
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1101, and he was properly identified in SBS Volume 109.
description: Totts[3][4] is a member of the Bonney Pirates. He was once a resident of the Sorbet Kingdom, having been a friend of Bartholomew Kuma and Ginny since childhood.
appareance: After the Summit War of Marineford, he was arrested by Admiral Akainu following his crew's defeat against the Blackbeard Pirates.

Name: Toyama Tsujigiro
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Toyama Tsujigiro[2] is a Wano Country government official who lives in the Flower Capital.[3] He is also a serial killer who attacked strangers at night.[1]
appareance: Tsujigiro's anime concept art.

Name: Trafalgar D. Water Law
Note: His true name was revealed in Chapter 763.
description: Trafalgar D. Water Law,[17] more commonly known as just Trafalgar Law (トラファルガー・ロー, Torafarugā Rō?) and by his epithet as the "Surgeon of Death", is a pirate from the North Blue and the captain and doctor of the Heart Pirates.[1][6] He is one of twelve pirates who are referred to as the "Worst Generation".[1][18] He became one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea during the timeskip,[2] but his position was revoked for allying with the Straw Hat Pirates.[13] Like many other pirates, Law has dreams of finding the One Piece, while also desiring to know the purpose of the Will of D.[19][20]
appareance: Law is the only known survivor of Flevance, a town whose inhabitants suffered from a condition known as Amber Lead Syndrome. Because the disease was fatal and poorly understood, Flevance was destroyed by neighboring countries out of fear (including Law's parents and younger sister), with a young Law barely escaping alive.[7] He subsequently joined the Donquixote Pirates, where Donquixote Doflamingo intended to make Law one of his executive officers.[21] However, thanks to the efforts of Doflamingo's brother, Rosinante, Law was freed from the Donquixote Pirates' influence and became a pirate set to bring down Doflamingo's empire.

Name: Trafalgar Lami
Note: Her full name was revealed on the website for the World Top 100 popularity poll.
description: Trafalgar Lami[2] was Trafalgar D. Water Law's younger sister from the town of Flevance.[1]
appareance: Lami was a young girl with brunette hair in pigtails, with a cheerful and wide smile. When she became sick with amber lead syndrome, she had white spots all over her body.[1]

Name: Trebol
description: Sticky-Sticky Fruit (FUNimation)
appareance: Trebol[6] is one of the top three officers of the Donquixote Pirates, acting as a Staff Officer.[7] He occupies the Club seat of the Donquixote Family and is the leader of the crew's Trebol Army subdivision.[8][9]

Name: Tristan
description: Tristan[2] is a squirrel mink[1] and one of Inuarashi's subjects.[3]
appareance: Tristan is a light blue-haired squirrel mink with tan fur, a dark patch on her forehead down to her nose, and a large bushy brown tail with two dark stripes down the center.

Name: Tritobu
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Tritobu[2] is the prince of the Nagagutsu Kingdom. He accompanied his father Furrari to the Levely.[1]
appareance: Tritobu is a stocky man with a double chin, stubble around his mouth and short blond hair.

Name: Tritoma
Note: She was first alluded to in Chapter 517 and named in SBS Volume 109.
description: Tritoma is a former empress of the Kuja Tribe, succeeding Shakuyaku and preceding Boa Hancock. She died years ago, as a victim of Love Sickness.[1][3]
appareance: Tritoma's appearance 44 years ago.

Name: Tsugaru Umi
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Tsugaru Umi[2] is a woman who trained Nico Robin to perform as a geisha.[3] She lives in the Flower Capital of the Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Tsugaru Umi's anime concept art.

Name: Tsukimi
Note: Cover story character.
description: Dr. Tsukimi was an old man who appeared in Enel's cover story.[1]
appareance: Tsukimi in the digital colored manga.

Name: Tsumonsieur Kamaya
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Tsumonsieur Kamaya[2] is a former CP9 agent.[1]
appareance: Kamaya is a tall man with long, curly hair of a coral pink color. He has high cheek bones, a square jaw and prominent lips.

Name: Tsunagoro
Note: He first appeared as a silhouette in Chapter 940. His name was revealed in Chapter 952.
description: "Broken Hat" Tsunagoro is a yakuza boss who was in charge of the Hakumai region in Wano Country. He was imprisoned in Udon by the Beasts Pirates, but was freed when Luffy took over the prison.[3][2]
appareance: Tsunagoro is a thin man with a long face and light colored hair. He has a signature double chonmage, while the rest of his hair falls down his face, covering his right eye. He is constantly seen with a sinister grin and twig in his mouth.[3]

Name: Tsunokkov
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Tsunokkov[3] is a former prisoner of Impel Down and resident of Newkama Land in Level 5.5. He is one of Emporio Ivankov's dancers.[2]
appareance: Anime concept art of Tsunokkov.

Name: Tsuru
description: Tsuru, known as the "Great Staff Officer", is a renowned Marine Vice Admiral,[1] as well as the grandmother of Kujaku.[6]
appareance: Tsuru is a tall, thin, and elderly woman with gray hair tied in a bun. Her attire appears to be less formal than the other high-ranking officers', consisting of an untucked shirt, with the sleeves rolled up and a tie around her neck, and calves-long pants, which makes her somewhat resemble the animal of her name, the crane. She sports earrings made of beads, and wears two bracelets on her right wrist. The epaulets on her Marine coat are golden for the outer epaulets and purple with two white dots for the inner epaulets.[1] During the time of the Battle of Edd War, they were the standard blue.

Name: Tsurube
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: "Careless" Tsurube was a retainer of the Kurozumi Family[2][3] who burned to death after accidentally falling into the boiling oil prepared for Kouzuki Oden's execution.[1]
appareance: Tsurube was an average-sized man with semi-long dark brown hair tied in a topknot. He wore a light gray kimono, a dark gray hakama, a black kataginu with white Kurozumi Family crests on both sides, white tabi socks and sandals.[1]

Name: Tsurue Monnosuke
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Tsurue Monnosuke[2] is the machi-bugyō of the Flower Capital.[1]
appareance: Monnosuke is an average-sized man with brown hair that is shaven to buzzcut at the top, but styled into a topknot at the back and forms wing-like curls on the sides. He wears a light blue kimono, light blue hakama and a dark blue vest.[1]

Name: Tsurujo
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 913. Her full name was revealed in Chapter 960.
description: Tsurujo,[3][4] commonly known as O-Tsuru (お鶴?, VIZ: "Otsuru"), is a tea house owner who lives in the Kuri region in Wano Country.[2] She is also the wife of Kin'emon.[5]
appareance: Tsuru has a youthful appearance for a lady of her age. She has light brown eyes and black hair in a shimada style with a gold crane-shaped hairpin. She has a prominent nose and wears lipstick. She wears a blue kimono with light blue clouds and white crane patterns. She also has large pale blue obi with teal polka dots.[1] After the Okobore Town incident, Tsuru has two burn scars on her forehead and the left side of her face.[6]

Name: Turco
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Turco[4] is a member of the Fake Straw Hat Crew and masqueraded as Franky.[2] When the crew switched to posing as the Kid Pirates, Turco impersonated Wire.[5]
appareance: Turco's disguise as Wire.

Name: Tyrannosaurus
description: Tyrannosaurus is Iceburg's pet mouse.[2]
appareance: Tyrannosaurus is a small, white mouse, with a long hairless tail, red eyes, and a cheerful look.[1]

Name: Ubau
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Ubau[2] was the God of Skypiea roughly 400 years ago. His desire to live on the Vearth the Shandia had called home initiated a war between the Skypieans and Shandia that would last over 400 years.[1]
appareance: Ubau was a massive, heavyset man who was over twice the height of a normal person. He had puffy black hair, a goatee with a large nose, prominent cheekbones, thick lips, and a very thick neck. Ubau wore white robes and smoked cigars.[1]

Name: Ucy
Note: He was named by Luffy in Chapter 714.
description: "Brutal Bull" Ucy[2] is a fighting bull (闘牛, Tōgyū?) that regularly competed as a gladiator in Dressrosa's Corrida Colosseum, where he was befriended (and named) by Monkey D. Luffy.[1][4]
appareance: He serves as an ally to Luffy during the Dressrosa Arc.

Name: Uhho
Note: Its name was revealed in SBS Volume 81.
description: Uhho-kun[2] is a gorilla.[1]
appareance: Uhho as a toy.

Name: Uholisia
Note: She was first mentioned by Chinjao in Chapter 771. Her appearance was revealed in SBS Volume 77, and was retrospectively added to the anime adaptation of the chapter she was mentioned in.
description: Uholisia is the daughter of Chichilisia, the leader of the Niho Navy.[5] She is the wife of 25 men and Sai's former fiancée.[3]
appareance: Uholisia is a very muscular and masculine woman with blonde hair who is about as tall as Sai. She has red patches on her cheeks and very pronounced lips. Her facial features are very similar to those of Okama.[1] She wears a blue dress with pink and yellow flowers on it.[3]

Name: UK
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 102.
description: UK[2] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: UK's original concept art.

Name: Ukkari
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Seaman Recruit Ukkari[4] is a Marine who serves at the Shells Town Marine base.[1]
appareance: Ukkari is a short man. He wears the standard Marine uniform: a white sleeveless shirt and hat.[1]

Name: Ukon
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Ukon is a samurai who allied with the Kouzuki Family.[2] After waiting 20 years for the return of the Nine Red Scabbards, he affiliated with the Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance to raid Onigashima.[1]
appareance: Ukon is a tall, fair-skinned man who is almost twice Usopp's height. He has blonde puffy hair tie up in a chonmage, sideburns that extend down to his jawline, a pointed nose, slim eyes, and black eyebrows. He wears a grey kimono with a slate-colored square pattern on it, and a light green cloak with a darker green, blotchy patterns on the sleeves and bottom of the cape. He also wears geta with a dark-colored strap and has a reverse crescent moon tattoo on his ankle.[1]

Name: Ulti
Note: Her name and appearance were revealed in Chapter 978.
description: Ulti[4] is a former member of the Tobiroppo, the six strongest Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates.[5] She is the elder sister of fellow former Tobiroppo Page One, and the daughter of a former Warlord of the Sea, Hanafuda.[6][7] Following the downfall of the Beasts Pirates, Ulti swore loyalty to Yamato for saving her and Page One from Who's-Who.[8]
appareance: Due to her actions and role, she is a supporting antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Ultraking
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Ultraking[3] was the assistant-manager of Rain Dinners in Rainbase during the Arabasta Arc.[2]
appareance: Ultraking is an average sized man, with wild white hair that resembles a crown. He has a tiny bit of hair on his upper lip and sports a black suit over a purple shirt and red bowtie.[2]

Name: Umit
description: "Deep-Sea Currents" Umit is a magnate who presides Umit Shipping and one of the emperors of the Underworld.[2]
appareance: Umit's concept art from the anime.

Name: Underbite
Note: Its name was revealed in Episode 567's credits.
description: Underbite[1][4] is a Sea King.[2] It is one of the six Sea Kings that speak to Shirahoshi when she fully manifests the power of Poseidon.[5]
appareance: Underbite's full body.

Name: Unforgivable Mask
Note: Joke character. His name was revealed in SBS Volume 48.
description: Unforgivable Mask is a hidden One Piece character, much like Pandaman. He is, in fact, Pandaman's rival.
appareance: Unforgivable Mask's appearance is that of a muscle-bound figure with a panda face as a mask. He wears black swim briefs and boots. Unlike Pandaman (and others with a similar style), who appears to have an authentic panda's head, Unforgivable Mask actually appears to be wearing a mask.[1]

Name: Uni
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 83.
description: Uni[2] is a member of the Heart Pirates.[1]
appareance: Uni is a tall man with puffy light hair (dark brown in the anime). It is unclear whether his eyes show to have irises or pupils, as he has appeared both ways. He wears a gray bandana with vertical black stripes on his face, which covers his entire face and goes all the way down to his upper chest. Like most members of the Heart Pirates, he wears a white boiler suit with the Heart Pirates' Jolly Roger on the left breast.[1]

Name: Unigaro
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Unigaro[2] was a Wild Zombie who lived on Thriller Bark.[3]
appareance: Unigaro's appearance can be described as a typical zombie unicorn. He had a gray skin tone and dark red hair. He had bandages wrapped all over his body, and a horn on his head. His zombie number, 42, is on his right shoulder (or frontal right leg).[1]

Name: Urashima
