description: Urashima is a yokozuna-ranked sumo wrestler of Wano Country's Flower Capital.[1] He is also of samurai class, thus giving him an elevated social status.[2] He is also the younger brother of Sukune.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist of the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Uraya Mashikatta
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Uraya Mashikatta[2] is a pirate.[1]
appareance: Uraya Mashikatta is a thin man with long, light brown hair, a large protruding nose, and a sharp jawline. He wears a blue hat and a crimson coat.

Name: Urban
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1108.
description: Urban[3] is a Marine Vice Admiral and one of the nine that took part in the Egghead Incident.[1]
appareance: He serves as a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc.

Name: Urbain
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Urbain-san[2] is a giant that Kouzuki Oden encountered in his travels.
appareance: Being a giant, Urbain is enormous, enough to surpass a large hill in height.[1] He has a square-shaped face with prominent lips and long curly brunette hair.

Name: Urouge
description: Urouge,[6] nicknamed the Mad Monk, is a pirate hailing from a sky island and high priest of the Fallen Monk Pirates.[1] He is one of twelve pirates referred to as the "Worst Generation",[7] and prior to the two-year timeskip had a bounty of 108,000,000.[1]
appareance: Urouge is abundant in both height and width. His face somewhat resembles a smiling totem mask as he is nearly always seen grinning, even when he is unhappy; the only moments he is not seen smiling was when he was approaching Raijin Island, when he was confounded by the island spewing lightning nonstop, and again when he gives final benedictions to Kaidou's jumping off a sky island. Apart from his smile, he also has what appears to be a stitched-up scar vertically descending over, and falling short just above his left eye. On his chin he has a prominent, jet-black, and scruffy beard that extends upwards to the sides of his jaw and then converges with his equally-dark side-burns. He seems to sport the short and clean-cut sort of hairstyle generally sported by monks. He also has black tattoos going down his shoulders that somewhat resemble fire.

Name: Usagihebi
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Usagihebi[2] is an animal who lives on the Island of Rare Animals.[1] Like all the animals on the island, he is protected by Gaimon.[3]
appareance: Usagihebi is a mixture of a snake and a rabbit, with a white and pink snake body and rabbit ears.[1]

Name: Usaguchi Hideo
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 53. His face is printed on every 1,000 banknote.

Name: Usakkov
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Usakkov[3] is a former prisoner of Impel Down and resident of Newkama Land in Level 5.5. He is one of Emporio Ivankov's dancers.[2]
appareance: Usakkov is a lean, tan-skinned man with a thick, curled black mustache, a white beard and a few missing front teeth. He wears a white shirt with a teal bowtie, a red and orange-striped coat, a pair of pink briefs, and stockings that go up to his mid-thigh. He also wears high-heeled boots, round yellow sunglasses, and a large rabbit pelt as a hat.

Name: Ushiano
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1082.
description: Ushiano is a cattle mink, the deputy commander of the Revolutionary Army's West Army, and the assistant of Morley.[1][2]
appareance: Ushiano is a cattle mink with a very long neck, a pair of horns, skinny limbs and relatively thick lower body. He has spotted fur, akin to a Holstein cattle.

Name: Usunoro
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Usunoro is a Shinuchi[1][2] of the Beasts Pirates and part of the Armored Division led by Sasaki.[3]
appareance: Usunoro is a muscular man with tanned skin and long blond hair, beard and mustache. Due to his SMILE ability, his lower body is a giant tortoise with light green skin and a dark green shell. He wears metal braces around his elbow, a black cape and a metal helmet.

Name: Usopp
appareance: "God" Usopp[10] is the sniper of the Straw Hat Pirates and one of the Senior Officers of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.[2] He is the fourth member of the crew and the third to join, doing so at the end of the Syrup Village Arc. Although he left the crew during the Water 7 Arc, he rejoined at the end of the Post-Enies Lobby Arc.[17]

Name: Uta
description: Uta is a world-famous singer or "diva" (歌姫, Utahime?) and the adopted daughter of the Emperor Red-Haired Shanks [2] who was also a musician in his crew until he left her while she was still a child.[6] She was left on the island of Elegia with Gordon, who became her foster parent and supported her dream of starting a "New Era" and later her desire to achieve this dream through a broadcasted, world-wide concert held on Elegia.
appareance: She is the main antagonist of One Piece Film: Red.[7]

Name: Uwattsura
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Uwattsura[2] is a Waiter of the Beasts Pirates who serves as a chief guard in the Prisoner Mine of the Udon region.
appareance: Uwattsura is a muscular man with wild dark brown hair, a scar above his right eye and a tattoo with the kanji 鬼ヶ島 (Onigashima) on his right arm. He goes shirtless and wears goggles on his forehead, dark blue belted pants and brown boots.[1]

Name: Uzu
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 686.
description: Uzu is a child who was held captive in Punk Hazard's Biscuits Room.[2] He was freed with the rest of the children by the Straw Hat Pirates.[1]
appareance: Uzu is a child with bushy brown hair and an upturned nose. Due to the influence of Caesar Clown's drugs, he is larger than normal children. Like the other captive boys, he wears a white shirt.[1]

Name: Uzuki Namida
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Uzuki Namida[2] is a samurai and a member of the Uzuki Family who was formerly imprisoned in the Udon Prisoner Mine.[1]
appareance: Namida is a man with a diagonal scar next to his left eye and ruffled dark brown hair tied in a short ponytail. He has thick dark brown eyebrows and a pencil mustache. He has an intricate tattoo on his left shoulder, although this was not present in the anime. He wore a standard prisoner outfit during his time in the Prisoner Mine.[1]

Name: Uzuki Tempura
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 101.
description: Uzuki Tempura was a samurai who, as a member of the Uzuki Family, served as the most recent daimyo of the Udon region[2] until he was imprisoned and killed by Kaidou 20 years ago.[1]
appareance: Tempura's anime concept art.

Name: Van Augur
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 234.
description: Van Augur,[6] nicknamed "The Supersonic", is the sniper of the Blackbeard Pirates,[2][1] as well as one of the Ten Titanic Captains, as the captain of the Third Ship.[3]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Jaya Arc, a supporting antagonist in the Impel Down and Marineford Arcs, a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

Name: Vander Decken
Note: Mentioned only character. He was first mentioned by Brook in Chapter 606.
description: Vander Decken was the first captain of the Flying Dutchman.[1]
appareance: So far, only a silhouette of him has been seen, resembling a grown man wearing a captain's coat.

Name: Vander Decken IX
Note: His full name was revealed by Pappag in Chapter 610. He is formally introduced in Chapter 613.
description: Vander Decken IX is the captain of the Flying Pirates on their ship, the Flying Dutchman, and the eighth descendant of the original Vander Decken of legend.[2] He is a Japanese bullhead shark fish-man[5] and the secondary antagonist of the Fish-Man Island Arc.
appareance: Decken is a tall individual with beige-colored skin (mid-dark brown in manga), slim build, and lanky limbs. His most distinguishing feature is his four legs. He has a short, scraggly goatee, a long, wavy mustache with spiky edges, and similarly, long, wavy and spiky black hair. After being rejected by Shirahoshi, he shaves the top of his head in depression. He also has sharp teeth, with bigger webs between his fingers than most fish-men, a very thin, pointy nose and a prominent hunch that puts his head on equal level with his shoulders.

Name: Vasco Shot
Note: He was first mentioned by Emporio Ivankov in Chapter 538.
description: Vasco Shot,[8] monikered "Heavy Drinker",[3] is one of the Ten Titanic Captains of the Blackbeard Pirates, as the captain of the Eighth Ship.[4] He was originally one of several legendary criminals given a life sentence on Impel Down's Level 6, before being freed by Blackbeard and joining him.[3][1][2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a supporting antagonist in the Marineford Arc, a minor antagonist in the Egghead Arc, and a major antagonist in the Final Saga.

Name: Vegapants
Note: Joke character. He first appeared in SBS Volume 112.
description: Vegapants is a joke character invented by a fan in the SBS and jokingly accepted by Oda. Vegapants is the cousin of Vegapunk (being the son of his father's younger brother) who resides on the island of Pants Hazard.[1]
appareance: Vegapants is very similar in appearance to his cousin Vegapunk, having the same elongated tongue and head shape. He possesses curly dark hair that is arranged into two pigtails on top; as is normal for residents of Pants Hazard, he wears a pair of women's underwear on the top of his head; the underwear he dons bears a heart pattern. He also wears round glasses and a jacket with two breast pockets.[1]

Name: Vegapunk
Note: He was first mentioned by Koby in Chapter 433.
description: Dr. Vegapunk was the leading scientist of the SSG in the employment of the Marines. His work included discovering the secrets and uses of seastone, the secrets of how Devil Fruit powers work, the co-discovery of the Lineage Factor and its applications, the creation of the Pacifista and Seraphim, and various other scientific achievements that are said to be at least 500 years ahead of current technology.[10][11] He hailed from the technologically advanced Karakuri Island[5][12] and resided on Egghead, where his laboratory is located.[6]
appareance: Before being employed under the World Government, Vegapunk had been the director of an outlaw scientific research team known as MADS, where he worked alongside other notable scientists such as Caesar Clown, Vinsmoke Judge, Queen, and Buckingham Stussy. The team was eventually arrested, and Vegapunk was later integrated into the Marines as its head scientist after MADS' dissolution.[4] During his tenure at Egghead, he created six copies, or "satellites", of himself (Shaka, Lilith, Edison, Pythagoras, Atlas and York), each embodying an aspect of his personality. However, once the World Government learned he was researching the Void Century, they dispatched CP0 and conspired with York to eliminate him, which resulted in the monumental Egghead Incident.[13] [14]

Name: Vergo
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 672.
description: "Demon Bamboo" Vergo[7][11] was one of the four elite officers[4] and the first to occupy the Heart seat of the Donquixote Pirates under the codename Corazon.[6]
appareance: He was a Marine vice admiral, and head of G-5,[3] who made his debut at Punk Hazard.[1] Due to his duplicitous conduct and allegiances, he can be considered the secondary antagonist of the Punk Hazard Arc.[2]

Name: Very Good
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook.
description: Very Good[4] is a Marine Captain and one of the Marines who helped to attack the Straw Hat Pirates during the Buster Call at Enies Lobby.[1]
appareance: Very Good in his youth as a marine.

Name: Victoria Cindry
description: Victoria Cindry was once a famous stage actress who died after falling off the stage twelve years ago.[6] Having been infatuated with her, Dr. Hogback stole her corpse in order to make her his own personal zombie servant with the aid of Gecko Moria's powers.[7]
appareance: In life, Cindry was tall and slim, with short, straight cut blonde hair and an ever-present smile on her face. She wore different outfits depending on the situation: formal for performances, while casual for everyday events like doctor visits.[8]

Name: Victoria Shiruton Doruyanaika
Note: She was first mentioned in SBS Volume 87. Her full name was revealed in SBS Volume 104.
description: Victoria Shiruton Doruyanaika[2] was a girl from Eustass Kid's and Killer's childhood and their first crush.[1]
appareance: When she was young, Doruyanaika had freckles on her cheeks, pronounced lips, and a short bob cut. She wore a light sleeveless shirt.[3]

Name: Vincent
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Vincent is the prince of the Sankan Kingdom (サンカン王国, Sankan Ōkoku?).[2]
appareance: Vincent's full body.

Name: Vinsmoke Ichiji
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 838. He first appeared as a fictional character in the Sora, Warrior of the Sea comic strip in Episode 783.
description: Vinsmoke Ichiji,[7] also known as "Sparking Red",[8] is the eldest son and second child of the Vinsmoke Family.[4] He is a prince of the Germa Kingdom and a commander in its military arm, Germa 66.[1][2]
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the first half of the Whole Cake Island Arc. However, he and his family became allies of the Straw Hat Pirates and the Fire Tank Pirates after realizing Big Mom deceived and intended to assassinate them.

Name: Vinsmoke Judge
Note: He first appeared as a fictional character in the Sora, Warrior of the Sea comic strip in Episode 783.
description: Vinsmoke Judge, also known as Garuda,[5] is the king of the Germa Kingdom, the supreme commander of the Germa 66, and the patriarch of the Vinsmoke Family, being Sanji's biological father.[1][7]
appareance: Judge is also a skilled scientist specialized in engineering and genetics, being responsible for the creation of most of Germa 66' technological advancements, including modifying his own children into super soldiers and developing the Raid Suit that supports their enhanced abilities. He is a former member of MADS, where he was a research partner to the leading World Government scientist Vegapunk and helped in co-discovering the existence of the Lineage Factor, which years later, led to him building and expanding his Kingdom's military might through the use of Cloning.[3] After escaping Totto Land, Judge and Caesar Clown, his former colleague, created NEO MADS as a successor to MADS.[2]

Name: Vinsmoke Niji
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 838. He first appeared as a fictional character in the Sora, Warrior of the Sea comic strip in Episode 783.
description: Vinsmoke Niji,[8] also known as "Dengeki Blue",[5] is the second son and third child of the Vinsmoke Family. He is a prince of the Germa Kingdom and a commander in its military arm, Germa 66.[1][2]
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the first half of the Whole Cake Island Arc. However, he and his family became allies of the Straw Hat Pirates and the Fire Tank Pirates after realizing Big Mom deceived and intended to assassinate them.

Name: Vinsmoke Reiju
description: Vinsmoke Reiju,[5] also known as "Poison Pink",[6] is the eldest child and only daughter of the Vinsmoke Family. She is the princess of the Germa Kingdom and a commander in its military army, Germa 66.[1]
appareance: She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates in the Whole Cake Island Arc and one of the central characters in Germa 66's Ahh... An Emotionless Excursion Cover Page Serial.

Name: Vinsmoke Sora
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 852. She first appeared obscurely in a photo in Episode 803.
description: Vinsmoke Sora[3][2] was the queen of the Germa Kingdom, the wife of Vinsmoke Judge and the mother of Vinsmoke Reiju, Vinsmoke Ichiji, Vinsmoke Niji, Sanji and Vinsmoke Yonji [1] who died sometime during Sanji's childhood.
appareance: Sora was a pale-skinned young woman with wavy shoulder-length blonde hair that had a tuft covering her right eye and dark-blue eyes. Her hairstyle and her overall facial features bear great resemblance to those of her daughter, Vinsmoke Reiju.[1] She wore a blue long-sleeved dress with frills and no shoes.

Name: Vinsmoke Yonji
description: Vinsmoke Yonji,[6] also known as "Winch Green",[7] is the fourth son and youngest child of the Vinsmoke Family. He is a prince of the Germa Kingdom and a commander in its military arm, Germa 66.[2]
appareance: Due to his actions, he is a major antagonist during the first half of the Whole Cake Island Arc. However, he and his family became allies of the Straw Hat Pirates and the Fire Tank Pirates after realizing Big Mom deceived and intended to assassinate them.

Name: Viola
Note: Her real identity was revealed in Chapter 728.
description: Viola[6] is the second daughter of the Riku Family and the current crown princess of Dressrosa after her niece Rebecca abdicated her position.[7] She is the younger sister of the late Scarlett.[8][9]
appareance: When the Donquixote Pirates took over Dressrosa, Viola joined them and adopted the name Violet,[1] working as an assassin and officer of the Trebol Army until betraying the crew.[2][10]

Name: Vista
Note: His name was revealed by Mihawk in Chapter 561.
description: "Vista of the Flower Swords"[5] is the former 5th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates. He is one of the most prominent members of his crew.[1]
appareance: Vista is a tall (around Jinbe's height), muscular, broad-chested, tanned man with a curly, black mustache, a dark blue top hat, and an earring in each ear. He wears a semi-open dark blue shirt with a white diamond stripe-pattern near the top that reveals some of his hairy chest, as well as a cape that his shirt, and white gloves. He also wears light blue pants with a belt that holds two sword sheaths, one on each side. He wields two sabers, one in each hand.[1]

Name: Vitan
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Vitan[2] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was subordinate to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Vitan is a cyborg with a body that appears to be made of iron or some other type of metal from the waist up. As such, his head, body, and arms are composed of metal parts, with his hands being a set of metal claws. On the other hand, the digitally colored manga shows that his neck and face also appear to be made from metal, but are skin-colored, as opposed to the metal color of his body. Furthermore, Vitan also wears a metal hat and a pair of gray, possibly metal pants with a green sash around it.[1]

Name: Vito
description: "Monster Gun" Vito[5] is a member of the Fire Tank Pirates, working as the crew's advisor.[2]
appareance: He debuts as a supporting antagonist during the Zou Arc. Later, along with his crew, he is a temporary ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Whole Cake Island Arc. He and his crew are also the central characters in "Gang" Bege's Oh My Family Cover Page Serial.

Name: Wadatsumi
Note: He was formally introduced in Chapter 613.
description: "Large Monk" Wadatsumi[3] is a giant tiger blowfish fish-man and a member of the Sun Pirates. He was formerly a member of the Flying Pirates under captain Vander Decken IX before they were defeated.[1]
appareance: Wadatsumi is an enormous fish-man, equal in size to the head of the kraken, Surume. He is large enough to make the giant-sized Shirahoshi and Megalo look like a regular-sized mermaid and shark.[5] His round head and chest are quite big in comparison to his arms and legs. His hands are webbed. He has a big, round face, with a large mouth full of massive, round teeth quite distant from one another, and child-like eyes. He has some stubble on his chin and dark hair surrounding his head, taking the shape of a protrusion pointing upward at the top, which also covers a part of his shoulders. His whole body is also quite hairy.

Name: Wakasa
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Wakasa[2] is a resident of Bakura Town in Wano Country who runs a restaurant alongside Hiroshi; the two of them own a tanuki named Saikoro which the sumo wrestler Urashima forced to be cooked and served to him.[1]
appareance: Wakasa is an older woman with wrinkly skin and gray hair tied in a bun. She wears a maroon kimono with dark gold polka dots, as well as a gray obi.[1]

Name: Wall Zombie
Wallace
Note: His name was revealed in One Piece Magazine Vol.2.
description: Wallace[2] is a weedy stingfish fish-man and a member of the Spade Pirates.[1]
appareance: Wallace's color scheme in the anime.

Name: Wallem
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Wallem[2] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with the Whitebeard Pirates.[1]
appareance: A sketch of Wallem.

Name: Wanda
description: Wanda is a canine mink of the Warrior Beast Tribe[6] and the Inuarashi Musketeer Squad[2] and was previously a Kingsbird to both Inuarashi and Nekomamushi.[3]
appareance: She is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Zou and Wano Country Arcs.

Name: Wany
description: Wany[2] is Wanda's crocodile-boar steed.[1]
appareance: Wany resembles a giant hybrid of a crocodile and a boar. It has a huge body compared to its legs and tail, the latter being curled up at the end of its body, with a short snout and big fangs popping out of its mouth from both the upper and lower jaw, the biggest fangs being located at the corners of its mouth. It has small eyes fixed in an angry look and a saddle strapped around its belly for its owner, Wanda, to ride on.[1]

Name: Wanyudo
Note: His name was reveled in Chapter 1020.
description: Wanyudo[2] is a Gifter in the Beasts Pirates, serving as Black Maria's weapon.
appareance: Wanyudo has a large face with flame-shaped beard and sideburns, bushy eyebrows and a bulbous nose. Due to the effects of SMILE, the rest of his body has become that of a small pug dog.[2]

Name: Wanze
Note: He was first mentioned by Corgi in Chapter 362.
description: Wanze is an agent of CP7 and a cook, specializing in making ramen noodles.[2]
appareance: He was one of the antagonists during the Sea Train voyage in the Water 7 Arc.

Name: Wapol
description: "Tin-Plate" Wapol[5] is the king of the South Blue's Evil Black Drum Kingdom and chairman of an international toy conglomerate.[2]
appareance: Originally king of the Grand Line's Drum Island,[3][4] Wapol fled when the Blackbeard Pirates attacked[9] (spending some time as the "captain" of his own, improvised pirate crew) and was permanently deposed by the Straw Hat Pirates soon after. However, his chance creation of a unique "miracle" alloy allowed him to rebuild as a toy manufacturer, winning wealth and power anew and eventually securing his current kingdom with the world-famous Kinderella as consort.[10] After accidentally witnessing the Five Elders and Imu assassinating King Nefertari Cobra at the latest Levely, he went into hiding aboard "Big News" Morgan's airship alongside Nefertari Vivi.[11][12]

Name: Warashi
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Warashi[2] is one of the Shandia warriors who fought against Enel.[1]
appareance: Warashi is a tall, broad, and pale man with unkempt blond hair that goes till his shoulders. He wears a white pointed cap, with red stripes, and white feathers with black tips on the top. He wears two thin dark red necklaces, and one necklace with a golden medallion with a star on it, and a white string hanging down. He wears a white, open, sleeveless coat that goes down to his thighs, and is torn at the bottom. He has two red arm bands on his upper arms, that have white circles with a white square in it as the design. He also has a plate around his stomach, and a dark brown grass skirt, with grey-brown pants. He has white wings on his back and carries a large broadaxe.[1]

Name: Warazane
Note: Its name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Sugamichi and Warazane[2] are two land-dwelling catfish ridden by Fujin and Raijin, respectively.[1]
appareance: Sugamichi and Warazane are pink catfish with round bodies larger than an average human.

Name: Waruno Furishiro
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Waruno Furishiro[2] is a man who manages weapon production orders on behalf of Kurozumi Orochi in the Flower Capital of Wano Country.[1]
appareance: Furishiro is an elderly man with a bald head, a long gray beard and a short mustache. He wears a red kimono, a golden decorated stole and beads around his neck.[1]

Name: Wellington
description: Wellington is a North Blue pirate from around fourteen to sixteen years ago.[1]
appareance: Wellington is a large, burly man with a short, shaggy beard. He wears a captain's coat and shorts. His hair is unkempt with a noticeable widow's peak. He has a scar above his right eye that runs diagonally down his face.[1]

Name: Wheel
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Wheel[2] is the prince of the South Fire Kingdom. He accompanied his father Jeep to the Levely.[1]
appareance: Wheel is a slightly stock young man with high cheekbones, small ears, small eyes, and a high forehead with hair pulled up into a pompadour style. Overall, he bears a great physical resemblance to his father Jeep.

Name: Whitey Bay
description: "Ice Witch" Whitey Bay is an infamous New World pirate captain who was once a member of the Whitebeard Pirates before forming her own crew subordinate to Whitebeard.[5][1]
appareance: Whitey Bay has long, flowing blue hair, full lips and always has a confident expression on her face. She sports a short striped dress closed by laces that have flower-shaped buttons, with loose sleeves, and a scarf. She also wears a polka-dotted bandanna, and over it a light blue and purple pirate hat with her Jolly Roger in the center, a skull with a snowflake design. She also sports a cape, hanging from her back.[1]

Name: Who's-Who
Note: His name and appearance were revealed in Chapter 978. He appeared shadowed in the anime in Episode 954.
description: Who's-Who,[9] also known as Who of the Droplets,[3] is a pirate who acted as one of the Tobiroppo, the strongest six Shinuchi of the Beasts Pirates, prior to Kaidou's fall from power.[10]
appareance: Over a decade ago, he served as an agent of CP9 before his failure to guard the Gomu Gomu no Mi led to his dismissal from service and imprisonment.[4] Upon escaping, Who's-Who turned to piracy, becoming captain of the Who's-Who Pirates before eventually joining the Beasts Pirates.[5][3]

Name: Wicca
Note: Her name and appearance revealed in Chapter 711.
description: Wicca is a female dwarf from Tontatta Kingdom beneath Green Bit.[2] She, along with other members of her kind often pose as Dressrosa's fairies and take their "offerings".[1] She is a member of the Tontatta Pirates, the 5th Division of the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.
appareance: Wicca, like all the other dwarves, is small in stature and has a large fluffy tail and a pointy nose. She has light blue hair, and also wears a large blue hat, with a red stripe around it. She also wears a blue dress with a white scarf.[2][5]

Name: Willie Gallon
Note: Mentioned only character. He was first mentioned in Chapter 218.

Name: Wire
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Wire[4] is a member of the Kid Pirates.[1]
appareance: Wire is among the tallest members of the crew, standing about one meter taller than Kid and Killer. He wears a dark brown cloak, a wire shirt, black shorts, and black fishnet stockings. The looped, golden belt on his shorts matches Heat's. He has the crew's secondary Jolly Roger over his chest and a necklace with small axe blades on it. He has droopy eyes, regardless of his expression.[1]

Name: Wolf
description: Wolf is a giant from Elbaph who works as the gym teacher at the Walrus School.[1]
appareance: As a giant, Wolf appears to be very large. He has short black hair and a beard tied into three ponytails. Wolf wears a white shirt with a belt and a black feathered coat, though they have been stained with blood after his injuries.

Name: Woop Slap
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Woop Slap[3] is the mayor of Monkey D. Luffy's hometown, Foosha Village.[1]
appareance: Woop Slap is a short, wiry, bespectacled man with something of a cleft chin. He generally wears lightweight "tropical" clothing, along with a selection of striped hats.

Name: Wyper
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 249.
description: "Berserker" Wyper[6] is the former leader of the Shandia warriors that fought to take Upper Yard back from Enel. He is the direct descendant of Kalgara.
appareance: He is an antagonist later turned ally during the Skypiea Arc. After the timeskip, he is one of God's Guards.[4]

Name: X Drake
description: "Red Flag" X Drake (pronounced as "Diez Drake") is the captain of the Marine Secret Special Unit SWORD. In order to go undercover as a pirate, he publicly defected from his position as rear admiral[8] and founded the Drake Pirates.[2][1] He is one of twelve pirates referred to as the "Worst Generation",[13] and before the two-year timeskip had a bounty of 222,000,000.[1]
appareance: Drake is the son of the Marine-turned-pirate Diez Barrels, and was affiliated with the Barrels Pirates until he defected to the Marines. As a young adult, he was called Dory.[6][14]

Name: Yama
description: Yama is a Birkan and the commander of the Divine Soldiers under Enel.[2] He is a supporting antagonist during the Skypiea Arc.
appareance: Yama is an obese man with a triple chin. He has a round body shape with long wavy black hair and tanned skin. He has bags under his eyes and thick lips. He wears a white toga with black vertical stripes, three on each side. Over his toga he has an orange sash, connected by strings, and has red lining and dark orange vertical stripes on it. Yama wears gold bracelets on both his wrist, and has wings on his back, like other Birkans.[2]

Name: Yamakaji
Note: His name was revealed in the Yellow databook.
description: Vice Admiral Yamakaji[4] is a Marine officer, and one of the five vice admirals who led the Buster Call on Enies Lobby.[1]
appareance: Yamakaji is a tall and broad-chested man. He has a slightly wrinkled face, a round nose with prominent nostrils, thick lips, and a wide, round chin. He has brown buzz cut-styled hair[5] which connects to a thick beard that covers his entire chin. He is always seen with his eyes closed and with a cigar in his mouth. He is also often seen with a cheerful smile. He wears a dark brown double-breasted suit with a black tie underneath, all over a yellow dress shirt with a red polka dot pattern. He also wears brown pants and brown shoes. Like most high-ranking Marine officers, he drapes his standard Marine coat over his shoulders like a cape. He also wears a standard Marine cap.[1]

Name: Yamanba
Note: Her name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Yamanba[2] is a Gifter of the Beasts Pirates who works under Black Maria.[1]
appareance: Yamanba is a woman of above-average height. She has a long face and chin with a large mouth, and is frequently seen with her tongue hanging out. She has long, purple hair, which she adorns with a flower. She wears a purple yukata with a pink sash, and has two small horns protruding from beneath her hair.[1]

Name: Yamato
Note: He was first mentioned by Kaidou in Chapter 977. His name was revealed by Kaidou in Chapter 979.
description: Yamato is the son  of Kaidou. Born as Kaidou's daughter and groomed from a young age to be his heir, Yamato instead developed a profound admiration for the legendary samurai Kouzuki Oden. After Oden's death, Yamato decided to become like him, impersonating him and adopting his mannerisms. As a result of this desire to emulate Oden, Yamato decided to become a man and identify as Kaidou's son, with his father and the Beasts Pirates referring to him as such as well.[4]
appareance: This path has put Yamato at odds with Kaidou, with much of his life being spent imprisoned on Onigashima.[9] Yamato befriended Portgas D. Ace during his visit to Wano Country, and after learning of Ace's death waited for the arrival of his sworn brother, Monkey D. Luffy.[10] Yamato eventually met Luffy during the Raid on Onigashima,[11] during which he took a rebellious stance against his father and fought as a valuable ally to the samurai against the Beasts Pirates.[2] Initially desiring to join Luffy's crew,[12] Yamato ultimately decided to remain behind in Wano to help protect it from outside forces, though he still intends to join them in the future.[13]

Name: Yame
Note: Her name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: O-Yame[2] is a woman who lives in Okobore Town of Kuri with her two sons, Kinbo and an unnamed infant.[1]
appareance: Yame is an average-sized woman with a round nose and brown hair tied in a bun. She wears a light blue kimono with light green cloud patterns and pink patches, as well as a purple obi with white dots and a red string. She carries her infant son on her back.[1]

Name: Yamenahare
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 47.
description: Yamenahare is a citizen of Pucci and the manservant to Marumieta, the daughter of Pucci's mayor, Bimine.[2][1]
appareance: Yamenahare in the digitally colored manga.

Name: Yamon
Note: He was first mentioned in SBS Volume 96.
description: Yamon[1] was a member of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution. His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Yamon has long, light-colored hair and thin limbs, and wears a light-colored, furry top and light-colored shorts.[1]

Name: Yarisugi
description: Yarisugi is a Marine Commodore of G-5 Unit 06.[1]
appareance: Yarisugi is a tall and muscular man who wears a round hat with a short dark brim and a "5" at the front. He also has brown colored hair sticking out from the sides of his head to form a circle and a small black beard with a mustache of the same color, and a scar on his left cheek.[4]

Name: Yasopp
Note: His name was revealed by Monkey D. Luffy in Chapter 25.
description: Yasopp,[6] known as "Chaser",[3] is one of the Senior Officers and the sniper of the Red Hair Pirates.[7] He is also the father of Usopp[8] and the widower of Banchina.[9]
appareance: His appearance is very similar to his son, Usopp. However, his shorter nose and blond hair do not match Usopp's longer nose and darker hair, both of which are hereditary traits of Usopp's mother.[8] Twenty years ago, Yasopp had the same tight curls and black hair as Usopp,[10] and in Romance Dawn, his hair was styled in loose waves,[11] but later appearances show him with it in dreadlocks. In addition to that, his body was slimmer while in his latest appearance,[2] it seems to have become more muscular.[12]

Name: Yatappe
Note: He first appeared as a silhouette in Chapter 940.
description: "Snake-Eyes" Yatappe is a yakuza boss who was in charge of the Kibi region in Wano Country. He was imprisoned in Udon by the Beasts Pirates, but was freed when Luffy took over the prison.[1][2]
appareance: Yatappe is an average size man, with long dark purple wavy hair and thick sideburns. His mustache and beard form a circle around his mouth. He has thick lips, a thin nose, and a circular scar over his right eye.[1]

Name: Yazaemon
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 97.
description: Yazaemon[5] is a ninja and a member of the Beasts Pirates. He previously was a member of the Orochi Oniwabanshu which served the shogun of Wano Country, Kurozumi Orochi.[2]
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is a minor antagonist in the Wano Country Arc.

Name: Ylva
Note: Her name was revealed in Chapter 1142.
description: Ylva is a student at the Walrus School on Elbaph.[1] She is the great-great-granddaughter of Jarul.[2]
appareance: Ylva is a young girl with short, light-colored hair. She wears a light tunic with a belt and black stripes along its bottom, as well as a large, nearly oversized horned helmet with a wide brim. Her helmet has two straps, though she leaves them open, and it has a design from her face to the back of her head.

Name: Yokan
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Yokan[2] is a doctor assigned to treat the injured at sumo matches in Bakura Town.[1]
appareance: Yokan is an elderly man with a very long face. He has gray hair tied in a topknot, but the top of his head is balding. He has a thick gray mustache and a short beard. He wears glasses on top of his head and a rose-colored kimono with the kanji 医 ("medicine"?) printed all over it. [1]

Name: Yokozuna
description: Yokozuna is a Sumo Frog that Tom's Workers kept as a pet, friend and mascot up until Tom's execution.[1]
appareance: He is a supporting character throughout the Water 7 Saga.

Name: Yomo
Note: His name was revealed by Pedro in Chapter 822.
description: Pastor Yomo[3] is a sheep mink and one of Inuarashi's Musketeers.[1]
appareance: Yomo is a large male sheep mink with fluffy, light-colored fur. He has narrow eyes, thick lips, and black skin. He has sheep hooves, horns, and a tail, and wears a pair of dark-colored pants.[1]

Name: Yonka
description: The Medaka Mermaid Quintuplets are five young Japanese rice fish mermaids who are friends with Camie. Their names are Ichika (イチカ?), Nika (ニカ?), Sanka (サンカ?), Yonka (ヨンカ?), and Yonka Two (ヨンカツー, Yonka Tsū?).[1]
appareance: The Quintuplets' size in comparison to Camie.

Name: Yonka Two
description: The Medaka Mermaid Quintuplets are five young Japanese rice fish mermaids who are friends with Camie. Their names are Ichika (イチカ?), Nika (ニカ?), Sanka (サンカ?), Yonka (ヨンカ?), and Yonka Two (ヨンカツー, Yonka Tsū?).[1]
appareance: The Quintuplets' size in comparison to Camie.

Name: York
Note: Her name was first seen on a chart in Chapter 1062.
description: York, also designated as Punk-06 (PUNK-06（パンク シックス）, Panku-Shikkusu?), is one of the six satellites of Dr. Vegapunk, embodying his aspect of "greed".[3]
appareance: She acted as an ally to the Straw Hat Pirates at first, but was later revealed to be a traitor responsible for instigating the Egghead Incident and many of the events prior during the Egghead Arc. Due to her actions, she is a major antagonist in the aforementioned arc. After Jaygarcia Saturn's demise, York has become the direct subordinate to Saturn's replacement, Figarland Garling.

Name: Yorki
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook. He is then formally introduced by Brook in Chapter 486.
description: "Calico" Yorki was the captain of the Rumbar Pirates who brought Laboon to Reverse Mountain fifty years ago from West Blue.[1]
appareance: Yorki was a blond haired pirate with two tattoos on his face, one under his right eye and one under his lower lip. His tattoos resembled the katakana character, ヨ (yo).

Name: Yosaku
description: Yosaku along with Johnny are old friends and former bounty hunting partners of Roronoa Zoro.
appareance: He is an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the Baratie Arc and the Arlong Park Arc.

Name: Yoshimoto
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Mr. Yoshimoto is the owner of the restaurant Spice Bean.[2][1]
appareance: Anime concept art of Yoshimoto.

Name: Yotsubane
Note: His name was revealed in the Blue Deep databook.
description: Yotsubane[2] is one of the Shandia warriors who fought against Enel.[1]
appareance: Yotsubane is a lean man with wings, like other Shandia. He wears a red cap that resembles a chullo, with two white stripes on it, with four white feathers with black tips on the top. The hat also has a white cloth hanging down on the sides. He wears a dark yellow robe, that shows half his chest, has white frills at the bottom, purple triangle shapes with white triangles inside on the hip area. He also wears a brown belt across his torso, which he carries the holder for his arrows and his bow.[1]

Name: Yu
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Yu[3] is a little girl who accidentally bumped into Smoker and got ice cream on his uniform.[1]
appareance: Yu's color scheme as depicted by Oda.

Name: Yui
Note: His name was revealed in SBS Volume 96.
description: Yui[2] was a member of the Roger Pirates until the crew's dissolution.[1] His current whereabouts and status are unknown.
appareance: Yui is a short man with wavy, red hair that sticks straight up. He wears a light-colored cloak with a collar that is high enough to cover the lower portion of his face.[2] His hair color was later changed to brown.[3]

Name: Yuki
Note: Her name was revealed in the Blue databook.
description: Yuki[3] was a young girl over 100 years ago. She was responsible for starting the century-long duel between Dorry and Brogy.[1]
appareance: Yuki has short brown hair. She wears a red top underneath yellow overalls.[1]

Name: Yurikah
Note: Cover story character.
description: Yurikah is the captain of the Tulip Pirates that attacked Mirrorball Island in Jango's cover story.[1]
appareance: Yurikah is a tall man, with black hair shaped into the shape of a tulip, and two white strands resembling leaves. He wears a dark colored coat with tulip petals on the end on the sleeves, and light colored dots and frills at the bottom. He wears a light colored sash and shoes, and is seen carrying two swords. His black shoes are also decorated with white tulips.[1]

Name: Zabo
Note: His name revealed in Episode 145 credits.
description: Zabo[2] was a man that illegally trespassed into Upper Yard and was subsequently punished by Enel during his escape.[1]
appareance: Zabo was an average man with gold circular earrings and an orange headband wrapped around his shaggy red dreadlocks. He wears a white shirt and dark purple shorts, that have been dirtied and ripped during his escape from the priests, and was barefoot. He also carried a dagger by his hip that is held up by a sash going across his left side.[1]

Name: Zadie
Note: His name revealed in Color Walk 4.
description: Zadie[2] was one of the archaeologists of Ohara.[1]
appareance: Zadie was an average sized man, with a brown mustache and beard. He wore a white cowboy hat, and a greenish-blue button up shirt, with lines going up and across each side, and the sleeves rolled up partly.[1]

Name: Zala
Note: She was first mentioned by Nefertari Vivi in Chapter 155 as her alias "Miss Doublefinger". Her real name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: "Poison Spider" Zala,[4] better known by her alias Miss Doublefinger, was the second highest ranking female officer agent in the secret organization known as Baroque Works. As an officer agent, she was partnered with Mr. 1.[3] She also used the alias of Paula while she acted as the owner of Spiders Cafe in Arabasta.
appareance: She was a major antagonist during the Arabasta Arc. After the group's dissolution, she went back to being the owner of the New Spiders Cafe alongside most of her Baroque Works colleagues.[7]

Name: Zambai
Note: His name was revealed by Franky Family members in Chapter 330.
description: Zambai was a member of the Franky Family and was Franky's right hand man.[1] After the timeskip, he, Kiev, and Tamagon have joined the Galley-La Company as Zambai's Company Union.[5]
appareance: He became an ally of the Straw Hat Pirates during the end of the Water 7 Arc and the beginning of the Enies Lobby Arc, having started off as a minor antagonist in the former.

Name: Zangirimaru
Note: His name was revealed in Vivre Card.
description: Zangirimaru[3] is a former prisoner of Udon's prisoner mines.[1] In the anime credits and closed captions, he was named Jo (ジョー, Jō?).[4]
appareance: Zangirimaru is a man of average height with blond hair that forms large bangs around his face and is tied in a ponytail at the back. At Udon, he wore a standard prisoner outfit.

Name: Zanki
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 1030.
description: Zanki is a member of the Numbers in the Beasts Pirates, representing the number "three".[2]
appareance: Due to the experiments conducted on him Zanki is far taller than even normal giants, and has a pair of slender, straight, outward-pointing horns, along with a mouth full of sharp teeth. He has a round body with slender arms. He has an oval-shaped face with a small downward-pointed nose, red cheeks and a bushy dark-colored goatee. He has a prominent brow-ridge, which is often seen sloped downward in a sad-looking expression. On his right side is tattooed the daiji 参 ("three"). He wears a plain-looking dark-colored kabuto helmet, a braided Shimenawa rope as a necklace, and a dark garment on his lower body. On his left wrist Zanki seemingly wears some sort of dark, metallic bracelet or gauntlet. He wears a dark sash around his waist that he keeps a katana tucked into. He wears simple geta for footwear.[2]

Name: Zeff
description: Zeff is the head chef and owner of Baratie. Before that, he was the captain of the Cook Pirates and known as Red-Leg Zeff, until his crew was annihilated in a storm.[6]
appareance: He is also Sanji's cooking mentor and adoptive father, having taken in the boy after being stranded with him on a desert island for months.[1][2]

Name: Zeo
description: Zeo[5] is a Japanese wobbegong fish-man[1] and the self-proclaimed "Noble of the Fish-Man District".[3] He was an officer of the New Fish-Man Pirates before their downfall and disbandment.
appareance: Due to his actions and role, he is considered to be a major antagonist in the Fish-Man Island Arc.

Name: Zepo
description: Zepo was a polar bear mink who was Bepo's older brother[2] and a member of the Nox Pirates. He was killed by Big Mom in Totto Land five years ago after he spun her Soul Pocus roulette wheel.[1]
appareance: Zepo was a large bear mink with light-colored fur and a piece of dark hair on his head. He wore a pair of sunglasses, a button-down shirt, polka-dotted pants, and a large cape.[1]

Name: Zeus
Note: His name was revealed in Chapter 844. He was first identified in Chapter 845.
description: Zeus the Thundercloud is a homie that is fused with Nami's Sorcery Clima-Tact. Before merging with the Clima-Tact, he was owned by Big Mom, who would summon him from her left hand.[3] Due to being made from a soul fragment from Big Mom herself,[7] he is more powerful than most homies.
appareance: He was created by Big Mom in her youth, and served her into old age as one of her personal weapons alongside Prometheus and Napoleon. During the Straw Hat Pirates' escape from Totto Land, Zeus was captured by the Straw Hats and forced to become Nami's servant.[8] He lived inside her Sorcery Clima-Tact for a brief period until he was reclaimed by Big Mom in Wano Country.[2][9] However, Big Mom later abandoned Zeus for good after he had struggled during the battle at Onigashima, replacing him with another homie named Hera. She attempted to remove her soul fragment from him,[10] but he survived the ordeal by permanently fusing with Nami's Clima-Tact as a vessel.[11] Zeus then joined Nami for good, this time as her partner.[4]

Name: Zodia
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Zodia[2] is an infamous New World pirate captain who was subordinate to Whitebeard.[1]
appareance: Zodia is a man with wavy long brown hair and a black beard. He wears a black coat with a white shirt and a purple tie. He has big round cheeks and a big mouth.[1]

Name: Zotto
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card.
description: Zotto is a Marine Lieutenant and a subordinate of Vice Admiral Momonga.[2][1]
appareance: Zotto as a young Marine.

Name: Zucca
Note: His name was revealed in the Green databook.
description: Zucca[3] is an infamous New World pirate who allied himself with the Whitebeard Pirates.[2]
appareance: Concept art of Zucca.

Name: Zunesha
description: Zunesha[2] is a Naitamie-Norida elephant[6] that was affiliated with Joy Boy 800 years ago.[7] It now wanders through the New World and carries the island of Zou on its back[1] as punishment for an unspecified crime it committed in the past.[8]
appareance: Zunesha is a gargantuan elephant, comparable to an island in sheer scale; its two-jointed[6] legs are disproportionately and extremely long, such that it can walk on the sea floor while its upper body, including about a third of each leg, remains above the water. However, Zunesha has comparatively small eyes (shown to have turquoise, ringed irises in the anime)[9] sunken deep into their sockets, being barely visible at most times and giving the impression that it has no eyes at all. Its gray skin is heavily wrinkled, reflecting its old age, and its ears are tattered and frayed at the edges.[1]

Name: Zururin
Note: His name was revealed in the Vivre Card databook.
description: Zururin[2] is a catfish fish-man who encountered Queen Otohime as a child 16 years ago.[1]
appareance: 16 years ago, Zururin was a small child with red skin, pointy teeth, webbed hands, and short dark brown hair. He wore a light blue sleeveless shirt with a picture of a fish and the text "uo uo" (uo meaning "fish" in Japanese). He also had snot dripping from one of his nostrils.[1]
